Everyone else stands around seemingly shocked.Gag: Peter and Terry (Barbara Harris) are out walking a pregnant dog who begins to give birth in the middle of the street as the couple hover over her. Peter, to policeman: "She's in labor." Policeman: "Well, don't let her stay there. Drag her over to the gutter and take the dog with you."Only a cockeyed sense of fair play prompts the recollection of these gags in detail. Some people may find them funny. Others, I assume, will grieve, remembering the precise, no-nonsense world evoked through Thurber's prose, as in his praise of the semiblindness that allowed him to see "a gay old lady with a gray parasol walk through the side of a truck." Practically unknown in Thurber's world are cheap wisecrackers and even, cheaper sentimentalists. It is, instead, inhabited by sweet wives who drive husbands mad by finishing their sentences, by grandmothers who fear that electricity is dripping all over the house from empty sockets, and by a cat who, at 35, spends all her time in bed, staring.In "The War Between Men and Women," Melville Shavelson, the director, and Danny Arnold, who collaborated on the screenplay with Shavelson, complete the job of ravaging Thurber country begun with their short-lived television series, "My World and Welcome to It," which was also about a fictional cartoonist, though he wasn't going blind.Shavelson and Arnold have helped themselves to some details of Thurber's life, as well as to his works, to make a comedy that alternates between being smart-alecky and as sweet as your average Doris Day Show. They've mixed up Thurber's thoughtful appraisals of women, children and dogs with the misogyny and sulky skepticism of someone like W. C. Fields. What's worse, since much of the story has to do with Wilson-Thurber's hiding his blindness from his wife, they've given him the kind of idiotically noble character that won't even wash anymore in soap opera.Lemmon is not terribly funny, but he is vigorously myopic and looks ageless, neither young nor old, though a bit beat, as Wilson-Thurber. Jason Robards does a long walk-on as Miss Harris's first husband, the father of the brood of children Lemmon inherits by marriage, a man whose undependability towards his family seems to inspire the creation of Thurber's "The Last Flower," which I always thought was about war.Although she hasn't the unbaked-cookie shape to be completely convincing as a Thurber woman, Miss Harris is so lovely and intelligent that I believed her completely. I also believed some other small moments in the film, like the little boy who, when asked what he is afraid of, answers desolately: "Everything." The children are, otherwise, movie monsters. Robert Dranko is credited with having designed the animation for several sequences in which the Thurber people come to cartoon life. They are so fine they make everything else seem just that much worse  clumsy and literal.

title: House Caucus Lists Black Bill of Rights
Gambino's, Nephew Reported Missing Kidnapping Feared
description: Emanuel Gambino, the 29yearold nephew of Carlo Garnbino, the reputed Mafia chieftain, has disappeared and may have been kidnapped,. accord,. ing to law enforcement. officials.

title: 15,000 Hotel Workers Demand a Wage Increase Here
description: More than 15,000 hotel workers left their jobs for several hours yesterday and gathered at Madison Square Garden to demionstrate for a wage increase.

title: SUTTON IS OPPOSED TO ANTIBUSING STAND
description: Percy E. Sutton, the Manhattan Borough President, has expressed strong disagreement with resolutions passed by the Nationl Black Political Convention last. March, opposing busing to achieve school integration and condemning Israel for alleged expansionist policies.

title: Army's DrugTesting Program Stirs Sharp Dispute
LOCALITIES LIMITED ON ABORTION CURBS
description: ALBANY, June 1 (UFI) The state's highest court ruled today that local governments could not require that abortions be performed only in hospitals licensed and accredited by the state.

title: SEOUL SEES TRICK IN PULLOUT CALL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 1  A South Korean Government spokesman asserted today that the demand bY Premier Kim Il Sung, of Worth Korea for the complete withdrawal of American forces from korea was aimed at reunifying Korea. by force after the pullout.

title: Canadian Bill Rates Level
description: OTTAWA, June 1 (Canadian Press)The Canadian Government auctioned today $190million of new 91day treasury bills at an average price and yield of 99.079 and 3.73 per cent, respectively, compared with a price of 99.078 and a yield of 3.73 per cent a week earlier. Also auctioned was $35million of 182day bills at 97.995 and 4.10 per cent, respectively, compared with 97.978 and 4.14 per cent last week.

title: Geane Linz Wed to Dr. R. D. Schubert
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., June 1Miss Geane Linz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. MyrOn Linz of Scarsdale, was married here this evening to Dr. Richard Dwight Schubert, son of Mr. and Mrs. Uriel Schubert of White Plains. Rabbi Maurice Davis of the White Plains Jewish Community Center performed the ceremony at the Hilton Inn.

title: IRAQ TAKES OVER BIG OIL COMPANY AFTER TALKS FAIL
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 1The Government of Iraq tonight, nationalized the Westernowned consortium, the Iraq Petroleum Company, which has been producing and marketing Iraqi oil for almost half a century.

title: DECLINE IS FORECAST IN RATE OF INFLATION
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 1 (UPI) The rate of inflation in the United States should drop to around 3.6 per cent the rest of this year and 3.5 per cent next year, the econometric forecasters of the Universtiy of Pennsylvania's Wharton School said today. The rate now is around 5 per cent.

title: PRESIDENT GETS GENERAL SUPPORT
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 President Nixon's report on his isummit talks was greeted with general Congressional support tonight, but it appeared he faced more difficulty than originally expected in getting Congressional approval of the arms agreements with the Soviet Union.

title: Anarchist Leaders Seized in Frankfurt
description: BONN, June 1The state and federal police captured two ringleaders of a West German anarchist band in Frankfurt early today who are believed to have been responsible for wave of bombings that killed four American soldiers and injured 30 persons last month.

title: Surviving Gunman Identified in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, June 1The survivor among the three. Japanese who killed and wounded scores of people at the Tel Aviv airport Tuesday night was identified today by the Japanese police as Kozo Okamoto, a 29yearold former student in the agricultural department of Kagoshima University.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Marinduque Mining & Industrial Corporation, headquartered in Manila yesterday announced the opening of a subscription rights offering to shareholders of 1,222,125 shares of the company's capital stock, at a price of $12.50 per share. Shareholders of record May 31 may subscribe for one share for each two shares held during the offering which expires on June 21. First National City Bank is acting as the subscription agent for the company in the United States. The company's stock, traded on the American Stock Exchange, closed yesterday at 12down .

title: J.W.L. Hammond Weds Sharon E. McCluskey
description: Miss Sharon Eileen McCluskey, who was married last evening to James William Lubbock Hammond in her mother's Park Avenue apartment, is more than happy about living in the same building with her.

title: Hussein Condemns Attack
description: AMMAN, Jordan, June (UPI)King Hossein, of Jordan today condemned the airport attack at Tel Aviv as a sick act

title: A RETURN TO SONG FOR DICK HAYMES
description: Dick Haymes spent a good part of the nineteenforties following Frank Sinatra. He followed him as the vocalist in Harry James's band, followed him as a vocalist in Tommy Dorsey's band and then followed him into the movies. But Mr. Haymes has finally turned the tables. Now that Mr. Sinatra has retired, Mr. Haymes has unretired, returning from a long residence in Spain to sing in. New York for the first time in 11 years in the Maisonette of the St. RegisSheraton Hotel.

title: Board Says Teachers'
description: Officials of the Board of Education said yesterday that a preliminary analysis showed that the recent gachers con., tract demands Would cost the city $2billion grant, more than the present total school budget, buy they expressed hope that agreement on a, new pact could be reached in time to avert a possible strike next fall.

title: The One That Got Away
description: EAGLE RIVER, Wis.A boy grows up aware, but only dimly, that there are Mysteries in life, and it takes certain maturity to grasp the depth of some of themsuch as fish.

title: U.S., at Israel's Request, Appeals to Lebannon to Curb Guerrillas
description: WASHINGTON, June 1As part of an international campaigni Israel has asked the United States to intercede with the Lebanese Government to prevent future terrorist attacks against airline connections With Israel.

title: F B.I. Identifies Hijacking Suspect
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP)The Federal Bureau of Investigation said today that Frederick William Hahneman, 49 years old, of Easton, Pa., was being sought for the hijacking of an Eastern Airlines plane May 5, extorting $303,000 from the line and then escaping by bailing out over Honduras.

title: Over $1Million Is Pledged For Press Institute Building
description: More than $1million in pledges in its campaign to raise $1.9million to construct a building in Reston, Va., has been received by the American Press Institute, it was announced yesterday.

title: Washingtonians Flee Flood
description: OKANOGAN, Wash., June 1 (UPI)Evacuation of families of about a dozen communities in north central Washington was stepped up today as the Okanogan and Methow Rivers continued to rise beyond the flood stages. Gov. Daniel J. Evans declared the area a major disaster area yesterday and ordered in National Guardsmen and equipment, as well as all available state agencies and men.

title: Archbishop Paul Leibold. Dies; Headed Cincinnati Archdiocese
description: CINCINNATI: June 1  The Most Rev Paul F. Leibold, appointed Roman Catholic Archbishop Of Cmicinnati less than three year ago by Pope Paul VI, died todey at Good Samaritan Hospital. He suffered a stroke earlier in the day at his residence at Mount St. Mary Seminary in nearby Norwood. He was 57 years old.

title: Three Bills Seek Uniform Drug Plan
description: Congress is considering three bills that would estab lish a uniform, drug abuse re habilitation program for the armed services and correct what some see as inequities in the system.

title: London Taking Some of the Bustle Out of Oxford Street
description: LONDON, June 1London's metropolitan Government told Its traffic commissioner today to close a half mile of Oxford Street, the city's most bustling shopping thoroughfare, to all traffic except buses and taxis.

title: House Votes 2Year Public TV Fund
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The House voted today to continue Federal financing of noncommercial television and radio for two more years.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Mayor Lindsay has continually reaffirmed his determination to build the Forest Hills housing project even after a court order. Simeon Golar stated to two Congressmen that the project will not be scaled down because the city lacks the authority.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARIS  The relationship between Russia and America has changed less dramatically than the prestige of the United States and the position of President Nixon as a world leader. This is an interesting aspect of the closely connected series of events that Jed to the remarkable Moscow accords.

title: SENATE UNIT EASES STAND ON WELFARE
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (UPI) The Senate Finance Committee retreated today from its decision to deny welfare aid to the children of mothers who refuse to work under its must work welfare bill.

title: Truck Tonnage Reported Off
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage last week was 2.1 per cent below the corresponding week last year.

title: Staub Smashes 3Run Homer in First Inning
description: The New York Mets cleared the decks for Henry Aaron last night by disposing of the Philadelphia Phillies, 61, for the sixth straight time this season.

title: SILVER FUTURES ADVANCE IN PRICE
description: Closing up 180 points (hundredths of a cent an ounce), prices on the silver futures market on the New York Commodity Exchange rose yesterday for the first time this week.

title: Coast Consulate Bombed
description: LOS ANGELES, June 1 (AP)The Lebanese consulate here was heavily damaged by an explosion today, but no one was injured. The police said they had no evidence that the explosion was an act of retaliation for the Tel Aviv airport killings.

title: Transcript of President Nixon's Address to Congress on Meetings in Moscow
description: Mr. Speaker, Mr. President, members of the Congress, our distinguished guests, ray fellow Americans:

title: TopLevel Changes at Soup Concern Are Announced
description: The Campbell Soup Company announced yesterday a number of changes in top management.

title: Mrs. Straub's 79 for 234 Captures Long Island Golf
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L.I., June 1  Mrs. Austin Straub of Huntington Country Club finished with a 41, 38  79 today for a 54hole total of 234 on rounds of 80, 75 and 79, to win the Women's Long Island Golf Association medalplay trophy at the Piping Rock Club. Par for the 5,539yard course is 35, 36  71.

title: JOSEPH M. JOYCE
description: Joseph, M. Joyce, vice presi dent of Earl B. LovellS. P. Belcher, Inc., 53 Park Place, surveyors, died yesterday at his home, 1534;Madison Street, Baldwin, L. I. He was 67 years old.

title: Levitz Trading Suspended For 10 Days by the S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The Securities and Exchange Commission suspended trading today in the stock of the Levitz Furniture Corporation and announced that it would have further announcement involving the company tomorrow.

title: Braves Shuffle Posts And Demote Richards
description: ATLANTA, June 1 (UPI)Paul Richards was eased out of his job as general manager of the Atlanta Braves today and Eddie Robinson, director of the Braves farm system, stepped up to, take his place.

title: 2 IN G.O.P. PRAISE TIMES PRESSMEN
description: WASHINGTON, June 1Two leading Republicans publicly congratulated the pressmen of The New York Times today for their protest against a twopage advertisement, published in, The Times yesterday calling for the impeachment of President Nixon.

title: Ottawa Police Say Bremer Was Seen 10 or 12 Feet From Nixon Motorcade
description: OTTAWA, June 1Arthur H. Bremer was within 10 or 12 feet of President Nixon's motorcade here on the evening of April 13, a report by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police said today.

title: MOSCOW HAILING SUMMIT ACCORDS Brezhnev Is Reaping Praise for Talks With Nixon
description: MOSCOW, June 1The new SovietAmerican agreements on strategicarms limitation and other issues, formally approved today by leading Communist party and Government bodies, are being hailed here as triumphs of major significance, altering the world political climate.

title: Music: Lily Pons's Sheen
description: This seems to be nostalgia week. At the Felt Forum these nights you can see and hear such stars of the nineteenthirties as Cass Daley, Arthur Tracy, Allan Jones and Beatrice Kay. On Wednesday night, if you were lucky enough to get into the New York Philharmonic's Promenades, you could have seen and heard Lily Pons, the Metropolitan Opera star of the thirtiesand the forties and fifties.

title: HAROLD T. MURRAY
description: NORWALK, Conn., June 1Harold T. Murray, retired director of the Municipal Tax Division of the state Tax Department, died yesterday at a local convalescent home, His age was 82.

title: Notes on People
description: Relaxed, smiling and saying that he had done his duty for the last 17 months, Robert G. Baker, the center of a Washington influence peddling scandal five years ago left a Federal prison farm in Williamsport, Pa., a paroled man.

title: ROBERT SIMPSON, WRITER, EDITOR
description: Robert Simpson, a newspaperman and magazine contributor who had been a. copy editor for The New York Times from 1929 to 1959, died yesterday of a heart allment in New York Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 223 East 61st Street.

title: N. C. Wyeth Retrospective Is in a Nostalgic Location
description: CHADDS FORD, Pa.Before films and television all but replaced them, illustrators performed a respectable artistic function for generations of readers: They brought to life episodes from the works of famous and notsofamous authors. N. C. Wyeth  the subject of a lively retrospective in the Brandywine River Museum herewas one of the most popular and successful illustrators of his time.

title: Couscous Wasn't Enough
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four sears to none) and for their atmosphere, service and dcor (four triangles to none).

title: PORT UNIT'S BOARD ELEVATES RONAN
description: Dr. William J. Ronan, chairman of the Metropolitan transportation Authority, was elected vice chairman of the Port of New YOrk Authority yesterday.

title: 6 ARRESTED HERE IN AIRTICKET RING
description: An international multimilliondollarayear airline ticket racket has been broken through the cooperative efforts of Federal, state and foreign law enforcement agencies, District Attorney Frank S. Hogan announced yesterday.

title: Poll in California Predicts A Big McGovern Victory
description: LOS ANGELES, June 1Senator George McGovern of South Dakota appears to be headed for a sweeping victory in the California Democratic Presidential primary, even beyond the expectations. of his supporters, according to figures reported tonight by the California Poll.

title: Beth Jakubovitz Becomes Bride In New Rochelle
description: NEW ROCIIELLE, N. Y., June 1Miss. Beth Susan Jakubovitz and Robert Chiger, son of Rabbi and Mrs. Morris Chiger of the Bronx. and Long Beach, L. I., were married this evening at the BethE1 Synagogue of New Rochelle by Rabbi Israel Miller.

title: Former Muskie Workers Find a New Home in California Race
Books of The Times
description: About twothirds of the way through Dan Greenburg's Scoring: A Sexual Memoir, one stops laughing, and that is too bad in a way, because, up until that point this is a very funny book. It's funny when Mr.. Greenburg begins it with his confession that I happen to be a coipulsive list maker. I not only keep lists of the people I have to telephone or write, or see, I also keep lists  going back Nome twenty years or so of the initials of every girl I have ever gone out with, every girl I have ever kissed good night, every girl I have ever gotten to third base with and every girl I have ever scored with.... And it's funny when he explains that The reason I made these lists was to be able to reassure myself at glance that I was doing better with women than I actually was. If I was feeling : particularly depressed about an Inability to get a date. why, all I had to do was turn to my secret lists of dating statistics and see that I had managed to plant my lips successfully on those of an actual female person a total of 458 times or get my cupped hand onto a cashmeresweatered breast, a total of 113 times... Hotblooded, male chauvinistic adolescence was like thator almostand we blush and chuckle to remember.

title: C.P.A. UNIT NAMED IN ANTITRUST SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP) The Justice Department today charged the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants with eliminating price competition among its members sales of accounting services.

title: Oil Deal Completed
description: The Standard Oil Company (Indiana) announced yesterday that it had received about 489,500 shares of Midwest Oil Company stock in an exchange offer that expired on Wednesday, giving it approximately 95 per cent of Midwest stock. The transaction had a market value yesterday of more than $55million, based on Indiana's closing quotation of 67 on the New York Stock Exchange. The exchange offer was 1.68 shares of Indiana Standard for each share of Midwest common.

title: Advertising:
description: Young & Rubicam has picked up the Kiku, Xanadu and Music fragrance lines from Faberge. They were previously handled by Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn.

title: Second Delegation Hinted in Michigan By Wallace Group
Centenary of Death of Founder Of New York Herald Is Marked
description: Peter Charles Petrie, a counselor at the British mission to the United Nations, was reading The Times of London last January and, as he scanned list of centenary anniversaries that were to occur this year, he noted that June 1 would mark the hundredth anniversary of the death of his wife's great grandfather, James Gordon Bennett, the founder of The New York Herald.

title: BINGO. ON, $7.20, WINS BY LENGTH
description: The Calumet Farm's Bingo On flashed a formidable stretch run to overtake the opposition and win the feature race, at Belmont Park yesterday. The event was a onemile test for older horses and was witnessed by a gathering of 16,455.

title: CANCER SERVICES TERMED UNEVEN
description: Through the use of the latest methods, more than 50 per cent of the children with acute lymphocytic leukemia can probably be cured, but only 20 per cent of those with the disease are currently receiving the best that medicine has to offer leading researchers said here yesterday.

title: CHARLES SHAFIROFF, SURGEON, 58, IS DEAD
description: Dr. Charles Shafiroff, a surgeon on the staff of Unity Hospital, Brooklyn, and Queens General Hospital, Jamaica, died Wednesday in his sleep of an occlusion of the left coronary artery. He lived at 19910 58 Avenue, Flushing, Queens, and was 58 years old.

title: Kibbee Inaugurated As Head of City U.; 135 Receive Ph.D's
description: Dr. Robert J. Kibbee was inaugurated as the third chancellor of the City University yesterday in ceremonies at which the institution also conferred the Doctor of Philosophy degree on 135 candidates.

title: Medicine Show Collage of Americana
description: Medicine Show is not so much a play as a way of theater. It is a collage of American fact and fiction, patriotic songs, vaudeville turns, tapdancing and tomfoolerycreated and performed by an ensemble of exceptionally attractive and talented actors and actresses.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Strike Held Unlikely By Merchant Marine
description: Prospects for labor peace in the American merchant marine have brightened for June 15, when the bulk of maritime labor contracts expire.

title: Consumer Safety Board Approved by House Panel
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP) A House committee approved today a bill to set up a new Federal board to help protect consumers against unreasonable hazards from products they use at home in school or at play.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT Activities. President Nixon ended his 13day trip to four countries and flew back to Washington, where he made a report to a joint session of Congress on his meeting with Soviet officials.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Dr. Naseer Aruri's May 20 OpEd article again illustrates an interesting facet of Arab psychologybaying and bombast before battle, followed by bleating and breastbeating afterward.

title: An Answer to Kahane
description: Rabbi Meir Kahane's article [OpEd Page, May 263 concludes that the current, ills of American society make ready for genocidal acts against its Jewish citizens and calls for the immediate mass exodus of American Jews to Israel. The facts simply do not bear him out.

title: NIXON FLIES HOME AND TELLS NATION OF SUMMIT GAINS
description: WASHINGTON, June 1President Nixon returned to Washington tonight from his twoweek tour of four nations and told a joint session of Congress that his trip to Moscow had laid the basis for a new relationship between the two most powerful nations on earth.

title: HUMPHREY HAS LEAD IN 2 NATIONAL POLLS
DONALD KINGSLEY, AIDED U.N. AGENCY
description: J. Donald Kingsley, who directed operations of the United Nations Korean Reconstruction Agency and was a former head of the Ford Foundation's program in the Middle East and Africa, died yesterday in London. He lived in Greenwich, Conn., and was 64 years old.

title: Gibson Stumps in Newark In Support of McGovern
BREWKASK TEAM GETS 65 FOR LEAD
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 1 Bill Brew and Fred Kask, highranking players from Connecticut, set a dizzy pace for field of 134 pairminded golfers today in the opening round of the Anderson memorial fourday fixture.

title: Vegetable Custard and a Cobbler for the Weekend
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by, a recipe.

title: Woman Rebel Fighting Tranny in Texas
LOANS ANNOUNCED BY THE WORLD BANK
description: The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (World Bank) announced loans and credits yesterday totaling $153.5million for projects in Brazil, Spain, Kenya and Indonesia.

title: Nashville Banner Publisher
description: NASHVILLE, June 1Wayne Sargent, a 46yearold Gannett Company executive, today was appointed publisher of The Nashville Banner. He succeeds James G. Stahlman, who retired after 42 years as publisher

title: MRS. HYMAN RICKOVER
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP) Mrs. Ruth Masters Rickover, wife of Vice Adm. Hyman G. Rickover, chief of the Navy's Nuclear Propulsion division, died last Thursday, it was reported by the Navy today. She was 69 years old.

title: Governor Signs Bill to Let City Borrow $100Million
description: Governor Rockefeller has signed without comment a bill granting New York City authorization to Issue $100million in budget notes during the city's 197273 fiscal year, beginning July 1.

title: Sales Climbed in May at Large Retail Chains
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It was reported on May 26 that a convicted heroin smuggler, termed by Federal authorities as the largest and most important narcotics distributor in the United States, was sentenced to 25 years in prison. In imposing the sentence, the Federal judge indicated that the defendant was responsible for importing one sixth of the annual supply of heroin used by addicts in this country.

title: All Around Them, Things to Climb and to Read
description: Parents are proud Educators are impressed. But, the children? They take their Un conventional, education and their innovative schoolhouse very much for granted.

title: S.E.C. in a Warning On Distribution Rule
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The Securities and Exchange Commission warned all companies subject to its regulation today that there are specific rules that must be followed when they make pro rata distributions of stock to shareholders.

title: SENATE CAUTIONED ON KLEINDIENST BID
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP)  Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, said today that the Senate was being asked to become a party to a whitewash by Confirming Richard G. Kleindienst as Attorney General before it had all the facts about settlement of antitrust cases against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: Girl, 15, Fatally Stabbed In Fight in Jamaica
description: A teenage girl was stabbed to death yesterday in an afterschool fight with 15 schoolmates in Baisley Pond Park in Jamaica, Queens, the police reported.

title: Spending in April For New Building Rose $800Million
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (Reuters)Total new construction spending rose $800million in April to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of $122.6billion, following a $600million March increase, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Ruling on Youth Vote Is Clarified by State
description: Clarifying the United States Supreme Court ruling on 18to 20yearold youths eligibility to vote in the state's primary June 20, state election officials said yesterday that any youth who is at least 18 and registered and enrolled in a party before May 20 is eligible to vote in the primary of his respective party.

title: 37 Thoroughbreds Killed in Fire at Bostwick Stables
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., June 1A predawn flash fire gutted the famed. Bostwick Stables today, destroying, all 37 thoroughbred horses inside.

title: Stravinsky Items Reflect Mind's Riches
description: More than 100 Igor Stravinsky musical scores, diaries, photographs, letters, posters and rare objects, Most never before exhibited, are on display on the third floor of the Research Library of the Performing Arts at Lincoln Center. They are from the collection of the composer's widow, Vera Stravinsky.

title: Reported in Michigan
description: JACKSON, Mich., June 1 (AP) Mr. Bremer spent a night in a motel in Jackson two days before Governor Wallace was scheduled to attend a rally here, according to the motel owner.

title: Books of The Times
description: GENEVA, June 1Fernand Legros, an art dealer and member of the supporting cast in the Clifford Irving Howard Hughes melodrama, said today that a New York publisher had agreed to stop publication of book repeating Irving's charge that Mr. Legros dealt in fake French Impressionist paintings.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In your May 19 editorial Bangladesh Backlash you spoke of the Bengalis appearing to take a terrible vengeance on the Bihari minority. While appreciating your concern, may I point out that there is no evidence of indiscriminate mob violence'? against the Biharis which could warrant such a conclusion.

title: Hamilton Watch Sees Profit
description: The Hamilton Watch Company, which had a loss of $2.4million in the fiscal year ended Jan. 31, expetts to return to profitable operations in the current fiscal year, Jerome W. Robbins, president, said yesterday at the annual meeting.

title: Governments Criticized
description: GENEVA, June 1Knut Hammarskjold, director general of the International Air Transport Association, sharply criticized governments today for failing to take adequate measures to forestall attacks such as that at Tel Aviv.

title: Charles O. DeBarry, 69, Architect Here, Is Dead
description: Charles O. DeBarry, an architect, who while with Rogers, Butler & Burgun had designed the addition to the Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court in Manhattan, died Wednesday, at his home, 320 East 53d Street. He was 69 years old.

title: STATE UNIT RULED EXEMPT ON ZONING
description: A State Supreme Court justice yesterday upheld the constitutionality of the exemption of the state's Urban Development Corporation from the restrictions of local zoning laws.

title: 852's Focus on Hue and Kontum Areas
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, June 2  The United States command announced yesterday that during the previous 24 hours B52 bombers had made heavy raids in the northernmost provinces of South Vietnam and in the Central Highlands, apparently in an effort to reduce the continuing threat to the cities of Hue and Kontum.

title: ELECTRONICS SEEN AS EDUCATION KEY
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The Carnegie Commission on Higher Education recommended today that the Federal Government spend from $100million to $300million a year over the next seven years to promote the development and spread of the new technology of instruction, a technology based on electronics.

title: Brewers Win in 12 on Roland's 4th W alk, 98
description: MILWAUKEE, June 1  Jim. Roland walked Rick Auerbach with two out and the bases loaded in the 12th inning today, giving Milwaukee a 98 victory and triggering the Yankees angriest postgame reaction of this frustrating season.

title: Cahill Sees His Tax Reform Doomed Unless Labor Reverses Its Opposition
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 1 Gov. William T. Cahill said today his taxreform program was doomed unless the state A.F. of L. and C.I.O. abandoned its opposition to the plan.

title: Times and News Guild Raises Challenged by the Pay Board
description: The New York Times and The Daily News have received letters from the Pay Board challenging the 11 per cent wage increases that became effective March 31, 1972, under threeyear contracts dated March 31, 1970, between each of the publishing companies and the Newspaper Guild of New York.

title: MARKET ENDS DAY ON AN EVEN KEEL
description: The stock market finished, yesterday on an even keel, recovering from its sharp drop, Wednesday.

title: Siderowf Is Ousted From British Golf
description: SANDWICH, England, June 1 (AP)Kemp Richardson, a thin, 6foot2inch, 26yearold stockbroker from Laguna Nigual, Calif., downed two formidable British opponents today and became the last American hope in the quarterfinals of the British Amateurgolf championships.

title: Hospital Crisis
description: The city's voluntary hospitals, already threatened with closing for lack of funds, are marching inexorably toward a strike at the end of this montha strike that would have a calamitous effect on the sick and dying.

title: MILBURN IS VICTOR IN N.A.I.A. HURDLES
description: BILLINGS, Mont., June 1 (AP) Rodney Milburn of Southern Louisiana and Melvin Bassett of North Carolina Central each earned places in the N.A.I.A. record books today with hurdles marks.

title: City Consultant Job for Mrs. Eldridge Disclosed
description: Mrs. Ronnie M. Eldridge, who gave up her $30,000ayear job as a special assistant to Mayor Lindsay last December to help in his Presidential campaign, was disclosed yesterday to have been put on the city payroll as a $135aday consultant six days after the Mayor quit the Presidential race.

title: MRS. JAMES NORRIS
description: Mrs. Marguerite Loris Norris, widow of James Norris, founder of the Norris Grain Company, Chicago, died yesterday at New York Hospital. She lived at 640 Park Avenue and had homes in Palm Beach,, Fla. and Mattituck, L.I. She was 78 years old.

title: Fashion Chain Chief ResignsHe Cites Basic Differences
description: Gordon P. Franklin the 56yearold president of Saks Fifth Avenue, the country's largest fashion specialtystore chain announced his resignation yesterday as a result of basic merchandising differences.

title: MOTHER WINS CHILD IN INTERRACIAL FIGHT
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 1  A young Alabama white woman who gave birth to child of a black man to whom she was not married has won state court battle to regain cuStOdy of. the child.

title: Bridge: Reisinger Play Draws Field With a Cosmopolitan Flavor
description: The early rounds of the Reisinger knockout team championship at the New York Hilton Hotel this week had a cosmopolitan flavor.

title: KING FOR A DAY BY VERDI STAGED
description: Since Verdi's Un Giorno di regno has much delightful music it, the performance presented Wednesday night at Town Hall by the Cosmopolitan Young people's Orchestra was certainly welcome. This was not, however, the American premiere. of the opera as advance publicity and the performance program claimed.

title: Mrs. Nixon, in a Park, Rebels Against Guard
description: WARSAW, June 1 (UPI)Mrs. Richard M. Nixon, on her last morning abroad, rebelled publicly today against the tight protective security that has surrounded her throughout the President's 13day trip.

title: T.V.A. Income Declines
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., June (AP)The Tennessee Valley Authority reported today a net income of $44.7 million on power sales for the quarter ended March 31. The T.V.A. said that that amount was almost $7million less than the net profit for the corresponding quarter a year ago and attributed the decline to increased costs of power production.

title: L.P.G.A. Suspends Janie Blalock
description: A few weeks ago, Janie Blalock bought her brother a truckcamper so he could travel with her on the women's professional golf tour.

title: Sanudo Borrows Putter, Gains Stroke Lead on 65
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., June 1 Lee Trevino's putter had everything to do with it, said Mexicanborn Cesar Sanudo today after he carded a 65 in the first round for the lead in the $175,000 Kemper open golf tourney.

title: BIG ONE, AT LAST, LOOMS FOR INSKO
description: WESTBURY, LI., June 1Del Insko, who has been driving trotters and pacers for 25 years, never has driven In the Hanibletonian, the classic race for trotters. But this season he may do so.

title: Davis Defense Terms Case a Big Hoax
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., June 1Final arguments in the trial of Angela Davis were concluded today with the defense, in its summation, labeling the case against her a sorry chapter in the history of justice in this country.

title: FUNDS ARE ADDED TO MONEY MARKET
description: The Federal Reserve System pumped almost $1.4billion into the money market in the week ended Wednesday, the central bank's regular weekly report showed yesterday.

title: HELPWANTED INDEX ADVANCED IN APRIL
description: Improvement in the employment picture is reflected in the larger volume of helpwanted advertising, according to the Conference Board. The board's helpwanted index in April rose to 93 per cent of the 1967 average and stood 15 points above the level of April, 1971.

title: Hart Asserts S.E.C.Lets Big Board Act Like Cartel
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (UPI)An influential Senator today accused the Securities and Exchange. Commission and the New York Stock Exchange of working together to foster pricefixing in the securities industry and to sacrifice the best interests of small investors.

title: Utility Plans Financing
description: Plans to raise $55million through a sevenyear loan from the First National Bank of Chicago were a announced yesterday by the San Diego Gas and Electric Company. The funds will be used to pay back shortterm loans and the loan is subject to approval by the California Public Utilities Commission.

title: This Weekend's Prospects for Fishing and Boating
description: Fishing Report

title: Executive Changes
description: Robert E. Elberson has been elected president and chief executive officer of the Hanes Corporation. He succeeds Gordon Hanes, who will continue as dhairman of the board.

title: Israeli Jets Over Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June (AP)  Israeli warplanes flew over southern Lebanon for 15 minutes today as this country braced for possible reprisal attacks.

title: Excerpts From NixonGierek Statement
description: WARSAW, June 1 (AP)Following are excerpts from the United StatesPolish communiqu signed by President Nixon and Edward Gierek, the Polish Communist leader, and made public today at the end of Mr. Nixon's visit:

title: Cheers for the President
description: WASHINGTON, June 1President Nixon has now completed the most dramatic experiment of his long career, and while it will be a long time before the, practical results of his trips to China and the Soviet Union are known, his efforts to reach an accommodation with the Communist world have to be recognized as the bravest diplomatic initiative of the postwar generation.

title: SHARES ON AMEX DISPLAY ADVANCE
description: The big story on the American Stock Exchange yesterday was about a stock recently favored by investors that took a nosedive. Guardian Industries shares dropped 13 points to 114, following a pessmistic article in a financial publication about analysts fear that its earnings growth might slow.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The possibility that the Dick Cavett Show will be canceled because of poor Nielsen ratings raised some questions in my mind concerning the Nielsen ratings and their impact on life's quality.

title: Paper Gold for Aid
description: The meatcleaver approach is again in evidence as the Senate Subcommittee on Foreign Operations plunges ahead with its annual hearings on the Administration's requests for foreignaid funds. The Senators are not concealing their desire to cut back sharply, perhaps by as much as onethird, on the appropriation request for $3.56billion, of which well over half is for military aid.

title: Military Alert in Lebanon
description: BBIRUT, Lebanon, June 1Lebanon canceled army leaves today and measures of alert were reported from Sydon to the Israeli boarder. Women and children were said to have been evacuated from commando centers there. Tarpaulins were removed from the Several small antiaircraft guns at Beirut International Airport.

title: CAMPAIGN WORKERS ACT AGAINST POLICE
description: A complaint against two patrolmen from the 63d Precinct, in Brooklyn, was filed yesterday with the Civilian Complaint Review Board on behalf of four volunteer workers for Irving Muldawsky, who is running for the Democratic district leadership in the 39th Assembly District against the incumbent, Meade H. Esposito, who is also the county leader.

title: Times and Ad Agencies Named In $1Billion Class Action Suit
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 1 (AP)  A class action suit seeking more than $1billion in damages from The New York Times, Time magazine and four advertising agencieg for alleged antitrust violations was filed today in Federal District Court here.

title: KODES AND SMITH BEATEN IN TENNIS
description: PARIS, June 1Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia, the defending champion and the topseeded player, was upset today by Patrick Proisy of France in the $100,000 French open tennis tournament and just when it appeared as if an American might win here for the first time since 1955, Stan Smith was upset, too.

title: Robin Stein Married To Steven Gene Miller
description: HARRISON, N. Y., June 1 At. the Jewish Community Center of Harrison this evening Miss Robin Ellen Stein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney A. Stein of White Plains, was married to Steven Gene Miller, son of Mrs. Edith Miller of Elmont, L. I. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Norton D. Shargel, assisted by Cantor Bernard Dienstag.

title: S.E.C. Orders 10Day Halt In Trading of Clinton Oil Co.
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday ordered a 10day suspension of trading overthecounter trading in the shares of the Clinton Oil Company, of Wichita, Kan. The Government charged some vital information had been omitted from both the company's annual and firstquarter reports.

title: A Bright New Downtown Is Taking Shape in Queens
description: An ambitious plan to change the Jamaica Avenue area of Queens from a shabby shopping street under the elevated tracks into a major metropolitan center is rapidly advancing off the drawing boards into the first flush of reality.

title: Poland and the U.S. Agree To Seek Increase in Trade
description: WARSAW, June 1Poland and the United States agreed today to establish a joint commission to expand trade through increased contacts on governmental and business levels. A similar but less formal arrangement will deal with scientific matters.

title: ExPeruvian Judge Pleads Guilty to Smuggling Charge
description: Felix Portocorreiro, 54 years old, a former judge of the Supreme Court of Peru, pleaded guilty yesterday to attempting to smuggle $106,000 worth of diamonds into the United States before Federal Judge Anthony J. Travia in Westbury L. I.

title: Columbia Journalism Alumni Elect a New President Here
description: Wayne Phillips, director of special projects for the American Stock Exchange, last night was elected president of the Alumni Association of the Columbia Graduate School of Journalism.

title: Auto Output Cut
description: DETROIT, June 1 (AP)The Memorial Day holiday cut deeply into United States automobile output this week, the trade journal, Automotive News, reported today.

title: Shooting at Tel Aviv Is Deplored by Pope
description: ROME, June 1Pope Paul VI, in an address today to a crowd in St. Peter's Square, read the text of a message he sent yesterday to President Zalman Shazar of Israel, deploring the massacre at the Tel Aviv airport.

title: 1,500 Demostrate in Paris Over Slayings at Tel Aviv
description: PARIS, Juna 1Over 1,500 Parisians demonstrated tonight against the killings at the airport at Tel Aviv by marching from Place de la Rpublique to the Jewish Memorial near the Seine in the Marais district.

title: The Kleindienst Case
description: Ideally, an Attorney General should be a lawyer, highly regarded for his professional attainments and wise, discriminating judgment. Although aware of political necessities, he ought not be a partisan in a narrow or combative sense. To the President, he should be sagacious counselor able to take a long view in the rush of immediate events. To the public, he should bealong with the members of the Supreme Courtone the ultimate guardians of justice.

title: 4 Concerns Raise Chemicals Prices
description: Prices of chemicals, metals and replacement tires moved upward yesterday.

title: Forest Hills Beats Lincoln For P.S.A.L. Tennis Title
description: Forest Hills won the Public Schools Athletic League tennis championship yesterday by defeating Lincoln High of Brooklyn, 41, on the courts of the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Soviet NuclearWar Gear Said to Be Unequaled in West
description: WIESBADEN, West Germany, May 17Soviet forces in Central Europe have been provided With special vehicles and decontamination equipment for operations in, a nuclear battlefield that. are unmatched in any Western army, according to qualified sources.

title: Report on Training
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. June 1 In a letter to the Security Council, Israel said tonight That Kozo Okamoto, the surviving Japanese gunman seized after the attack at the Tel Aviv airport said that he had been trained for his mission in Lebanon at a camp situated some 20 kilometers, or about 12 miles from Beirut.

title: Ali, Foster and the Quarrys To Fight in DoubleHeader
description: More than $800,000 in purse money will be guaranteed for a boxing doubleheader in Las Vegas, Nev., on June 27. In the feature heavyweight bout, Muhammad All will collect $500,000 for appearing against Jerry Quarry, who has been promised $200,000.

title: Red Smith
description: There is at hand a book entitled Fishing the Dry Fly as a Living Insect, by Leonard M. Wright Jr., a practicing heretic (E. P. Dutton & Co., $6.95). Although the dust jacket identifies Leonard Wright as a New York ad man, it is improbable that he is still alive. His book has been in the stalls about a month. By now, surely, he must have been struck dead for blasphemy, for he has had the mortal audacity to suggest that the high priest, Frederic Halford, and such sainted subdeacons as Theodore Gordon, George M. L. LaBranche and Edward Ringwood Hewitt had rocks in their heads when came to floating a tuft of feather and silk over a trout.

title: State Holds a Party to Mark 5th Lottery Year
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., June 1  State officials served birthday cake and accordion music to 500 lottery enthusiasts at the Roosevelt Field Mall today to celebrate the fifth anniversary of the state drawing.

title: Bridge: Taiwan's Team Makes Rally To Advance in Reisinger Play
description: All the highranked teams, advanced in the third round of Reisinger knockout team play Thursday night at the New York Hilton Hotel.

title: Flown to New York
description: WASHINGTON, June 2  A spokesman for the Justice Department said tonight that Brown had been flown to New York under tight security.

title: Carty Connects for 3 Atlanta Runs in 6th
description: Neither Henry Aaron nor Willie Mays hit a home run or anything else in their first New York confrontation last night, but Rico Carty did as the Atlanta Braves sank the Mets, 61, before 42,757 persons in Shea Stadium.

title: Inquiry on Tariffs on U.S. Films Requested by Rep. Goldwater
description: HOLLYWOOD, June 2 (UPI)Representative Barry Goldwater Jr., Republican of California, whose constituency includes scores of movie and television personalities, has taken showbusiness problems to the State Department for better, treatment abroad.

title: Brooklyn Man Imprisoned In Securities Embezzlement
description: A Federal judge gave a oneyear prison sentence Thursday to a Brooklyn man who had admitted scheming to embezzle $1,183,000 worth of securities from the Bankers Trust Company when he worked there last summer.

title: Miami Beach in Accord On TV Equipment Rent
U.S. Raid Said to Damage Power Plant Near Hanoi
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, June 3The United States command reported yesterday that American warplanes, using smart bombs guided by laser light beams or television cameras, had damaged a power plant near Hanoi described as a major source of electrical power to warrelated industries in the area.

title: Art: The Sculpture of Upper Volta
description: Everything considered, New York City must be the best place in the world to see African sculpture. Brussels may have the best Congolese material and the Musee de I'Homme in Paris has some unrivaled pieces, but New York, with the Museum of Natural History, the Museum of Primitive Art and important private collectors who are generous in lending for exhibition, is hard to beat for a combination of anthropological range and esthetic quality. A small but beautiful exhibition at the Museum of. Primitive Artstill functioning at 15 West 54thStreet pending its absorption by the Metropolitanis the latest pleasure in the field.

title: J. Harold Kolseth Is Dead; Management Consultant, 64
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 2 J. Harold Kolseth, a retired management consultant and former vice president of AnheuserBusch, St. Louis, died Wednesday at Greenwich Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived on. Oakwood Lane.

title: Chilean Opposition Gains ViCtories in Union Elections
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 2The Opposition Christian Democrats have scored surprising victories in elections for the leadership of a number of, national unions this week, including the Chilean Central Union, a political mainstay of the leftist Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: BREWKASK TEAM POSTS 71 FOR 136
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 2Bill brew and Fred Kask, from Wethersfield, Conn., overcame a shaky start to finish with a par round of 71 today to lead a field of 16 qualifiers into the 72hole matchplay sequence of the Anderson Memorial bestball team tournament.

title: U.S. Maps Appeal of Ruling That Overturns Wiretapping
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 2 (AP)The Federal Government is preparing to appeal a judge's ruling that the 1968 Federal wiretap law is unconstitutional, (wiretap States Attorney Carl 3. Melone said today.

title: Britain Asks Payment
description: LONDON, June 2  The British Government today asked its allies in the Central Treaty Organization to put pressure on Iraq to give fair compensation for the seized assets of the Iraq Petroleum Company.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Because of a psychological blunder, the United States proceeded to lose the Korean War after it had won resounding victory there. North Korea had invaded South Korea and had seized perhaps 90 per cent of the territory of South Korea, United States forces having been compressed into small area in the southwestern corner of South Korea surrounding Pusan.

title: Companies Discuss Equal Opportunities for Women
description: About 300 representatives of companies that sell to the Federal Government wound up a twoday conference yesterday on equal opportunity for women in business.

title: Hearings on Natural Gas
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) A Congressional committee will hold hearings this month on natural gas regulation and on a transAlaska oil pipeline proposal. Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, said. the Joint Economic Committee will investigate Wednesday and Thursday the regulation of natural gas by the Federal Power Commission.

title: Ross Jones Weds Cody Johnson
description: The marriage of Miss Katherine Cody Johnson to Ross Jones, an investment manager with the private banking house of Brown Brothers Harriman & Co. took place here yesterday afternoon. The ceremony in St. James Episcopal Church was performed by the Rev. Ralph Warren.

title: Rap Brown Resentenced in New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 2 H. Rap Brown was resentenced here today to five years in prison and a fine of $2,000 for violation of the Federal Gun Control Act.

title: 2 Anti Nixon Republicans in Coast Races
Tokyo Orders Curb on Student Leftists
description: TOKYO, June 2Acting to reduce the possibility of further Japanese terrorist acts abroad like the Tel Aviv airport massacre of Tuesday, the Japanese Government ordered school officials today to keep closer check on radical students at universities and ordered tighter surveillance at airports on overseas travelers.

title: Sally P. Rich Has Nuptials
description: ATLANTA, June 2  Miss Sally Prescott Rich, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Clayton Eugene Rich, was married here this afternoon to Richard Edward Huff, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Ernest. Huff. Both families are of Atlanta, where Mr. Rich is associate director of development for Emory University and Mr. Huff is president of E. E. Huff & Co., mechanical contractors for the building industry.

title: U.S. AGREES TO PACT ON PLANE TEST DATA
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (Reuters  The United States, Britain and France have agreed to accept one an other's test data ozi, new aircraft, a step that could help the sale of new jets, particularly the AngloFrench Concorde, it was announced today.

title: GILBERT, WITH 135, LEADS BY STROKE
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., June 2C. L. (Gibby) Gilbert Jr., who has recovered from an airplane accident that kept him from the pro tour for five weeks earlier in the year, led the $175,000 Kemper open today with a 36hole total of 135.

title: BURUNDIAN DENIES FIGHTING IS ETHNIC
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 2The official Government version of the fighting in Burundi as given here is that no ethnic war is involved and that the fighting was touched off by an invading force that attacked on rafts across Lake Tanganyika.

title: RoseDichter Concert to Aid 14 Civic Groups in Brooklyn
description: Leonard Rose, cello, and Misha Dichter, piano, will give a benefit concert at Carnegie Hall a week from tomorrow to aid 14 Brooklyn community organizations. The expenses of the concert have been underwritten by Frederick W. Richmond, the Brooklyn civic leader and philanthropist who is chairman of the board of Carnegie Hall.

title: Soviet Calls Iraq's Seizure Of Oil Holdings a'Victory
description: MOSCOW, June 2The seizure of Western oil interests by Iraq and Syria was hailed in the official Soviet press today as a great victory for the Arab peoples.

title: Eastern Team Gains Final For Sears Cup in Tennis
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., June 2  Teams representing the Eastern and Middle Atlantic Lawn Tennis Associations gained the final today in the intersectional women's matches for the Sears Cup at the Piping Rock Club.

title: Attica Inmates Give To SickleCell Fund
description: ATTICA, N. Y., June 2 (UPI)A group of 269 Attica Correctional Facility inmates have raised $398.30 to help fight sicklecell anemia, it was disclosed today.

title: U. S. Court Rules Mrs. Chisholm Must Receive Equal Time on TV
Rev. James F. McDonald, Pastor of St. Rose of Lima
description: The Rev. James F. McDonald, pastor of St Rose of Lima Roman Catholic Church, Rockaway Beach, Queens, for the last seven years, died yesterday in Peninsula General Hospital, Rockaway Beach. He was 64 years old.

title: The Old Values Are the Best Values
description: OXFORD, OhioMay I offer a suggestion that will horrify many of your readers? This is it: One of the greatest needs of American education is a commitment and a program to develop character.

title: CHRYSLER DEFERS MITSUBISHI DEAL
description: TOKYO, June 2 (AP)The Chrysler Corporation has suspended a plan to buy an additional 25 per cent interest in the Mitsubishi Motor Corporation, Chrysler and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd. announced today in a joint statement.

title: Senator Gravel to Seek VicePresidential Spot
description: SOUTH PORTLAND, Me., June 2 (AP)Senator Mike Gravel of Alaska said today that he would seek the Democratic VicePresidential nomination if a race develops.

title: Richardson, Last U. S. Golfer, And Bonallack Lose in Britain
description: SANDWICH, England, June 2 (AP) Kemp Richardson, the last American in the British Amateur golf championship, bowed out in the quarterfinals today when Alan Thirlwell, 43 yearold Briton who was the runnerup in 1958, beat him at the 20th hole on the Royal St. George course.

title: New Gangway Devised For Evacuating Trains
description: WASHINGTON, June 2An engineer for the New York Transit Authority has invented an emergency gangway to evacuate passengers from stalled subway or rail

title: No Comment From Boston
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP)The Boston school system declined immediate comment today on the charges by the Federal Government that it was maintaining racial segregation.

title: Concorde Prototype Begins 10Nation Tour
description: LONDON, June 2Britain's prototype of the Concorde took off into a wild blue yonder of uncertainty today as it began a 40,000mile, 10nation sales promotion tour.

title: Dublin Arrests Protested
description: DUBLIN, Jun 2The ProviIsional wing of the Irish Republican Army told Prime Minister John Lynch in a statement today that the arrest of Its leaders would not deter it from continuing its campaign to drive the British Army out of Ulster.

title: America: In Search of Safe Places
description: Is the United States still inhabitable? We decided to find out, and the result was a memorable 20,000mile trip across America.

title: F.T.C. VIOLATION LAID TO SOUTHLAND CORP.
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (UPI) The Southland Corporation was accused today of illegally using the purchasing power of its 7Eleven grocery store chain to force food companies to buy Southland chemical products.

title: Illinois Airport Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) The Department of Transportation said today that the Federal Aviation Administration would conduct a public hearing at a date and place to be determined, on a request for Federal aid to build an airport in Illinois to serve the greater St. Louis area. The hearing was requested by Missouri, the MissouriSt. Louis Mertpolitan Airport Authority and St. Louis County.

title: The Meek Inherit The Subway Seats
description: How do you get a seat on the subway? YOu ask for it. That is the tentative conelusion of a stiidy done by 15 doctoral psychology students at the. City. University Graduate; School and discussed at a conference on urban life yesterday at the City University Center, 33 West. 42d Street.

title: Notes on People
description: The Folk Festival at Kerrville, Tex., was going along pretty much as expected, and then suddenly there he was, a surprise guest, clapping his hands and stomping his feet Lyndon B. Johnson, appearing in public for the first time since his heart attack April 7. The former President and his party, including his wife and Darrell Royal, coach of the University of Texas football team, stayed at the festival for about an hour. Mr. Johnson, who left, the hospital May 13, smiled and shook the hands of several spectators before going home to the ranch. Mrs. Johnson said This came as a surprise to us all. He, on the spur of the moment, said, Let's all to the music festival.

title: The New Equilibrium
description: President Nixon was justifiably jubilant when addressed Congress immediately upon his return from Moscow, Teheran and Warsaw. His negotiations with Leonid I. Brezhnev and his earlier negotiations with Mao Tsetung and Chou Enlai are changing the political geography of the world. There is good warrant for his hope that they have begun to free us from perpetual confrontation. Trouble spots and potential dangers remainnotably in Vietnam and the Middle Eastand so do areas of intense ideological and political competition. But their menace is more than counterweighed by the promise of the new equilibrium and the new alignment now in the formative stage.

title: TRADING STOPPED IN ISRAELI PAPER
description: A stock that did not trade at all yesterday offered an interesting subject for talk among investors. The American Stock Exchange stopped trading all day yesterday in shares of American Israeli Paper Mills. The reason was a huge order influx for shares, which jumped 2 to reach 9 on Thursday.

title: EMPIRE FIRE ADDS 3 TO LEAD NEW ISSUES
description: The first public offering of stock in the Empire Fire and Marine Insurance Company sparked an otherwise quiet newissue market this week, with the specialty company's shares advancing from an offering price of 16 a share on Wednesday to 19 yesterday.

title: Transit Sparkplug
description: In common with most forceful administrators, Chairman William J. Ronan of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority has plenty of detractors. But his record trying to improve the citystate network of subways, buses and commuter railroads makes plain his dedication to the cause of more efficient mass transita dedication he has carried into his duties as a commissioner of the decidedly nontransitminded Port Authority.

title: Politics vs. Petroleum
description: The seizure of the Iraq Petroleum Company by the Iraqi and Syrian Governments Thursday has the potential to become the greatest crisis in world oil since the nationalization of the Iranian oil industry by Premier Mohammed Mossadegh in the early nineteenfifties.

title: Mrs. King, Miss Goolagong Reach French Tennis Final
description: PARIS, June 2Mrs. Billie Jean King and Evonne Goolagong gained the final of the $100,000 FrenCh open tennis tournament today with less than scintillating victories.

title: Helping the Voiceless Children
description: I recently went to Hue to see the damage caused by the new fighting. Before it began doctors at.the hospital. there estimated it would take thirty years after the fighting stopped to take care, of the war's innocent victims. Now it most certainly was worse sudden rocketing followed by heavy bombing in populated areas.

title: CITY IS STUDYING AIRCONDITIONERS
description: Charging that the.airconditioning industry's, attempt at selfregulation was a'. attempt and a fiasco, Milton Musicus, chairman of theMayor's Committee on Public Utilities, said the city; might have to impose regulations on the sale of home airconditioners.;

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Over the joint protest of the governments of Fiji, Tonga, Western Samoa, the Cook Islands, Nauru, New Zealand and Australia, the French will resume their nuclear testing in the atmosphere at Mururoa in French Polynesia in June.

title: Antiques: Real Art Deco
description: See the Jean Puiforcat exhibition at the Sonnabend Gallery, 924 Madison Avenue, if you want to understand what Art Deco is really all about.

title: Italians Parade Might On Republic's Birthday
description: ROME, June 2Italy celebrated the 26th anniversary of the Republic today with a twohour military parade that experts described as the most impressive display of armed strength here since World War II

title: Peyote Wins Jumping Title at Devon
description: DEVON, Pa., June 2Peyote finished fourth in the stake and the single point he picked up enabled him to win the intermediate jumper championship today at the Devon horse show.

title: S.I. Poverty Area Getting Federal Medical Help
description: Across the VerrazanoNarrows Bridge, past the neonlighted shopping centers, beyond the neighborhood of booming home construction on Staten Island is a pocket of poverty.

title: McGovern Wins 8 Kentucky Delegates
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., June 2Senator George McGovern of South Dakota did slightly better than expected today in Kentucky's delegate conventions, capturing eight of 35 delegates to the National Democratic Convention in Miami Beach, opening July 10.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Nearly three years ago, Joe Louis, bulkily muscular a beige sports jacket, was sitting in the upstairs room Les Champs restaurant. He was there for a news conference to announce the formation of the Joe Louis Food Franchise Corporation, which never materialized. But that day, he was talking about Muhammad Ali, also known as Cassius Clay, then unlicensed as a boxer during the appeal to the United States Supreme Court of his draftrefusal case.

title: U.S. AIRMAN RESCUED NORTHWEST OF HANOI
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, June 3 (AP)A huge United States Air Force rescue armada plucked a downed airman from deep behind enemy lines northwest of Hanoi yesterday, spokesmen disclosed today.

title: Epic Journey Takes Mile by 2 Lengths at Belmont
description: Epic Journey became the late favorite with the crowd of 19,057 at Belmont Park yesterday, and he proved that the confidence in him was justified. Competing against six others in a mile contest for older horses, Epic Journey responded to splendidly judged ride by Chuck Baltazar to carry the colors of Mrs. Ethel D. Jacobs to score by two lengths over John Marsh's Eager Exchange.

title: Thousands Reported Dead In Massacres in Burundi
description: BUKAVU, Zaire, May 30Thousands of refugees are arriving here from neighboring Burundi in what diplomats call one of the worst ethnic wars in modern African history.

title: Plane Seized at Reno
description: RENO, June 2 (UPI)  A hooded hijacker commandeered a United Airlines 727 today as it disembarked passengers and demanded $200,000 in unmarked onedollar bills.

title: Kennedy Platform Inquiry Told Economy Is the Issue
Letters to the Editor
description: To The Editor: I would like to notify your readers of an innocentappearing hazard that most have in their homes. That disposable glass bottle filled with carbonated beverages has the potential for destroying an eye or some other part of the human body.

title: Britain's deserves Up for 20th Month In May to New High
description: LONDON, June 2 (UPI)Britain's gold and foreigncurrency reserves increased in May for the 20th consecutive month, the Treasury said today.

title: BISHOPS THREATEN TO EXPEL MAKARIOS
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, June 2 (AP)The Holy Synod of the Cypriote Orthodox Church has reiterated its threemonthold demand for the resignation of Archbishop Makarios as head of state, warning that he would be expelled from the church if he failed to comply within nine days.

title: Executive Changes
description: The B. F. Goodrich Company has named Gerard Alexander and Thomas B. Nantz, as executive vice presidents.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 2 (AP)Miss Davis was visibly shaken when told of the report that she was part of the hijacker's demands.

title: French Weigh Move
description: PARIS, June 2French oil interests have taken under serious consideration an offer by Iraq to negotiate a separate deal following the nationalization of the Iraq Petroleum Company.

title: BOSTON'S SCHOOLS FACE BIAS HEARING
description: WASHINGTON, June 2Charges against the Boston school system of niaintaining racial segregation were ordered today to be heard by a Federal examiner, the first noncompliance action filed against a major Northern school district.

title: Envoy's Dispatch Reported
description: TOKYO, June 2 (AP)The Japanese Foreign Ministry has dispatched a staff member from New York to Puerto Rico to check reports that antiJapanese feeling was mounting there following Tuesday's slaying of 17 Puerto Ricans by three Japanese guerrillas at the Tel Aviv international airport. Kyodo News Service reported today.

title: U.S. NEARS ACCORD ON SWISS BANKS
description: GENEVA, June 2The United States and Switzerland are reported to be near agreement on a treaty under which Swiss banks would be subject to requirements by Swiss courts to provide information on money deposited by American criminals.

title: William H. Johnson Dies; White industries President
description: CLEVELAND, June 2William H. Johnson, president of White Consolidated Industries, Inc., industrial manufacturers, died yesterday after having suffered a heart attack four weeks ago. He lived in suburban Pepper Pike and was 51 years old.

title: Aid for Sickle. Cell Study
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (UPI)A check for $20,000 raised at a concert sponsored by the cadets at West Point was presented today to the sickle cell anemia research center at Freedman's Hospital in Washington. The concert was held Armed Services Day, May 20, with Stevie Wonder, the Supremes, Smokestack and Ecstasy and other singers donating their services.

title: LEGAL AID GROUPS CLASH ON POLICY
description: A major clash is developing between the Legal Aid. Society and Community Action for Legal Services over the philosophy of legal services to the poor and control of a neighborhood legal services office in the South Bronx.

title: Mutual Fund Payout Up
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (UPI) Mutual funds distributed $825million in dividends and capital gains in the first quarter of this year, the highest quarterly payout since the first quarter of 1970. Shareholders reinvested $662million in the funds. The average mutual fund account at the end of March was $5,486, compared with $5,000 a year earlier.

title: Pratt Graduates Hear Call For Committed Response
description: Events of the last few years have shown that a degree of change can arise from protest, but the hope for America rests on a committed response, Representative Shirley Chisholm said yesterday.

title: Kent State Room Searches In May, 1970, Ruled Illegal
description: CLEVELAND, June 2 (UPI)A federal judge ruled today that a search of Kent State University dormitory rooms following the shooting deaths of four students by National Guardsmen on May 4, 1970, was illegal.

title: Great Southwest Reduces Its Loss
description: The Great Southwest Corporation, following completion of an audit for 1971, announced yesterday higher revenues and a reduced loss for the year. The company also reported that its financial statement for the three preceding years had been restated to reflect a settlement reached earlier this week with the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to accounting for three major transactions in 1968 and 1969.

title: PEARL LANG GIVES MYSTICAL SHIRAH
description: Pearl Lang is an exceptionally beautiful dancer with lyrical lift to her whole body. It is a delight to see the singing line of her movement in almost anything. In her concert Thursday evening at Hunter College Playhouse, those works in which she appeared the most dominated those in which she had little or no part. Shirah, a mystical dance based on a joyous Hasidic parable, was one of her most effective vehicles.

title: Teachers Ratify Pact
description: CHICAGO, June 2 (UPI)Chicago's public school teachers have accepted the lastminute settlement that forestalled their strike last week. A 13,2344,715 vote yesterday ratified the agreement.

title: HEARINGS RECESSED IN CHICAGO DISPUTE
description: CHICAGO, June 2Hearings on challenges to 59 uncommitted. Democratic National Convention delegates from Chicago, including. Mayor Richard J. Daley, were recessed at midnight last night until next Thursday.

title: Bootless Firemen Climb 40 Flights To Combat Blaze
description: Four firemen in their stocking feet climbed 40 flights of stairs yesterday morning after a fire broke out in a machinery room on the top floor of an office building at 399 Park Avenue, near 54th Street, trapping three persons in an elevator for more than an hour.

title: Books of The Times
description: Robert Shogan, who covers the Supreme Court for Newsweek, has written a model book. He has taken a sensational case; the resignation under fire of. Justice Abe Fortas from the Supreme Court, stripped it of its extravagances and excesses, and made it into a tense, resilient and affecting narrative. Instead of milking the sensational aspects of the story or making capital of its cast of characters that includes, at the top, two Presidents, he has combined the personal elements and the historical to show a man whirled around by forces he could not control or ride, Many will say that his punishment was greater than his fault.

title: You Worry About Your Manhood
description: HOLYOKE, MassAnna looked at George across the breakfast table knowing she was supposed to be understanding and wondering why she felt only anger.

title: George Francklyn Lawrence, Investment Banker, Dies at 77
description: George Francklyn Lawrence, an investment banker and former London representative for Dillon, Read & Co., died yesterday, at his home, 155 East 72d Street. He was 77 years old.

title: Dividends Expand
description: A total of 161 companies took favorable dividend action last month, up from 141 in April and 127 in May, 1971, Standard & Poor's said yesterday. Favorable action includes an increase, an extra or resumed payout.

title: Dellacroce Begins Sentence
description: Aniello Dellacroce, reputedly second in command of the Carlo Gambino Mafia family, surrendered to authorities in New York yesterday to begin serving a oneyear prison term. He was convicted in 1971 of contempt for refusing to answer questions on organized crime before a grand jury. Appeals of the conviction had delayed the start of the 57yearold Dellacroce's imprisonment.

title: The AllNight Supermarket: Nice to Shop in Your Nightgown
description: Is the East Coast ready for the allnight supermarket?

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 33yearold Brooklyn rabbi was arrested yesterday on bribery charges in connection with an alleged attempt to get city. funds for a daycare center he operated. The rabbi, Moses Kessler of 1568 50th Street, was arrested by detectives in the office of the Commissioner of Investigation, Robert K. Ruskin.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: On the first page of The Times of May 21 there appeared an article entitled Modern Medical Price: Bankruptcy for a Family, relating to the cost of securing extraordinary medical services in connection with the occurrence of a sudden and very serious medical emergency.

title: TWO INDICATORS OF ECONOMY RISE
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) The Government released two bullish reports on the state of the nation's economy today, including one that reflected continued strong consumer spending.

title: Nixon Sends Pressmen at Times His Thanks for Protest Over Ad
description: President Nixon's special consultant on labor affairs personally delivered the President's thanks last night to pressmen who in against publication n The New York Times of a paid twopage advertisement seeking Mr. Nixon's impeachment.

title: Court Order Allows Miss Blalock to Play Despife Suspension
description: ATLANTA, June 2 (UPI)A Federal judge cleared the way today for Janie Blalock to compete in tournaments despite oneyear suspension by the ladies Professional Golf Association.

title: Would Padlock Pentagon
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., June 2 (AP)Gus Hall, the Communist party's candidate for President, says that, if elected, he will padlock the Pentagon, the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Intelligence Agency and will close all united States military bases. Mr. Hall spoke in Grand Rapids last night to a handful of supporters,

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, June 2In the opinion of wellinformed diplomats in the Far East, the Premier of North Vietnam, Pham Van Dong, was out of his country for at least four days during the Moscow summit meeting:. May 23 through 26. The general guess is that he was in China, but it is only a guess.

title: Dolph, Head of A.B.A., To Step Down in Fall
description: Jack Dolph, the 44yearold former television network executive who helped raise the American Basketball Association to a position of respectability, resigned yesterday as commissioner of the league, effective in October, the final month of his threeyear contract.

title: Japanese, Fearing Reprisals, Leave Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico, June 2 (AP)About 25 Japanese employes of a colortelevision manufacturing company and their families have left Puerto Rico in fear of possible reprisals for the slaying of Puerto Rican pilgrims in is rael Tuesday by three Japanese terrorists.

title: B.O.A.C. Plans Routes
description: TOKYO, June 2 (AP)  The British Overseas Airways Corporation hopes to inaugurate Concorde supersonic air service linking London with New York, Tokyo, Johannesburg and Sydney early in 1975, David Nicolson, chairman of the British Airways Board said today.

title: Military Pentathlon Opens
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., June 2 (AP)The 1972 world military pentathlon championships officially opened at Fort Sam Houston today with formal ceremonies. Competition in the Conseil International du Sport Militaire begins tomorrow with horseback riding over an obstacle course.

title: Women's Lib in Colombia: The Restraint Is Fading
description: BOGOTA, Colombia Women's liberation, a budding movement in South American countries, has at least one or two blooms here.

title: Fetes Benefit Primaries Here
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 Last Wednesday evening, guests milled about the spacious stone house and lawn of Raymond Lamontagne, a Washington businessman, just north of the Washington Zoo, paying $25 a person and sipping wine to raise money for a Democratic

title: U.S. Seeks Compensation
description: WASHINGTON, June 2, (Reuters)  The United States said today it hoped Iraq would make prompt and adequate compensation for the multimilliondollar holdings of the Westernowned Iraq Petroleum Company.

title: Democratic Convention Reform: More Blacks, Women and Youth
description: WASHINGTON, June 2A study of the first onethird of the delegates chosen for the Democratic National Convention shows that the proportion of women is running at three times the level set in 1968, that the proportion of blacks is nearly double and that of other minorities is higher.

title: Fittipaldi Fastest in Trial
description: NIVELLES, Belgium, June 2 (AP)  Emerson Fittipaldi of Brazil, at the wheel of his John Player Special Lotus, clocked the fastest lap today in the first day of trials for Sunday's Grand Prix of Belgium Formula I race. Fittipaldi was clocked in 1 minute 11,6 seconds, 116. 088 miles an hour.

title: China Buying More Of Canada's Wheat
description: OTTAWA, June 2 (Canadian Press)Canadian wheat sales to China this year received a $100million boost today with the announcement of an additional Chinese purchase of 58.8 million bushels.

title: Bomb Threat Empties Streets of Stuttgart at Midday
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, June 2Thousands of policemen combed streets, parks and parking lots for an hour today, seeking cars loaded with plosives that anarchists had threatened to set off between 1 and 2 P.M.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Passengersand drivershave for years been smoking on buses despite plain No Smoking signs. Now people are smoking more and more on the subways. How in the world are nonsmokers to make smokers understand thatwhile we would of course defend their right to smoke unto death we don't want to smoke their smoke because it might be the death of us?

title: Burundi at a Glance
