description: GEOGRAPHY Burundi is 10,747 square miles of grassy uplands and plateaus in Central Africa, 1,000 miles from the closest seaport. The population was estimated in 1970 at 3.5 million. The capital is Bujumbura, a picturesque place of terraced banana plantations on the eastern shore of Lake Tanganyika; its population is 75,000.

title: FOOD PRICES PACE WHOLESALE INDEX IN SHARP MAY RISE
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 Wholesale prices, paced by renewed spurt in food prices, rose sharply again in May, and unemployment once again failed to decline.

title: S.E.C. SUES LEVITZ, ENDS TRADING BAN
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission filed suit today against the Levitz Furniture Corporation, charg:ng that the warehouse furniture dealer did not tell prospective stockholders about a pending labor contract with the teamsters union.

title: Auto Output Drops
description: DETROIT, June 2 (AP)Following are the weekly automobile production results released today by Automotive News, the trade publication:

title: 14 ARE SUSPENDED OVER A JAIL RIOT
description: Suspensions Of from three to 20 days without pay were imposed yesterday on 14 uniformed personnel, including four assistant deputy wardens, who pleaded guilty to charges arising from a jail riot in Long Island City, Queens, in October, 1970.

title: Criminal Trial for Kerner Is Slated for November 15
description: CHICAGO, June 2 (AP)A Federal judge today set November 15 for the trial of Otto Kerner, former governor of Illinois, and four codefendants accused of fraud and other criminal charges in connection with ownership of race track stock.

title: Comment in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 2President Suleiman Franjieh said today that the country was taking steps to halt the publicity activities of the Arab commando group that claimed responsibility for the Tel Aviv airport massacre.

title: Labor's Changing Face
description: Few unions have done nearly as much to civilize labormanagement relations and to promote social idealism as the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America. Its tradition of industrial peace and community, concern, initiated nearly sixty years ago by Sidney Hillman, has been embellished in the quartercentury since his death by Jacob S. Potofsky, as president and Frank Rosenblum as secretarytreasurer.

title: Roundup: Blue Wins Oriole Fans but Loses Game
description: Vida Blue hasn't been able to win yet this season, but the Oakland Athletics lefthander pitcher hasn't lost any of his ability to draw fans into parks.

title: Conrad, Mont., a Casualty of the Nuclear Arms Pact
description: CONRAD, Mont., June 2 Considering all that happened, it didn't seem right that Chester Ferris should have a smile on his face. But he did. It was like the old joke about the man with the spear through his chest who said it only hurt when he laughed. I'm glad Nixon

title: Republic Steel to Transfer Export Unit to Cleveland
description: The Republic Steel Corporation confirmed yesterday that it was moving its export division from New York City to corporate headquarters in Cleveland. A spokesman said the move was to provide better service to customers, since employes of the division would be closer to the sales staff and corporate headquarters.

title: CONSUMERS QUIT HOSPITAL BOARD
description: All eight consumer members of the 17member St. Vincent's Hospital advisory board resigned yesterday, charging that the hospital's management had deliberately withheld information they needed to perform their duties.

title: Derailment Injures 13
description: DALLAS, June 2 (AP)An explosion or a derailed tank car injured 13 persoms, started flames that destroyed five houses and forced at least 200 persons to flee their homes early today. Officials said the tank car, filled with liquefied petroleum gas, blew up after five cars in a Missouri Pacific Railroad freight jumped the track in a switching yard.

title: MRS. CHARLES HAPKETT
description: LINCOLNVILLE BEACH, Me., June 2 (AP)Mrs. Virginia Z. Hackett, widow of Charles F. Hackett, a Metropolitan Opera singer who died in 1942, died yesterday in a nursing home. She was 72 years old.

title: Market Place:
description: A problem involving potential conflicts of interest has, resulted from Wall Street's publicownership spree, It boils down to this question: Can you get an objective appraisal of the investment merits of a brokerage company?

title: 2 SOLDIERS KILLED BY MINE IN ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 2 (AP)  A road mine at the border of the Irish Republic killed two British soldiers today and wounded two others.

title: Schoterman Sets Hammer Mark
description: EUGENE, Ore., June 2 United States hammer throwing, at the mercy of European minds and muscle during the last decade, brightened considerably today when Al Schoterman uncorked the finest toss by an American collegian this year, 231 feet 3 inches, during the National Collegiate outdoor track and field champion shhips.

title: Israel Vows to Retaliate But Not With Rash Action
description: JERUSALEM, June 2  A senior, Israeli Cabinet Minister promised today that the massacre at Tel Aviv's international airport Tuesday would be fully avenged, but not by any rash or impatient Israeli action.

title: Antiwar Vigil in 2d Year Outside the White House
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 Nearly 100 protesters gathered on a White House sidewalk this afternoon as an antiwar vigil there began its second year.

title: Grant for Puerto Rico
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 UPI)The Labor Department regional office in New York has awarded a $76,543 grant to Puerto Rico for occupational safety and health planning, Resident CommiSsioner Jorge L. Cordova Diaz announced today.

title: City's Tangled Budget
description: There is no way of knowing how much the city's elongated, confused budget struggle preoccupied Mayor Lindsay during his weeklong vacation in the Bahamas.

title: SHOP TALK
description: The reason the Donald Davies shirt dress has inspired something of a cult is quite simple. If a woman likes it she can obtain it in about 500 different colors and patterns. At least that is the variety being offered at the Donald Davies shop at 19 East 57th Street. "A Donald Davies lady will come in and buy five or six at a clip and just live in them, says Cherry Swasey, manager of the store, the first the Irish designer has opened in this country. They are our bread and butter dress. We can't keep enough of them in stock.

title: Screen: 'Top of the Heap' Examines Black Cop With Problems
description: "Top of the Heap," which opened yesterday at the Forum Theater, was written, produced and directed by Christopher St. John, a young black actor who had a feature role in "Shaft," and who now stars himself as a Washington cop with problems.Conditions in general must present any black cop with problems enough, but St. John's cop also makes up his ownwith an attitude of un-relaxed rage for his world and, for himself, a hyperactive fantasy mechanism that keeps going off at the drop of a symbol (usually phallic) and that transports him into dreams of public grandeur or private sexual bliss.There are, of course, explanations for both the aggressive anger and the eager retreat, and everybody around the cop works very hard to apply them. They include a mother's death, the decision not to attend her funeral, no money, no promotion to sergeant, a teen-age daughter starting on dope, a demanding wife, a more demanding mistress, and the assorted friends and enemies who see black first, policeman second, and man hardly at all.But the cop's reactions, and the intensity of his unreal emotional life, are still in excessof anything that provokes them or anyone who misguidedly tries to lay them to rest. And it is only because of this excess that "Top of the Heap" occasionally manages to develop a measure of genuine interest as a movie, to break out of the already deadly stereotypes of black-white confrontation film, to become ironic, sometimes fantastic, and even comic.I suspect that Christopher St. John may some day make and act in very good funny movies. The general drift of this one, unfortunately, is toward pathetic tragedy.At the times when he passes into another level of consciousness the cop sees himself as a heroic astronaut (except when he sees himself as a tropical lover) occupying spaces that are suspiciously white-on-white, annexing the moon and immediately littering it with food wrappers, conducting his own one-man welcome celebration.Not all this material is equally successful. Much of it isn't any good at all. But some of it is quite intricately good. And it suggests an actor (writer, producer and director) who has ideas, and sufficient command over his own very powerful presence to work those ideas into the kinds of metaphors that are for film among the basic signs of life.

title: Counselor Killed in a Fall From Classroom Window
description: A guidance counselor was killed yesterday when she fell out of a window of a fifthfloor classroom at Public School 182 at 720 Dumont Avenue, in the East New York section of Brooklyn, the police reported. The 12th Detective District listed her death as an apparent suicide.

title: Ballet Danish Repertory
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, June 1One of the things that Flemming Flindt has achieved during his sevenyear tenure as director of the Royal Danish Ballet has been to increase its American accent. The company is not so Americanoriented as are some other European troupes, but it does have a large American repertory and also an American, Bruce Marks, as one of its star dancers.

title: Counterfeit Bill Charge
description: BOSTON, June 2, (AP)Felix Figueroa, 26 years old, of New York was indicted by a Federal grand jury today on a charge of illegal possession of $1,600 in counterfeit $20 bills.

title: Dinner With Mrs. Sun Yatsenip Old Peking
description: PEKING, June 2Dinner at Mrs. Sun Yatsen's home, a palace that once housed a Manchu prince on the banks of the Imperial Lakes in the northern quarter, is a rare event.

title: Cast Changes Add New Interpretations To Royal Invitation
description: Changes in the cast in The Invitation, one of Kenneth MacMillan's dancedramas for the Royal Ballet, made for distinctively different interpretations Thursday night at the Metropolitan Opera House when compared with those given earlier this week.

title: Reaction by Company
description: POTTSTOWN, Pa., June 2A Levitz spokesman here said today that the S.E.C. actions relate solely to the alleged, material nondisclosures in the company's registration statement and preliminary prospectuses and certain pending labor matters as referred to by the S.E.C.

title: Geometric Abstractions of 30's Shown
description: A casual mention of American art of the thirties generally brings to mind notions of social realism. We think of, say, the W.P.A. murals celebrating various aspects of the American way of life, the political paintings of Ben Shahn or the Thomas Hart Benton renderings of a Midwestern farm. But abstract art, which had already established a tradition in the American esthetic, also formed part of the period's pictorial expression.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: New York University's task force has labored mightly to come up with one of the most socially irresponsible recommendations ever to emanate from an academic body. The fiscal hangups of the university, instead of being shared equally by all facets of university activity, now are to be resolved partly by elimination of the Graduate School of Social Work.

title: Laura Chittenden Wed to D. J. Brooks
description: RYE, N. Y., June 2Miss Laura Dunham Chittenden and Dwight Jordon Brooks, students at the University of Wisconsin, were married here this afternoon.

title: E.P.A. TO LET FORD SHIP 1973 MODELS
description: WASHINGTON, June 2The Environmental Protection Agency announced today that it would permit the Ford Motor Company to ship its 1973 models provided they can meet preliminary pollution tests.

title: U.S. Acupuncture Use in 5 Years Is Seen
description: The head of New York State's medical regulatory body said yesterday that acupuncture to deaden the pain of surgery could be generally accepted in this country in two to five years.

title: Conservative Democrat Favored in Texas Today
BROWN ADVANCES TO ROWING FINAL
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., June 2Although only seven of its eight oarsmen were pulling any water in the last 200 meters, Brown's unheralded crew today rowed its way into tomorrow's final for the intercollegiate championship.

title: Release of Black Activist Ordered in Marijuana Case
description: HOUSTON, June 2Lee Otis Johnson, a 33 year old black activist who has served four years of a 30year sentence for giving a marijuana, cigarette to a police undercover agent here in 1967, was ordered released on $10,000 bond by a Federal judge.

title: DAVIS CASE GOES TO JURY ON COAST
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., June 2A jury of seven women and five men began its deliberations late this morning in the trial of Angela Davis and after six hours recessed for, the night.

title: 2 Rescued After CaveIn
description: BOSTON, June 2 (AP)Two men were rescued today from a cavein that buried them in a 15foot trench in the Fields Corner section. Both men, Colman Riddge, 26 years old, and Patrick Flavin, 33, were reported to be in good condition at Carney Hospital.

title: CityState Relief Dispute Is Becoming More Heated
description: The citystate dispute over welfare fraud statistics grew angrier, yesterday, with each side charging misrepresentation and deceit. City Human Resources Administrator Jule M. Sugarman, seeking to discredit a charge by State Welfare Inspector General George F. Berlinger that 20 to 30 per cent of the cases on the city's welfare rolls were ineligible for assistance, accused the state official of distorting the statistics for political purposes.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Eleazar Lipsky [letter May 24] might be reminded of the little girl who was taken to church for the first time and heard the minister deliver a rather scathing sermon. After the service she was asked what she thought of it. She replied that she didn't think that the man should have said all those bad things about the Christians because there might have been some of them there.

title: Jockey Hurt in Spill
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., June 2 (AP)Fernando Toro suffered a concussion and facial bruises today when he was spilled from his mount during the first race at Hollywood Park. The 31yearold Chilean was knocked unconscious from the fall after his mount, Galleria, clipped the heels of Grey Silky and fell midway in the far turn.

title: U.S. CALLS ON CENTO FOR MIDEAST ALERT
description: LONDON, June 2 (AP)The United States urged four allied nations today to guard against any new Soviet thrusts through the. Middle East and South Asia despite President Nixon's understandings with the Kremlin.

title: Theater: Of the Absurd
description: Concealed thought becomes comic action in Sharon Thie's Soon Jack November at the Manhattan Theater Club. We pretend, therefore we perform.

title: State Opens Way for Arbitration in Hospital Labor Dispute Here
description: Vincent D. McDonnell, chairman of the State Mediation Board, said yesterday that he had paved the way for binding arbitration in contract negotiations between the League of Voluntary Hospitals and Local 1199 of the Drug and Hospital, Union.

title: AUGUSTUS GIBSON, 63, RESEARCH EXECUTIVE
description: BLOOMFIELD, N. J., June 2 Dr. Augustus Gibson, vice president for scientific affairs of the ScheringPlough Corporation, died yesterday in Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center in New York. He was 63 years old and lived here at the Troy Towers Apartment.

title: U.S. Says Rattenni Tampered With Jury in TaxBribery Trial
description: Federal jury tampering charges against Nicholas A. Rattenni were announced here yesterday by United States Attorney Whitney North Seymour Jr.

title: Bags of Elizabeth 2's Passengers XRayed
description: Near a boarding gangplank of the Queen Elizabeth 2 at Pier 84 yesterday, an elderly passenger watched with puzzlement as his suitcase was taken from him and placed in front of a camera.

title: Rail TonMileage Drops
description: WASHINGTON, June 2The Association of American Railroads reported freight traffic on United States railroads during the week ended May 27 totaled an estimated 15.9 billion tonmiles, 3.7 per cent below the corresponding week last year. Loadings in 1971 represented the peak week of the year, following a twoday nationwide strike.

title: City Is Accused by Fire Officers Of a Double Cross on Contract
description: A new dispute over pay parity and differentials brought charge of double cross yesterday from the city's fire officers and a threat to exert unspecified pressures on the city.

title: Pakistan Reported to Get Chinese MIG's and Tanks
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, June 2China has delivered to Pakistan substantial quantities of new military equipment, including jet fighters and tanks, according to diplomats here.

title: STOCKS REGISTER SMALL CHANGES
description: Weakness in certain international oil stocks and profit taking in the highflying airline issues featured a stock market yesterday that displayed small changes overall for the second day in a row.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES DECLINE IN PRICE
description: Prices of wheat and soybean futures dropped yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade as a result of an announcement by the Administration that an agricultural pact between the United States and the Soviet Union may not be agreed upon before the end of the year.

title: MISS SMITH LEADS CARLING GOLF AT 68
description: BALTIMORE, June 2 (AP)Marilynn Smith toured the Pine Ridge golf course in fiveunderpar 68 and took a onestroke lead over Carol Mann today in the opening round of the $30,000 Lady Carling golf tournament.

title: Plane Hijacker Flees With 48 Aboard and $500,000
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 2A man dressed in an Army captain's uniform hijacked a Western Airlines plane with 98 persons aboard over Seattle tonight, then took 48 hostages on a second airplane that flew east from San Francisco.

title: State Names an Official To Investigate Prisons
description: ALBANY, June 2In an effort to determine what's really going on in the prisons, the Corrections Department today appointed a career civil servant to the agency's newly created position orinspector general.

title: Jordan Faces a Stiff Fight in Carolina Runoff Today
8 More Policemen Killed Throughout Nation in May
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (UPI) The Federal Bureau of Investigation said today that eight law enforcement officers were killed as a result of criminal action in May, bringing the year's total to 42.

title: Coast Department Store Officer Named New President of Saks
description: Norman V. Wechsler, vice president and general merchandise manager for fashion apparel and soft lines at the J. W. Robinson company, a Los Angeles department store, has been named president of Saks Fifth Avenue, effective Aug. 1.

title: Who Is Responsible?
description: The quarrel between Air France and Rome authorities over responsibility for the security lapse that allowed three killers hired by Palestinian fanatics to smuggle guns and grenades aboard an Israelbound jet the other day exposes an inexcusable gap in international arrangements to protect air travelers.

title: BROKERS BARRED BY THE BIG BOARD
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday, that its board of governors had permanently barred two former brokerage officers from associating with any member firm in any capacity.

title: Lakers Name Newell As General Manager
description: LOS ANGELES, June 2 (AP) Pete Newell, a coach and executive for more than a quarter of a century, was named today as general manager of the Los Angeles Lakers, champions of the National Basketball Association.

title: Loading of Oil Halted
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 2The Iraqi Government today decided to stop the loading of crude oil from the nationalized Westernowned Iraq Petroleum Company at the Syrian and Lebanese Mediterranean terminals until further notice.

title: BONN AND MOSCOW END RIFT ON PACT
description: BONN, June 2West Germany and the Soviet Union concluded today a threeday dispute over the details of ratifying their 1970 friendship treaty, clearing the way for the signing tomorrow of the fourpower agreement on the status of West Berlin.

title: Bills on Beer Sale and Trailers Vetoed
description: ALBANY, June 2Governor Rockefeller has vetoed a bill that would have divided the state into three wholesale beermarketing zones, terming the measure contrary to the public interest.

title: Backing Public TV
description: By voting for two years of Federal funding instead of the chancy one year sought by the Administration, the House has given a vote of confidence to the important place of public and educational broadcasting on America's TV and radio dials.

title: SENATE IN SAIGON REJECTS THIEU BID FOR DECREE RULE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 2The South Vietnamese Senate today rejected a request by President Nguyen Van Thieu for legislative authority to rule by decree for six months because of the Communist offensive.

title: Delaware Bank Robbed
description: CLAYMONT, Del., June 2 (UP)Three gunmen escaped with $320,000 from the Wilmington Trust Company branch here, the largest robbery in the history of this tiny state.

title: RUSSIAN TRUCK DEAL CONFIRMED BY G.&W.
description: Gulf and Western Industries Inc., confirmed yesterday that it had signed an agreement to provide equipment for the Soviet Union's big Kama River truck plant project.

title: M'DONALD'S TOED TO REDUCE PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, June 2The Price Commission ordered McDonald's restaurants today to lower the prices of some hamburgers and cheesburgers.

title: Maxwell House Raising Wholesale Coffee Prices
description: The Maxwell House division of the General Foods Corporation has increased the wholesale prices of its ground coffees, effective Monday, it was announced yesterday.

title: Locomotive Given to Exhibit
description: CHICAGO, June 2 (AP)V. The Pioneer, described by its owners as the only steam locomotive of its type still in existence, was given to the Chicago Historical Society today for a permanent exhibit. In 1848 it was the first loco. motive to operate in Chicago. It was purchased then by William Butler Pgden, first Mayor of Chicago and president of the Galena and Chicago Union Railroad, predecessor of the Chicago and North Western Railway Company, which has owned the Pioneer ever since.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A number of times your newspaper has commented that it would be an asset to the City of New York if there were a number of additional small parks scattered throughout the city.

title: SALE IS APPROVED FOR BOSTON PAPER
description: BOSTON, June 2 (UPI)Stockholders of the Herald Traveler Corporation approved today the sale of the 125yearold Boston Herald Traveler to the Hearst Corporation for $8.64million, effective June 18.

title: Thousands Mourn the Duke of Windsor at Castle
description: WINDSOR, England, June 2 They came by the thousands today to say farewell to their former King, the Duke of Windsor, who gave up his throne for a woman but retained the admiration of his subjects.

title: N.R.B.Q. JOGS CROWD WITH HAPPY SOUNDS
description: The amazing thing about N.R.B.Q.a rock band that is shaking the pillars of the Village Gate this weekis that it's been around for years but has never quite broken through to major public consciousness. With luck, the Gate appearance should start to change all that.

title: Chicagoans Win on Reichardt, Melton Belts
description: CHICAGO, June 2  The schizophrenic Chicago White Sox, playing at home where the positive half of their split personality surfaces, slugged their way to a 61 victory tonight over the confused New York Yankees.

title: JOHN V. GRONER, 70, A PATENT LAWYER
description: John Vaughan Groner, a senior partner in the law firm of Fish & Neave, 277 Park Avenue, died Thursday in Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 76 Thunder Mountain Road, Greenwich.

title: N.C. CENTRAL WINS IN N.A.I.A. TRACK
description: BILLINGS, Mont., June 2 (AP) North Carolina Central's recordbreaking speedsters, paced by Larry Black, raced to the team title of the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics track and field championships today.

title: Crossovers Upheld In Jersey Primary By Justice Brennan
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (UPI) Associate Justice William J. Brennan Jr. refused today to overturn a ruling allowing New Jersey voters to cast their ballots in either the Democratic or Republican primary next Tuesday regardless of their party affiliation.

title: ASSURANCE VOICED ON ARMS ACCORDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 2After a meeting between President Nixon and the Congressional leaders, the White House said today that it expected prompt consideration and eventual approval by Congress of the strategic arms limitation agreements signed in Moscow last week.

title: Why Hark! Is a Lark
description: AT THE moment I am In love with a girl who asks October questions, speaks in cellophane whispers, and, in the end, makes no more than pastel promises. She doesn't actually appear in a delightful new Off Broadway revue called Hark! which is presently spinning its way about the four pillars and five painted circles that shape the stage of the MercerO'Casey. She is only sung about (very nicely sung about, over a giftwrapped pianoforte, by Dan Goggin and Marvin Solley, who also happened to have written the notes). For that matter, I'm not entirely certain whatever does come of her, though I do know her name is Molly.

title: All Five Boroughs
description: Having just read or looked over some 20 New York City guidebooks, I've come to the uncertain conclusion that the best of them was written 33 year's ago, the famous NEW YORK CITY GUIDE, commissioned by the W.P.A., originally published by Random House and now reprinted by Octagon Books at $20. Uncertain, because I don't know whether it's my childhood that appeals to me or the happy, plain, leisurely manner of the book. There were many city and regional guides produced by the W.P.A.; the good ones are still read, consulted, and copies of them treasured. The end of the Depression was the right time to describe America; the country had stood still for 10 years.

title: Expos Win, Make Triple Play
description: MONTREAL, June 3 (AP)Boots Day's oneout single in the 10th inning off Jim Ray car ried the Montreal Expos to a 10 victory over the Houston Astros tonight.

title: Field Archers in Suffolk Find Home on the Range
description: HUNTINGTON, L.I.  The dewey dingles and bosky dells of this rolling country, side took on the festive air of a Nottingham bilah last Sunday. The occasion? A gathering of Suffolk's archery clan and prospective converts.

title: Letters to the Editor.
description: East Side coop applauded; reporter looks down his nose at West Side building. Wouldn't that headline more accurately describe the article Tenants Evaluate Shift to CoOp [April 23]?

title: Gail Degnan Married
description: Miss Gail Degnan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward P. Degnan of Brooklyn, was married here yesterday afternoon in St. Paul the Apostle Roman Catholic Church to Sgt. Edward F. McAlarney, U.S.A., son of Mrs. Edward R. McAlarney of Rockaway, Queens, and the late Mr. McAlarney. The Rev. Walter T. Gouch performed the ceremony. The bride's father is assistant, treasurer and manager of credit and collections of Todd Shipyards Corporation. The bridegroom is stationed at Fort Hamilton in Brooklyn.

title: Unclaimed '71 Winners Of Top Lottery Prizes
description: TRENTON  Among the S50,606 top weekly prizes in the New Jersey Lottery that the Lottery Commission reports as not having been claimed by the winners are the 1971 lottery tickets containing the follosiving numbers:

title: STEPHEN TIMOSHENKO
description: Dr. Stephen P. Timoshenko, a specialist in theoretical and applied mechanics, whose leadership strengthened the teaching of that subject in the United States, died Monday in Wuppertal, Germany. He was 93 years old and had formerly lived in Palo Alto, Calif.

title: The World
description: DUBLINEarly Wednesday afternoon, at 2A Kevin Street, acrost from Duignan's Pub, the offices of the Irish Republican Army's Provisional wing were virtually deserted. Stacks of newspapers, carrying the headline Stop Collaboration, were in a corner and visitors were warmly greeted.

title: Boys High, Taking Six Running Events, Wins P.S.A.L. Team Track Title
description: We performed up to my expectations, said Doug Terry yesterday after his Boys High team successfully defended its title in the 68th annual Public School Athletic League track and field championships at Downing Stadium, Bandalls Island.

title: Woman Raped and Knifed; L.I. Police Seek a Suspect
description: LINDENHURST, L. I., June 3The police are searching for a young man with long blond hair and a beard who, they said, raped a woman, stabbed her twice and then set fire to her car here late last night.

title: Those Russians Aren't Coming After All, the Cosmos Get Word
description: The Soviet Union Football (Soccer) Federation has informed the New York Cosmos and five other teams in North America that Moscow Dynamo will not make a scheduled tour of the United States and Canada, the Cosmos disclosed last night. Dynamo was scheduled to arrive in New York tonight.

title: Skillman School Helps Delinquents
description: MONTGOMERY  Only, 19 of the 198 boys paroled from New Jersey's 3yearold juvenile facility have returned to corrective institutions because of repeated delinquency.

title: Gonzalez Halts Batoto in 4 To Keep Flyweight Title
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, June 3 (AP)Betulio Gonzalez of Venezuela retained his World Boxing Council flyweight title by knocking out Socrates Batoto of the Philippines in the fourth round of a scheduled 15round bout tonight.

title: Bahamas 500 Next for Powerboats
description: Offshore powerboat champions seem to thrive on streaks. When Don Aronow was winning race after race in 196768 there was little competition. Then came Vincenzo Balestrieri for two more years without A peer, and last year Bill Wishnick dominated.

title: So We Got Papp In to See A Runthrough
description: FIVE weeks into rehearsal of The Basic Training of Pavlo Hummel, the director, Jeff Bleckner, and I knew there were problems, and knew also the main area in which, they Iurked. The first act Seemed rooted to an Inextricable degree in documentary realism, while the second was fragmentary and impressionistic in a way that seemed to make any comprehensive sense of realism impossible.

title: One answer to the atomicenergy puzzlePut the atomic power plants in the ocean
description: THE increasing gap between the demand for electric power in the United States and our limited capacity to produce it  a gap that has grown to the point where we're planning months in advance for brownouts and blackouts  is forcing utilities to turn to new and imaginative sources of power. Americans want more electricity to operate their airconditioners and stereos and to supply their computers and industrial processes. But in growing numbers they are resisting the construction of new generating plants, not only oilfired and coalfired facilities, which are condemned for polluting the atmosphere, but also nuclear plants which, the critics say, produce thermal pollution and represent a threat of explosion or lethal radiation. The people, says one utilitycompany executive, want the power but not the plants.

title: Margot Hartmann a Bride on L.I.
description: ROSLYN, L. I., June 3Miss Margot Keating Hartmann, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank William Hartmann of Roslyn Harbor and St. Agathe, Quebec, was married here today to Klaus Otto Haberich, son of Dr. and Mrs. J. Matthias Haberich of Dusseldorf, Germany.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: It seems likely that the dollar standard came to an end in 1971. In my judgment it was a good system for the world's money better than the alternatives of flexible exchange rates and foreign exchange control, which mean that there is no international money and more practical at this point in history than the ultimate standard of a world money run by a world central bank.

title: The Guest Word
description: Two decades of selfconsuming, selfnourishing despair will be ending soon; and those among us who have prowled around in the gardens and cemeteries, after dark, will be eager to help with the rakingup, the reclaiming of the vandalized land, because it will occur to us that energies released in the daytime, in. the sunlight, can be as exciting and powerful as energies released at night. In fact, the triumph of such activity will be greater than the other: to impose an order is always more challenging than to celebrate disorder.

title: Pop
description: THE Rolling Stones are on the West Coast this weekend, about to embark on their first American concert tour since the disastrous events at Altamoat. The timing obviously was right for the release of a new album, and the Stones have obliged with a farranging, twodisk collection called Exile On Main Street (Rolling Stones Records COC22900).

title: McGovern's Big Chance
description: With the California primary on Tuesday, the long and often pointless series of preliminary battles for the Democratic Presidential nomination reaches its climax. It completely overshadows New Jersey's polling on the same day, not because that state's 109 delegates are unimportant but because they will be divided between the contenders, whereas the winner in California will be awarded all 271 delegateseven if no more than 51 per cent of the primary voters, are for him. In this unfairness of distribution at least, the California system calls out for belated correction by those electoral reformers who have done so much to change the face of the Democratic party in this election year.

title: DAKOTANS FOCUS ON MUNDT'S SEAT
description: ABERDEEN, S. D., June 3With Senator George McGovern assured of his state's 17 votes at the Democratic National Convention, interest in South Dakota's primary on Tuesday is focused on the contests that will produce a successor to Senator Karl E. Mundt.

title: Keefe Gets Brewers Post
description: MILWAUKEE, June 3 (AP)Arthur J. Keefe, assistant public relations director of the Boston Red Sox since 1968, was named director of public relations today for the Milwaukee Brewers. Keefe will assume his new duties June 12, succeeding Bill Curley, who resigned.

title: Travel Notes:
description: A 24page folder outlining 10 Upstate New York driving tours, each covering 200 to 300 miles. Write: The Hertz Corp., 660 Madison Avenue, New York 10021.

title: Miss Syliria Clarke To Wed in August
description: FOREST HILLS, Calif., June 3  Mr. and Mrs. Vincent James Clarke have announced the engagement of Mr. Clarke's daughter, Miss Sylvia M. Clarke, to Glenn A. Diegan, son of Mr. and Mrs. David F. Deigan of Wayne, N. J. The wedding is planned for Aug. 20 in Palos Verdes.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: PERHAPS it was merely a normal bout of profittaking after the stock market's sharp, contraseasonal ascent during the first four weeks of May. Or, it might have been a Sign of developing disenchantment with the glamour issues over their ability to pile further price gains atop their recent steep advance.

title: The Nation
description: Hard Tomatoes, Hard Times. That's the title of a 308page critical study of the agricultural research being done at the nation's, taxsupported landgrant universities released last week by the nonprofit Agribusiness Accountability Project. Much of the research, the study said, is absurd and frivolous. It cited the search to discover: A hard tomato that would withstand mechanical picking (it turned out to be tasteless) how hard shoppers should squeeze grapefruit to determine firmness and texture... a seedless cucumber... a way to cross broccoli with white cauliflower and come up with green cauliflower.

title: S. H. Klinghoffer Weds Lori Kreitchman
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., June 3Miss Lori Karen Kreitchman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Morton A. Kreitchman, and Steven Harold Klinghoffer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Melvin Klinghoffer were married here this evening at Temple Israel. Rabbi Joachim Prinz of Temple B'nai Abraham and Rabbi Herbert Wiener of Temple Israel officiated at the ceremony. Both families are from South Orange.

title: Aftermath of Lydda...
description: To the horror of the massacre of innocent's at Tel Aviv Airport must now be added the disgraceful almost lunaticcomment of the Premier of Egypt, who said that the assault proved only that we, are able to achieve victory over Israel.

title: P. K. SHELDON SR., 79, EXTIMES REPORTER
description: Preston King Sheldon Sr., a religious news reporter for The New York Times from 1934 to 1955, died Friday in Calvary Hospital, the Bronx. He would h#e been 80 years old tomorrow. His home was at 14963 ASh Avenue, Flushing, Queens.

title: Key Dam Completed in Laos Despite Intensified Fighting
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. June 3  Despite intensified fighting in Southeast Asia, the Mekong Delta Development Project reports progress in its efforts to develop the water fesources of the lower Mekong basin which includes parts of Thailand, Cambodia, Laos and South Vietnam.

title: Hanoi Daily Scoffs At Nixon Journeys
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, June 3(Agence FrancePresse) The. Hanoi party daily, Nhan Dan, in a comment on President Nixon's East and West journey said today that running about and knocking on any door at random will not sea:ire anything.

title: The World
description: MOSCOWIn the euphoria that has followed the MoscoW summit talks, OrdinarY Russians are now joking that President Nixon is the chief architect of Mostow and that Communist party leader Leonid Brezhnev is the chief architect of Mr. Nixon's reelection.

title: NEW TOOL FREES ACCIDENT VICTIM
description: In four minutes an injured woman was extricated from an automobile crushed in a collision on the Lower East Side last week when a Fire Department rescue squad used a new tool to pry off the vehicle's door.

title: SHOP TALK
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I. From farms to flights is the way that townspeople sum up the progress of this milesquare village, which, in years gone by, used to be known as Hardscrabble. For a great many of the 9,297 peoplee, here, tilling the. soil has given way to work on what sqme early farmers called those clanged flying contraptions.food products one can buy there (everything for a barbecue); are a gallon of Stern's genuine garlic pickles for $1.95, a gallon of relish ($2.65) or a gallon of pure wine vinegar for $1.45.

title: The World
description: The time: shortly after 5 A.M. last Thursday. The place: outside a wellappointed threestory apartment house in Frankfurt, Germany. A special squad of state and federal police had just cordoned off a garage adracent to the apartment. One of the officers shouted through a bullhorn to the bUilding's occupants: Come out! Your means are limited but ours are unlimited: When there was no response, tear gas cannisters were lobbed into the structure., Pistol and automatic rifle fire came from the building in response. The police called up an armored car to have it ram through the garage doors. As the vehicle started, a young man emerged and was apprehended. A second man came out, shooting wildly with a 45 caliber pistol; he was felled by a police bullet in the hip.

title: Thieu Names a New Chief Of Unit Beaten at Quang Tri
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 3 (UPI)President Nguyen Van Thieu ordered another military command shuffle today, naming a new chief for the remnants of the 3d Infantry Division, which was driven out of Quang Tri province May 1.

title: Vivien C. Rothman Becomes Fiancee
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., June 3Miss Vivien. Carol Rothman and Paul Ian Tartter, who have entered their senior year at Brown University, plan to, be married.

title: Susan Torrey Married to Lawyer
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 3 The marriage of Miss Susan Eyre Torrey to Michael Ray Coppock took place here this afternoon at the home Of Dr. and Mrs. Claude Forkner Jr., brotherinlaw and sister of the bride.

title: Run the Gantlet, $6.40, Victor on Belmont Grass
Protestants Clash With Soldiers in Londonderry
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, June 3Thousands of Protestants, thwarted by soldiers and policemen from marching near the Roman Catholic district, staged an angry demonstration today in this tense city.

title: FUTURE OF IRA. SEEN IN JEOPARDY
description: The future of the American Basketball Association will be at stake June 12, when the league's board of trustees meets here to discuss the makeup of the 197273 season.

title: BEEMAN SCORES IN ETCHELLS22
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 3John Beeman sailed off with Etchells22 Class honors today as 56 boats competed in the Cow Bay area, Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound regatta conducted by the Manhasset Bay Yacht Club.

title: Best Feet Went Forward in Benefit
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I.It was a bright and balmy Saturday on Memorial Day weekend, With juit a touch of chill in the air. It also Was perfect weather for walking, and 234 people did just that, starting at 10 A.M. from Hook Mill in East Hampton and heading east on the Montauk Highway. The objective: Montauk Plaza, 14.3 miles away.

title: Garden Enthusiasts Grow In an L.I. Ecology Center
description: SETAUKET, L. I.  Jeffrey Ames and Matthew Civello have completed their spring planting of beets, onions, radishes, lettuce, parsley and wax beans, and before they know it they will begin cultivating the first green sprigs that make their way above ground.

title: Riley's Nanina Captures Predicted Log Contest
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 3James Riley of Greenwich skippered his powerboat, Nanina, to first place today in the New York Yacht Club's predicted log contest on Long Island Sound off the Indian Harbor Yacht Club.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: DJthe #1 shocker of the year, New in paperback. from the new Popular LIbraryAdvt

title: State Policemen Become Favorites of Waywards
description: MONTGOMERYNormally, the most unwelcome visitor at a state reformatory would be a policeman, the symbol of authority that keeps offenders behind bars.

title: Writing About Music
description: Anyone who writes about music must come to feel, in his frequent depressed moments, somewhat the same frustrations as the author of sexinstruction books. If he goes about his job responsibly, using the precise, clinical terminology of his craft and trying primarily to explain rather than entertain, he is likely to be read only by those with a specialized fascination in his subject. If, on the other hand, he hurls himself into his writing too imaginatively, he runs serious risk of producing the musical equivalent of pornography: titillation for the aurally impotent. For it must never be forgotten that the writer on music is dealinglike the sex expertin something other than primary experience. Even at the exalted level of, say, Sir Donald Francis Tovey or D. H. Lawrence, writers about music and sex can offer only secondhand satisfactions: They are symbol mongers, allegory dealers; metaphor merchants, traders in analogy. At worst, of course, they are criminal types.

title: Enter Alan Budd
description: ACUSTOMER needs no references to rent a person, but does undergo a sort of visualinspection cumcontract signing. In the cases of Judy Klemesrud and Peter Andrews, the head of the rental agencies, Alan Budd, came to their hotel rooms himself to formalize the personleasing. The contract required that the customer neither drink too much nor behave in a way that would embarrass or offend the escort.

title: A STRIPMINE BILL IS UNDER ATTACK
description: WASHINGTON, June 3  A twoyear effort by a handful of environmental reformers in Congress to bring strip mining under Federal control is bringing forth an unexpectedly strong bill. With it has come a move by mineral interests to weaken the legislation.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI)Two small racing planes collided today during maneuvers at Transpo '72, sending one pilot to his death in the second fatal accident of the week long international transportation show. Thousands of persons looked on.

title: CHINA ETIQUETTE: HANDS DOWN
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Cahill Tax Plan: Fight Is On
description: TRENTON It did not make political sense to many in New Jersey when a Republican Governor asked a Republican Legislature two weeks ego to approve the most progressive and urbanoriented tax reform program ever proposed here or in any other state in recent y ears.

title: BRAZILIAN ON POLE FOR BELGIAN RACE
description: NIVELLES, Belgium, June 3 (UPI)  Emerson Fittipaldi of Brazil easily held of the challenge of a twopronged Ferrari attackand a late bid by Yardley McLaren today to win the pole position for tomorrow's Belgian Grand Prix.

title: Cricket Match Is Drawn
description: The Staten Island and Casablanca Cricket Clubs played to a draw yesterday at Walker Park, Staten Island. Casablanca had 106 runs, Staten Island 98 for nine wickets.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: Aircraft design, which owes a lot to the study of birds, is off on an experimental tack that would horrify the average ornithologist. It would probably horrify the average nonscientific airline passenger as well.

title: Tigers Stroke 2 Home Runs
description: DETROIT, June 3 (UPI)Home runs by Gates Brown and Dick McAuliffe drove in all five Detroit runs today to give the Tigers a 53 victory over the Minnesota Twins.

title: Horse Show News
description: DEVON, Pa., June 3  The 76th edition of the Devon horse show ended an eightday run tonight and exhibitors and officials were pleased with the newly resurfaced main ring.

title: Kentucky Picks Delegates
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., June 3The Kentucky Democratic convention voted overwhelmingly today to send 36 uncommitted delegates and 11 delegates committed to Senator George McGovern to the Democratic National convention at Miami Beach next month.

title: A's Topple Orioles
description: BALTIMORE, June 3 (AP)Mike Epstein drove in the winning runS"with a tworun homer in the eighth inning and Ken Holtzman notched his eighth victory of the season today as the Oakland Athletics beat the Baltimore Orioles, 42.

title: Brew and Kask and Three Collegiate Teams Reach Anderson Golf Semifinals
description: MA1VIARONECK, N. Y., June 3Bill Brew and Fred Kask, two of Connecticut's top amateurs, who dominated the 36We medalplay phase of the tournament, moved into the semifinals of the Anderson Memorial bestball event with two matchplay successes today.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Soviet Selects Site for 7th Polar Basel
description: MOSCOW, June 3  The Soviet Union has announced that it has selected a site for its seventh permanent polar research station in the Antactic, extending its systematic exploration of the icy continent.

title: 15 McGovern Men Win in Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, June 3 At least 15 of this state's 51 Democratic delegates Will go to the convention in Miami Beach on July 10 publicly or privately pledged to suport Senator George McGovern for the Presidency. The rest are uncommitted or still unselected.

title: BREWERS PARSONS DOWNS RANGERS, 391
description: MILWAUKEE, June 3 (UPI)  George Scott drove in two Innis with a single and a sacri. fice fly and Bill Parsons hurled a fivehitter today to give the Milwaukee Brewers a 31 victory over the Texas Rangers. The victory was the fifth in six starts for Milwaukee and the fourthin five games since Del Crandall took over as Brewers manager on Tuesday.

title: Soviet Envoy Back in China. After Two Weeks in Moscow
description: PEKING, June 3 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Soviet Ambassador, Vasily Tolstikov, returned here today after a 17day visit to Moscow.

title: The duplex house will have separate quarters for the poor.
description: While we are struggling to find solutions, for yesterday's errors in social policy, we are making new errors that will bedevil us tomorrow. One critical error is being made by default, without even much awareness that a choice is being made.

title: Elizabeth Henschel Conland Is Bride of Henry Happel 3d
description: WESTPORT, Conn., June 3 In Christ and Holy Trinity Episcopal Church here this afternoon, Miss Elizabeth Henschel Conland was married to Henry William. Happel 3d by the Rev. Dana Forrest Kennedy.

title: Light Whisky
description: If a jaded palate is finding some of the kick gone from Scotch, rye, bourbon, gin, vodka, brandy and rum, hold onrelief is on the way. Come July 1, there will be light whisky.

title: The World
description: JERUSALEMLydda airport, Israel's main port of entry, was crowded as usual last Tuesday night. The three young Japanese, passengers on Air France flight 132 from Rome and Paris, stood alongside a large party of Puerto Ricans on a pilgrimage to the holy sites of Christendom. Two valises came down the conveyor belt. The Japanese grabbed the bags and unzipped them. The time was 10:25 P.M.

title: Travel Notes:
description: Purchasers of three or more roundtrip tickets to Miami. via Amtrak, the governmentowned railroad corporation, can have a rental car waiting for them in Florida free of charge for a week. Under the offer, being made by Kinney Rent A Car in cooperation with Amtrak, there is no rental or mileage charge (and insurance coverage is provided). Participants buy their own gas and also pay a small state tax. The deal is based on roundtrip Amtrak fares to Miami, though the car may be picked up and returned at other cities in Florida. The rail trip can originate in any one of more than a dozen Northern cities, from Minneapolis to New York, Newark and Philadelphia.

title: Patrolman Held in Sex Attacks On Two Women, in Forest Hills
description: A 24yearold Queens patrol, man, a member of the Police Department since 1969, was suspended from pay and duty and arrested yesterday, charged with sexual attacks at gunpoint on two Forest Hills women.

title: Television
description: CLIFTON DAVIS recalls a knife fight he saw four years ago and how he stood fascinated and at the same time horrified as a tall, skinny black man in a green, shiny suit died on the dirty sidewalk at Eighth Avenue and 44th Street near the St. James Theater. Boom! He dropped to his knees and then he did an amazing thing, honey, he got up still trying to fight after the dude plunged the, knife dead into his, chest. He got up and said, You stuck me, mother'and then booml He dropped again, head first. He was dead. Just like that.

title: Fairleigh Uses Sea for Campus.
description: MADISON  Fairleigh Dickinson University, landlocked in suburban New Jersey, last week dedicated its new laboratory for aspiring marine, scientists by the white sands and shimmering bluegreen waters of Tague Bay, about 1,600 miles away, as the seagull flies.

title: C.I.A. Aide Gets Court Post
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., June 3 (UPI)  Central Intelligence Agency aide, James B. Ueberhorst has been named chief administrator of. the Florida Supreme Court. Mr. Ueberhorst, 43 years old, will assume the $30,000ayear job on July 4. He spent 14 years with the C.I.A. and has served as assistant general counsel for the agency since 1964.

title: Medicine
description: WASHINGTONA barbiturate epidemic is sweeping the country, says Senator Birch Bayh, chairman of the Senate's subcommittee on Juvenile Delinquency, and may well be more serious than amphetamines and even heroin. Joseph P. Busch, the Los Angeles County District Attorney, told the committee a few weeks ago that according to word on the streets of Los Angeles 1972 is the year of the barb.

title: Foe Believed to Be Marshaling Forces As Monsoon Rains Impede Air Activity
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, June 4Heavy monsoon rain drenched much of South Vietnam yesterday, and the sporadic clashes characteristic of the fighting during the last few weeks were mired in mud.

title: Boston Police Back Rise In Base Pay to $11,518
description: BOSTON, June 3 (AP)Boston patrolmen have voted 7 to 1 to ratify a new contract that will give them a base pay of $11,518.

title: SHOP TALK
description: SUMMIT  Back in the 1860's, when this community broke away from the town of Turkey (now New Providence), it took the name of Turkey Hill; indeed, it was on hilly terrain well populated with wild turkeys.

title: Hugh Clark, Weds Phoebe Myhrum
description: PERU, Vt., June 3Miss Phoebe W. Myhrum and Hugh R. Clark were married here today in the Peru Congregational Church. by the Rev. Henry Powers of Tenafly, N. J. A reception Was held at the farm home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert Myhrum.

title: Miss Anne Smadbeck Wed to Robert Morey
description: Miss Anne Violeta Smadbeck, daughter of Mrs. Warren Smadbeck, was married here yesterday afternoon to Robert Albert Morey, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Morey. Both families live in New York, where the ceremony was performed by the Rev. Albert Martin, a Baptist minister, at the Universalist Church.

title: Indiana Free of Hog Cholera
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI)  The nation's number three ranking state in hog production, Indiana, has been officially classed as free of hog cholera, the Agriculture Department announced today. A nationwide program to eradicate the hog disease began in 1962.

title: Letters to the Editor.
description: Readers who are looking for a cooperative apartment will be interested in this footnote to Mr. Mandelbaum's article. He lists the most expensive apartment at 250 West 94th Street as costing the tenant just under $15,000. We looked at a large apartment in the building. The owners had put $5,000 worth of renovations into the apartment. Their selling price was $40,000; they would consider no lower offer.

title: Politics
description: LOS ANGELESThe Wilshire Hyatt House, where Senator George McGovern is staying, features a singing group called The April Fools. That billing on the marquee could also refer to most of the politicians and newsmen in town, all those experts who thought, only two months ago, that Senator McGovern's lonely, longdistance run for the Democratic Presidential nomination would collapse well before the finish line.

title: Boston U. Names Dean
description: BOSTON, June 3 (AP)Prof. Alasdair Maclntyre has been appointed dean of the College of Liberal Arts at Boston University. He will take over as dean Sept. 1. The liberal arts college has 5,500 students and a faculty of 450 professors and instructors.

title: Miss Humphreys, Teacher, Is a Bride
description: PURCHASE, N. Y., June 3 Miss Sharon Patricia Humphreys and William Weston Driver Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Driver of Binghamton, were married here at noon today. The bride's parents are Mr. and Mrs. William E. Humphreys of Katonah. Mr. Humphreys is president of Abercrombie & Fitch Company, New York.

title: REPRISAL THREAT UPSETS SAN JUAN
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., June 3Threats of reprisal against Japanese nationals here for the terrorist attack at the Tel Aviv airport on Wednesday in which 16 Puerto Ricans died have affected the Casals Festival of Puerto Rico.

title: Architects'
description: The New York chapter of the American Institute of Architects has elected Thomas F. Galvin president.

title: Topical meatballs
description: In a year when everything Chinese is in fashion from brooms and baskets to silks and jades, what could be more appropriate for summer's festive occasions than Chinese pork balls? These golfballsized meatballs make an excellent hot appetizer to precede an elaborate cold buffet and are equally good for a casual Sundaynight gettogether or drinks on the terrace. And, a boon to hostesses, they can lie made ahead. The chicken wings marinated in soy sauce and then deepfried are another appetizer with a Chinese. heritage.

title: About Pro Football
description: LIVERPOOL, N. Y., June 3 Life for Walter Patulski, the No. 1 draft choice of the National Football League this year, is becoming involved. Patulski, a 6foot6inch, 260pound defensive end, was graduated from Notre Dame two weeks ago and returned to take a couple of deep breaths here in his home town, a quiet village on the west side of Syracuse. Patulski will be mar ried next Saturday. He has not yet signed a contract with his pro team, the Buffalo Bills. He is out of money but says his credit is good. He will be on the ballot as a potential uncommitted delegate to the Democratic National Convention in a primary here on June 20. On that date he will be finishing a honeymoon in Hawaii.

title: Wetlands Shift To U.S. Approved
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I.The Oyster Bay Town Board has authorized the shift of three additional parcels of wetlands to the United States Government to be retained as wildlife refuge.

title: Bellport Site of Sailing Trials
description: What was advertised as the East Coast speed trials to qualify for fastest sailboat in the world contest has turned into a dress rehearsal. But next weekend's regatta at Beliport (Li.) Yacht Club may prove to be just as exciting anyway.

title: EARLY MONTHS HELD KEY TO TRANSPLANTS
description: HOUSTON, June 23 (UPI)Dr. Norman E. Sharnway, who has performed more heart transplants than any other surgeon, said today that if the recipient of a new heart survived the first three months he had a 3to1 chance of living a year and a 2to1 chance of living two years.

title: Ford Captures Lone Event Of Soling Class Regatta
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn., June Jonathan Ford of the Riverside Yacht Club won the only race in the Pequot Yacht Club's Soling Class invitation regatta today.

title: 4 Vying for the Democratic Nomination to Oppose Case of Jersey
description: LINDEN, N. 3., June 3 Daniel Manuel Gaby has at least one thing in his favor as he vies for the dubious privilege of running for the United States Senate in November against Clifford P. Case, the New Jersey incumbent Republican. As one General Motors assembly plant workman Wisecracked here, he looks like a Senator anyway.

title: MOSCOW'S JEWS GET A NEW RABBI
description: MOSCOW, June 3The Moscow synagogue disalosed today that a former automobile worker had been appointed rabbl to succed Yehuda Leib Levin, Who died in November at the age of 76.

title: Recordings
description: CHURCHInspired music in the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries moved gradually from intithate and somewhat spare declarations of faith to dramatic constructions that could rival in sophistication and splendor the operatic creations of the period. A clutch of new recordings and rereleases illustrates this progression  some might not call it progress  of religious music from the time of Monteverdi to the era of Mozart.

title: Joan K. Fleischmann Is Engaged
description: CINCINNATI, June 3 Mrs. Julius Fleischmann has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Joan Kruse Fleischmann of Washington, to Maurice Bernard Tobin, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Francis Vaughn Tobin of Kansas City, Mo.

title: Sports of The Times
description: I knew it was gone as Soon as I hit it, said Henry Aaron. So did Willie Mays in center field. No longer at an age when he could afford to waste energy, Willie didn't even turn around to watch the flight of the ball. He conceded the home run without looking and it was quite a historic home run to concede. This was in Atlanta a, year ago April and it was No, 600 for the little slugger of the Braves. Last Wednesday in Atlanta the constantly increasing Aaron home run total advanced still another notch and there was no Willie on the premises to appreciate its significance. The amazing Mays was in NeW York as a relatively now member of the Mets and he was losing his distinction as the undisputed runnerup to Babe Ruth. When Henry smote No. 648 the other day, he drew even with Willie. Before the season is over Aaron should leave him well behind as he heads for the Ruthian record of 714.

title: DAVIS JURY GIVEN JACKSON LETTERS
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., June 3 The jury in the murder, kidnapping and conspiracy trial of Angela Davis continued its deliberations here today after receiving several pieces of evidence, including the defendant's controversial letters to George Jackson.

title: How to Go To College And Not 06
description: TRFNTONAn educational program, to enable individdals to a acquire a college degree. without actually attending structured classes bas been initiated by the state's DeOrtment of Higher Edudaton.

title: WALL STREET.
description: What happens to a company's stock when it becomes the center of worldwide controversy? In two recent cases, both involving reams of negative publicity, the stocks declined, reflecting selling pressure.

title: Travel Notes:
description: We don't promise good weather, but we can certainly insure against bad days, says a spokesman for the Ocean City, N. J., Hotel, Motel and Restaurant Association. This year Ocean. City is joining neighboring Atlantic City and Wildwood in offering insurance against rainspoiled vacation days.

title: TURNPIKE GETTING CURTAIN OF GREEN
description: NEW BRUNSWICK  A curtain of living green is being drawn along the southern section of the New Jersey Turnpike, with half a million oaks, maples, pines and other trees to be planted by 1975.

title: ALBATROSS WINS IN RECORD TIME
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 3Albetross, the sensational 4yearOld, won the Realization Pace in worldrecord time for 1 1/16mile event on a halfmile track tonight at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: All out for summer
description: Everybody out! On the porch. Off to the beach. Around the pool. For a picnic. Summer is here! Seasonal accessories make outdoor living as comfortable as indoors. Wicker (for the sunporch or covered deck) looks cool and contemporary; plastic seats take wet bathing suits in stride. Lightweight totables make dining al fresco both funand fashionable.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Quietly, through two attorneys, Joe Namath and the New York Jets are negotiating a contract for what looms as the highest annual salary in National Football League history, perhaps as much as $250,000.

title: U.C.L.A. CHAMPION
description: EUGENE, Ore., June 3The United States unveiled New Faces '72 for the Summer Olympics today. The names may sound unfamiliar, like Joe Lucas, Bruce Collins, Dave Wottle, Tom Woods and Larry Burton, but their performances will force the track and field world to reassess America's starting lineup for Munich.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONWhat has oil to do with world monetary reform?

title: Ross, Van Nostranci Reach Final in Long Island Tennis
description: ROSLYN, L. I., May 3Steve Ross of Brooklyn and King Van Nostrand of Brightwaters,. the topseeded players, reached the final of the Long Island men's tennis championship today at the Tower Tennis Club.

title: Hurnphrey Faczng Defeat In Jersey Ballot Tuesday
description: TRENTON, June 3With the Deinocratic Presidential primary election in New Jersey just three days off there was a growing conviction among partyleaders today that Senator George McGovern the candidate who, was given no chance in the estate six months ago, might be on the verge of a major victory Tuesday over Senator Hubert H. Humphrey.

title: Native Heir, $46.80, Captures Oceanport by 5 Lengths
description: OCEANPORT,N. J., June 3Native Heir scored an upset today in the $29,775 Oceanport Handicap at Monmouth Park Saturday.

title: TWO RECORDS TIED IN JERSEY TRACK
description: HIGHLAND PARK, N. J., June 3Reggie Blackshear of Metuchen and Bruce Scully of Audubon tied allgroup records in the hurdles events at the 54th annual New Jersey State track and field championships today.

title: Reds Win in 10th on Javier's Single, 65, as Phils Drop 17th in Last 18 Games
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 3 (UPI) Indian Javier singled home the deciding run today for the Cincinnati Reds, for a. 65, 10inning victory over the Philadelphia Phillies.

title: Claremont Colleges Given $5Million Anonymous Fund
description: An anonymous donor has given $5million to the Claremont Univeriity Center the coordinating body for the six institutions that make up California's Claremont Colleges.

title: AROUND THE
description: The AllAmerican Rose Selections has announcedthree winners for the 1973 AllAmerican Awards. Candidate roses for the award are tested on a twoyear basis and rated by a team of professionals for performance, appearance, stamina and substance unknown to previous roses on the market.

title: ...But Some Company Wives Hear Echoes of Women,s Liberation
description: ROCHESTER, Mich., June 3I bask in my husband's reflected glory. I don't have to be anything myself. His status is my status. Sometimes I feel he's living his life to the fullest and I'm living his life to the fullest.

title: PERILMAN FETED BY CONGREGATION
description: Forty years ago a young, newly ordained rabbi came out of Cincinnati's Hebrew Union College to serve a temporary, fourmonth stint as assistant at Temple EmanuEl here, the nation's largest and most prestigious. Reform synagogue.

title: TOP HAWAII COURT UPHOLDS SURGEON
description: HONOLULU, June 3 Dr. Maurice L. Silver, a former Providence, R.I., neurosurgeon who has been struggling for 10 year to practice freely in Hawaiian hospitals, has won key legal battle.

title: DETROIT SCHOOLS FACE FUND CRISIS
description: DETROIT, June 3Detroit's school system has reached the brink of bankruptcy and school officials are talking about survival plans that for practical purposes would end the educational function of the schools.

title: Van: Heusen's Hair Shirt
description: In what is believed to be the first attempt by a publicly owned corporation to give its employes the power to scrutinize and make voting decisions about the stock it holds in other corporations, the PhillipsVan Heusen Corporation has granted the power to vote the proxies in its pensionfund portfolio to a committee of its employes.

title: Batsto to Stage Annual Crafts Festival
description: BATSTO  When one sees thousands of visitors inspecting the ironmaster's 30room mansion here and wandering around this genuinely, historic village, founded in 1766, it ie nice to imagine that Gen. Nathanael Greene, one of Washington's most brilliant field generals, was here during the American Revolution to inspect his investment in Satsto's ironsmelting furnace.

title: Depositors Being Paid a Failed Bank in Massachusetts
description: WAKEFIELD, Mass., June 2 Federal officials, brought in to liquidate the first Massachusetts bank to close since the Depression, have restored to customers nearly $11million of a total of $20million in deposits.

title: Movies
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y.

title: MARSHALLS VICTORS IN LUDERS CLASS
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 3 Robert P. Marshall Jr.'s Electra, with the owner's son, Geoffrey, at the helm, won the Luders16 Class race today in the Indian Harbor Yacht Club regatta. It was the fifth series of the season for Yacht Racing Association fleets based east of Rye.

title: Warren a rowin a Growing County
description: It took Warren County, a hilly, rural and, onceremote part of northwestern New Jersey, more than 70 years to double its population from 37,781 in 1900 to 75,300 in 1971.

title: Headliners
description: Old Scruffy is the name sometimes applied to him by the soldiers he commands in Vietnam, but any day now, Gen. Creighton Williams Abrams, 58, is expected to be named the Army's new Chief of Staff, succeeding Gen. William C. Westmoreland whose fouryear tour of duty ends June 30. A dashing World War II tank commander, General Abrams has had a more frustrating role in Vietnam the past four years. As American troops have been withdrawn, he has presided over the Vietnamization program sponsored by President Nixon. And he has carried out the task despite rising criticism of the war and setbacks on the battlefield. It's too bad, said one of his officers, Abrams is very good. He deserves a better war. Last week there were signs in Washington that the promotion would be controversial. Look, said one Pentagon general, he's a great guy but... he's not going to shake the boat and it really needs shaking right now.

title: LOBSTERS RETURN TO MENU IN MAINE
description: PORTLAND, Me., June 3Lobsters are back on restaurant menus in Maine, but the prices continue to be high and some restaurateurs feel the days of plentiful, inexpensive seafood dinners are gone.

title: Grease? Groovy
description: THE kind of musical that Broadway has needed for some time will finally get there this weekafter playing for quite a while Off Broadway. On Wednesday, Grease transfers from the Eden Theater on Second Avenue to the Broadhurst on West 44th Stret. Singularly unappetizing as its title is, the show should prove most nourishing for Broadway. Somehow, it has managed to combine the two commodities everyone agrees our theater most requires: younger audiences and what I can best describenot too ponderously, I trustas older virtues. That is, Grease deserves the adjectives we once awarded shows like Pal Joey, Kiss Me Kate, Guys and Dolls and The Pajama Game but haven't had much call for recently.

title: Miss Milliken Plans Nuptials
description: Henry Oothout Milliken Jr., headmaster of the Grace Churbh School, and Mrs. Milliken of New York have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Harriet Paige. Milliken, to George Ross Starr 3d, son of Di. and Mrs. Starr Jr. of Duxbury, Mass.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Home Improvement
description: THE new drill guide illustrated below is a handy accessory that every owner of a portable, electric drill will find useful. Designed to simplify the problem of drilling holes that are square (perpendicular) to the surface, the device also makes it easy to position a hole exactly where desired without the drill bit walking or jiggling around on the surface. The round base plate has holes for 13 different size bits  up to %inch  and works like a dial so the user can turn it to the size needed. The handle provides a firm grip for holding against horizontal or vertical surfaces, and the base has a rubber facing to keep it from slipping. In addition, the tool eliminates the need fon marking the starting point with a center punch, and the hollow handle has a storage compartment for drill bits. Drill Guide, $2.98. at hardware stores. (Stanley Tools, 195 Lake St., New Britain, Conn. 06050).

title: Gardens
description: AFTER one season of vegetable growinga frenetic, endless summer of unlimited aches and ridiculously limited resultsthis transplanted New Yorker was ready to throw in the trowel. Until I discovered that successful vegetable gardening can be remarkably easy and thoroughly rewarding.

title: Army's Secret Inquiry Charges 43 Mylai Failures to Top Officers
description: WASHINGTON, June 3The Army's secret report on the MYlai 4 massaere conciuded that the two top generals of the America Division committed a total of 43 specific acts of misconduct or omission in connection with the initial field investigations of the, atrocity.

title: Meet the People's Party Candidate
description: After a career of revolutionizing child care, Dr. Benjamin Spook is counting on the votes of today's. youththe Spock babiesfor a good showing in this year's Presidential elections.

title: Letters to the Editor.
description: It was ironic for us, as middleclass cooperators of a yetunfinished MitchellLama development, Cadman Towers in Brooklyn Heights, to read Allan Luks's article, Housing a Key to Slowing Flight of Middle Class [May 7].

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EIUTOR:

title: Phillies Promote Owens
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 3 (AP) Paul Owens, farm director of the Philadelphia Phillies since 1965, was named general manager and director of player, development today for the National League team, replacing 64yearold John Quinn.

title: News of the Rialto
description: ON the assumption that next season just has to be better than the one now fading, note two entrants for the fall that may brighten Broadway. One is a comedy, a first play by Bob Randall, for which two frontline performers have agreed to lend their presence: Jerry Orbach, who last held forth in comic splendor in Promises, Promises, and Jane Alexander, well remembered in The Great White Hope and soon to open in Major Barbara at Stratford, Conn.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: State Increases Aid, but 9 Catholic Schools Will Close
description: NEWARK  Nine Roman Catholic schools in New Jersey will shut their doors forever after the current academic year ends on June 17, four of them in Newark alone.

title: Kelly, With Five Points, Leads in Laser Regatta
description: RYE, N.Y., June 3Joseph Kelly of Larchmont won two races and finished third in another during the first round of the American Yacht Club's invitation regatta for Laser and 420Class yachts.

title: 1ST WOMAN RABBI IN U.S. ORDAINED
description: CINCINNATI, June 3Sally J. Priesand was ordained at the Isaac M. Wise Temple here today, becoming the first woman rabbi sin this country and, it is believed, the second in the history of Judaism.

title: Patents That Expire
description: WASHINGTON  More than 30,000 patents are expiring this year and the inventions they have protected since they were issued in 1955 go into the public doMain for anybody to use.

title: Miss Ruth Burgess Greenwich Bride
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 3Miss Ruth Webber Burgess, daughter of Robert S. Burgess and the late Mrs. Jean Webber Burgess, was married here this afternon to Robert Sheffield Faulkner, son of Mr. and Mrs. F. Sheffield Faulkner of Wilton.

title: LongDistance Hijacking Mark Set in 1971 in Central America
description: The longdistance record for air hijacking was set by a zigzagging flight over Central and South America, from Monterey to Buenos Aires, that was estimated at 7,500 to 8,000 miles.

title: Duchess Visits Body
description: LONDON, June 3 (Reuters) The Duchess of Windsor tonight traveled from Buckingham Palace to Windsor Castle to visit the body of her husband.

title: Forest Hills Project: The Political Side.
description: The headquarters where State Senator Emanuel It Goldirimslis campaign for reelection is fourroom rabbit Warren on Main Streit in Hew Gardens

title: Upstate Bridal Held for Banker And Anne Place
description: MILLBROOK, N. Y. June 3 Miss Anne Rogers Place, daughter of K Curtis Place, Supervisor of Washington Township of which Milibrook is part, was married here this noon to Hugh Fiore Jr.

title: Group for Blind Names Fund Drive Chairman
description: Recording for the Blind, Inc., announced yesterday the appointment of Floyd D. Hall as general chairman of a nationwide campaign to raise $13million to triple the organization's book circulationl by 1976 and to provide a base for future expansion.

title: They Teach Ecology Here
description: BASKING RIDGEThe 400acre Environmental Education Center, in Lord Stirling Park adjacent to the Great Swamp National Wildlife Preserve, will have guides available for naturewalks along its trails after dedication ceremonies set for 2:30 P.M. next Sunday.

title: The World
description: LONDON  Gold may be, as the economist John Maynard Keynes once declared, a barbarous relic, but evidently that is not the verdict of the world's money markets. The gold price in markets in London and Zurich last week closed a whisker off $60 an ounce  an alltime record and $10 higher than a month previously.

title: Goats Do It, Why Can a Tourist?
description: ONE July. day, as oil gently floated onto the Mediterranean beach where we were lolling, I suggested to my husband that we turn our backs on the summer crowds, congestion and pollution of Europe's holiday playgrounds and go for a long walk in the Alps. He agreed, on condition we end up in Venice; he hates to give up oilslicks completely. So we mapped out a trip that would start in Switzerland (because it was simple to fly to Zurich from where we were, and there my husband could buy hiking boots) and end up in Italy, with some walking in Austria in between simply because Austria is in between.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: 210CLASS TAKEN BY WATT'S SLOOP
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 3David Watt, sailing the 210 Class sloop Tomuz, ran his undefeated string to three races on Long Island Sound, today, but Dr. George K. Brazill Jr.'s and Joseph F. O'Hora's Double Dare, in the Shields Class, was beaten for the first time after three Yacht Aacing Association victories.

title: Louis Reynal Norris Marries Miss Barbara Ellen Haneman
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., June 3Miss Barbara Ellen Haneman, daughter of Mrs. Isabel Wayland Haneman of Lloyd Harbor and the late. John Theodore Haneman, was married here this afternoon to Louis Reynal Norris of Oyster Bay. He is the son of Nathaniel, R. Norris of Newport, R. I., and St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, and the late Mrs. Norris.

title: How I Got My Granola Bowl: Confessions of a Tomb Robber
description: THE Customs inspector was obviously interested only in pot, not pottery. Like a trained police dog, lie paynd his way past the bottles of tequila, vodka and vermouth in my suitcases and actually tamed up his nose at the ceramic bowl I had secreted in a corner, dismissing it with Oh, so you brought some crockery back from Mexico.

title: Warning: Thin Ice
description: One of the most frenzied weeks in hockey since the National League was created in 1917 will start tomorrow with the beginning of the N.H.L.'s annual meetings.

title: U.S. Pilot Tells of 23 Days Near Hanoi
description: SAIGON South Vietnam June 3 (UPI)An American pilot plucked chives from a garden and tapped a banana tree for water during a 23day struggle for survival behind enemy lines in North Vietnam. Capt. Roger C. Locher described his ordeal today by telephone from his base in Thailand, where he was taken following his rescue.

title: Accords on Berlin Signed, Opening New Era for City
description: BERLIN June 3The Foreign Ministers a the four victorious powers of World War It signed the first comprehensive agreement on Berlin here today and yawed it would, end a quarter century of periodic Crises and uncertainty over the divided City.

title: A Hill of Irises in Montclair
description: MONTCLAIR  A display of irises that annual attracts admirers from around the world is blossoming heretall and short, smooth and fluted, and in every color of the rainbow.

title: Educators Find Black Studies Are Changing Higher Education
description: Although divided on what black studies are, what they should be and whom they should reach, a number of black educators, social scientists and intellectuals agree that the discipline has forever changed some aspects of American higher education.

title: P.B.A. VOTE CALLED A HELP TO BUDGET
