description: The likelihood of any new local taxeS next year virtually vanished yesterday as policemen, rejected their proposed new contract, freeing an unexpeeted $49million to fill most Of the remaining gap in the 197273 city budget.

title: SALEM CAPTURES OPEN JUMP TITLE
description: DEVON, Pa., June 3Salem, twice the runnerup for the championship, captured the open jumper title at the Devon Horse Show tonight even though he failed to make the final jumpoff of the $5,000added stake.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON Zero population growth has long been an earnest, if Utopian goal, of many Americans concerned about the quantity of national resources and the quality of national

title: World News Briefs
description: PEKING, June 3  Britain, one of the first Western nations to give diplomatic recognition to China, today marked Queen Elizabeth's official birthday with a reception on the lawns of the British Embassy here.

title: Taiwanese Are Pleased By New Cabinet Posts
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, June 3 Premier Chiang Chingkuo's Cabinet appointments earlier this week appear to have succeeded in winning some goodwill for the Government among the native Taiwanese.

title: IIARALD OF NORWAY WINS IN SOLING RACE
description: KIEL, Germany, June 3 (UPI) Crown Prince Harald of Norway held off a lastIeg challenge from Timir Pinegin of the Soviet Union to, win the opening race in the Soling class today as more than 400 yachtsmen from 33 nations opened preOlympic trials.

title: Indianapolis 500 Finish Is Delayed By Gurney Appeal
description: INDIANAPOLIS, June 3 (UPI)  The official finish of last Saturday's Indianapolis 500mile auto race apparently will not be determined for almost another month because of an appeal filed by Dan Gurney.

title: N.H.L. Unit Names Volpe
description: Ray Volpe has been named national advertising director of National Hockey League Services, Inc. Volpe was previously associated with Doyle Dane Bernbach, the advertising agency.

title: CALIFORNIAN WINS RACE FOR WOMEN
description: Across Central Park paths renamed Cheesecake Lane and Gorgeous Gain Gulch, 75 women and an uninvited man competed in the sixmile Crazylegs minimarathon yesterday.

title: Montanans to Vote on 2 Seats and a New Charter
description: BILLINGS, Mont., June 3Nominations for Governor and Senator will be at stake in Montana's primary election on Tuesday. Montanans will also vote on a new constitution, drawn up by a special convention earlier this year.

title: Pope Urges Doctors to Help Combat Growing Hedonism
description: ROME, June 3Pope Paul VI has urged participants in an international medical convention here to help the Roman Catholic Church defend Christian ethics in the face of spreading hedoniim."

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: In the remote backwoods of eastern Washington's Wenatchee National Forest, backpackers until recently could spend hours hiking into isolated valleys, sit down for, a rest, and be startled by the arrival of helicopters discharging campers and hunters.

title: Exploring Legendary Sag Harbor
description: SAG HARBOR, L.I.First referred to in 1651 in a posted notice offering a reward for the killing of WolveS this seaport community has survired many onslaughts since its earlier days as a quiet Indian encampment. Since then attacks by the British three great fires, hurricanes and assorted. nar!easters, plus a rising tide of progress, havefailed, to appreciably alter the salty atmosphere:.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: STOCKTON, Calif., June 3Someone remembered to reserve a train today for Senator GeorgeMcGovern's whistlastop journey down the San Joaquin Valley.

title: Humphrey Strength With Vote Blocs Fades
Moderates on Board
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., June 3 Candidates with moderate views on the busing issue, one of them a black bank official, were elected today to fill three positions on the ninemember CharlotteMecklenburg County Board of Education.

title: Emma Killington Wed To Richard Lee Wood
description: SHORT HILLS, N.J., June 3 Miss Emma Mary Billington, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harold J. Billington Jr. of Short Hills, and Richard Lee Wood, son of Mr. and Mrs. F. Lamar Wood of Kensington, Md., were married here this morning in St. Rose, of Lima Roman Catholic Church?? The Rev. Frank. Logue, the bridegroom's cousin, performed the ceremony.

title: Detective Works on Own Time To Clear 2 Youths He Arrested
description: A detective who spent every chance he had to look into the case on my own time was credited last week with having saved two teenaged youths he had arrested from possible, 25year prison terms for the slaying of a girl in a Brooklyn park.

title: West Coast Judge Drops Charges Against Panther
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 3 (UPI)A charge against the Black Panther chief of staff, David Hilliard, has been disMissed by a Federal district jUdge because the Government refused to disclose material obtained by wiretaps.

title: $1MVIillioh colt Chantilly Choice
description: CHANTILLY, France, June 3 With all my heart I hope I will be taken for an imbecile Sunday.

title: ECONOMY SHIFTS IN NEW ENGLAND
description: BOSTON, June 3  New England, recovering from its second major economic dislocation since World War II, appears to be shifting rapidly toward regionwide, servicebased economy.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONFor a man Who believes in capping his diplomatic dramas abroad with ceremonial climaxes at home, Thursday night may well linger in Richard Nixon's Mind some of the most satisfying theater of his Administration.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The Chemical Construction Corporation has subleased 42,225 square feet of office space at 437 Madison Avenue to three firms for 11 years at an aggregate rental of about $4million, or about $8.60 a square foot year.

title: Miss Gretchen Pfaff Married To J. Barton Riley, Stockbroker
description: SUMMIT, N. J., June 3Miss Martha Gretchen Pfaff, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry C. Pfaff Jr. of Summit and Hope, was married here this afternoon to J. Barton Riley, son of Mr. and Mrs. W. Phelps Riley of Gladwyne, Pa. The Rev. Dr. Franklin D. Fry performed the ceremony in St. John's Lutheran Church.

title: U.S. AID FOR CITIES DETAILED IN BOOK
description: All through history, individual cities have been destroyed by conquest, disease, natural calamity or changing patterns in agriculture, commerce and technology. But what we are witnessing in the United States is a new phenomenona voluntary and massive abandonment of cities....

title: Coins
description: THE Great Eastern Numismatic Association will hold its 10th anniversary convention here in the fall and the program will eXtend over four days, instead of three as, in former years, it was announced by Jackson Storm of Glen Cove, L. I., president. The event is scheduled for Oct. 5.8 at the Americana Hotel, Seventh; Avenue and 52d Street.

title: Joanne Mullen Is Wed
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., June 3  Miss Joanne Frances Mullen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Clarence Mullen of Allenhurst and Mountain Top, Pa., was married in Trinity Episcopal Church here this afternoon to Martin Joseph Vaccaro, Jr., son of Mayor and Mrs. Vaccaro of Allenhurst. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. L. Dudley Rapp of Trinity and the Rev. John MacDonald of St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in Deal.

title: Youth in SelfBurning Dies
description: CHICAGO, June 3 (AP) Steven Gates, 19 years old, who set himself afire May 22 at a downtown intersection, died today. No motive for the burning was learned.

title: Mary Jacqueline Lawrence Bride
description: DEAL, N.J., June 3Miss Mary Jacqueline Lawrence was married here this evening to Alan Joseph Lockman by Mayor Daniel Kruman of Deal at a candlelight ceremony at, home of the bride's paents, Mr. and Mrs. John Ewing Lawrence.

title: ANTICANCER DRUGS FACE WIDER USE
description: Encouraged by the success of potent anticancer drugs in treating acute leukemia and Hodgkin's disease, researchers are now trying to use these Chemicals to help improve the life expectancy of patients with other forms of malignant disease.

title: Environment
description: WASHINGTONAt his confirmation hearings on Dee.. 1, 1970, William D. Ruckelshaus, administratordesignate of the new Environmental Protection Agency, was asked, during discuselan of an ambiguity in the National Environmental Policy Act, whether he would resolve such ambiguities in favor of the environmental view.

title: Gamblers Who Fight Gambling
description: WESTWOOD  At 8 o'clock each Sunday night, a group of men meet at the United Methodist Church here to discuss their common problems  compulsive gambling.

title: Students Blake Profit In Investment Course
description: MADISON, Wis., June 3 (AP)Twelve University of Wisconsin students who were given $100;000 to invest as they choke turned an $4050 profit this year, $1,300 more than their predecessors in 1971.

title: The Nation
description: For 30 years, John. L. McClellan has been a fixture on Capitol A decade ago, as chairman of the Senate Government Operations Committee his Abrasive questioning of witnesses during organized crime and labor racketeering hearings made him a national figure. And in his native Arkansas, Senator McClellan always plctured himself to his constituents as a man of power and influence hi the nation's capital with the seniority to win for the state a wealth of public works projects and other economic benefits.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Movies
description: OH, WHAT a lovely war World War II is turning out to be for moviemakers. The latestand perhaps most ambitiouscinematic effort to show today's youth what warfare was like in the bad old days is the movie version of Albert Speer's Inside the Third Reich. According to Paramount president Frank Yablans, who was but a slip of a lad himself at the time of Hitler's terror, his company has already quietly embarked on a dramatization of the memoirs of the fuehrer's Minister of Armaments and War Production.

title: State Department Invites 9 Scholars to Gauge Research
description: WASHINGTON, June 3The State Department has invited a panel of prominent Scholars drawn from universities across the nation to evaluate its external research program, officials have reported.

title: WALL STREET.
description: It was nine months ago yesterday that Thomas J. Holt, Wall Street's intrepid Super Bear, climbed fearlessly out on a precarious limb and forecast an imminent stockmarket crash of great magnitude.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: The Ghost Of Populism Walks Again
description: AMERICAN political culture encourages the periodic revival of ghosts. The practice has become traditional. Revivals and celebrations of the past are national rituals. Before fully recovering from a Civil War Centennial, we gird ourselves for a Revolutionary Bicentennial. We have had two Whig parties and two Republican parties, and now we appear to be pregnant with a second Populist party. There is already a populist movement, some would have it a populist fad or myth. Populist slogans and populist candidates abound.

title: Travel Notes:
description: The Queen Mary, the former luxury liner now tied up at Long Beach, Calif., as a tourist, dining and shopping center, attracted more than 1.5 million visitors in its first year of operation. They spent a total of $6,330,000, about half of it for admissions to the Queen Mary Museum, Jacques Cousteau's Living Sea exhibit and upper deck tours. The rest of the revenue came from the operation of the vessel's banquet facilities, restaurants and 32 specialty shops.

title: A Test for Paterson Democrats
description: PATERSON  The city's strong Democratic party must weather another primary fight Tuesday before it gets down to the business of trying to recapture the City Hall it lost to the Republicans six years ago.

title: Threat to Airports Reported
description: LONDON, June 3 (AP)Air France reported tonight that it had received a warning that Japanese revolutionaries might attempt a suicide attack at a European airport on Monday.

title: PARENT IS SIGNED TO BLAZER PACT
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 3 (AP) Bernie Parent returned to Philadelphia today as the new Philadelphia Blazers of the embryo World Hockey Association announced they had signed the goalie to a fiveyear contract.

title: Nixon Reported to Plan Official oar byConnally
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 3White House sources said today that former Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally would leave soon, probably next week, on a worldwide tour as. President NixOn's special representative on international economic matters.

title: Concerned Nlothers Working to Get a Children's Hospital
description: When Elaine Wolbrom was faced with a serious medical problem involving her young son a few years ago, she could find no single place in the metropolitan area where diagnosis and treatment for all aspects of the disease was available.

title: Suspect Flown to Miami
description: MIAMI June 3Mr. Hahneman, the suspected airplane hijacker, was flown here today from Honduras under F.B.I. guard.

title: Carol Brennan Becomes Bride Of Brian Moss
description: PITTSBURGH, June 3In St. Paul's Roman Catholic Cathedral this afternoon, Miss Carol Mary Brennan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Robert Brennan, became the bride of Brian Hart Moss, son of Senator Frank E. Moss, and Mrs. Moss of Salt Lake City and Washington. The Rev. Adam Maida performed the ceremony.

title: The World
description: SAIGONThree months ago, an American official here said last week, we were virtually out of the refugee business. The next thing we knew there were refugees all over the place. By the weekend, American officials were estimating that nearly 800,000 South Vietnamese had been driven from their homes since the North Vietnamese offensive began more than two months ago.

title: OFFICIALS DIFFER OVER AIR CLEANUP
description: Federal and state officials agree that New York needs an extra two years to meet clean air standards but they disagree sharply on how those standards are to be achieved.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Leasing People for Fun and Profit
description: In a world of instantsatisfaction consumerism, perhaps the ultimate, short of inflatable deities, is the RentaPerson business. To find out what it's like to spend six hours with a leased person, New York Times staff reporter Judy Klemesrud and freelance writer Peter Andrews independently went to Miami, cash in hand, to rent someone. Miss Klemesrud, acting out her fantasy, posed as the traveling secretary of the New York Knickerbockers; Mr. Andrews, acting out his, posed as a publisher. They reserved their people by phone from an agency called RentABird and its brother firm, RentAGent. Mr. Andrews's bird cost $50 an evening, Miss Klemesrud's gent $55he is expected to open doors and pull out chairs; the agencies explain.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  In his moody, introspective way, Senator J. W. Fulbright, the chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, has an Achillean trait. When humiliated or scorned on the field of battle of the Senate floor, he, like the Greek hero on the fields of Troy, tends to sulk in his tent, discouraged with himself and the impervious ways of the Senate.

title: Hijacking Suspect Surrenders At U.S. Embassy, in Honduras
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, June 3 (Reuters)The man suspected of bailing out of a hijacked United States jet with $303,000 ransom over the jungles of Honduras a month ago surrendered to the United States Embassy here last night, Frederick W. Hahneman, 49 years old of Easton, Pa., told Ambassador Hewson A. Ryan that he was afraid and wanted to return to the United States. He Was flown to handcuffed and under guard today.An arrest warrant issued in Alexandria, Va., on Thursdny named Mr. Hahneman as the hijacker of an Eastern Airlines 727 that was seized after it left Allentown, Pa., On May 5 en route to Miami.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: The Senate confirmed Jeffrey M. Bucher, a lawyer and banker, last, week to a 14year term on the sevenman Federal Reserve Board. Thus, the nation's central bank is slowly changing. Despite strong objections from Senator William Proxmire, president Nixon seems to want more businessmen on a board still dothinated by economists.

title: G. W. Foxley Marries Carole L. Judson
description: WESTON, Conn., June 3Miss Carole Lorraine Judson, an account executive with Cunningham & Walsh, Inc., the New York advertising agency, was married here this afternoon to Griffith William Foxley, a lawyer with the New York firm of Palmer & Series. The Rev. Robert W. Greene performed the ceremony in the Norfield Congregational Church.

title: Stamps
description: ILLUSTRATED are the five U.S. postal cards that will be issued on June 29 at Boston, in observance of Tourism Year of the Americas'72. The cards, first reported here on May 21, measure 6 x 4 inches, larger than normal. They were designed by Melbourne Brindle of Bridgewater, Conn., and will be printed in black and dull orange on beige card stock by the Government Printing Office. Mr. Brindle designed the 1971 Historic Preservation series.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: HONOLULUIn Italy in the early part of the century when a native son returned from his first trip to America and expounded on the glories of the New World, his friends exchanged meaningful glances and exclaimed, Ah, Cristofero Colombol He has discovered America.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: A REVIVAL of Eurobond market was indicated last week with $300million in dollar convertibles.... Squibb Beechnut. and General Electric each offered $50million Issues; Broadway Hale $35million, and Mohasco Industries $20million... Price of gold reached a high of $59.75 an ounce in the London market and at the weekend closed at $59.40 bid and $59.70 asked.... Soviet sales of gold at periodic intervals have kept price of gold, from going over $60, according to Walter Frey, senior vice president of the Swiss Bank Corporation. And the United States and Switzerland are close to signing a treaty under which Swiss banks could be required to provide information on numbered accounts held by American criminals.

title: The process of politics
description: It's all Theodore White's fault. Ever since the enormous success of The Making of the President, 1960, reporters have been pushing aside the curtains of the political process, probing the performances of stagehands, directors, lighting engineers and wardrobe mistresses. This fascination with the process of politicsthe election game, in Joe Napolitan's revealing phrasehas almost dominated the reporting of politics. We are likely to know more about Hubert Humphrey's pancake makeup in the coming weeks than Hubert Humphrey's position on the war.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Juno 3  The experts have it all figured out, By all the rules. of the game, George McGovern is going to win the Democratic Presidential nomination in Julyand be trounced by Richard Nixon in the general election in November. But there are no experts and there are no reliable rules any longer, and even the grinning champions worry about their successes in the night.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Beneath the Feuerish palms, The Machismo of Martinique
description: VAUCLIN, Martinique  Perhaps we were not really as surprised as we pretended, but we wanted to please and impress the hotel owner, a game Americans feel bound to play when they learn they are among the first United States tourists ever to stay long in an outoftheway Caribbean spot. The owner of the hotel  the only hotel in this small fishing village on Martinique's sdutheastern shorevowed to frame our signed traveler's checks next to the telegram we had sent, in French, a week before from New York requesting accommodations. The telegram had scared her, she said. It was her first.

title: Maine Democrats Elect
description: AUGUSTA, Me., June 3 (UPI) Gov. Kenneth M. Curtis and Representative William D. Hathaway have been elected cochairmen of Maine's delegation to the National Democratic Convention.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: DETROIT, June 3M. Bachir Soueidan, a pnarmaceutical salesman, puts the blame on a faulty accelerator for the wreck of his company's 1972 Chevrolet Impala last month.

title: Medicine
description: WASHINGTON  Heartbeat and breathing are the traditional signs of life, and their cessation, the traditional legal and clinical indication of death. But both are controlled ultimately by the brain. Is a patient still alive when consciousness and brain control are permanently gone and the flow of blood and breath persists only by grace of machine?. Is a medical decision to pull the plug, to turn off the machines, simply a recognition that life is overor a form of murder?

title: Goodbye to Nixon
description: President Nixon has let Richard Whalen down. That I take to be the central theme of Catch the Falling Flag, and it is a position that a conservative Republican could quite understandably hold. But what gives Whalen's treatment its eccentric flavor is that he knew at the outset that Nixon was not a conservative ideologue (on Page 24, Nixon offers him

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: The death sentence imposed on Americanflag passenger shipping in the North Atlantic three years ago by unfavorable economic conditions has been confirmed officially.

title: BRYN MAWR RACE TO GROTON MISS
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 3A locally owned horse won in an 11horse horse field today at Liberty Bell Race Track when Groton Miss was first in the $28,850 Bryn Mawr Stakes by a halflength over. Michael G. Phipps's Monolith.

title: Mary Fahey Is Bride Of Irvin Cherashore
description: Miss Mary Antonia Fahey, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Fahey of Bronxville, N.Y., was married here this afternoon to Irvin Lee Cherashore, son of Mrs. David Cherashore of Elkins Park, Pa., and the late Mr. Cherashore. The Rev. John Murray performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Chapel of SS. Faith, Hope and Charity.

title: SEAVER TAKES 8TH
description: The New York Mets subdued the Atlanta Braves, 52, yesterday with their onetwo pitching punch Tom Seaver and Tug McGrawbefore a crowd of 51,912 in Shea Stadium.

title: Corning College Tuition Up
description: CORNING, N. Y. June 3 (UPI) The board of trustees of Corning Community.College approved a budget of $3,873,000 yesterday and then announced a tuition increase for the twoyear college's 2,000 students to help defray the $100,000 added expenditures the spending package represented. Tuition charges at the college starting in the fall will he $470 for residents up $50  and $940 for outofstate students  an increase of $520.

title: Ballet: The Danes and Modern Dance
description: COPENHAGEN, DenmarkIn national rather than international terms Copenhagen has a special difficulty in being accepted as a ballet center. Although it is the home of one of the world's few significant classic dance companies, the Royal Danish Ballet, the town, unlike New York or London, plays host to comparatively few visiting dance companies.

title: Nelson Backs McGovern
description: MADISON, Wis. June 3 (AP) Senator Gaylord Nelson said today that he was supporting Senator George McGovern of South Dakota for the Democratic Presidential nomination. The Wisconsin Democrat said in a statement that Mr. McGovern is the only candidate in either party who has recognized the urgent necessity for fundamental change in our society and has had the courage to make the case.

title: Photography
description: SPIRISPIRIT photography the recording on film of sorts of psychic phenomena  has a history almost as long as that of photography itself. Spiritualists and psychic investigators, recognizing immediately the potential value of photography as a recording technique, began using cameras to document paranormal manifestations more than a century ago.

title: NEPENTHE WINS L. I. SOUND RUE
Man In Black Scores
description: STANTON, Del., June 3 (AP) Bel Feliciano guided Man In Black to a threequartrlength victory in today's feature race at Delaware Park.

title: The Nation
description: NEW ORLEANS  George Wallace would win an open Presidential primary in conservative Deep South Louisiana. Yet blacks and supporters of Senator George McGovern have taken over the state's delegation to the Democratic National Convention.

title: FREEAGENT DRAFT TO START TUESDAY
description: Professional baseball clubs will be looking for players like Burt Hooton when the eighth summer freeagent draft will be held in New York Tuesday and Wednesday.

title: ClosedCircuit TV Spots Hoboken Crime
description: HOBOKENA crime committed in the main streets here  a holdup or mugging, for example  stands a good chance of being seen by the police as it is taking place. An arrest will be made in seconds, and a film of the robbery or, assault can be shown in court.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: NIXON'S POPULARITY INCREASES IN POLL
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 3President Nixon's popularity is at its highest point in nearly two years, according to a nationwide survey conducted by the Gallup Poll during his summit meetings with Soviet leaders.

title: A Selection Of Recent Titles
description: The following list has been selected from titles reviewed since the Christmas Issue of Dec. 5, 1971. Such a list can only suggest the high points in the main fields of reader interest. Books are arranged alphabetically under subject headings. Quoted comments are from earlier issues of the Book Review.

title: Mignon Griffith Bride Of James Latimer Jr.
description: ATCHISON, Kan., June 3 In the First Presbyterian Church this afternoon, Miss Nina Mignon Griffith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James M. Griffith, was married to James Harris Latimer Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Latimer of Wallingsford, Pa. The Rev. George Reed White performed the ceremony.

title: Humphrey Finds T.V.A. Is Preferable to Hitler
description: HOLLYWOOD, June 3 Hubert H. Humphrey recoiled today at a KNXT news interviewer's suggestion that the Tennessee Valley Authority was an environmental atrocity. He denied that expanded power production need necessarily pollute.

title: Realignment Restudied
description: Realignment of baseball's major leagues, advocated by many critics and some in siders for many years, is closer to, acceptance than ever before because of tWo recent events the move of Willie Mays from San Francisco to New York and a Giant Dodger game that drew 9,885 paid admissions in San Francisco last Thursday.

title: AUXILIARY POLICE MAKING COMEBACK
description: There was no crime in Chinatown or, Little Italy the other nightor none that came to light. The Police DepartMent knows because it had three foot patrolmen assigned to each block in the area.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Venezuelan Police Kill 4 But Fail to Rescue Hostage
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, June 3, (Reuters)Policemen and soldiers stormed a house where they thought a kidnapped Venezuelan millionaire, Carlos Dominguez, was held tonight but found only the four bodies of guerrillas who died in a hail of machinegun fire.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Watkins Glen, the upstate village that did so much to revive road racing after World War H, will open its silver anniversary season on the weekend of June 1618 with four races for four classes of cars. The feature will be the season's first Eastern appearance of the L.&M. Continental 5000 Championship, which is expected this year to be the most competi tive series of the Sports Car Club of America. The other races will be a pair of TransAmericans for sedans divided into two classesengines above 2.5 liters and engines below 2.5 litersand a sprint for Formula Super Vees.

title: The Nation
description: As New Jersey, Gov. William T. Cahill stepped to the podium last week to ask the state A.F.L.C.I.O. convention in Atlantic City to support his taxreform program, he said he felt like an attorney, addressing the jury after the verdict is in. The labor organization had unanimously gone on record in opposition to the Governor's plan to reduce local property taxes and replace them with new broadbased taxes, including the state's first income tax. The state would take over most local education and welfare costs. The union said the plan was filled with loopholes for business and landlord favoritism.

title: MISS SMITH'S 141 LEADS BY STROKE
description: LUTHERVILLE, Md., June 3 (AP) Marilynn Smith, an 18year veteran on the. Ladies Professional Golf Association tour, maintained the lead with a fiveunderpar 141 following a secondround 73 today in the Lady Carling open golf tournament.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: IF a Rented gent Makes Passes, Take Two and Go. Right to Politics
description: MIAMI Hil I'm Bud The smiling man Standing beAfore me in the lobby of the DuPont Plaza Hotel was wearing the brightest orange suit I'd ever seen. And that's not all  his iridescent tie was orange, too, and so was his striped shirt and his sunburned face. A Clockwork Orange, thought, and then :I extended my hand and formally met my $55anight date, my RentAGent, Talmadge (Bud) Chapman.

title: Theater League Backs Discount Ticket Plan
description: The League of New York Theaters' board of governors yesterday authorized the exploration of a plan to establish a discount ticketoffice in the Broadway area, possibly at Duffy Square, Weft 46th Street and Broadway.

title: Dance
description: BRITAIN'S Royal Ballet is almost a New Yorker. It is the closest thing we have to a resident company that is not a resident company. It arrived in 1949 and last night, after six weeks at the Metropolitian Opera House, it ended its 13th season in New York and its first New York season under the direction of the company's third director, Kenneth MacMillan.

title: Movies
description: IN 1967, one of the surprise hits of the San Francisco Film Festival was a foreign entry, The Story of a ThreeDay Pass. The film's director was originally from Chicago, but he came to the festival as a French delegate. He had spent 13 years abroad painting, writing and finally directing, in Paris, this bittersweet movie about a black American soldier who falls in love with a French girl. The director's name was Melvin Van Peebles and he was black. And to many, he seemed to offer new hope that one day American movies might deal with relevant, contemporary black themes.

title: Friend Reported With suspect
description: TEGUCIGALPA, June 3 (AP) According to local. news reports, Mr. Hahneman surrendered to the embassy with an old childhood friend, Jose Gomez Rovelo. Mr: Hahneman grew up in Central America. The broadcast quoted Mr. Hahneman as telling Ambassa, dor Ryan that it was unjust that the United States put a price on my head without having been judged.

title: Caroline Pelz Plans Bridal
description: Miss Caroline Campbell Pelz, a birth control and abortion counselor with the Pregnancy Counseling Service in Boston, plans to be married to Peter Henry Elbow of Somerville, Mass., an assistant professor of humanities at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

title: Holiday Stabbing Called SelfDefense
description: CLEVELAND, June 3  The attorney for a man accused of stabbing another man to death while they waited to see Santa Claus in a downtown department store here indicated, this week that his case would be based on a plea of selfdefense.

title: Lallie Lloyd Married
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., June 3Miss Lallie Barnes Lloyd and. Scott Thorne O'Brien were married here shis afternoon in the Episcopal Church of the Redeemer by the rector,. the Rev. Timothy Pickering. He was assisted by the Rev. Peter C. Moore. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. H. Gates Lloyd 3d of Haverford. Her father is an investment banker in Philadelphia. Mr. O'Brien is the son of Mrs. John L. Cox of Mount Kisco, N. Y., and the late Dr. George E. O'Brien, a dentist.

title: Miss Genton Wins Title In Women's Foil Fencing
description: ROCK HILL, N. Y., June 3 (AP)Averil Genton of the New York Fencers Club upset Ruth White of New York University to night to win the championship of the women's foil competition in the Emerald Green Fencing Tournament.

title: Art
description: PARIS

title: MUJIB CRACKS DOWN ON PROCHINA GROUP
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, June, 3 The Government of Bangladesh has cracked down on the extreme leftist Naxalites proChinese Marxists, following a series of murders and outbreaks of ether lawlessness in rural areas.

title: Mark Weintraub Weds Miss MullerThym
description: DARLINGTON, Md., June 3 Miss Alice Goodwin Muller. Thym and Mark David Weintraub, seniors at Case West. ern Reserve University, were married at noon today at the home here of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Toy MullerThym, parents of the bride.

title: 30 Held in Paris Protest
description: PARIS, June 3 (Reuters) Poice detained about 30 demonstrators who chained themselves to a stand at an environment exhibition today to protest French nuclear tests in the Pacific. A statement signed by about 30 French intellectuals and scientists, including JeanPaul Sartre, condemned the expulsinn from France last weekend of a leading opponent of the test program, Ben Metcalfe, a place activist from Vancouver, British Columbia.

title: General Dynamics Navy Pact
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI) The General Dynamics Corporation's facility at Croton, Conn., received a $1.3million Navy contract yesterday for planning, engineering and design work to convert Polaris nuclear submarines to Poseidon ballistic missiles.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: DO YOU KNOW ANY IMPORTANT MAN IN BUSINESS WHO DOES NOT READ FORBES MAGAZINE?ADVT

title: Miss Richmond, Peter A. Orgain To Wed Sept. 9
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., June 3Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Thacher Richmond of New Canaan; Bridgewater, Vt., and Lake Wales, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Caroline Heywood Richmond of Hanover, N.H., to Peter Arpin Orgain, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Roy Orgain of Hackettstown, N.J., and Chippewa Bay, N.Y.

title: WHITE CLOUD PROVES A PLEASURE TO HEAR
description: An unheralded but quite appealing group named White Cloud is working upstairs at Max's Kansas City this week. At a time when the air is filled with quiet, desperate efforts to keep the rock group phenomehon alive, it is a distinct pleasure to hear a band that has the potential to deliver what it promises.

title: Horsemen Back TV From Westbury
description: The board of directors of the Standardbred Owners Association, following a general membership meeting, voted yesterday to approve the proposed experimental televising of harness races from Roosevelt Raceway by the Offtrack Betting Corporation.

title: Angels Gain. Fifth VictorAin Row by Beating Indians, 84, on Two Homers
description: CLEVELAND, June 3 (AP)Home runs by Leroy Stanton and Ken McMullen helped the California Angels, to an 8.4 victory today over the Cleveland Indians. The victory was the fifth straight, for the Angels.

title: Parrish Museum Blooms for Season
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I. With the opening of the summer season, art blossoms on the South Fork, and perhaps nowhere in greater profusion than here at the Parrish Museum, which is celebrating its 75th anniversary.

title: The Nation
description: The Pay Board, enjoying a serenity no one would have dreamed possible when it was the most strifetorn agency in Washington only a couple of months ago, moved back to the firingline last week. All of its legal batteries were trained on a midget case of alleged violation of wage ceilings.

title: RAIL COMMUTERS MAY GET FARE RISE
description: The Penn Central Transportation Company has called for an increase on the Harem and Hudson Divisions that would raise fares 23 per cent for the great majority of the commuters using those lines.

title: Photography
description: THE New York Universi. ty School of Continuing Education, 2 University Place, New York, N. Y. 10003, is offering a number of photographic courses this summer, including two basic coursesone for beginners with no previous knowledge, and one on color photography for those with some experience. The beginners course will meet in two sections on Tuesday evenings starting this week  one section meeting from 6:10 to 8, the other from 8:10 to 10. The color course will meet on Thursday evenings from 6:10 to 8, starting this week. The courses will end the latter part of July and each will cost $35. The instructor for each will be Casey Allen. For more information call (212) 5983991.

title: Bar Told to Serve Women
description: The Cafe Bar in the SherryNetherland Hotel has been prohibited from refusing to serve women because they are unescorted. The order was issued by the State Division of Human Rights at the request of the office of Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz.

title: Writing About Art
description: The art of painting, when all is said, wrote Eugene Fromentin, is but the art of expressing the invisible by means of the visible. Fromentin was luckier than most writers on art. He was, as a Dutch historian remarked, a man of two muses, being at once a painter and a writer, and he therefore approached the task of writing about art with all his intuitions alert to the mysteries that lie on both sides of the boundary separating the visual from the literary.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARIS  Death and political disappearance have been the two ways of changing postStalin Russia's power structure and the two most dramatic instances were those of Beria and Khrushchev. Beria was contemned and feared for his despicable habits and brutality. Khrushchev was considered uncultivated and cheap even by many who Jiked his switch from oppressive dictatorship.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: The big voice in the nation's major industry  the $95billion retail grocery business  is the Progressive Grocer, now celebrating its 50th anniversary.

title: Music Mailbag
description: SOL GREITZER was studying the violin at the Juilliard School when he was drafted into the army during World War II. He took his violin with him to Spartanburg, S. C., where he was given basic training in the infantry, and he played concerts regularly at the USO. He had gotten into the army too late to get a safe job in one of the service orchestras; they were filled up by that time. He was assigned to a combat unit. Nine months were spent at the front, and he was decorated for heroism during the Battle of the Bulge.

title: IRENE PEERY RETAINS POISE IN PIANO DEBUT
description: Irene Weiss Peery, a pianist who has been given a great many awards in her native Canada, made her New York debut in Carnegie Recital Hall on Friday night. Her, playing made clear why she has been frequent prizewinner. She is, capable technician, a poised performer and a correct interpreter.

title: MIAMI PLANNING CONVENTION CORPS
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 3The creation of a convention peace corps". as a deterrent to dis, turbances during the two national conventions here is being planned by this city with Federal assistance.

title: Education
description: A student in a special campus laboratory sits at a computerized typewriter with a Russian keyboard and, as he receives instructions through his earphones, he types sentences in Russian. The voice on the earphones prods and corrects.

title: Deep Recession Grips Saigon
description: Jun 3South Vietnam is in the throes of its worst recession in memory, and its Miniater of the Economy among others believes that there may be street rioting and political up beivals if quick solutions are not found for the problem of urban unemployment

title: MORE FUNDS SOUGHT FOR SPACE STUDIES
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (AP) Discoveries in the last seven years add up to a high probability that intelligent life exists elsewhere in the universe, a committee of the National Academy of Sciences has reported.

title: Sale of Scout House Opposed
description: Faced with widespread community protest and dissension within their ranks, the Boy Scouts are selling a Victorian house in Sheepshead Bay to a man who plans to build a restaurant or fish market in its place.

title: 350 to Vie Starting Friday In Annual Wheelchair Games
description: More than 350 men and women from 32 states will compete in the 16th annual National Wheelchair Games beginning on Friday at the Joseph Bulova School of Watchmaking in Woodside, Queens. The threeday competition will conclude on Sunday with ceremonies at Bulova Park, Queens.

title: Burtis's Guachero Is Vidor In Star Class Yachting
description: SEA CLIFF, L.I., June 3Alan and Bill Burtis's Guachero posted a third straight victory, in Star Class competition on Hempstead Harbor today as Paul and David Pritchard's Mimi finished second.

title: 14 ON NAVY PLANE KILLED IN MOROCCO
description: NIA,PLES, Italy, June 3 (UPI) A United States Navy plane crashed in northern Morocco today, killing all 14 men aboard, a Navy spokesman at Sixth Fleet Headquarters in Naples said.

title: If You Go...
description: ... to Washington, Ga., don't expect to find accommodations in town. There are no hotels, motels, restaurants or bars. (The county is dry.) An occasional motel and eating place can he found on U.S. 78 either east or west of Washington, but the nearest tourist centers of any size are Athens, 50 miles northwest, and Augusta, 60 miles southeast. Atlanta is about 110 miles to the east. Washington is a fine place to spend the dayon your way to somewhere else. The museum is open Tuesdays through Saturdays; the plantation restoration is open Mondays through Saturdays from May to November.

title: PIRATES RALLY TO BEAT GIANTS
description: SAN FRANCISCO June 3 (AP)  Al Oliver's tworun double in the seventh inning highlighted a threerun rally that gave the Pittsburgh Pirates a 43 victory over the San Francisco Giants today.

title: A CITIZENS PARLEY AT WALDORF SCORED
description: PITTSBURGH, June 3Plans for a national citizens participation conference sponsored by the New York City Model Cities Administration have been criticized by the Rev. Donald Mcllvane, a Roman Catholic priest.

title: An Old Family Portrait Actually a Gainsborough
description: LONDON, June 3 (AP) Two sisters have discovered that a dusty old family portrait that had hung unnoticed in their home for 40 years is a Gainsborough masterpiece that no one even knew existed, art experts said today.

title: Phase 2: A Can Maker's Woes
description: GREENWICH, Conn. Grumbling about Phase Two is increasing, and one of the unhappiest voices on the corporate block is the American Can Company's.

title: Convenience Sets Stakes Record in Capturing $105,900 Vanity at Hollywood
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., June 3 (UPI)Glen Hill Farms Convenience scored the biggest victory of her career today when she captured the 31st running of the $105,900 Vanity Handicap for fillies and mares at Hollywood Park.

title: Top Canadian Tennis Star Is Suspended for Walkout
description: TORONTO, June 3 (AP)Peter Burwash, the topranked player in Canada, was suspended for two months by the Canadian Lawn Tennis Association yesterday for having quit the Davis Cup team three weeks ago in Vancouver, British Columbia.

title: Soviet Sows More Wheat to Offet Poor winter Crop
description: MOSCOW, June 3  The Soviet Union has announced that it has virtually completed its spring sowing campaign, adding substantial acreage to make up for losses in the winter grain crop.

title: Banging Holes in the Land  The Vietnam war from the deck of a V.S. cruiser
description: THROUGH the binoculars on the signal bridge one discerns specks of people walking along a beach littered with sampans and hootches. Beyond the beach rise green paddy fields and woods fading rapidly into a distant skyline of blue peaks and haze. Occasionally one also sees white or black puffs of smoke hovering gently on the horizon, but for the most part the view of Quangtri, the first South Vietnamese province to fall entirely to the North Vietnamese in the current offensive, appears deceptively tranquil and calm.

title: Methodist Hospital Expansion Questioned
description: A comprehensive plan prepared by a private consultant firm as a guide to Methodist Hospital's expansion has been met with apprehension by some leaders of the Park Slope community.

title: Major Discrepancies Discovered At Site of Olympic Track Trials
description: EUGENE, Ore., June 3An illegal waterjump area has impaired the credibility of the three fastest steeplechase performances by American trackmen and raised other pertinent questions about the site for the United States Olympic trials. The recordbreaking race was run last. year.

title: New Private Club Here Accents Diverse Appeal
description: Talk about private clubs and the picturetrue or notcomes to mind of highceilinged darkened rooms with old men sitting in wellworn leather chairs, squinting through the financial pages and muttering about the unfitness of the younger generation.

title: Criminals At Large
description: And so, at the year's halfway point, there are  of the several hundred mysterycrimesuspenseespionageGothic novels published so fara handful that stand out. Let's begin with the traditional mystery, the one that was carried to its height in England and still is more or less owned by the British. Two come from veteran practitioners  Agatha Christie's NEMESIS (Dodd, Mead, $6.95), and Michael Innes's THE OPEN HOUSE (Dodd, Mead, $4.95). Jane Marple is the spinster detective in the Christie, and Sir John Appleby is his suave self in the Innes. Between them they confront impossibly artificial situations, examine clues, refuse to be misled, and end up making all the traditionalists happy.

title: Jutland Find Puts Presence Of Man Back 45,000 Years
description: AARHUS, Denmark, June 3 (AP) banish archeologists have announced new finds that, they say, that hunters and fishermen lived in East Jutland as long as 60,000 to 100,000 years. ago.

title: Finger Lakes Exacta $1 ,745
description: CANANDAIGUA, N. Y., June 3 (AP)The exacta in the fifth race at Finger Lakes today paid $1,745, the largest in the track's history. The winning combination was 10 and 6Blues Count, a 50.1 shot that paid $116 to win, and Hospitable Lady, 51.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: The Nation
description: What's, the point? They're not going, to change anything!

title: 399in Primary Vie as Delegates
description: TRENTON  There are count em  399 candidates running for New Jersey's 109 delegate seats to the Democratic National Convention.

title: Paula Mirabile Wed To Robert Wall Jr.
description: Miss Paula Angela Mirabile and Robert Anthony Wall Jr., son of Judge Robert A. Wall of the Superior Court of Connecticut and Mrs. Wall of Harwinton, Conn., were married yesterday afternoon in Immaculate Conception Roman Catholic Church in Jamaica, Queens. Msgr. Raphael J. Testagrossa performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: Dead Inmate's Family Suing Jersey Officials, Charging Them With Responsibility for His Strangulation
description: The family of an inmate who died by strangulation in a segregation cell in a division of the New Jersey prison system has brought suit against a number of state officials, charging them with responsibility for that death.

title: Music Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Ch. Sagamore Toccoa, a Cocker Spaniel, Is Judged Best at Wellesley Show
description: WELLESLEY, Mass., June 3 After a lapse of 23 years,, a cocker spaniel moved to the top rung at the prestigious Ladies Dog Club show on the magnificent treeshaded grounds of the Stigmatine Seminary today. She was the silverbuff, Ch. Sagamore Toccoa, otherwise known as Bunny, and owned by Mrs. Peggy, Westphal of Bedford, N. Y.

title: Many Overlook Lottery Prizes
description: TRENTONRalph F. Batch, a former Federal Bureau of Investigation agent who leans toward conservatism in demeanor and dress, has given away $89,667,800 te strangers in the last year and a half, and he would gladly give thousands more if potential recipients would only put out their hands.

title: Architecture
description: IT'S deid vu time at the Museum of Modern Artfor this observer, anyway. This is where I came in, which gives me a very funny feeling. Twentyodd years ago, convinced that there was a vigorous and significant rebirth of design activity in Italy, I went there with a Fulbright grant to collect the evidence. There was a good deal of talk about the postwar flowering of an Italian style in those days, and we spoke of a renaissance of Italian design leadership. In 1952, I brought the material home to turn it into a traveling show for the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Forurn School at Waldwick Offers Attic Children Hope
description: WALDWICKThe attic childrencalled so because they often have been kept hidden, damaged to life without hopeare finding new hope.

title: Art
description: Two exhibitions of graphic and decorative arts  a show of Alphonse Mucha posters at the FAR Gallery, 746 Madison Avenue, until June 10, and an exhibition entitled Art and Design in Vienna, on view at La. Boetie, Inc., 1042f, Madison Avenue until June 24  are both instructive and attractive, covering one of the more interesting cultural periods when an internatinnal art movement encompassed both high :art and the products of everyday life.

title: P.B,A.'S MEMBERS REJECT CONTRACT
description: Rank and file members of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association have rejected a new 30month contract with the city that would have given them a large raise in pay and other benefits, but would have Meant revisions of their work schedules for better productivity.

title: U.S. REPORT LISTS CONSUMERS GAINS
description: Substantive steps were taken in the consumer's behalf in 1971 at the state level, a new study by President Nixon's office of Consumer Affairs reports.

title: ARAB COMMANDOS SHOW NO REMORSE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 3The young, men who speak for the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, the Marx1St guerrilla organization, show no remorse for the shooting at the Tel Aviv airport that took the lives of 25 bystanders, many of them Puerto Rican pilgrims.

title: Circumstance May Reign Over Pomp in Northport
description: NORTHPORT, L. I.Is the flap against renting caps and gowns at Northport High School a ludicrous putdown by insensitive glory seekers, as one mother phrased it? Or is it g charitable move  donating the rental fee to the Save the Children Federation with an antiestablishment twinge?

title: Pale and cool
description: When the summer heat is stifling, you can still look citycool and elegant. The secret is pongee. Paper thin, this bamboocolored raw silk enjoying a comeback, although sophisticated women have always been aware of its virtues, Ivory jewelry adds to its coolasamelon look.

title: COLONIAL PROFILE IN HONG KONG IN
description: HONG KONG, June 3Flags flew at halfstaff in Hong Kong this week to mark the death of a former King of England, the Duke of Windsor. It was one of few visible reminders that this city of 4 million people, 99 per cent of whom are Chinese, is a British colony.

title: JOHN S. WILSON'S Music
description: As saxophonist and leader of a strongly bluesoriented jazz band, Charles Williams will be playing the role he relishes when he appears tonight at the Galaxy, Farmers Boulevard and Linden Street in St. Albans, Queens.

title: City and Transportation Authority Request a Federal Grant of $142Million for 750 New Subway Cars
description: The city and the Metropolitan Transportation Authority announced yesterday that they had asked for a Federal grant of $142million to purchase 750 new airconditioned subway cars.

title: The Nation
description: Two New York City welfare caseworkers played chess from noon to 2 P.M.then went out together for half an hour, brought, back sandwiches and ate until 3 P.M., when one of them left for the day. The other did no work the rest of the afternoon.

title: Hamburgers: Sweet. Smell of Success
description: ROOSEVELT, L. I.Schloesser & Weingarten hamburgers are eaten in cafeterias, diners, Now York City airport lunch counters, some highpriced Manhattan restaurants and at Wetson's 72 fastfood outlets in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Summer Reading
description: With the political season approaching itspeak, the political shopper is once more touring the supermarkets of opinion, thumping a melon here, discarding a lemon there, snapping up the taxreduction loss leader, being dazzled by the packaging of the latest plan to end the war. Ever consumerconscious, the publishers have issued biographies of several of the candidates. (There are three of Ted Kennedy alone. Are they trying to tell us something?)

title: the traveler's world
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.Houseboating today has nothing whatever to do with the shantyboats of earlier times when a rough shack could be set up on a flatbottom boat with an outboard motor hung off the stern. Today's houseboats are slick, chic, 3040 foot affairs with comfortable beds for six, electric pumps for the heads, showers, electric or butanepowered refrigerators and stoves, electric lights, and power units ranging from 110horsepower outboards to twinengine powerplants putting out 500 horsepower or more.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: LOS ANGELES, June 3What would Hubert Humphrey do, the woman interviewer on San Francisco's KPIXTV asked at midmorning yesterday, if he had three days off?

title: Linda Duchan to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Ira Duchan of Hollis Hills, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Linda Hillary Duchan, to Michael Alan Bleiweis, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Bleiweis of Belmont, Mass. Mr. Duchan is Commissioner of the New York City Department of Real Estate.

title: Crucial First Steps
description: The United Nations Conference on the Human Environment, opening in Stockholm tomorrow, should not be expected to save the environment from the various types of doom that, rationally or hysterically, are, being predicted for it.

title: Bergen Debates Priorities: Concert Hall or Concert Lovers?
description: TEANECK  With cultural activities flourishing in the county, the question was raised last week whether to build a proper home for the performing artsin Bergen or whether the first need is for building an audience large enough to support such a hall thibkhout the year.

title: Mart Gains Two Minutes On the Doomsday Clock
description: CHICAGO, June 3 (AP)The doomsday clock on the cover of the Bulletin of Atomic Scientists has been set back by two minutes in. recognition of the strategic arms limitation agreement with the Soviet Union.

title: Bobby Unser Wins Pole in Rex Mays Classic
description: WEST ALLIS, Wis., June 3Bobby Unser broke his own qualifying record here today to win the pole position for tomorrow's running of the 150mile Rex Mays Classic in this Milwaukee suburb.

title: Coins
description: The fifth medal In the series depicting scenes and characters from the plays of William Shakespeare, which is being sponsored by,the Shakespeare Birthplace Trust, will portray Antony and Cleopatra. Like the first four medals in this series, it will be designed by Paul Vincze,

title: Governor Signs Bill to Aid The Children of P.O.W.'s
description: ALBANY, June 3A bill providing educational assistance to children of prisoners of war in North Vietnam has been signed by Governor Rockefeller.

title: Gardens
description: BUY a quart of crawl cleaned ladybugs; tie up a praying mantis egg case  and you'll never need to use chemical sprays in the garden again. So say the advertisements.

title: M'GOVERN SPENDING IS REPORTED HIGH
description: WASHINGTON, June 3Senator George McGovern has spent in California at least $700,000, more, than Senator Hubert H. Humphrey has spent in California, New Jersey and New Mexico, according to data filed by their campaign managers.

title: Builders Show Scouts Jobs in Construction
description: RIVER. EDGEThe Boy SConts of America and the Builders Association of Northern New Jersey have faired forces in Bergen CountY to interest highschool boys in the construction field.

title: PROFESSOR OUSTED IN DISPUTE ON BIBLE
description: ST. LOUIS, June 3A dispute over the alleged failure tb accept literal teachings of the Bible has led to the dismissal of a professor at Concordia Seminary here and the placing of academic penalties on the school by an accrediting agency.

title: Massachusetts Sets Quota To Speed Minority Hiring
description: BOSTON, June 3 (AP)In an attempt to speed up implementation of minorityhiring plans in the construction, trades, Massachusetts will impose a 20 per cent minorityhiring requirement on all construction contracts for state projects in the Roxbury, Dorchester and South sections.

title: Marriage in jersey For Barbara Hazen
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., June 3Miss Barbara French Hazen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Burchard Miller Hazen of Llewellyn Park, West Orange, was married here this afternoon to Arthur Boynton Glidden 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Glidden Jr. of Dover, Mass. The Rev. Robert Wardrop performed the ceremony In the Episcopal Church of the Holy Communion.

title: Nassau Hospital Sues Over 2 Patients
description: EAST MEADOW, L.I., June 3The Nassau County Medical Center has filed suit to compel a state institution to accept mentally retarded patients. who are in the county hospital against the wishes of the State Department of Mental Hygiene.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Ocean water and its inland counterparts, long supportive of little understood marine life, vessels and mankind, have comparitively recently become the object of renewed exploration.

title: FRESH AIR CAMP ADDS ATTRACTION
description: FISHKILL, N.Y., June 3Three pairs of Canada geese recently flew into the area to raise their families, and, at the edge of the little lake, muskrats and ducks eagerly fed on aquatic plantings.

title: Allen and White Sox: A Happy Deal
description: CHICAGO, June 3 Dick Allen, so unloved and unwanted that he was traded three, times in slightly more than two years, has become as welcome among the Chicago White Sox as an open fire hydrant is among kids in an underprivileged neighborhood on a hot day.

title: Sheila Flinn Married
description: WASHINGTON, June 3Miss Sheila Teresa Flinn was married here this afternoon to Andrew Grover Stone, a lawyer with the Federal Trade Commission. The bride's brother, the Rev. George B. Flinn, performed the ceremony in Holy Trinity Roman Catholic Church. The Parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. George Blair Flinn of Cresson, Pa., and Frank B. Stone, a senior partner in Chadbourne, Parke, Whiteside & Wolff, New York lawyers, and Mrs. Stone of Summit, N. J.

title: How to avoid rape and murder and be near a doctor.
description: The worst thing that can happen to you in the big city, I always tell myself on the bus into New York City every morning, is that you will get mugged, lose all your credit cards, get sold into white slavery or become a hopeless drug addict. (A person who isn't careful can pick up an addiction to marijuana from public toilet seats.) Some commuters I know have even worse fears, which I don't have to go into here.

title: Miss Susan T. Mueller Married To Louis Timchak Jr., Lawyer
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., June 3  Miss Susan Truesdale Mueller, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Swan Mueller Jr. of Haverford and, Hillock, Warick, Bermuda, was married here this afternoon to Louis John Timchak Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Timchak of Johnstown, a.

title: Feuerbach Voted Top Track Star
description: Al Feuerbach, who broke the world indoor record for the shotput, was voted the outstanding athlete of the 1972 indoor track season yesterday by the Track Writers Association of New York.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: BOSTONIn front of the Harvard Graduate School of Business, a member of the class of 1972 sat on the bank of the Charles River and talked about his future.

title: A Seville Lawyer, Critical of Franco, On Trial in Madrid
description: MADRID, June 3Alejandro Rojas Marcos, a Seville lawyer who is one of the more prominent of a younger generation of Spanish professionals critical of the Franco regime, went on trial today in Madrid's Public Order Court.

title: Dodgers Down Cards
description: LOS ANGELES, June 3 (AP) Unbeaten Don Sutton registered his eighth victory with a sevenhitter and Duke Sims droVe in the only run with fifthinning single as the Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the St. Louis Cardinals, 10, tonight.

title: 7 West African Nations Sign Treaty for Economic Union
description: BAMAKO, Mali, June 3 (Agence FrancePresse)  Seven of the nine Frenchspeaking, countries of West Africa signed a treaty today to set up a West African economic community.

title: Patrolman Shoots 4 on Staten I. For Refusal to Halt Disturbance
description: A city patrolman shot four youths in the leg Friday night because a gang of them had allegedly created a disturbance in front of his house on Staten Island and refused to stop, the police reported yesterday.

title: Annapolis Dean Named
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 3 (AP)  Robert W. McNitt has been appointed dean of admissions at the United States Naval Academy. He succeeds Dr. William S. Shields, who retired last month. Mr. McNitt is a retired rear admiral.

title: Best of, Two Worlds
description: LONDON, June 3That Celtic urge toward selfdestruction, so fully chronicled in modern literature, seems to have overtaken Northern Ireland's brilliant soccer player, George Best, Nothing in football, it might be said, became him less than the leaving of it.

title: Iran in Olympic Soccer
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, June 3 (AP)Iran beat North Korea, 20 today and gained a place in the Olympic soccer tournament in Munich, Germany.

title: A Family Business: Hijacking, Bookmaking, Policy, Dice Games Loansharking and Special Contracts
description: IT is the second largest and mostpowerful of the Mafia families of New York, according to one veteran investigator. It is without doubt the most turbulent and strifetorn. For more than a decade now, it has compiled an unparalleled record of violence and gore; kidnapping of gang leaders; allout warfare with bodies dumped on the streets and in the sea; the public gunning down of its latest boss and his permanent incapacitation; and now again more warfare, more slayings, more contracts for more hits.

title: Travel Notes:
description: THIS year it's 10yearolds and next year it will be 8 year olds. Lower age qualifications are but one of the developments in a growing business that itself is less than a decade old: organized studytravel programs abroad for secondary and now elementary school students.

title: Cambodian Post Attacked
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sunday, June 4 (Reuters)North Vietnamese troops today launched a heavy ground attack on a Cambodian outpost close to a strategic supply line into South Vietnam's delta region, the military command reported.

title: Pele and Santos to Play Exhibition in Jersey City
description: PM and his Santos team of Brazil will play an exhibition soccer game at Roosevelt Stadium in Jersey City on June 25 against Catanzaro of Italy.

title: Damaged Memorial In Queens Restored
description: Victorious America, the war memorial that the Parks Department lacked funds to restore after it was damaged in an automobile accident in 1970, has been restored to its former location at Laurel Hill Boulevard and 65th Place in Winfield, Queens.

title: In Search Of Nixon
description: Every fourth year we become, for the span of a Presidential campaign, a nation of amateur psychologists. True, we reaffirm our loyalty to party (many of us) and our concern with issues (to some extent). But most of all we concentrate on the candidates themselves, the particular human specimens offered up for our inspection. One candidate shoots from the hip"; another weeps in public; another seems indecisive all this and much more is duly noted in our mental casebooks. Gradually we form our, judgment as to which man can best handle the burdens and stresses of what we like to call the toughest job in the world.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Smiths Jr. Have Child
description: A daughter was born on May 20 at the LyingIn Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Ramsaur Smith Jr. of Brooklyn Heights. The child has been named Ashley Chapin Smith.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: WILMINGTON, Del., June 3 Stanley Dancer won aboard Silent Majority at the Brandywine Raceway tonight after his triumph at Roosevelt Raceway in the Realization Race.

title: HIJACKED PLANE LANDS IN ALGIERS; 36 SET FREE HERE
description: A quickwitted hijacker and his woman Companion landed early last evening at Maison Blanch. Field in Algiers after in intercontinental flight that began 20 hours and 7,360 miles earlier in Seattle.

title: Little Richard and Lloyd Price Star in a Revival of '50's Rock
description: Rock revival shows are like corporeal versions of the latenight television ads for collections of pop recordings to capture instant nostalgia.

title: Tripping on Bicycles
description: This summer thousands of people are discovering the New Age of American Bicycling, urged on by Dr. Paul Dudley White and the antipollution people, encouraged by cycling friends, tempted by the potent charm of the bikes themselves. Seeing others easing uphill on their elegant 10speeds and nonchalantly coasting down may persuade the vacationer to rent a seaside bike, fix the flat in his rattly old Raleigh, or start lurking about the bike shops looking at price tags. A number of people are going to be sitting down with one of the new bike books, ready to drool over the prospect of a new mobility, new health, new sense of newness, new perplexities. Fifty dollars or 400? Three, 5, 10 or 15 speeds? Fancy, vulnerable sewup tires or Honest John wireons?

title: Net Championship Slated
description: The first individual tennis championships for high school girls in New York City will be held June 12 through 16 at Queensboro Community College. The girls swimming championships are scheduled for next Sunday at the Flushing Y.M.C.A. in Queens.

title: ... and Japan's Reaction
description: Since every nation has its fanatics and its madmen, the fact that the three mass murderers at Lydda were Japanese can be blamed neither on the Japanege people nor their government.

title: Ortiz Stops Ferratt in 3d
description: CHICAGO, June 3 (AP)Carlos Ortiz of New York, seeking another shot at the lightweight title he once held, knocked out Gerardo Ferratt of Mexicali, Mexico, in the third round of their scheduled 10round bout before a crowd of 5,000 in the International Amphitheater tonight.

title: Cosmos Lose First Game Of Season to Tornado, 1.0
description: DALLAS, June 3 (AP)The New York Cosmos lost their first North American Soccer League game tonight, 10, to the Dallas Tornado.

title: 29 Guilty in War Protest
description: LEBANON, N. H., June 3 (AP)  Twentynine persons were convicted yesterday on charges arising from a May 15 antiwar demonstration in which they sat down in front of a Selective Service bus. Each was fined $100.

title: Town's Move to Quit Held Peril to Monmouth Library System
description: NEPTUNE TOWNSHIPEmotions are rising here over an upcoming referendum on whether the township should pull out of the Monmouth County library system and set up en independent library.

title: Education
description: LONDONLondon's schoolchildren and teachers were enjoying the traditional midterm holiday last week, but the ,memory of the recent demonstrations for pupil power was in the air. For the protest strike that brought 2,500 youths into the streets two weeks ago marked a new stage in the children's rights movement in Britain.

title: Antidrug Prpiect Stirs Contention
description: PRINCETONA drugprevention program with 50 teenege members, a handful of youthful charismatic leaders and a set of rigid rules is the subject or eonsfitierable controversy these days among the adults in this articulate community.

title: Excerpts From Secret Army Inquiry Into Mass Killings of Vietnamese at Mylai
description: Following are excerpts from Chapter 12, Findings and Recommendations, of the summary volume of the official report of the Department of the Army review of the preliminary investigations into the Mylai incident:

title: U.S. Officer Charges Foe Killed Anloc Churchgoers
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Anie 3 (UPI)An American adviser who spent 53 days in Anloc said that North Vietnamese soldiers had massacred women and children a church service and bombarded a clearly marked hospital in the besieged city.

title: If You Go...
description: ... to Martinique and hope truly to experience it, try to read beforehand the books of two very different authors  the poet Lafcadio Hearn and the prophet Frantz Fanon. Hearn was a late19thcentury visitor whose Two Years in the French West Indies, first published in 1890, is a classic among descriptive travel books. There isn't a detail, not a single color, that Hearn failed to see. Fanon, a psychologist and revolutionary, was a 20thcentury inhabitant of Martinique. And much of what Hearn and Fanon saw and felt remains true today.

title: Matt Killed in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sunday, June 4 (Reuters)An unidentified man was shot dead in the street and 47 people injured in a bomb attack during a night of renewed violence here.

title: IN THE NATION
description: The fundamental redirection of the nation proposed by George McGovern in his Presidential campaign depends first on raising billions through tax reform and military reductions. So, in different fashion, does Mr. McGovern's most interesting and controversial proposala minimum income guarantee.

title: Cost of Cleanup
description: LOS ANGELESA prominent industrialist told a large Western college audience a few weeks ago: U.S. Department of Commerce figures show that 219 plants last year were forced to shut down primarily because of environmental pressures. His words, which were untrue, were part of a rising clamor that one Federal official remarked had been taking on the proportions of a national myth: the idea that current pollution abatement regulations are crippling substantial segments of American industry.

title: Bhutto Arrives in Ethiopia.
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, June 3 (Agence FrancePress)President Zulfikar All Bhutto of Pakistan arrived here today for an overnight visit and talks with Emperor Haile Selassie.

title: Berlin's Status Has Troubled EastWest Relations Since City Fell to Soviet at the End of World War 11
description: BERLIN, June 3When the fighting ended in Berlin on May 2, 1945, Soviet Armies found themselves in command of the prostrate city.

title: June Evening
description: June, brings some of the most pleasant evenings of the year, evenings when you can almost hear meadow grass growing, strawberries ripening, roses straining at the seams of their buds. Young maple leaves gleam the first starlight. Dogwood, now past its prime in daylight, still glows in surprising beauty against the deepening shadows of late dusk. Lilies of the valley sweeten the air when you pass the flower garden, and the fragrance of a newcut lawn has a special distillation of sunlight, dew and green growth, the very, essence of June.

title: Stars in Films and on TV, Delve Into Politics
description: SOUTH ORANGE  It could be asked  as indeed it has been asked often in New Jersey in the last few weeks: what does a screen star have in common with a television sportscaster?

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Mississippi Democratic Groups Battle in Court Over Delegates
description: JACKSON, Miss., June 2In an apparently unprecedented action, a faction of a state Derriocratic party is trying to persuade a Federal court to keep a rival faction's delegates from being seated at the Miami Beach national convention.

title: Evander Dinner June 21
description: Evander Childs High School's outstanding athletes, including the title winning swimming team and the undefeated football team of last fall, will be honored at a dinner at the Chateau Pelham, 3250 Westchester Avenue, The Bronx, on June 21. Alumni interested in attending are invited to write to Duke Marshall at the school.

title: News of Dogs
description: Dog show judges were charged with being too nice and not withholding ribbons, by Walter F. Goodman of Oyster Bay, Li., at the fifth annual symposium of the OwnerHandlers Association. The session was held in Garden City, L.I., after the recent 66th Ladies Kennel Association of America show at Hofstra University."Judges don't want to hurt an exhibitor's feelings, said Goodman, so frequently they give a ribbon when they shouldn't. In an ordinary class, this may be all right. However, when you come to winners dog or winners bitch, where points are involved, there may be the rare occasion when a ribbon should be withheld if the animal isn't of real quality.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Chess
description: Cuba's annual tournament in memory of the former world champion Jose Capablanca, usually played in Havana, was held this year in Cienfuegos, the island's third largest city. The change of site served to emphasize that this event, the ninth of the series, was less important than previous ones because of the players status, and the general standard of play was consequently lower.

title: Woman Loses for Governor
description: HOUSTON June 3Texans rejected the idea of a woman Governor today and voted the Democratic nomination for Governor of the State to Dolph Briscoe, a rancher; in the primary runoff.

title: Virginia Upsets Johns Hopkins, 1312, for N. C.A.A. Lacrosse Championship
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., June 3Pete Eldredge of Virginia scored the last of his'four goals with 4 minutes 21 seconds remaining today to give the Cavaliers a 1312 victory over Johns Hopkins in the final of the National Collegiate Athletic Association lacrosse championship.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, June 3Attacking marriage is the big new thing in publishing this year, and why not? The evil of marriage may be a timeworn theme but at least it beats the tiresome old generation gap. So far, however, most of the writers doing the attacking seen short on qualifications. Either they have never been married at all or, if they lave, their marriages have been brief and unhappy.

title: Georgia's Private Williamsbur
description: WASHINGTON, Ga.The bus lets you off a block from the town VV square. Across the street is a huge white 1804 Greek Revival plantation house with an encircling secondstory veranda. Eighteen Doric columns, each 22 feet high, surround the house, and an elaborate double stairway climbs up to the veranda level, framing a fullsize ground floor doorway underneath. Enormous old oaks shade the yard. On the grounds, among a grove of pecan trees, are several of the original work sheds belonging to the house. Beyond these, on a street lined with weeping willows, a row of tumbledown tarpaper former slave quarters disappears out of sight down the hill.

title: Miss Stecher Equals Mark
description: BERLIN, June 3 (UPI) Renate Stecher of East Germany equaled the women's world 100meter sprint record of 11.0 seconds today at a track and field meet in Potsdam; the East German press agency said. Miss Stecher jointly holds the mark with Wyomia Tyus of the United States and Tshi Tshenk of Nationalist China. Hans Joachim Rothenburg of East Germany set a European shotput record of 21.32 meters.

title: DRUGS TASK FORCE SEEKS AGENT POOL
description: A yearold interstate narcotics task force with two major drug raids to its credit is Seeking legislation to enable its members to exchange undercover agents.

title: Nancy Wickman Bride of Thomas R. Trowbridge 3d.
description: SHARON, Conn., June 3Miss Nancy Wickman and Thomas Rutherford Trowbridge 3d, both lawyers an New York, were married here this afternoon in Christ Episcopal Church. The Rev. Thomas Fletcher of St. Mark's Episcopal Church in New Britain, performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Frederick Stimson, rector of the church.

title: Son to Burt Solornons
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Burt Solomon on May 24 at the Klingenstein Pavilion of Mount Sinai Hospital. Mr: Solomon is publicity manager for Paramount Pictures Corporation. His wife is the former. Miss Susan Crane. The child has been named Jonathan Crane.

title: iHome Improvement
description: A PROBLEM that Is fairly common In most parts of the United States is the development of mildew or mold on many painted surfaces around the inside and outside of the house. Mildew is actually a fungus  microscopic living spores that are carried through the air and that feed on organic matter when conditions are right for their growth. They require moisture and some degree of warmth, and will propagate and spread at an astonishingly rapid rate after they land on the surface, eating into the paint film until they finally decompose and destroy it entirely (if unchecked the mildew will also attack the wood underneath, particularly if the environment is warm and humid).

title: Even Heyerdahl Must Have Wondered: What Am I Doing Here?
description: MIAMIThere was a time, deep out in the Pacific, when even Thor Heyerdahl knew a moment of terrible selfdoubt. Lying on his raft KonTikl, a thousand miles from help, he looked at the waves storming paat him as big as cathedrals and began to;:.think, What the hell am I doing here?

title: SALMON FISHING CURBED IN CANADA
description: OTTAWA, June 3Commercial salmon fishing in Canada's Atlantic waters became a thing of the past this weekat least for six years. Even sportsmen, including hundreds of Americans, will find their limit for catches of the prized Gaspe salmon drastically reduced.

title: 9 Killed at Iran Border
description: TEHERAN, June 3 (AP)Three Iranians and six Iraqis were killed and several wounded,in separate skirmishes yesterday, the official press agency reported from NaftiShah, on the.Iraqui border.

title: PENN CREW WINS NATIONAL CROWN
description: SYRACUSE, June 3When the Pennsylvania crew swamped on the Schuylkill River a month ago the oarsmen were a ludicrous sight as they sat in water up to their waists while Harvard and Navy rowed on in the Adams Cup race. The Penn athletes reaction was anger and their determination to prove something to somebody lasted right into the national intercollegiate championships today.

title: Miss Maura McManmon Is Married
description: BOSTON, June 3Miss Maura McManmon was married this afternoon to Joseph Jameson Collins in St. Ignatius Roman Catholic Church in Chestnut Hill. The Rev. John Joseph McManmon, cousin of the bride's father, performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: Travel Notes:
description: Construction contracts have been let for Worlds of Fun, a $20.5million, 140acre family recreation center seven miles from downtown Kansas City, Mo. Site preparation has been under way since last September. The park is scheduled to open in, the spring of 1973.
