title: PANEL CRITICIZES M'GOVERN SLATES
description: A state Democratic commission declared yesterday that slates of delegates to the national convention backing Senabor George McGovern had failed to comply fully with reform guidelines recommended by a national Democratic commission headed by the Senator himself.

title: Search Delays TWA Plane
description: ATHENS, June 3 (Reuters)A Trans World Airlines jumbo jet on a flight from Athens to Tel Aviv was delayed for more than. two hours tonight for a search for explosives, a company spokesman said. Nothing was found. The spokesman said it was a routine check for security reasons.

description: LOS ANGELES, June 3Senator George McGovern's campaign managers were concerned today that overconfidence might diminish their getoutthevote, campaign next Tuesday, while Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's advisers were glum because of adverse poll reports.

description: PARIS, June 3  Patrick Proisy upset Manuel Orantes of Spain today to become the first Frenchman to reach the final of the French championship since 1963.

description: NAPLBS, May 31 A Naples prosecutor brought formal charges this week against 77 persons, including executives of the Fiat Motor Corporation and police officers, accusing them of having conspired to operate an illegal intelligence network.

description: Although you certainly haven't found out about it from me, there is a lot more to Forest Hills than just Austin. Street. There is, for example; Metropolitan Avenue.

title: RED SOX BEATEN BY ROYALS, 10 TO 4
description: KANSAS CITY, June 3 (AP) John Mayberry's threerun double capped a sixrun Kansas City seventh inning and led the Royals to a 10.4 victory over the Boston Red Sox today.

title: KISSINGER TO VISIT TOKYO FOR 3 DAYS
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 3 The White House announced here today that Henry A. Kissinger the President's adviser for national security, will fly to Tokyo Friday for three days of discussions with Japan's government and business leaders.

title: PagelsSingleHandedVictor In Great South Bay Series
description: BLUE POINT, L. I., June 3A score that included three first places in a ninerace roupndrobin series enabled William Pagels of the Wet Pants Association to capture the Great South Bay Yacht Racing Association's men's singlehanded championship today. Pagels had a triumph in the final race in which the runnerup, David Towle of the Shinnecock Yacht Club, fell to ninth place. The final standigs:

title: Music; Happiness? It's Verdi
description: CONTRARY to Commonly Held Belief, 90 Per Cent of Americans Are Happy! A shocking headline, that one, screaming out its news of mass contentment from Page One of a sensational tabloid weekly. But it has the ring of truth. Man, for all his protesting and angry talk, is a deeply conservative beast. The headline above could, with a little alteration, apply to New York operagoers, for instance. For them, happiness is total immersion in the warm bath of the familiar: three solid weeks of the most popular works of Verdi. The Metropolitan Opera's Verdi Festival, which opens tomorrow night with Otello and runs through June 24, is already reported to be a financial success, and for the same reasons that an allBeethoven program usually Is. People know what they want and want what they know. So, a tip of the hat to the Met box office.

title: Boys Chorus Is Sprouting
description: NEWARK  It is a tradition at the Newark Boys Chorus School to clap for visitors. Both the tradition and the school are new, but in several short years, the world is beginning to clap Rack,

title: JOHN S. WILSON'S
description: HOLMDEL  Not content with one gala opening, the Garden State Arts Center is going to begin its fifth season of summer events on three separate occasions.

title: Karate Olympics On Today
description: The Karate Olympics, with 300 entries, will be held today, starting at 10 A.M., at the Union (N. 3.) Boys Club.

title: Art
description: THE National Gallery of Canada in Ottawa is housed just now, and has been since 1960, In an eightstory blocklike structure that has exactly the air of an office building outside and of a converted office building inside, which is not surprising after you learn that a converted office building is exactly what it is. My first visit to these curious quarters last week to see some fine old favorites, some admirable recent acquisitions, and a special exhibition of medieval art, was not quite a success.

title: Television
description: THE Emmy Awards. That memorable evening has ripened slowly in the mind, like a piece of cheese left on a warm shelf until it can't be ignored any longer. And, in fact, there are worse images for Emmyland, a region full of holes, moldy corners and the odor of stale, pale yesterdays.

title: HEALTH SPENDING OF U.S. FOUND UP
description: WASHINGTON, June 3Despite Nixon administration attempts to cut Federal outlays for health programs, the Government's expenditures rose 22 per cent in the last fiscal year, according to an American Medical Association study.

title: Rightists Call Nixon Dupe of Leftist Plot
Sara Briggs Has Nuptials
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., June 3 Miss Sara Aldrich Briggs was married here this afternoon to Kirkland Hopkins Gibson. The Rev. Keith A. Brown of the First Presbyterian Church of Bethlehem, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. John D. Briggs.

title: Mrs. Felstiner Wed
description: Mrs. Nata Purvin Felstiner, widow of William Felstiner, a lawyer here, was married yesterday afternoon to Emanuel Robison of Mount Vernon, a widower and retired plastics manufacturer. Family Court Judge Louis Otten performned the ceremony at the bride's home.

title: Travel Notes:
description: July is Independence month, with the United States, France and most Latin American countries staging celebrations recalling their struggles for liberty. In the U.S., of course, it's July 4, on a Tuesday this year (one of the few exceptions in the Monday holiday legislation). In France it's Bastille Day, July 14, and in Central and South America it'sJuly 24 in honor of Simon Bolivar, the liberator.

title: Yale Professor Honored
description: CHICAGO, June 3 (AP)Harold D. Lasswell, professor emeritus of the Yale Law School, received the University of Chicago's Alumni Medal today at the alumni association awjrds luncheon.

title: Contemplating the National Navel
description: We may muddle through. There is no way of knowing now whether we will look back on this as a time when we went on one of our periodic binges of national selfabsorption, or whether it will be seen as a turning point in our history. Our political dialogue and literature would indicate that this is indeed an Important Moment. In part, this is a decennial rite, marking our passage from one decade to the next. At the end of the 1950's, many of us bought the idea that we had come to the end of ideology"; there were earnest commission studies of our national goals. The more dire the diagnosis now, the more we seem to like it; we have a galloping case of hairshirtitis.

title: Stephanie Hill Has Nuptials
description: Miss Stephanie Diane Hill and Milton Arthur Galamison Jr. were married here yesterday afternoon in the Riverside Church, where his father, minister of. the Siloam Presbyterian Church in Brooklyn, performed the ceremony.

title: Session on Environment Will Be Historic, Waldheim Tells 8,500 at Fordham
description: The Secretary General of the United Nations told 8,500 people at the Fordham University commencement yesterday that the impending Stockholm meeting on the environment would be a historic conference.

title: Travel Notes:
description: Are Olympic tickets and accommodations still available? Yes, from at least one source. Scholastic Magazines, Inc., reports it has a number of spaces on its Summer Olympic Tour, departing Los Angeles, Chicago and New York on Aug. 21 andreturning Sept. 11. The tour includes transportation (on Trans World Airlines), twinbedded accommodations, daily breakfasts and transfers to and from airports, hotels and the Olympic Gamesplus 11 tickets to Olympic events, eight of them track and field. Tickets to the opening and closing. ceremonies are available and may be purchased separately. In addition, sightseeing trips in and outside Germany, can be arranged. Prices are $895 from New York, $925 from Chicago and $950 from Los Angeles. For information write: Scholastic Magazines Olympic Tour, 50 West 44th Street, New York, N. Y. 10036 or call collect (212) 8677700.

title: Queen Leads Memorial for Windsor
description: LONDON, June 3 (UPI)Britain's, royal family sought to comfort the ailing Duchess, of Windsor in their Buckingham Palace home today as thousands of Britons paid their last respects to the King who gave up his throne to marry her 35 years ago today.

title: The World
description: The Moscow summit has been all work and no play for Henry Kissinger, the reputed swinger of the Nixon Administration. Night after night the President's nationalsecurity adviser conferred with his Soviet counterparts on details of the nuclear arms treaty. But when the Nixon party moved to its next stop, things eased up. In the small hours of last Wednesday Mr. Kissinger, sitting on cushions in the ballroom of a Teheran hotel, beamed on a shapely ravenhaired belly dancer, Nadina Parsa, doing her belly dance. After press photographers were hustled off by Iranian police, Nadina plopped. into Mr. Kissinger's lap. What, reporters wanted to know afterwards, had they talked about? Miss Parsa, he replied, was a delightful girl very interested in foreign policy.... I spent some time explaining how you convert SS7 missiles to Yclass submarines.

title: Public Reconstruction Is Helping the South Bronx to Lose Its Image as a Slum
description: New public schools on concrete stilts straddle railroad tracks, ready to admit children in September. The steel skeleton of a new Lincoln Hospital towers over blocks of debris. Elderly men and women beam as they arrange for apartments In a gardenstyle housing project. Fresh paint and window sills glisten where old buildings are being, rehabilitated.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Fourteen members of an antiCastro group handcuffed themselves yesterday to iron railings inside the pedestal, main body and crown of the Statue of Liberty part of a demonstration protesting the treatment of political prisoners in Cuba. The statue remained open to visitors as officials of the National Park Service attempted to reason with the demonstrators.

description: It Is Saturday morning. What to do with the children today?

title: Lindsay to Join Tribute To Atoms Track Club
description: The Atoms Track Club of Brooklyn will be honored by the Madison Square Garden Corporation Tuesday night at a dinner in Felt Forum. Under. the leadership of Fred Thompson, their coach, the Atoms have developed many of America's outstanding women track stars and potential Olympic competitors.

title: 3 Added to Debate By Senators Today On TV From Coast
Killer to Get Electric Chair
description: BOSTON, June 3 (UPI)A 21yearold Boston man has been sentenced to die after being convicted for the murder of James W. Christian, 30, outside a Mission Hill housing project. The man, Lawyer Johnson, was sentenced yesterday to die in the electric chair.

title: The Ratings Are Wrong
description: AS ONE of those people who originally thought that the motion picture industry's film rating system, which was put into effect Nov. 1, 1968, would be a vast improvement over the old Production Code, I must admit that I was wrong. Not that the old code, which took such a dim view of lustful kissing and words like nuts and bastard, was doing much good at the time it was abandoned. It wasn't, but at least there was something positive and honest in the hypocrisy with which it was not observed. Today the situation seems more chaotically hypocritical than ever.

title: Lawyer Weds Mrs. Mary Stanton
description: SOUTH DARTMOUTH, Mass., June 3Mrs. Mary Francis Stanton, widow of Otis. Cook Stanton, was married at her home here today to Thomas Campbell PlowdenWardlaw, a widower, of Loudonville, N. Y., and New York. The Rev. Nehemiah Boynton 3d of the Congregational Church here performed the ceremony at noon. He was assisted by the Right Rev. E. Brooke Moseley, president of the Union Theological Seminary and former Episcopal Bishop of Delaware.

title: PROMENADE GETS FANCY REPERTORY
description: The New York Philharmonic Promenade Fantastique concert performed at Philharmonic Hall on Friday night showed how fancifully Andre Kostelanetz skips around through the symphonic repertory when devising a program to fit title.

title: Bridge
description: DECLARERS should usually heed the admonition of the English Book of Common Prayer: Put not your trust in princes, nor in any child of man: for there is no help in them. The second part is subject to exceptions, for help may be forthcoming from an ordinary opponent. But if the defender is a prince of the game, as East was on the diagramed deal played recently in New York, and he seems to be helping, it is best to assume that he is not.

title: Race Track Puts On A DoItYourself Day
description: CHARLESTOWN, W. Va., June 3 (AP)Racing fans financed their own payoffs at the Charles Town Turf Club today, chipping in $85,000 that enabled the track to cash winning muttiel tickets.The emergency donation became necessary because the bank, containing the track's $206,000 operating fund, was set to open two hours after the scheduled 2 P.M. post time. It took about 20 minutes to round up the $85,000 from track patrons, each of whom was reimbursed when the mutuel fund was delivered. One fan contributed $10,000.

title: Show Time in Maplewood
description: MAPLEWOOD  For nine days beginning Friday, Maplewood will become a stage and many of Its citizens players for a cultural celebration.

I., June 3 Miss Alison Grace Byers, daughter of Mrs. Augustus Gibson Paine of Old Westbury and the late John Frederick Byers Jr. of Sewickley, Pa., was married here this afternoon to Marshall Lawrence Norton, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nathaniel R. Norton Jr. of Bedford Hills, N. Y.

description: Weary but relieved, three dozen Western Airlines passengers filed off their hijacked airliner at Kennedy International Airport early yesterday and headed for a welcome breakfast.

title: Medicine
description: Nothing in the American rediscovery of China has excited the popular imagination more than acupuncture anesthesia. Visitors tales and pictures of patients undergoing major surgery while fully conscious have astonished laymen and physicians both. Last week it was learned that some American physicians are beginning to duplicate the Chinese results.

title: For These Women, Marriage Is Enough
description: CHICAGOMrs. John E. Swearingen rented a commercial vacuum cleaner the other day and gave her housesized apartment a thorough cleaning. When she was finished with the oriental and tigerskin and broadloom rugs, she began dusting. Her emerald ring glittered as the cloth whisked over French furniture, English furniture, a 12panel Chinese screen, modern sculpture and scores of photographs taken with the world's beautiful and notable people.

title: Harry N. Brandt Is Dead at 75; Head of a Movie Theater Chain
description: MIAMI, June 3Harry N. Brandt, president of the Brandt Theater chain and a movie industry pioneer, died here tonight at St. Francis Hospital. He was 75 years old.

description: There are tides in the affairs of men that ebb and flow and sometimes appear to acquire a momentum of their own.

title: The World
description: BUJUMBURA, BurundiJust before Christmas of 1968, Ntare V, the 19yearold Mwame, or King, of Burundi, paid a visit to the neighboring country of the Bongo, or Zaire, as it now calls itself. (See map.) He left behind a ceremonial drum, a symbol of his power. During the King's absence, the commander of the Burundi army, Capt. Michel Micombero, drove up to the royal palace, seized the drum, went to the state radio, station and proclaimed himself, President.

title: The Good Word
description: Somebody had to pay for the Polish jokes and the Agnew watches, and it might as well be the White AngloSaxon Protestants. Not necessarily because they started them (as we shall see, there is some question whether Wasps ever have any fun at all) but because it is their turn to pay for something. Also, Wasps are the only group in the U. S. guaranteed not to fight back, being either too arrogant to notice or too sick with guilt to defend themselves, and in either case, quite extinct, poor chaps.

June 3The First Congregational Church wag the setting this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Susan Avalon Bosworth to John Wood Brooks Jr., son of Mr. Brooks, chairman, president and chief executive officer of the Celanese Corporation, and Mrs. Brooks of Bedford Hills, N.Y.

Paul Getty Museum of Malibu, Calif., arranged to buy Titian's The Death of Actaeon, the export of the masterpiece has been virtually thwarted by the British Government, the National (Gallery and hundreds of schoolchildren, businessmen and art lovers.

He has argued that great powers can balance their mutual interests on a planetary scale, transcending local or ideological differences. In Moscow as in Peking President Nixon boldly followed that approach.

Glenn Beall, mid seven others were chosen me statewide delegates by the Republican state central commit. tee here yesterday.

title: Scholarly Activist Angela Yvonne Davis
description: To sonic, Angela Davis's rather bookish upbringing seems an improbable background for the fierce revolutionary cause she espouses. Notoriety, people point out, was something thrust upon her in 1970, when she was dismissed from her post on the faculty at the University of California, Los Angeles. But to Miss Davis, her radical beliefs are a natural outgrowth of her pastfor the most part, one of scholarly pursuits and the evolution of an ideology that animated her later activism.

title: Screen: 'Day in the Death of Joe Egg':Story of Spastic Child and Her Parents
description: Some experiences are so special that it's impossible to imagine how one might react to them until they come to pass: being in an air raid, winning a million-dollar lottery, losing one's sight or one's pants.Death, the commonest mystery and usually inevitable, is like that. So too is the experience shared by Bri and Sheila in "A Day in the Death of Joe Egg," Peter Medak's English film adapted by Peter Nichols from his play which ran on Broadway four years ago.Bri (Alan Bates), short for Brian, is a teacher in a boys school in Bristol, a man who embraces failure and loss with humor that is the wit's end of despair. His wife, Sheila (Janet Suzman), is the sort of woman who, as she says, tries to make life work, as if it were a troublesome washing machine that won't go unless it's at a tilt. Largely because of Sheila, their house is stuffed with second-order lifegoldfish, birds, plants, two cats named Sidney and Beatrice Webb, one of whom, Beatrice, acts as host to a colony of errant fleas.More importantly, Bri and Sheila are the parents of a 10-year-old daughter, Joe, variously referred to as "a living parsnip," "a wegetable," "no trouble at all," "crackpot" and "my blossom."Joe is a spastic whose brain is so damaged that she is incompletely helpless, a lump of life whose eyes float in their sockets like the twin bubbles in a carpenter's level. She is unable to talk or move, or do anything except lay about, slumped over in a wheelchair."A Day in the Death of Joe Egg," which opened yesterday at the 68th Street Playhouse, is a difficult movie to describe properly. It is beautifully acted, funny, moving, but infinitely depressing.The play was presented as a kind of domestic, one-set, cabaret theater, with a jazz combo at the side of the stage to accompany Bri and Sheila in their direct confidences to the audience, in their song-and-dance turns, and in their burlesqued reminiscences of life with Joe, with the idiot doctors who attended her, and with one C of E vicar, imitated by Bri, who tried to sell them a laying-on-of-hands ceremony.Although Mr. Nichols has not changed the play's text much except to add several subsidiary characters and scenes that take the film outside the house into Bristol and to the seashores, "A Day in the Death of Joe Egg" is now completely naturalistic.The only distance left in it is anything but Brechtian. lt is the distance that Bri and Sheila take as they stand apart from themselves, apart from their wounded egos, as they play little games in which they give Joe the imaginary identity of a bright, fractious child, and through Joe, alternately rail at and caress each other.One immediate and major effect of this naturalism is to transform the film into a love story, but one that doesn't quite fit the shape of the plot that Mr. Nichols has devised, which is that of the dissolution of a marriage.I suspect that "Joe Egg" has always been first and foremost a love story, though it was difficult to recognize on stage through the cabaret turns that gave it a kind of epic form. Remove those vauderville bits and you have the profoundly felt experience that Mr. Nicholas has taken from his own life but changed in significant ways.The first child of the playwright and his wife was a spastic daughter, described by Mr. Nichols when interviewed here tour years ago as "a meaningless accident.""We used to make up fantasies about the child, but we are not the parents in the play," he said. "We put our child in a home, which, of course, is what the parents in the play should have done." Instead of despairing, the Nicholses had two more children, both normal.In projecting his story into fiction, Mr. Nichols succeeds in making us believe in the love between the parents so completely that it's impossible to believe that their life together is collapsing, as the play wants us to, which may be why the film seems more depressing than it need be."A Day in the Death of Joe Egg" is worrisome indeed, difficult to recommend, since it isn't grand enough to go much beyond its special experience, but easy to admire in isolated instancesBates's rages at God ("a manic-depressive rugby footballer"), his imitation of the swinging churchman (met on a banthe-bomb march) singing "Animal Crackers in My Soup," Miss Suzman's beautiful soliloquy about the day Joe knocked down some toy blocks, all of the supporting performances, especially Joan Hickson's as Bri's purposefully dim, self-centered mother, a woman who can be counted upon to say of sleep: "Two hours before midnight are worth two after, I always say."

title: Bloodbath in Burundi
description: With some reason, leaders of the new Africa resent the emphasis outsiders give to tribalism among the problems of nationbuilding on that continent. They cite CatholicProtestant feuding in Ulster, perennial trouble between Walloon and Fleming in Belgium and American racial hostilities to show that problems arising from ethnic differences are not peculiar to Africa.

title: Letter From an Israeli
description: To my neighbor in Egypt: In the absence of lines of communications between your country and mine and of any means of dialogue between our two Governments may I be permitted to convey to you, by this medium some thoughts and reflections on the destiny and the future of the relations between Egypt and Israel.

description: NIVELLES, Belgium, June 4 (UPI)Favored Emerson Fittipaldi of Brazil lengthened his lead in the world driver's championships when be won the 30th Grand Prix of Belgium today by leading virtually from start to finish.

description: TOKYO; June 4  Yasuo Okamoto, the 62yearold father of Kozo Okamoto, who participated with two other Japanese in, last week's massacre at the Tel Aviv airport, said today he had sent a letter to the Israeli Embassy here asking that his son be executed.

title: WIT AND GRACE CAP 5HOUR DANCE EVENT

description: STOCKHOLM, June 4 (AP)Kjell Isaksson of Sweden, who holds the recognized world polevault record of 18 feet 2 inches and who leaped 184 with Bob Seagren at El Paso, Tex., in May, said today he had canceled his proposed United States tour, which would have included competitions at Los Angeles Friday and San Francisco Saturday.

description: LOS ANGELES, June 4 Using a shot two ounces too heavy, George Woods became the third man in track and field history to break the 70foot barrier today.

description: LUTHERVILLE, Md., June 4 (AP)Carol Mann, playing before nearly 8,000 fails from her home, city, tied the Pine Ridge course record with a sixunderpar 67 today and won the Lady. Carling open by two strokes. She finished with a nineunderpar 54hole score of 210.

title: AMERICAN LEAGUE
description: Oakland at BaltimoreThe A's kept their lead in the Western Division in winning two games by 20 scores. Jim Hunter pitched a twohitter for his 100th major league triumph in the opener as Sal Bando secured the victory with a tworun homer in the first off Mike Cuellar. In the second game, the A's again picked up their runs in the first. Dave Hamilton, Roland Fingers and Darold Knowles gave Baltimore eight hits.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The progression of thought in your very interesting May 26 editorial Church and State flows with irresistible logic up to a point. But at that point, I am afraid, the logic breaks down and rhetoric takes its place.

Joseph T. Cahill the school's president and principal speaker at its 102d commencement exercises, strive for mutual respect to heal the sternest problem they facethe great division between people because of poor communication,

Two holdings obtained as dividends from I.O.S.22 per cent of International Bancorp and 38 per cent of Value Capitalwere sold to Global Financial, Ltd., for $7.35million of fiveyear notes.

title: FOOD TALK
description: Some youngsters say it's because they're against killing; others cite ecological reasons and a few point to religion. But whatever the reasons, clearly more young people are turning to vegetarianism. One of them Catherine Urbain, a sophomore at Sleepy Hollow High School in North Tarrytown, N. Y. She switched to vegetarianism a year ago after attending a convention of a group associated with the Unitarian Church. At the convention, only vegetarian meals were served, and now she says, I just don't like the taste of meat.

description: PITTSBURGH, June 4Dr. J. Cutler Andrews, chairman of the history department at Chatham College, died Friday in MageeWomen's Hospital. He was 63 years old.

description: To the Editor: Congratulations on your editorial Nuisance in Technicolor. The only way to stop this defacement of public property is to post signs in a conspicuous place in the subway cars that each offense is punishable by a fine of $500 and that onehalf of the fine collected will be awarded to the person reporting the defacement.

A committee headed by Marshal Dawee Chullasapya, director for communications and development, will negotiate a contract with Northnip Airport Development Corporation, an American company.

description: WASHINGTON, June 4The Army's official secret report on the Mylai massacre has revealed that a second massacre, involving the killing of as many as 90 civilians, did in fact take place less than two miles from the hamlet of Mylai 4 on the same morning March 16, 1968.

description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, IMonday, June 5  North Vietnamese troops attacked a district capital in populous Binhdinh Province on the central coast yesterday, according to Deports from the field.

title: BHUTTO FOLLOWS A CAPITALIST PATH
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, June 3The Government of President Zulfikar, Ali Bhutto, which came to power in December with a credo of Socialism is our economy, is slowly but steadily leading Pakistan down the familiar capitalist road.

description: YONKERS, June 4The Department of Development here plans to submit an application tomorrow for an $11.4million urban renewal project to upgrade four areas and keep the Otis Elevator Company, the largest local Industry, from leaving.

description: WASHINGTON, June 4Enforcement of wage and price controls, spotty in the early months of Phase Two, is gradually being tightened, according to Government officials in charge of the economic stabilization program.

description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, June 4 (AP)  Howard Hughes has been granted a oneyear extension of his Canadian visitor's permit, officials here said today.

Nevada Ransom Sought

description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (AP) An Air Force Thunderbirdjet pilot was killed today during a precision flying exhibition, at Transpo 72 after parachuting from his plane just before it crashed and exploded.

title: SANDERS POSTS 68, WINS KEMPER GOLF BY STROKE AT 275
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., June 4 Dapper Doug Sanders, with the short back swing, the wide stance and a penchant for socializing, returned to the winning column today with a birdie putt that clinched the Kemper open tourney. The 30footer from off the green at the 18th hole of the Quail Hollow Country Club gave the 38yearold professional a fourunderpar 68 for a 275 total and earned $35,000 of the $175,000 purse.

title: Environment Conference Will Offer Some Sideshows
description: STOCKHOLM, June 4  The United Nations environmental conference, which begins tomorrow, is the main event here but it is only part of the story. ;t,has stimulated environmentalists and other activist groups, here and abroad, to organize complementary conferences, alternative conferences, exhibitions, teachins and assorted happenings and demonstrations.

title: Artful Italians Building Bridges to Longer Holidays
description: ROME, June 4  Italy ended a fourday vacation today with a nearly nationwide traffic jam.

title: TV Format Limits Country Musicians At 2d Garden Fete
description: The second annual pilgrimage of Nashville's country music set to Madison Square Orden, Nashville at the Garden, turned out to be primarily a TV production this year. The performance Saturday night at the Garden, which involved Lynn Anderson, Sonny James, Jim Ed Brown, Loretta Lynn, Conway Twitty and Jack Greene and Jeannie Seely, teas controlled by the requirements of TV cameraswhich resulted in long waits between each act, faked applause and bright lighting that gave the affair the quality of a circus rather than concert.

title: Lindenhurst Man Is Held In Knifing and Sex Attack
description: WEST ISLIP, L. I., June 4 (UPI)A 20yearold man was arrested today on charges of attacking a woman in the parking lot of a Lindenhurst, L. I., bar Friday night.

title: McGovern Gains 41 Votes In Elections of Five States
Missile Freeze
description: Early approval of President Nixon's historic, if limited, agreements with the Soviet Union for freezing nuclear missile deployment is the most urgent foreignpolicy business before the Congress. But care must be taken not to pay a price to opponents of arms control that will undermine prospects for future progress in this vital area.

title: Has Levitz Furniture Lost Its Glamour on Wall Street?; Concern's New Offerings Apparently Lack Support
description: About five years agoat the height of the 19671968 bull marketthe business of two obscure brothers from Pottstown, Pa., began to click. They had been struggling for over 35 years in the furniture business, and like everybody else in it, found it a tough go. It was an industry that was widely known as suffering from a lack of new ideas.

title: 52,216 See Braves Rout Mets, Matlack Here, 93
description: New York's largest baseball crowd of the season, 52,216 at Shea Stadium yesterday, didn't get too much to cheer about as the Mets lost to the Atlanta Braves, 93.

title: L. I. Woman Dies in Fire
description: HICKSVILLE, L. I., Tune 4 (UPI)A woman. was killed early today by a fire in her twostory home here, the Nassau County police aald. Mrs. Marian Frankel, 56 years old, died from burns she suffered in the fire. Mrs. Frankel's dog was also killed in the fire. The police said Mrs. Frankel's daughter, who lived with her mother, was not at home.

title: Hanoi Reports MineLaying
description: HONG KONG, Monday June 5 (Reuters)North Vietnam said today that the United States had dropped more mines in North Vietnamese harbors,

title: Tennis Title to Miss Gengier
description: WOODBURY, L. I., June 4Marjorie Gengler of Locust Valley, L. I. defeated topseeded Louise I., of River Edge, N. J., 36, 63, 63, in the final of the Eastern women's hard court tennis championship today at the Woodbury Country Club.

title: Diana Gorenstein Is Bride in Jersey
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., June 4. miss Diana Gorenstein and Joel M. Cherlow were married here this afternoon in Temple Beth El by Rabbi Moshe Samber.

title: Blast Rips S. I. Garage
description: An automobilerepair garage at 417 Seaside Boulevard in the South Beach section of Staten Island was damaged last night by what the police said was an explosive device placed outside the building. The blast tore hole four feet square in the wall.

title: The Separatist Threat
description: The rejection by Roy Wilkins, executive director the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, of the black separatist positions taken by the National Black Convention represents a courageous and constructive reaffirmation of an, integrated America as the only rational goal.

title: Paris: Silence and Solitude Rise Anew
description: PARISReferring to the scandal about cubism in the Salon d'Automne of 1912, the Socialist Deputy Marcel Sembat advised Don't call the police.

title: Police Brutaiity inquiry Set
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., June 5 (UPI)The United States Civil Rights Commission said today that hearings would begin Thursday in Santa Fe into charges of police brutality against minority groups in the state.

title: Hard to Beat Captures French Derby
description: CHANTILLY, France, June 4 The 90yearold Japanese textile magnate, Junzo Kashiyama, knight himself a thoroughbred last week for $1million, and today the colt, Hard to Beat, picked up $251,000 in winning the 131st running of, the Prix du JockeyClub.

title: Crime 100 Years Ago
description: Probably in no city in the civilized world is life so fearfully insecure, wrote one Englishwoman about New York in the eighteenfifties Terrible outrages and murderous assaults are matters of such nightly occurrence as to be thought hardly worthy of notice.".

title: Sadat Is the Common Foe in 13th District Race
Bangladesh Is Building a Viable Economy Out of War's Ruins
A Cruising Gunman Kills 1 And Injures 5 in Elizabeth
description: ELIZABETH N. J., June 4A man cruising through a 15squareblock area of this city shot a 17yearold youth to death and wounded five other personstwo of them critically early this morning.

title: You'll Never See It Again
description: MIAMI, June 4 (UPI)The authorities in Honduras and Miami were trying today to find out what became of $303,000 hijacking ransom, although the man accused of taking the money a month ago has said, You'll never see it again.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: If Roberto of 103d and James of 138th had prospects of someday being asked to write for Tho Timesor even to read itthey surely would not emblazon their names so conspicuously on walls where they are bound to shatter cultivated sensibilities. As things stand, however, the colorful names and blobs are not at all pointless, nor is the paint spray can at the toot of the current insanity, as you so smugly put it (editorial Nuisance in Technicolor, May 26).

title: Nestle Begins Operation Of Flexible Work Day
description: The Nestle Company, Inc., today is inaugurating a flexible working hours system at its White Plains headquarters that allows the 670 employes working there to arrive any time between 8 A.M. and 10 A.M.

title: ExDrug Abusers Are Plagued by Job Problems
Balancing of Cycles That Support Life Is Issue for Parley
description: STOCKHOLM, June 4 The winds and ocean currents recognize no national boundaries and the inhabitants of the earth are woven into a fragile web of interdependence.

title: The C.A.B.'s Paradoxical Stance
description: A lawyer for Donaldson International Airways, a British airline accused by the United States, of operating fraudulent charter flights to Europe, claimed to be puzzled last week by the Civil Aeronautics Board. Shortly after a Federal court ruling that, the line contended, had all but grounded its operations in this country, the lawyer said: The C.A.B. says it's trying to liberalize charter rules so more people can fly at cheap rates and then it tries to stop our charter flights.

title: Bodies of Puerto Ricans Slain in Raid Flown Home After Tel Aviv Ceremony
description: TEL AVIV, June 4The Puerto Rican survivors watched in silence, their faces taut. The wife of the Japanese Ambassador put her handkerchief to her eyes over and over again. Israeli policemen, snapped to stiff salute before each of the aluminum coffins.

title: Dr. Knowles Is Facing Censure Over His Allegations on Medical Profits and Surgery
description: Massachusetts Medical Society officials, in a move made rarely during the organization's 101year history, are expected this week to censure Dr. John H. Knowles, who is due to become president of the Rockefeller Foundation here. July 1.

title: Minter Triumphs
description: LEXINGTON, Ohio, June 4 (AP)Milt Minter captured the $4000 midOhio TransAmerican. auto race today, leading all the way in a Pontiac Firebird.

title: JOSEPH CALLO, 73, CIVIC LEADER, DIES
description: Joseph F Cello a Bronx civic leader and chairman of Cello & Carroll Inc., an advertising and public relations firm died yesterday in St. Barnabas HoSpital. He was 73 years old and lived at 2300 Gunther Avenue, the Bronx..

title: White Sox Sweep Yanks Before 51,9041
description: CHICAGO, June 4  After Chicago defeated the Yankees, 61, on Tom Bradlye's sixhitter in the first game of today's doubleheader, Manager Chuck Tanner decided to keep Dick Allen, the White Sox star, on the bench for the second game.

title: 11 Pakistani Inmates Die As Police Fire in Jail Riot
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, June Eleven prisoners were killed and 35 injured today as the police and prison guards fired on rioting inmates of the jail at Sukkur, about 400 miles north of Karachi.

title: Angela Davis Acquitted on All Charges
Authors Take a Look at Growth Stocks
description: QUESTION: Some people believe that growth stocks now are selling at excessive priceearnings ratios. Mr. Furth, what is your view?

title: Car Bearing 2 Colombo Sons Hit By Spray of Bullets in Bay Ridge
description: A spray of bullets hit a white Cadillac carrying two sons of Joseph A. Colombo Sr., the reputed Mafia leader, as the car pulled up to the elder Colombo's home in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, early this morning, the police reported.

title: Rain Dampens Fiestas in 3 Languages
description: New York took its publicity as a summer festival quite literally yesterday before a cloudburst soon after 6 P.M. dampened festivities in several languages.

title: The McGovern Income Program
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  In their debate in California over the post, of a radiCal new incomesupplement plan for all Americans, both Senator George McGovern of South Dakota and Senator Hubert H. Huinphrey of Minnesota are using figures that neither their staffs nor political and tax experts here have been able to support. Senator McGovern is using many more unsupported figures than Senator Humphrey. But this is at least partly because he simply uses more figures. The income supplement plan is his, after all, and he has offered details, about how, it would be financed.

title: IMPORTS OF STEEL DECLINED IN APRIL
description: PITTSBURGH, June4April imports of steel were the lowest in two years. The April intake of less than 930,000 tons was down 15 per cent from 1.09 million tons in March and was off more than 31 per cent from 1.36 million tons, in. April of

title: Anne Barone Is Bride
description: ROSLYN HARBOR, L. I., June 4The marriage of Miss Anne Marie Barone, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stephen S. Barone of Old Brookville and Point Lookout, to William Vincent Tronolone took place here this afternoon in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church. The Rev. R. Michael Reid performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass. The bride's father is staff vice president, international licensing, of the RCA Corporation in New York. Mr. Tronolone is a son of Mrs. Michael Settanni of Plainview and the late Edward M. Tronolone, who was a supervisor on the lunar module (LEM) project at the Fairchild Camera and Instrument Company in Syosset.

title: Pennsylvania Panel Urges Free Choice on Abortions
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., June 4 (AP)Abortions should be a decision between women and their doctors up to the 18th week of pregnancy, the preliminary report of a Governor's study commission contends.

title: A.B.A WILL SHIFT TWO FRANCHISES
description: Faced with the threat of potentially bankrupt franchises in Pittsburgh and Miami, the American Baseball Association yesterday annnounced that it would seek new locations for those troubled clubs in major cities and major television markets to stabilize the league.

title: HIJACKERS TRACED TO SAN DIEGO AREA
description: SAN DIEGO, June 4The Federal Bureau of Investigation placed a guard today on an apartment in suburban Linda Vista, belieVed to have been occupied for two weeks by the young couple who were involv,ed In the hijacking of a Western Airlines plane from San Francisco to Algiers.

title: ORCHESTRA PLAYS OFFICIAL DEBUT
description: Somebody should really think up a handier title than the New York City Housing Authority Symphony Orchestra, but meanwhile the 48player ensemble made its official debut yesterday afternoon at the New School Auditorium on West 12th Street.

title: DEMOCRATS FIRM ON PRISQNER ISSIJE IN COAST DEBATE
description: LOS ANGELES, June 4Senator Hubert H. Humphrey and Senator George McGovern held fast tonight to their sharply different positions on handling the prisoner of war issue in the closeout of American involvement in Vietnam.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your editorial of May 23 strongly implies that policies of Mayor Lindsay are responsible for the steep rise in the number of welfare cases in New York City in recent years. If you had made a more thorough examination of available data, you would have found that your assumptions and conclusions are both mistaken.

title: DR. JOSEPH MORTON, ENDOCRINOLOGIST, 66
description: Dr. Joseph H. Morton, a retired physician and endocrinologist, died Friday of a brain tumor in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived at 2 East 86th Street.

title: Paul Matson Marries Miss Kathy Kirshner
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., June 4Miss Kathy Bailey Kirshner and Paul Matson were married here at noon today. Rabbi Jacob Rudin performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Herbert J. Kirshner. The bridegroom is the son of Mrs. Michael Matson of Miami and the late Dr. Matson, an oral surgeon.

title: Personal Finance
description: There are few hiding places left for people who want to keep their finances secret from the Internal Revenue Service.

title: 31 Vancouver Police Hurt At Rolling Stones Concert
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, June 4 (Reuters)Thirtyone policemen were injured last night as they battled a crowd of 22,000 rockthrowing and firebombthrowing youths unable to get into concert by the Rolling Stones.

title: Hiring Gains Found For. Disadvantaged In Industry Survey
description: Public and private concern with job prospeas for the socalled disadvantaged in the years 1968 through the first half of 1971 helped generate more hirings in this period, according to a study by the Conference Board released over the weekend.

title: N.A.S.D. PROPOSES DRASTIC NEW RULE
description: WASHINGTON, June 4The National Association of Securities Dealers today proposed a drastic new rule aimed at making sure that only investors of meansand, presumably, of sophisticationare permitted to buy taxsheltered equities. The most popular of these are oil and gas drilling programs and real estate syndication.

title: Key Races in Essex and. Hudson Counties Put North Jersey in Spotlight for Primary Vote Tomorrow
description: NEWARK, June 4 New Jersey's Democratic primary Tuesday will focus on the northern part of the state, on the counties of Hudson and Essex, and on this city, where a variety of political strategies and alliances will be tested.

title: MARYLANDERS WIN IN ANDERSON GOLF
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y., June 4 With four holes to play today in the final round of the Anderson Memorial bestball team golf tournament at the Winged Foot Club, George Marucci put his arm around his University of Maryland teammate, Rick Bendall, and hugged him.

title: Iraq Plans to Market Oil
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 4 (Reuters)Iraq announced from Baghdad today that she would market oil from the northern oil fields.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In his May 11 OpEd article, Harold J. Berman states that Congress has repealed the prohibition on impnrtation of certain types of Soviet furs. This is erroneous. The embargo on certain types of. Soviet and Chinese furs is still in effect.

title: Gregory Imparts Some Intemperate Observations
description: Wherever Dick Gregory goes, the first question people ask him is why he isn't running for President this year as he did in 1968. It's too dangerous, he answers matteroffactly. By the time they finish shooting this year, they'll come back and get me. I'll be the only one left.

title: Bhutto Arrives in.Nigeria
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, June 4 (Agence FrancePresse)President Bhutto arrived tonight from Khartoum The Sudan, on his African and Mideast tour.

title: Advertising:
description: William C. Lyddan, the last president and chief executive officer of Lennon & Newell who couldn't save the dying giant,,has been named president and head of the New York office of Buchen Advertising, Chicago.

title: Mrs. Lynda Ann Goldsmith Is Married
description: Mrs. Lynda Ann Goldsmith of New York and Alexander Strulovic of Caracas, Venezuela, were married yesterday in the Versailles Suite at the St. RegisSheraton. The ceremony was performed by Rabbis Joseph A. Lookstein and Haskell Lookstein.

title: Learson's Sloop Victor In Solution Cup Regatta
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June T. Vincent Learson's 58foot sloop. Nepenthe, was awarded the Solution Trophy today as the New York Yacht Club's 118th annual cruisingboat regatta wound up with a record 75boat fleet on Long Island Sound.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: FRESH AIR FUND= SUMMER FUN.

title: Berrigan Walks Out of Peace Mass at St. Patrick's
description: The Rev Daniel J. Berrigan, outspoken opponent of the Vietnam war walked out of a mass for peace yesterday in St. Patrick's Cathedral and held his own prayer service on the church steps. He charged that he had been denied the opportunity to preach.

title: NIXON VISIT BRINGS PRIDE IN POLAND
description: WARSAW, June 4A Warsaw taxi driver asked his British passenger last Thursday if he had been in Victory Square the day before when President Nixon was engulfed by a chanting throng of thousands.

title: Five Killed in Iowa Crash
description: STORM LAKE, Iowa, June 4 (AP)Five people were killed and four were injured today when the two cars in which they were riding collided some 13 miles northwest of Storm Lake, the authorities said. Those killed were identified as Leon Ludwig, 27 years old, and Mrs. Genevieve Ludwig, 68, both of Ottosen, Iowa; Susan Weatherell, 12, and Sandra Weatherell, 11, both of Brainerd, Minn., and Mrs. John Cox, 36, of Sutherland, Iowa.

title: Ecuadorian Soccer Team Defeated by Aberdeen, 51
description: Barcelona of Ecuador was no match for the Aberdeen soccer team of Scotland at Downing Stadium on Randalls Island yesterday as the Scottish players triumphed, 5.1, before 1,300 fans, 200 of whom were standing in the pedestrian aisle of the Triborough Bridge.

title: Miami Cubans Dance for Nixon
description: MIAMI, June 4  In a carefree mood reminiscent of preCastro Cuba more than a decade ago, several hundred wealthy Cubans and other Spahishspeaking residents of Miami, ate, drank and dented into the small hours of the dawn today at a lavish party to raise funds for the reelection of their neighbor, Richard M. Nixon.

title: Commencement 1972
description: Subdued dignity appears to be the mood of Commencement 1972. With a few exceptions immediately after the mining of Haiphong, the campuses have remained quiet. Antiwar protest expresses itself in urgent but nonviolent pleading, with students joined in their appeal by powerful voices among university presidents. Symbolic of the new mood was the polite arrest during a protest demonstration last month of John William Ward, president of Amherst College.

title: 20,000 Italian War Dead Brought Back From Libya
description: BARI, Italy, June 4 (AP) The body of Italy's aviation hero, Air Marshal Italo Balbo, and more than 20,000 other war dead were brought home today from a military cemetery at Tripoli that Libyan authorities have ordered moved.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the. Editor:Supertankers (six times bigger than at present) using Long Island Sound and Montauk for unloading are going to require a lot of dredging. Constant emptying of passing ships ballast tanks off Long Island is going to put a lot of oil on our beaches. Drilling rigs in offshore waters are goings to adversely affect the marine life.

title: Windsor's Service to Be Joined By Archbiehop of Canterbury
description: LONDON, June 4 (UPI) Queen Elizabeth raised what had been a private funeral for the Duke of Windsor to royal heights today by asking the Archbishops of Canterbury and York and the Moderator of the Church of Scotland to take part.

title: Muncey Hydroplane Wins
description: MIAMI, June 4 (AP)  Bill Muncey drove Atlas Van Lines to victory today in the Champion Sparkplug Unlimited hydroplane regatta. Muncey hit an average speed of 105.448 miles an hour in the final heat.

title: Robin Heller, Teacher at Dalton, Married to Charles B. Moss Jr.
description: Miss Robin Heller, daughter of Mrs. Myron J. Eiseman of Harrison, N. Y., and Morton A. Heller of Beverly Hills, Calif., and Aspen, Colo., was married here yesterday to Charles B. Moss Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Moss of New York and Greenwich, Conn.

title: 425 Agencies Aided
description: It may be true that charity begins at home, but millions of New Yorkers demonstrate that charity also begins by giving at work to the United. Fund of Greater New York. They do so because they know that the 425 hospital, health and socialservice agencies of the United Fund help nearly 4 million New Yorkers annually. Help the old, the young, the sick, the handicapped. Help all who live and work in New York regardless of race or religion. So give generously, to the United Fund of Greater New york. It's a lot of New Yorkers helping each other.

title: Napoles to Fight Saturday
description: Jos Napoles, the Cuban who has become a Mexican idol, will defend his world welterweight championship this Saturday night against Adolph Pruitt at Monterrey, Mexico. It will be Napoles's seventh defense.

title: Miss Robin Kutner Wed to B. A. Nadler
description: SYOSSET, L. I., June 4 Miss Robin Gail Kutner and Burton Alan Nadler who expect to graduate from the University of Wisconsin in August, were married here this afternoon. Rabbi Lloyd Tennenbaum of Cold Spring Harbor performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Bernard Kutner.

title: Briton Meets Peking Aide
description: PEKING, June 4 (Agence FrancePresse)  Foreign Minister Chi Pengfei had a twohbur meeting here today with Anthony Boyle, Parliamentary Under Secretary of the British Foreign Office.

title: Bobby Allison First
description: DOVER, Del., June 4 CAP)Bobby Allison outdueled, Richard Petty for 400 miles today, then sped to victory by more than a mile in the Mason Dixon 500 stock car race at Dover Downs.

title: 26 Establishments Cited for Violating City's Health Code
description: Gordon Chase, the city's Health Services Administrator, has, disclosed the names of 26 additional foodprocessing establishments cited for serious violations of the Health Code.

title: MRS. JOHN W. ADAMS
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y. June 4Mrs. Jean Marie McDermott Adams former head of the St. Augustine's School Library in Larchmont and the wife of John W Adams, vice chairman of Albert FrankGuenther Law Inc., advertising and public relations, died yesterday of hepatitis in New Rochelle Hospital. She was 45 years old and lived at 25 Oak Street.

title: Stanley Dancer's Bid to Win Double Foiled by Air Flight
description: Strong headwinds that slowed Stanley Dancer on his 150mile air trip from Westbury, L.I., to Wilmington, Del., on Saturday night prevented the famed harnessracing driver from scoring an unusual double.

title: Tito Goes to Moscow Today
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, June 4 (UPI)President: Tito is to leave for Moscow tomorrow for five days of talks with Soviet leaders, government officials said today.

title: Train Crash Kills 76 in Bangladesh
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, June 4 (Reuters)At least 76 people were killed and more than 500 injured when a crowded passenger train struck a stopped train In the western Bangladesh town of Jessore today. officials reported.

title: Abigail Louise Abeles Bride of Mark Spirer
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 4Miss Abigail Louise Abeles and Mark Howard Spirer were married here this afternoon at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Lowell Abeles. Rabbi Daniel Wolk performed the ceremony.

title: Wallace on Kansas Ballot
description: TOPEKA, Kan., June 4 (UPI) Gov. George C. Wallace Of Alabama has been assured place on the Karam ballot this year even if the Democrats do not nominate him. The Kansas Conservative party, meeting in state convention yesterday, nominated. Mr. Wallace for President over the National Conservative party candidate, Richard Kay of Cleveland.

title: Lindsay's Budget Experts Focusing on Department of Highways
description: The Lindsay administration's budget experts have recently been focusing on the city Highways Department, a L'indsay administration aide reported.

title: Stage: Buy Bonds, Buster! Arrives; Musical From Atlanta at Theater de Lys; A Satire of Camp Life in World War II
ANDREOTTI IS ASKED TO FORM A CABINET
description: ROME, June 4 President Giovanni Leone asked Premier Giulio Andereotti tonight to succeed himslf by forming new Government.

title: Miss Baruch Becomes Bride
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 4Miss Bonnie Joy Baruch, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Andre Baruch of Pompano Beich, Fla., formerly of Scarsdale, N. Y., was married here this afternoon to Carl Frank Ekstein, He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Bob Ekstein of Gloversville, N. Y.

title: MILLS BARS A RACE FOR VICE PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, June 4Representative Wilbur D. Mills said today that he would refuse the Democratic nomination as Vice President, regardless of whom the party nominates for President.

title: U.S. UTILITIES WARN ON POWER OUTLOOK
description: SAN DIEGO, June 4Only prompt Congressional action in removing courtimposed restraints on the building and operation of new generating plants can eliminate the threat of serious power shortages this summer, the nation's electric utilities said today.

title: SHOP TALK
description: For a decade or more, perfumes have been growing stronger and heavier, so that being in an elevator with some women has been as staggering as an LSD trip. Now, there are signs that they are turning back tosweetness and light, with perfumers talking about sports perfumes, early morning brews and scents as wholesome as an organicallygrown carrot.

title: Sanford, Citing Split, Will Press Campaign
YOUNG DANCERS FILL PROGRAM WITH ZEST
description: For those who take the view that children like to see other children onstage, the Children's Ballet Theater directed by Christine Neubert fits the bill perfectly. This year the company, made up of children and a few adults, is presenting Miss Neubert's choreographic adaptation of Mark Twain's The Prince and the Pauper.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As an American living in London was interested to read that the Royal Opera House Covent Garden will solicit contributions in the United States through the American Friends of Covent Garden.

title: Roundup: Bench's Cooled Bat Keeps Reds RedHot
description: Johnny Bench forgot to hit a home run yesterday. After walloping seven in Cincinnati's five previous games, the 24yearold catcher failed to clear any outfield fences in Philadelphia against the Phillies.

title: 3,404 DROP FOUND IN RELIEF ROLLS, MOST IN 6 YEARS
description: The city's welfare rolls decreased by 3,404 persons in April, the first decline in 11 months and the largest in six years, Human Resources Administrator Jule M. Sugarman announced. yesterday.

title: Red Smith
description: The scene was a room under the grandstand in Al Lang Field, St, Petersburg, Fla., where the working press munches cold cuts before exhibition games, where Gussie Busch fulminates about the ingratitude of pitchers who Win 20 games for the Cardinals and want to be paid for where Bowie Kuhn calls press conferences when he has nothing to say. On this particular day a guy was holding forth on the advantages of reshaping the majors into three eightclub leagues. Among those listening was Gussie Busch, a beer baron who is malty rather than yeasty.

title: Fred S. Royster Is Dead; Proponent of Cigarettes, 63
description: DURHAM N.C., June 4 (UPI) Fred S. Royster managing director of a tobacco industry organization and one of the chief defenders of cigarettes against what he called the antitobacco zealots, died yesterday in Duke University Hospital where he had been under treatment for a heart ailment He was 63 years old.

title: PANEL URGES CUTS IN MAIL RATE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Postal Rate Commission recommended today a $78.3million reduction in increases that had been temporarily permitted for the United States Postal Service, but left undisturbed the existing rates for first class airmail and post cards.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on Colonialism 3 P.M.

title: Advertising:
description: Clios and Effies showered down on worthy advertising folks last night in Philharmonic Hall at the 13th annual American Television and Radio Commercials Festival.

title: May Savings Bond Sales Exceeded Redemptions
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (Reuters)  Sales of Series E and HSavings Bonds increased in May and exceeded redemptions for the 20th month in a row, the Treasury Department reported today.

title: Details on Primaries to Be Held Today in 6 States
THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., June 5Senator George McGovern flew into Albuquerque tonight for a political rally in an effort to stall a stop McGovern movement that could keep him from winning any of the state's 18 delegates to the Democratic National Convention.

title: Merger News
description: The SevenUp Company has agreed in principle to acquire the Mountain Valley Spring Company of Hot Springs, Ark., the nation's largest independent spring water company, for an undisclosed amount of common stock, it was announced yesterday. The annual volume of Mountain Valley, which is privately owned, is $4million to $5million, according to John G. Scott president. It would become a subsidi ary of SevenUp, which is primarily engaged in the sale to independent franchised bottlers of concentrated extract and flavoring coipound for its soft drinks.

title: C.A.B. IS PETITIONED ON AIRLINE CONTROL
description: WASHINGTON, June 5, (AP) The Aviation Consumer Action Project an arm of Ralph Nader's operation petitioned the Civil Aeronautics Board today to require two holding companies and the Chase Manhattan Bank to quit ownership or control of stock in 11 airlines.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Back in the days when the National Football League and George Hales were younger and more venturesome, revolutionary rules changes were offered by the imaginative George Preston Marshall of the Redskins. This was exactly 40 years ago and it was to be a breakaway from the college rules that the professionals had followed much too slavishly.

title: Twins Defeat Orioles, 3.2
description: BALTIMORE, June 5 (UPI)Bobby Darwin's sixthinning double sent the Baltimore Orioles down to their fourth straight defeat tonight as the Minnesota Twins rallied for a 32 victory.

title: Humphrey CampaignReport Shows Debt of $1,149,967
description: ST. PAUL, June 5 (AP)Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota has campaign debts totaling $1,149,967 on the eve of the California primary, according to a report filed today in the office of the Minnesota Secretary of State.

title: ESCAPED, $35.40, 5LENGTH VICTOR
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., June 5 (AP)Mrs, A. J. Toman's Escaped circled the pack and drove home with a fivelength upset triumph in the $7,000 Three Rings Purse at Monmouth Park today.

title: Three Amateurs Qualify
description: PORTLAND, Ore., June 5 (AP) Three amateurs qualified forthe United States Open in regional play today at the 6,743yard, par72 Portland Golf Club. They were JiM McLean of Seattle, 70, 67137; Bob Allard of Beaverton, Ore., 69, 70139; and Steve Cole of Seattle, 70, 72142. There were 31 entrants.

title: GRAIN PRICES OFF ON GOOD WEATHER
description: Grain and soybean futures dropped yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, chiefly as a result of favorable weather in the growing areas.

title: WALTER MARTINEAU, INSURANCE LEADER
description: Walter F. Martineau, executive vice president, treasurer and a director of the Companion Life Insurance Company, 230 Park Avenue, died Sunday, apparently of a heart attack, in Scarsdale, N. Y. He was 70 years old and lived at 119 Chippewa Road, Yonkers.

title: Chase Bank Is Sued As Trust Sponsor
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank has been sued on the ground that its sponsorship of the Chase Manhattan Mortgage and Realty Trust, one of the nation's largest real estate investment trusts violates the Ranking Act of 1933, which separated commercial banking from the securities business.

title: $155,000 Recovered in Reno Jet Hijacking
description: RENO, June 5 (UPI)Agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation yesterday recovered ed the remaining $155,000 of 3200,000 given to a hooded hijacker who parachuted from a :United Air Lines 727 jetliner Alto the sagebrush near Reno Friday night.

title: Early Retirement Policy
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UPI) The Postal Service announced today a special early retirement policy that could cut its nationwide staff of 730,000 by as many as 180,000 employes.

title: CutOff Notice Is Required of Utilities
description: ALBANY, June 5 Utility companies will have to notify tenants in multifamily dwellings 15 days in advance of cutting off service under a bill signed into law by Governor Rockefeller, his office announced today.

title: CoverUp
description: When the Army first announced partial findings its investigation into the Mylai massacres two years ago, this newspaper joined many others in applauding the remarkable vigor and candor exhibited by the panel of inquiry headed by Lieut. Gen. William R. Peers.

title: BENNETT TRIUMPHS IN A.A.U. DECATHLON
description: LOS ANGELES, June 5 (UPI) States Army won the final event, the 1,500 meters, in 4 minutes 8.9 seconds to capture the national Amateur Athletic Union decathlon with 7,910 points today.

title: Credit Markets
description: Bond rates; which last week reversed course and began to move upward, continued to climb yesterday in quiet trading. Money rates were mixed, but with an upward bias. There were no major economic or market developments during the day to affect sentiment, but analysts noted a growing belief that credit policy was being tightened up a notch and new skepticism about the efficacy of the bat tie against inflation.

title: TALKS WITH LIBYAN. SOUGHT BY MOROCCO
description: RABAT, Morocco, June 5King Hassan II of Morocco called today for the liberation of all African territories still under foreign domination as he opened the 19th meeting of the Council or Ministers of the Organization of African Unity here.

title: 6 Players Drafted In N.H.L.
description: MONTREAL, June 5An ominous portent for the new expansion teams, the New York Islanders and the Atlanta Flames, arose today during the National Hockey League's intraleague draft.

title: Rogers Regrets the Absence Of Russians in Stockholm.
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) Secretary of State William P Rogers voiced regret today that the Soviet Union and a number of its allies have apparently decided, for political  reasons, not to join the Stockholm conference on the environment.

title: Cities Rushing to Impose Taxes on Air Departure
description: Cities around the nation have begun a rush to impose $1 and $2 airport departure taxes on air travelers in the wake of a Supreme Court decision upholding the constitutionality of such taxes.

title: Minnesotan Won't Quit
description: LOS ANGELES, June 5Senator Hubert H. Humphrey is telling close friends that he cannot win the California Democratic Presidential primary tomorrow and is concentrating on minimizing the loss.

title: SUIT SEEKS TO HALT GLEN ALDEN MERGER
description: The May 30 announcement of a plan to merge the. Glen Alden Corporation into the Rapid American Corporation drew a Federal law suit here yesterday alleging violating of disclosure provisions of securities laws.

title: Pay Board Reports Raises Averaging 5.2% for Million
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) The Pay Board said today that it had approved wage increases averaging 5.2 per cent for a total of 1.1 million workers in a fourweek period ended May 26.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE SUMMER GAME. By Roger Angell. 303 pages. Viking. $7.50.

title: German Surplus Narrows
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, June 5 (Reuters)West Germany's basic balance of payments in April showed a provisional surplus of 1.42billion marks ($4.45million) against a revised surplus of 1.87billion in March and a surplus in April lastyear of 1.37billion marks, the Bundesbank said today.

title: An Alleged G.O.P Partisan Temporarily Pulls Mrs. Abzug's Hat Out of the Ring
description: For a few brief moments yesterday morning, there was a rare sight on Broadway. and 110th Street: Bella Abzug without her hat.

title: Troop Strength in Vietnam Drops 1,100, to 63,700
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 5 (UPI)The United States military command said today that American troop strength in Vietnam dropped to 63,700 last week, the lowest level in seven years, but still short of President. Nixon's goal of 49,000 by the end of the month. The troop level represented a drop of 1,100 men from the previous week, including 510 men in eight units that were deactivated. It was the largest weekly troop pullout in four weeks, the command said.

title: British Find Poor Children Lag
description: LONDON, June 5  A survey of. 17,000 children born in Britain in one week. in 1958 has found that, by the age of 7, wOrking;class youngsters have dropped far behind their iniddleclass contemporaries in reading, schoolwork and mental development.

title: Market Place: The Big Bard And the Public
description: Now that the New York Stock Exchange has revealed the direction of its thinking on public members of its new 21member board it is clear that many questions remain unresolved regarding appropriate qualifications for the 10 public members.

title: Mets'
description: The schedule takes on a sterner character for the New York Mets tonight as they open a threegame series with the Cincinnati Reds at Shea Sta. dium. Of the next 15 games the Mets play, 12 will be against Cincinnati and Houston, two Western Division teams that have been winning regularly,

title: Abel Labor Father of Year
description: PITTSBURGH, June 5 (AP)I. W. Abel, president of the United Steelworkers of America, has been named Labor Father of the Year by the National Father's Day Committee. Mr. Abel has two married daughters.

title: Suspect Linked to Far Right
description: MIAMI, June 5The airline hijacking suspect who bailed out May 6 with $303,000 ransom over Central America has admitted to being a member of a far right LatinAmerican group, according to testimony by an F.B.I. agent here today.

title: JERSEY MAN SHOT FROM CAR IN LODI
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., June 5The police of this Union County city and of the Borough of Lodi in Bergen County, 15 miles north of here, widened their search today for the gunman or gunmen who shot and killed one person on a street corner here early yesterday and wounded five others at separate points in an unexplained shooting spree.

title: Older WomenTheir Own Cry For Liberation
description: More than 500 older women (definition: females over the age of 30) met here over the weekend to reassure each other that wrinkles, gray hair and the menopause do not automatically relegate a woman to the scrap heap.

title: News Analysis
description: How many heroin addicts are there in the United States? How many in New York?

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rose at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities. In last week's sale, the average rate for 3month bills was 3.762 per cent and the average rate for 6month bills was 4,106 per cent.

title: College sports Notes
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., June 5  When Rutgers dropped Delaware from its football schedule it was felt that Scarlet officials were unwilling to continue playing against one of the powerful teams of the region. That is apparently not the case.

title: ItalianAmerican League Is Beset by Woes
description: Officials of the ItalianAmerican Civil Rights League said in an interview yesterday that they were retrenching and reorganizing its activities. Their efforts were an apparent attempt to regain the power the league had possessed before the nearfatal shooting of its founder, Joseph A. Colombo Sr., last summer.

title: Hannum Scoffs at Report
description: DENVER, June 5 (AP)Alex Hannum, coach and general manager of the Denver Rockets, said today that reports that Denver's A.B.A. franchise had asked to be put on ice temporarily were completely unfounded.

title: THE 1972 CHAMPAIGN
description: LINCOLN, Neb., June 5 (AP) Senator George McGovern gained another three committed Democratic National Convention delegates as a result of the official canvass today of Nebraska's May 9 primary election returns.

title: Westchester Shoppers Petition Board for Consumer Affairs Unit
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 5A proposal now before the County Board of Legislators for a new agency to protect Westchester consumers has brought reactions from both sides of the political aisle and some support from the supermarket aisle.

title: SHOP TALK
description: The look, for the most part, is Italian. The shapes and use of materials are modern. And, with few exceptions, the 50 furniture designs by students on view through this month at Sachs New York (35th Street and Eighth Avenue) look as if they would really work in today's home.

title: CustomsAccordSignedHere
description: The first collective bargaining accord between the New York region of United. States Customs and the Council of Customs Locals, Region II of New York has been signed. The pact will cover over 2,000 customs inspectors, import specialists and classified and wagegrade employes in the New YorkNew Jersey area.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: CAIRO, June 5 (Reuters)President Anwar elSadat told Egyptians today that a new round of fighting with Israel was inevitable, and he rejected any bigpower agreement to limit arms supplies to Egypt until the occcupied Arab territories were recovered. The President was speaking to wounded soldiers at a rehabilitation center in Cairo.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 5 (AP)  Verna Lea Farms Holmestretch returned to his favorite race track in winning style today when he easily captured the Latrobe Purse at Liberty Bell.

title: Allende's Opponents Claim an Upset Vi story in National Union Election in Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 5The Christian Democratic party, leading component of the antiMarxist Opposition, claimed victory today in the national labor election for officials of the Central Union, a political bastion of Chile's leftwing Government.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: NARROWSBURG, N. Y.Those who canoe the Delaware cannot fail to be astonished at how unspoiled the river is in its upper reaches.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, June 5Here is letter from a woman who raises a difficult question:

title: Influenza Virus Is Found to Affect Fetus
description: Two British researchers have reported evidence that influenza infections in pregnancy may not be as harmless as doctors have previously be. lieved.

title: Intercity Picturephones Used by Private Callers
description: CHICAGO, June 5 (UPI)Edward Heveran and Charles L. Brown were 20 miles apart today, but as they chatted on the telephone they could see each other on 5by51/2inch screens.

title: The Zurich Gold Pool: Taking a Look at How It Operates
description: Every day shortly before noon, the telephone operator of the Union Bank of Switzerland puts through a call to the goldtrading room from the Reserve Bank of South Africa in Pretoria. The central bank, as agent for the mines that produce 80 per cent of the world's gold, wants to find out how the gold is moving and at what price, and also wants to get an opinion about the desirability of feeding more gold to the market.

title: Bonn to Give $47Million. In Honor of Marshall Plan
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 5 Chancellor,Willy Brandt today to Harvard;.where ttie Marshall Plan was offered, 25 years ago, and ,announced that West Germany would d6nate $47Million to the United States in gratitude for the. plan!s heavy contribution to Western Etirope's postwar economic recovery.

title: Man in the News
description: Jule Meyer Sugarman has such a reputation for management that some city officials wish he would draw the line occasionally when it comes to his own position as Human Resources Administrator.

title: $30Million NoFault Rebate in Massachusetts
description: BOSTON, June 5 (UPI)The nofault automobile insurance concept won a court battle today that enabled drivers in Massachusetts to reap from $30million to $40million in refunds from insurance companies.

title: Stars Turn Out for Fabulous 40's Patty to Benefit Phoenix House
description: They pushed their way into Roseland last night, past the barricadeS, the mounted police and the television cameras. There were the social types who rarely go to the West Side and the showbiz crowd that calls the area home And all the just plain people that added up to a mob of 1,500.

title: Lipchitz Show : Statement of My Life
description: For Jacques Lipchitz, his retrospective exhibition that opens today at the Metropolitan Museum of Art is the big one. It is the statement of my life, the 81yearold artist said the other day.

title: Athens and Peking Establish Relations; Taiwan Aide to Go
description: ATHENS, June 5Greece established diplomatic relations today with China. They issued a joint declaration that affirmed mutual respect for sovereignty and integrity and said that Athens and Peking would exchange ambassadors within six months.

title: Tender Offer Is Weighed
description: The Tyler Corporation is holding talks on a possible tender offer of $18 a share cash to be made to shareholders of Anchor Coupling Company, Inc. Anchor makes hydraulic and freon hose assemblies and related fittings. Tyler makes pipe and fittings for various industries.

title: GREEK CHOIR OFFERS GENEROUS PROGRAM
description: Dino Anagnost has proved his choral conducting skills on a number of previous occasions here, so it was no surprise to find his Metropolitan Greek Choir a welltrained, smartly efficient ensemble. At Alice Tully Hall on Sunday night, the 50voice group offered a generous program, mostly of Greek liturgical, folk and popular material.

title: Warrant Issued for Couple
description: Vincent A. Catoggio, a United States Magistrate, issued a warrant here yesterday for the arrest of 22yearold Willie Roger Holder and Catherine Kerkow, 20, on charges of aircraft piracy for the hijacking of a Western Airlines plane from California to Algiers last Friday and Saturday. A ransom of $500,000 was paid in the hijacking.

title: CONNALLY IS GOING ON15NATION TOUR FOR THE PRESIDENT
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 5President Nixon is sending Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally on a monthlong mission to some 15 nations on four continents, starting tomorrow, the White House announced today.

title: Stopping Air Piracy
description: It is now four months since the Federal Aviation Administration ordered airlines to screen all passengers in the hunt for potential skyjackers. No reader of the nation's front pages needs convincing that the effort has failed, nor can any frequent passenger on the airlines be unaware that in many places not even the most rudimentary screening effort is discernible. Apparently one doesn't even need weapons or a bomb to take over an airplane these days. The hijacker flown to Algeria last weekend turned out to have two books and a shaving kit in a briefcase he said contained explosives.

title: A'S DOWN INDIANS ON HOMER IN 10TH
description: CLEVELAND, June 5 (UPI)Bert Campaneris hit his third homer of the season in the 10th inning tonight to spoil Gaylord Perry's bid for his 10th victory as the Oakland Athletics took a 32 decision over the Cleveland Indians. Reggie Jackson hit a tworun homer for Oakland in the third.

title: Chess: Quarter of Century Divides Two Titles Won by Shipman
description: The Manhattan Chess Club at 14 East 60th Street, long the camping ground of many international grandmasters from the United States, has a new champion, Walter Shipman of Bay Shore, L.I.

title: Suit Over a Movie By ExU.S. Agent Dismissed by Court
description: MINEOLA, L.I., June 5 State Supreme Court Justice Sol Wachtler dismissed today a suit by the real former Federal narcotics agent in the film The French Connection, who contended that he and not Eddie (Popeye) Egan had, in fact, broken up the heroin smuggling ring and that the movie and book portraying him as a bumbling incompetent had defamed him.

title: MUSEUM RETURNS
description: Portions of an inscribed Mayan monument from a Guatemalan jungle, in the possession of the Brooklyn Museum since 1964, were relinquished yesterday to the Guatemalan Government.

title: Jacket Leads on Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 5 (AP)Barry Jackel led the. 11 California professional golfers who qualified on the olympic club Lake course today for the Open. He shot a threeunderpar 68 after a morning round of 75. for a 143 total.

title: An Easy Way to Save
