description: It is all too easy to spend and all too hard to saveunless you sign up for the payroll savings plan where you work. Then saving regularly can be as easy as picking. heck your paycheck What ever amount you decide on will be deducted in advance, before you have a chance to spend it.

title: Bats at Belmont
description: With offtrack betting on next Saturday's $125,000added Belmont Stakes scheduled to start Thursday at 2 P.M., a wide range of possibilities appears likely.

title: PANEL POSTPONES INSTITUTION ISSUE
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Senate Securities subcommittee decided today to postpone consideration of the issue of institutional membership on stock exchanges.

title: Senate Panel Backs Welfare Revisions; Large Saving Cited
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) The Senate Finance Committee tentatively adopted a new plan of Federal financing of welfare programs today and said the plan would save the states $2,6billion in 1974 when it would be fully effective.

title: Algeria Hints Ransom Accord
description: ALGIERS, June 5 (UPI)Algeria will returwthe $500,000 ransom of two Western Airlines hijackers butt will give the couplg political shelter in the local Black Panther colony, Government officials said today.

title: Party Role Is Minimal In California Election
Davis Juror Reports Unanimity in Talks
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., June 5 (AP) The jurors who acquitted Angela Davis on murderkidnappingconspiracy charges had no major disagreements on her innocence from the start of their 13 hours of deliberations, the forewoman has disclosed.

title: Judge's Wiretapping Ruling Is Limited to One Case
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 5 (AP) The Federal judge who last week declared the 1968 Federal wiretapping law unconstitutional said today that his action applied only to the case he was hearing.

title: Telkam's Sugar On Right Track Thanks to a High School Girl, 18
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 5Telkam's Sugar is a 4yearold trotting mare, who made only one start last season and who has gone postward only once so far this campaign.

title: Electronics Blends With Farming at LI College
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., June 5  When George L. Franke arrived here in June, 1916, he found 35 fellow members of the first class of the new State Agricultural Institute, a large area of plowed land, a small herd of cattle, one barn and two temporary classroom buildings.

title: UnioriPresident Is Nanied To Rerit Guidelines Board
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday named Arthur L. Harckhani, president of Local 32B of the Service Employes International Union tO serve on the city's Rent duidelines Board, He fills the vacancy by the death of Thomas B. Shortman, his predecessor as unioN president, on Jan, 6

title: Albert Bars Convention Post
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) The House Speaker, Representative Carl Albert of Oklahoma, removed himself today from consideration as chairman of the Democratic National Convention and suggested the party chairman, Lawrence O'Brien, be chosen by the convention for the job. Mr. Albert was chairman of the 1968 convention.

title: Duke of Windsor Is Buried After a Private Funeral
description: WINDSOR, England, June 5 The Duke of Windsor was buried here today at Frogmore, the Royal Burial Ground close to Windsor Castle.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Cambodia Seems Adrift After 2 Years as Republic
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 5From a start full of hope two years ago, Cambodia has sunk into a deep malaise, without confidence in her leadership, institutions, or ability to decide her own future, in the assessment ofa wide range of Cambodians and foreign diplomats.

title: HOUSE ASSAILED ON OUTSIDE JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 More than onethird of the 435 members of the House hold Incomeproducing outside professional or business positions that may conflict with their duties as Representatives, a political action group said today.

title: FORD TO EXTEND OUTPUT FOR 1972
description: DETROIT, June 5The Ford Motor Company will build its 1972 models longer into the summer than planned and introduce its 1973 models one week later than planned. to avoid layoffs and shutdowns resulting from its faulty emission testing.

title: An Impressive Musical LineUp In Armstrong Memorial Concert
description: A benefit performance billed as the first annual Louis Armstrong Memorial Concert brought together an impressive lineup of singers, musicians and dancers at Philharmonic Hell on Sunday evening. The concert was presented by Elmcor Youth and Adults Activities, Inc., an organization that has been serving Corona and East Elmhurst, Queens, for seven years, to raise funds for a proposed Louis Armstrong Memorial Cultural Arts Center and Memorial Plaza in Corona.

title: DR. LEO MAYER, 87, A NOTED SURGEON
description: Dr, Leo Mayer, a prominent orthopedic surgeon, who was chairman and president for 25 years of the Federation of the Handicapped, died yesterday at the DeWitt Nursing Home, 211 East 79th Street. He was 87 years old.

title: Public Access Experiments on Cable TV Advancing
description: The content can be miserable. The technical quality is often atrocious. And, as established television executives insistently note, nobody is watching anyway.

title: The City's Heroin ClinicIt Was 1919
description: NEW HAVENLast June the Mayor's narcotic control council in New York released a proposal for heroin research and rehabilitation to end heroin maintenance among hardcore, treatmentresistant addicts. Heroin addiction would be curbed by using the drug for shortterm maintenance, never more than six months, to attract addicts to a setting where there would be a full range of rehabilitative services. In such an environment, the addict would be encouraged to transfer to a heroinfree rehabilitation program, perhaps one employing methadone, or to a drugfree therapeutic community.

title: JAMES P. M'ELREE
description: WEST CHESTER, Pa., June 5 James Paul MacElree, the presiding judge of the Orphan's Court of Chester County, died at his home here today of congenital heart failure. He was 85 years old.

title: Celebrity Tennis to Greenberg Duo
description: RANCHO LA COSTA, Calif., June 5Hank Greenberg, 61yearold former slugger of the Detroit Tigers, and Bob Boyd, University of Southern California basketball coach, defeated O. J. Simpson, Buffalo Bills running back, and Gail Goodricji, Los Angeles Lakers guard, today, 50, to win the second annual Dewar's sports celebrities tennis tournament.

title: Defense BudgetCutting
description: Senator Humphrey's endorsement of a $12.5billion defense budget cut and Senator McGovern's proposal for a $30billion reduction make it certain that the Administration's military spending plans will be a major issue in the Presidential campaign. That is as it should be. The historic agreements just reached in the firststage strategic arms limitation talks (SALT) with Moscow are unlikely to pare American military outlays very much, if at all. SALT II ultimately may reduce nuclear forces. But SALT I, unprecedented as its results are, will merely freeze them at more or less present levels.

title: Lebanon Issues Denial
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 5Lebanon today denied that the terrorists who carried out the attack at the Tel Aviv airport had been trained on Lebanese soil.

title: Industry Sees a Giveaway
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UPI) The dairy industry said today that the new cheese plan amounted to a giveaway of domestic markets to foreign producers.

title: Indiana Totals Complete
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Ind., June 5 (AP)  Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota defeated Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama by 44,749 votes in the Indiana Democratic primary May 2, according to the certified totals released today by the Secretary of State's office. The official count was: Humphrey, 354,244; Wallace, 309,495 and Senator Edmund S. Muskie, 87,719.

title: 6 Killed in Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 5 (AP)Rockets were fired into Pnompenh today in the first daylight attacks on the Cambodian capital in nearly two years of war. Six persons were reported killed and 11 wounded.

title: MILLS TO OPPOSE JOINT FISCAL BILL
description: WASHINGTON, June 5Willbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, indicated today that he did not plan to try to attach his taxreform bill to the bill increasing the limit on the Federal debt, which has to be passed by the end of this month.

title: Israelis Say They Have Traced Route of 3 Terrorists From Japan to the Tel Aviv Airport Massacre
description: JERUSALEM, June 5  Israel's national police said today they had traced the odyssey of three young Japanese radicals across Canada. and Western Europe to guerrilla training in Lebanon, all in preparation for the moment they opened fire on crowds in the arrival lounge of the Tel Aviv international airport last Tuesday night.

title: MacLeish and 3 Others Honored by Scottish Group
description: As a threetime Pulitzer Prize winner, Archibald MacLeish is no stranger to celebrity and its ways, but there was a note of puzzlement in his voice whem he spoke yesterday after receiving still another award for outstanding contribution to the arts.

title: Sharp Rise in City Welfare Cited in Last Quarter of '71
description: A sharp increase in the city's rate of accepting families for welfare rolls took place in the last quarter of 1971, with particularly high admission rates in areas of the Bronx, a study disclosed yesterday.

title: Lazar and Taxi Industry Clash on Regulation Ruling
description: Taxi Commissioner Michael J. Lazar and a lawyer for the city's radioequipped owneroperated taxis clashed yesterday over the meaning of a Federal court ruling made last Friday involving that segment of the taxi industry.

title: A KASHMIRl LEADER ALLOWED TO RETURN
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir, June 5 The government of the state of Kashmir today permitted the return of Sheik Mohammed Abdullah, its former Prime Minister, from exile in India.

title: FUND TO AID AREAS SHORT OF DOCTORS
description: $10million studentaid program to increase the number of doctors who would practice in medically underserved locatians was announced yesterday by the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation.

title: Yanks'
description: Ambushed in Milwaukee and Chicago during the first week of their western trip, the New York Yankees spent yesterday exploring downtown Arlington in preparation for their first American League game on Texas soil tonight. Meanwhile, back in the Bronx, things were even tougher than in what used to be called the western badlands.

title: Mrs Onassis, in First Visit to Kennedy Center Sees Bernstein Mass
description: WASHINGTON, June 5Mrs. Aristotle Onassis still evokes that old magic for the people of Washington.

title: FRED RAYFIELD
description: Fred Rayfield, executive vice president of Milton. Feaster Associates, public relations counselors, died yesterday of cancer in Doctors Hospital. He was 49 years old and lived at 838 West End Avenue.

title: Bill to Aid Horse Breeding In New York State Vetoed
description: ALBANY, June 5 (UPI) Governor Rockefeller vetoed a bill today that would have created a New York thoroughbred breeding and development fund to promote the thoroughbred industry in the state.

title: Swiss to. Sponsor Parley In 1974 on Rules of War
description: GENEVA, June 5Switzer land will sponsor an international diplomatic conference in 1974 to adopt new rules for protecting military, guerrilla and civilian victims of wars and civil strife, officials of the In ternational Committee of the Red Cross said today.

title: More Women Join Ranks of Nation's Police Forces
description: A small but growing number of policewomen are patroling the streets of American cities and responding to emergency calls in exactly the same way as male police officers.

title: Possible Violation Noted In Humphrey Donations
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) The Office of Federal Elections referred to the Justice Department today what it called a possible violation of the 1971 election law involving contributions to the campaign of Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of The new law prohibits giving or accepting contributions in the name of another person.

title: Police Break Up Protests In 2 South African Cities
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, June 5White South African students clashed today in two major cities with the nolice, who used tear gas and charged them with sticks.

title: NEW QUOTAS SET ON DAIRY IMPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) Operating details of a new plan for dairyimport quotas were announced today by the Agriculture Department. The plan is expected to increase the amount of cheese imported next year by 5 to 10 per cent, according to Government projections.

title: HARRY H. STRAUS JR.
description: BETHESDA, Md., June 5Harry H. Straus Jr., son of the late Harry H. Straus, president and founder of the Ecusta Paper Corporation, a leading manufacturer of cigarette paper, died today at his home here, after a long illness. His age was 48.

title: Birth Control Study Says Many Rely on Unimproved Methods
description: WASHINGTON, June 5Despite the rapid, spread of sophosticated methods, a quarter of all women who want to limit the size of their families still rely on less effective means of contraception, according to a major family planning study published today.

title: Teachers Vote for a Statewide Union
description: Members of the United Teachers of New York and the New York State Teachers Association have voted overwhelmingly to merge their organizations and thereby create the largest statewide union of educational employes in the nation.

title: LANDLORDS TOLD TO PAY WAGE RISE
description: The BronxRealtY Advisory Board announced yesterday that it had advised its member landlords. to continue to pay a wage increase to service employes until it was determined whether the city was implementing Li court order on maximum base rents in rentcontrolled apartments.

title: Acting Governor Takes Office In Alabama in Caretaker Role
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 5 Lieut. Gov. Jere L. Beasley became Acting Governor of Alabama today and promised to make no major decisions without the approval of Gov. George C. Wallace, who is hospitalized in Maryland as a result of an assassination attempt three weeks ago.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  Votersparticularly California votersshould never be taken for granted, but on the eve of the Democratic primary in that state, all signs point to another victory for Senator George McGovern. So maybe dt is no wonder that, from Florida, President Nixon announced that he is sending Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally on a trip to fifteen nations.

title: Economic Analysis
description: The sixday ArabIsraeli War, which began five years ago yesterday, set in motion forces that have sharply changed the international oil industry.

title: City Finds Wide Harassment of Tenants by Owners Seeking to Rebuild
description: Widespread harassment of tenants lry, owners wishing to replace their buildings with more profitable luxury apartments and office buildings has been found as a result of an investigation, Commissioner Nathan Leventhal announced yesterday. He has been head. of the Rent and Housing Maintenance Department of the HouSing and Development Administration for the last month.

title: Records Set in Car Sales For May 2131 and Month
description: DETROIT, June 5Newcar sales in the final third May and for the full month were at record levels, another sign that Detroit's sales boom is rolling through the spring.

title: McGovernDominating Coast Media Coverage
description: LOS ANGELES, June 5In the fierce politirial competition of the California Democratic Presidential primary, Senator. George. McGovern is attracting measurably more attention than Senator Hubert a Humphrey in newspapers andtelevision news programs.

title: Price Changes
description: The Mead Corporation, a major paper and paperboard producer, announced yesterday that it had raised prices on selected grades of printing papers by a range of $10 to $25 a ton.

title: F.B.I. Chief Not Disappointed
description: NEWARK, June 5 (UPI)The acting F.B.I, director, Patrick Gray 3d, said today that the verdict represented the responsible working of American jurisprudence and that he was not disappointed.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Policemen in a launch fired two I2gauge shotgun shells at a 15foot gray shark at 12:45 P.M. yesterday about 300 yards off Beach 120th Street, the Rockaways. The shark, which was seven feet from the launch, submerged and was not seen again.

title: State Official Is Appointed To Help Cut Court Backlog
description: The Judicial Conference of the State of New York announced yesterday the formation of a management planning unit in the office of the state administrator of the courts.

title: Baghdad's Gamble
description: Iraq's seizure of the Westernowned consortium, the Iraq Petroleum Company, is a blow to the West, a boon for the Soviet Union and a highrisk gamble for the radical regime in Baghdad.

title: 21 Race Horses Killed In Vancouver Barn Fire
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, June 5 (AP)Up to 21 horses were believed killed last night, when a fire swept thre barns in the stable complex at Exhibition Park race track in the city's eastern end.

title: $90,000 in Hashish Seized
description: BEAUMONT, Tex., June 5 (UPI)Federal agents, alerted by the ship's captain, seized $90,000 in hashish last night on the freighter Andrew Jackson at the port of Beaumont, the United States Customs Service said today.

title: SNEAD FAILS IN BID AS OPEN QUALIFIER
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., June 5 (AP)Sam Snead, the 60yearold golfing star from the hills of West Virginia will not play in the United States Open this year.

title: U.S. Shelves Complaint Against Japan
description: TOKYO, June 5The United States, in a move intended to deescalate continuing trade warfare with Japan, has shelved plans to file a formal complaint with offlails in Geneva a qualified American source, disclosed today.

title: Acquittal
description: The acquittal of Angela Davis shouldbut unfortunately will notdeflate worldwide propaganda aimed perpetuating the myth that American justice, represented in San Jose by an allwhite jury, is loaded against all political dissenters, black revolutionaries in particular. Miss Davis herself tried to perpetuate this myth with her statement after the verdict that she considers the people who sat as jurors not as part of the judicial system but of the people.

title: DELTEC SUES TO BAR BOISE CASCADE MOVE
description: Deltec International, Ltd., filed suit late Friday in the United States District Court here charging that the Boise Cascade Corporation arranged an unlawful 10fold increase in the capital stock of Timbo, S. A., a jointly held Argentine cattle ranch.

title: Bills Owner Faces Suit; 2 of His Horses Attached
description: Two prominent race horses belonging to Ralph C. Wilson Jr., owner of the Buffalo Bills, were impounded at Belmont Park yesterday in a. legal wrangle.

title: The Baby Boom May Be Over, but Business Is Still Good
description: An oil company recently pointed out in an advertisement that, with the birth rate in the United States now below that of the Depression years and with a continuing drop expected, each member of the smaller family would have more money to spend. This could mean better business for many industries.

title: June 5,1947: Start of the Marshall Plan Effort to Build a New Europe Amid Ashes of War
description: PARIS, June 5With Europe fat, prosperous and not a littlei smug, it is somewhat difficult to recall the conditions of a ruptured continent after its second major war of the century, with its institutions discredited, its cities ravaged, its survivors disillusioned and displaced.

title: Rights Aide Resigns, Charging Discrimination Because He Is White and a Jew
description: A $15,867ayear senior investigator for the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission resigned yesterday, charging that the Federal agency discriminated against him both as a white and as. a Jew.

title: State Develops New Test To Detect Lead Poisoning
description: ALBANY, June 5 (AP)Scientists for the State Health Department say they have developed a simple, quick test for lead poisoning in children.

title: M.I.T. Given $2Million
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 5 (AP)Reunion gifts of nearly $2million were announced today by classes celebrating their 50th, 40th and 25th reunions at Massachusetts Institute of Technology. The money was raised in the last five years.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION SHOWS A DECLINE
description: I The American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday a decline of 1.1 per cent in steel production for the week ended June 3. The trade association said the week's output was 2,637,000 net tons, down from the 2,665,000 poured in the preceding week.

title: Agenda Deadlock Broken in Korean Red Cross Talks
description: PANMUNJOM, Korea, June 5The longstalemated Red Cross talks between North Korea and South Korea achieved a breakthrough today when working level delegates agreed on a draft agenda for a fulldress conference aimed at reuniting members of families separated in the two Koreas.

title: THOMAS TO CONDUCE CONCERTS FOR YOUNG
description: The New York Philharmonic has named Michael Tilsgn Thomas director and conductor of its Young People's Concerts for the next two seasons. He succeeds Leonard Bernstein, who is giving up this position after 15 seasons because of heavy commitments elsewhe0.

title: Carrier Sails for War After Norfolk Protest
description: NORFOLK, Va., June 5 (AP)The aircraft carrier America sailed today for Vietnam after the Coast Guard cleared the way of antiwar protesters so the big ship could move from her Norfolk Naval Station pier to an ammunition loading anchorage.

title: Trackmen Miss College Routine
description: LOS ANGELES, June 5Last year, Ralph Mann, Sid Sink, Pat Matzdorf, Cary Feldmann, Marty Liguori and Jim Green were the toprated Americans in their track and field specialties, with international credentials that seemed certain to carry them to medals in the 1972 Olympics.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Samuel Ungerleicler Jr. Dead; Pulp and Paper Executive, 55
description: Samuel Ungerleider Jr., senior vice president of Gottesman & Co., Inc., and the Central National Corporation, investment and paper and pulp merchants, died yesterday at his home on Oak Lane in Larchmont, N.Y., after a long illness. He was 55 years old.

title: KAIVIACHI DEFEATS GARCIA AT FORUM
description: Cemal Kamaci of Istanbul, Turkey, made his first appearance in an American boxing ring last night and scored resounding victory over Angel (Robinson) Garcia, a muchtraveled Cuban who now makes his home in Venezuela.

title: Orderly Seattle Audience Cheers Rolling Stones
description: SEATTLE, June 5The Rolling Stones, the popular British rock group, began a new American tour here yesterday at an afternoon concert in Seattle's Coliseum.

title: Roy Gussow Wins an $87,500 Sculpture Commission,
description: The sculptor Roy Gussow, noted for his abstract works in stainless steel, has won the $87,500 commission in a sculpture competition sponsored by the city. The competition calls for a large, freestanding sculpture to be placed at the entrance of the new Family Court building at Lafayette and Leonard Streets, a 12story, $27million structure scheduled for completion in 1974.

title: U.S. JETS DESTROY A BRIDGE IN NORTH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, June 6  The relative lull in the Vietnam war persisted yesterday as skirmishes and shelling incidents were reported from various parts of the country.

title: Executive Changes
description: Leopold Amolsky has been elected vice president of Interstate Stores, Inc.

title: Pay Board's Delay May Aid City Budget
description: The city could enact a $9.4billion budget without imposing new taxes and with only minimal layoffs under a plan being considered by the Lindsay administration, Deputy Mayor Edward K. Hamilton said yesterday.

title: AN ISRAELI SOLDIER SLAIN BY GUERRILLAS
description: TEL AVIV, June 5The military command said that an Israeli soldier was killed today in an ambush by Arab guerrillas near Quneitra on the occupied Golan heights of Syria.

title: LAIRD PROJECTS BIG RISE IN COST OF VIETNAM MR
description: WASHINGTON, June 5Secretary of Defense MelVin R. Laird told Congress today that the expanded military activity in Vietnam could add $3billion to $5billion to the defense budget in the corning fiscal year, virtually doubling the projected annual cost of the war.

title: TITO IS WELCOMED IN SOVIET WARMLY
description: MOSCOW, June 5President Tito of Yugoslavia, often the target of sharp attacks from Moscow because of his historic independeRce, today received warm welcome and one of the highest Soviet awards, the Order of Lenin, on his first state visit to the Soviet Union in seven years.

title: Bridge: By Overcoming a Big Deficit Mason's Team Wins Reisinger
FREE PARKING SET AT MERRICK PLAY
description: David Merrick has arranged for patrons holding orchestra and mezzanine tickets to his latest show, Sugar, to park free of charge Monday through Friday evenings at the Bowser Garage on West 45th Street between Broadway and Eighth Avenue.

title: Notes on People
description: The people who knew him as the Salad Oil King of Bayonne, N. J., would hardly have recognized Anthony (Tino) De Angelis as he walked out of Federal prison at Lewisburg, Pa.

title: Pakistan Says U.S. Sought Reversal on Drug Names
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, June 5 Pakistan's Health Minister said today that the United States and West Germany had brought pressure to bear on the Government in an attempt to reverse a decision to switch fipm brand names to generic names of medicines their companies manufacture here for sale in Pakistan

title: 11 OPEC Members Ask Concerns for Equity Share
description: VIENNA, June 5The head of an organization representing 11 oil producing countries warned today that if the countries demands for 20 per cent equity ownership in Westernowned facilities were not met, they might well nationalize the properties, as Iraq did last week. Their eventual aim is for 51 per cent participation, he said.

title: MISS HANKS HONORED WITH CASALS DEGREE
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., June 5 The Conservatory of Puerto Rico, founded by Pablo.Casals 13 years ago, conferred honorary doctorates last night on Nancy Hanks, President Nixon's cultural adviser, and Alexander Schneider, the New York violinist, who organized the CasaIs Festivals, first in Prades and since 1957 here in San Juan.

title: Chinese Jar Auctioned For a Record $573,300
description: LONDON, June 5A 14thcentury Chinese wine jar was sold for $573,300 here today, establishing an auction record for a work of art other than a painting.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Air Alert in Birmingham
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., June 5 (UPI)Health officials today declared the second air pollution alert in four days for this industrial city, just 24 hours after the earlier alert was lifted. A spokesman for the Jefferson County Health Department said the pollution level in north Birmingham this afternoon was 425 micrograms of particulate matter per cubic meter of air. An alert is declared when the level exceeds 375 micrograms.

title: William N. Doniger Dead at 64; Headed McGregor Sportswear
description: William N. boniger, chairman and chief executive officer of McGregorDoniger, Inc., who introduced many new fabrics and fashions in men's sportswear, died Saturday night in United Hospital, Port Chester, N. Y., after a heart attack. He was 64 years old and lived at 32 Norman Drive, Rye, N. Y.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CALDWELL BAND VS. THE ELEMENTS
description: The storm that drenched the city early Sunday evening proved to be bad luck for New Jersey's James Caldwell High School Band. Rain, thunder and lightning notwithstanding, the band played on, comparatively high and dry underneath the. Guggenheim Memorial Band Shell in Lincoln Center, but had virtually no audience.

title: From Campus to Cop
description: ALLSTON, Mass.The question I've heard most since deciding to become a policeman is: Why would you want to be a cop? The implication, I believe, is that I could have gotten into a more prestigious line of work, something with greater financial reward, more palatable surroundings and considerably less danger.

title: TOXICITY IS FOUND IN SHARKS OFF L.I.
description: MONTAUK, L. I., June. 5A Long Island research oceanographer said today that toxic levels of mercury had been found only in the mako shark among the six varieties of edible fish that he had tested in Long Island waters in the, last two years.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: UTILITIES APPROVE RISE IN RESEARCH
description: SAN DIEGO, June 5  The Edison Electric Institute approved today a greatly expanded research program, beginning next January, that would add up to $137million a year to the electricity bills paid by the customers of the 183 utility companies that make up its membership.

title: Illinois Looking Into Reports Of Fixes at Chicago Track
description: CHICAGO, June 5 (UPI)The Illinois Racing Board chairman, Alexander MacArthur, said today his office was investigating reports that a racefixing ring had been operating at Maywood Park.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The McDonald's Corporation announced yesterday that it had filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission covering a secondary offering of 554,043 shares of the common stock of the company, giving effect to the restaurant chain's previously announced twoforone stock split payable June 5 to holders of record May 22. According to the announcement, the shares are being sold for the accounts of 42 selling shareholders and the corporation will not receive any of the proceeds of the offering, the principal underwriter for which is Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis, Inc. The company's stock, traded on the New York Stock Exchange was down 1 at 111 at yesterday's close.

title: BEARING IS ASKED IN ELLSBERG CASE
description: LOS ANGELES, June 5Lawyers for Dr. Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony 3. Russo, who are accused of stealing the Pentagon papers, argued in a Federal court today that the court should permit a pretrial hearing of witnesses that would show that leaks of classified Government documents were a routine practice of Washington officials.

title: MARKET POUNDED; DOW INDEX OFF 7
description: The stock market was pounded yesterday in a manner reminiscent of the Blue Monday syndrome affecting prices during the last bear market.

title: Carolina Democrats Backed
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., June. 5A black civil rights lawyer, MattheW J. Perry, defended the South.Carolina Democratic patty today against charges of discrimination in the delegate selection process. The challenge by a group of predominantly white young people is being heard by George P. Taylor, chief counsel with the Lawyers Committee for Civil Rights Under Law in Jackson Miss.

title: AMTRAK SET TO PAY PENNSY $17MILLION
description: The bankrupt Penn Central Transportation Company announced yesterday that Amtrak, the National Railroad Passenger Corporation, had agreed to pay the carrier an extra $17.1million for the avoidable costs of operating intercity passenger trains until June 30, 1973.

title: Court Rules That Objector Was Wrongfully Assigned
description: RICHMOND. June 5 (UPI)The United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit ruled today that the Selective Service System had wrongfully ordered a New York conscientious objector to work in a Greensboro, N.C. hospital.

title: Russians Hail Davis Acquittal as a Victory for the Progressive American
description: MOSCOW, June 5  The Soviet Union, after having made a virtual folk heroine of Angela Davis, today hailed her acquittal yesterday as a victory for the progressive American and world community.

title: Dakotan Woos Governors
description: HOUSTON, June 5Senator George McGovern, concerned over the response that the prospect of his nomination for the Presidency has aroused among Democratic. Governors, arrived at the National Governors Conference tonight on a political pacification mission.

title: N.B.A. Says It Keeps Its Nose Out of A.B.A.'s Future Plans
description: Commissioner Walter Kennedy of the National Basketball Association reacted to queries about the rival American Basketball Association yesterday. with the attitude that the A.B.A. was running its own business.

title: Federal Control Urged
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 5 (AP)Secor D. Browne, chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board, recommended today that the Federal Government take over responsibility, including costs, of operating the antihijacking system.

title: Marshall Joins Study Unit
description: Alton G. Marshall, president of Rockefeller Center, has been named a member of the city commission studying private cartmen that was established in late May, the Mayor's office said yesterday. The committee, headed by Irving Schneider, executive director of HelmsleySpear, Inc., the real estate concern, will study what parts of the city's garbage and refuse should be collected by private cartmen.

title: Raceway Merger Approved
description: Directors of the Madison Squaire Garden Corporation and Roosevelt Raceway, Inc., yesterday approved in principle their merger, with Roosevelt Racefway becoming a wholly owned subsidiary of Madison Square Garden, which bolds 96.9 per cent of its outstanding stock.

title: Organizer Asks New Legal Concepts AsWorld Environment Parley Opens
description: STOCKHOLM, June 5The United Nations Conference on the. Human Environment opened today with a declaration by its chief organizer that global environmental demands required new concepts of sovereignty, new codes of international law, and new international means of managing the oceans and the atmosphere for the benefit of mankind.

title: Jersey Youth Loses Legs
description: TEMPE, Ariz., June 5 (AP)Stephen Rosenberg, 19 years old, of Clifton, N. J., lost both legs yesterday when he fell beneath the wheels of a passing freight train, the police said. They sttid he had been traveling with a knapsack and a sleeping bag.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 Get 2 Degrees Apiece And a 2d Chance at Jobs
description: Victor Langhorne, at 23, graduated from an allblack high school in southern Virginia, and fbr a few years it looked as if he would end up traveling the Midwest as an evangelist. He was good at preaching, but he had grown disillusioned with some of his superiors. Still, he thought, it was better than selling magazines or picking tobacco in the Connecticut Valley for 60 cents an hour.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX REGISTER A DROP
description: Many small investors apparently discovered the shares of American Israeli Paper Mills, Ltd., yesterday. Trading in the shares, which was halted last week because of an influx of buy orders, was resumed yesterday and then halted again about 15 minutes later.

title: CARTERWALLACE IN QUARTER DROP
description: Net Income of CarterWallace, Inc., in the fiscal year ended March 31 rose to a record high despite a 26 per cent decline in fourthquarter profits, the producer of drugs and toiletries reported yesterday.

title: Colombo Gunplay Is Linked to Revenge
description: A wellplanned but badly executed attempt to even the score for the murder of Joseph Gallo triggered a volley of gunfire early yesterday morning in front of. the Brooklyn home of Joseph A. Colombo Sr.,, according to investigators close to the case.

title: 118 Transit Policemen Are Honored for Bravery
description: Five transit policemen received their department's. highest award, the Medal of Honor, yesterday for performing acts of outstanding bravery at immediate personal risk to life. They were among 118 transit policemen receiving awards for valor in the department's fifth annual presentation ceremony.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: The Democratic party needs a Southerner on its national election ticket in order to beat President Nixon, and Representative Wilbur D. Mills of Arkansas is probably the best choice, Representative Shirley Chisholm, Democrat of Brooklyn, who is campaigning for the Democratic nomination for President, said yesterday.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: TRENTON, June 5  One of the most enduring tenets among the oldline Democratic party organizations in New Jersey is that a light turnout on primary day invariably keeps them in power and their candidates in office. A clubhouse canard goes something like this: If nobody rocks the boat, nobody gets wet.

title: LEVITZ FURNITURE SKIDS 12 TO 47
description: Shares of the Levitz Furniture Corporation plunged sharply yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange in the first market reaction to the disclosure of charges against the company by the Securities and Exthange Commission.

title: Boycott of Seoul Assembly By Ruling Party Protested
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 5 Some 80 opposition members of the National Assembly staged a street demonstration there today protesting a fivemonth boycott of Assembly sessions by the governing Democratic Republican party.

title: Move Hailed in Europe
description: LONDON, June 5 (AP)A number of European newspapers today hailed the acquittal of Miss Davis as a demonstration of the impartiality of American justice.

title: Advertising:
description: Substantiation of Advertising Claims was the topic yesterday for the Eastern Annual Conference of the American Association of Advertising Agencies. And judging from the turnout it is a hot topic.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: EXEMPTIONS RAISED ON TAX FOR ELDERLY
description: ALBANY, June 6Governor Rockefeller's office announced today he had signed into law a bill raising to $6,000 the maximum income eligibility level for propertytax relief for elderly'persons.

title: Nelson Dean Jay Is Dead at 89; Headed Morgan Bank in Paris
description: Nelson Dean Jay, the banker who headed the Paris affiliate of J, P. Morgan & Co from 1920 to 1941 and again after World War II, died yesterday at his home on Ridge Road in Syosset, L. I. He was 89 years old.

title: JAPAN ZIPPERS TOPIC OF DUMPING INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (Reuters)The Treasury said today it was beginning an investigation to see if imports of Japanese permanent magnets and zippers were being dumped, or sold in the United States at less than fair value.

title: U.N. Parley Appeals for Curbs On the Release of Toxic Metals
description: STOCKHOLM, June 6Delegates to the United Nations environmental conference approved today an appeal to all countries to minimize the release of toxic metals and chemicals into the environment,

title: German Doctor Is Acquitted In Nazi Killing of the Insane
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, June 6 (Reuters)  A court here acquitted a former doctor today of a charge of helping M the killing of thousands of the mentally ill during the Hitler era. It said his contention that he acted from humane considerations had not been disproved,

title: OneYear Term
description: Executive vice president of American Telephone and Telegraph... Native of Boston and graduate of Boston College.... Began career with Bell System as installer for New England Telephone in 1937. Became president of New York Telephone, largest unit in system, in 1965, when its service problems were rising to a peak.... Rejoined A.T,&T. in charge of rate planning and government relatibns in 1970... Widower; will be 59 next month.... Director of Marine Midland Banks, W. R. Grace & Co.

title: Longtime Love of Theater
description: To Colorado residents and those of the Rocky Mountains. area, Helen G. Bonfils was the proprietor of The Denver Post and a patron of the theater, in that order. In New York, her betterknown association was with the stage., recently, she was a.backr of Sleuth, a Tony Award winner in the 197071 Broadway season:

title: Ribicoff Shows Carnpaign Style at Booksellers'
description: WASHINGTON, June 6Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff, a veteran of three decades of political battles, entered into a new kind of contest today, that of an author seeking public recognitionand salesfor his book.

title: HUMPHREY LOSES
description: LOS ANGELES, June 6Senator George McGovern of South Dakota won California's Democratic Presidential primary today and with it 271 delegate. votes at the Democratic National Convention.

title: Hospital Moves Wallace Out of Intensive Care Unit
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., June 6 (AP)Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama was moved out of the intensive care unit today and into a private room at Holy Cross Hospital.

title: 464 Coal Miners T rapped By Explosion in Rhodesia
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, June 6A coal mine explosion trapped 464 Rhodesian miners underground today, and hopes for their survival dimmed after 10 hours of rescue efforts. failed to establish contact with them. The blast occurred at the Wankie Colliery in northwestern, Rhodesia 300 miles froth SaliSbury.

title: PUPIL BUSING PLAN IN RICHMOND AREA UPSET ON APPEAL
description: RICHMOND, June 6  A United States court of appeals here struck down today a Federal judge's order to merge the schools of Richmond with those of two adjoining counties. It ruled that the order went beyond the judicial authority of the courts.

title: Helen G. Bonfils Dead at 82; Chairman of The Denver Post
description: DENVER, June 6 (AP)Helen G. Bonfils, chairman of the board of The Denver Post, and a patron of the theater here and in New York, died todayr at St. Joseph Hospital after long illness marked by heart trouble. She was 82 years old.

title: Notes on. People
description: To thank her supporters, Angela Davis will leave Friday on a threeweek nationwide tour, ending v.jith a starstudded Evening With Angela in Madison Square Garden on June 29.

title: Removal of Lindsay Asked
description: Councilman Edward V. Curry of Richmond, who is at home ill, had a resolution introduced at yesterday's City Council meeting calling on Governor Rockefeller to institute removal proceedings against Mayor Lindsay. The resolution was referred to the Committee on General Welfare. Apprised, of the resolution, Thomas B. Morgan, the Mayor's press secretary, said: Today's prize for silly, political publicity goes to Councilman Curry.

title: McGovern Wins Home State
description: SIOUX FALLS, S. D., June 6 (AP)Senator George McGovern captured his home state's 17 delegates to the Democratic National Convention without opposition in today's South Dakota primary.

title: SETTLEMENTS SET IN SALADOIL SUITS
description: Justice Jacob Markowitz confirmed yesterday a referee's report on the settlements of two suits brought as a result of the famous 1963 saladoil scandal.

title: LANSKY INDICTED IN. U.S. TAX PLOT
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP) Meyer Lansky and one of his reputed longtime associates were indicted today by a Federal grand jury on charges of conspiring to avoid paying taxes on money allegedly received from gamblers on junkets to George Raft's Colony Sporting Club in London, England.

title: N.Y.U. Official to Head L.I.U. Brooklyn Center
description: The vice chancellor for administration at New York University, Dr. Lester Brookner, has been appointed president of Long Island University's financially troubled Brooklyn Center.

title: Sheetmetal Union Hailed On Admitting Minorities
description: Louis L. Levine, State Industrial Commissioner, yesterday commended Local 28 of the Sheetmetal Workers International Association on its minority group representation in class of apprentices graduating to journeymen status.

title: Arab Exporters to Meet
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 6 (Reuters)The Arab Oraniza tion of Petroleum Exporting Countries is expected to hold an emergency meeting here tomorrow or on Sunday to discuss ways of backing Iraq against the nationalized Iraq Petroleum Company.

title: Stage: Stratford Festival Reaches 20
description: STRATFORD, Ontario, June 6  It is remarkable how quickly the unknown can become the established, and the established can become the Establishment. The Stratford Festival opened its 20th season last night. It has expanded from its original and imaginative tent and now occupies three permanent stages. When it started it employed 65actors for 12 weeks. Now it employes over 100 actors, some for as long as 10 months. The festival, which runs through Oct. 21; is one of the most important theater events in the world, and the company is one of the best in North America.

title: France Sets New Goal
description: PARIS, June 6 (Reuters)France's Finance Minister, Valery Giscard d'Estaing, told the National Accounts Commission today that the Government intended to aim for A 5.8 per cent rise in volume',.in the gross national product during 1973.

title: Cayman Islands Bank Unit
description: LONDON, June 7 (Reuters)The LBI Bank and Trust Company (Cayman), Ltd., has been incorporated as a subsidiary, Lloyds and Bolsa International Bank, Ltd., announced today.

title: Dakotan Beats Humphrey By a Big Margin in Jersey
description: Senator George McGovern overwhelmed Senator ,Hubert H. Humphrey in yesterday's Democratic Presidential primary election in New Jersey. The South Dakotan held 5t1 majorities in some counties, capturing at least 65 committed delegates to the national convention and leading in races for '18 others of the state's 109.

title: TwoYear Term
description: Chairman and chief executive officer of J. C. Penney Company, one of the nation's largest retailing organizations.... 1971 sales: $4.8billion.... Born in Reedy, W. Va., 63 years ago... Graduated from Ohio State University with degree in economics Joined J. C. Penney as a parttime salesman in 1928 and became a fulltime salesman in 1935. Army lieutenant colonel in Office of the Quartermaster General during World War II.... Rejoined Penney as personnel representative, became vice president in 1953, president in 1958 and chairman in 1964.... Director of A.T.&T., Boeing, First National City Bank.

title: At Revlon, a Controversy Over Who Wears the Pants
description: Elegant, chic, cool, daring or demure, little girl or siren, whatever her Image, she's always garbed in fashion that's not one millimeter off the moment. She's the Revlon girlthe one who models in the advertisements for the newest lipstick, eye shadow or gel.

title: Ashley Retires as Referee
description: MONTREAL, June 6 (AP) Referee John Ashley has retired from the National Hockey League officiating staff, the league said today.

title: Osborne, McManus Are Beaten
description: HAMBURG, Germany, June 6 (UPI)  Istvan Gulyas, the 41yearold Hungarian, ousted Jim Osborn of Honolulu at the start of the German open tennis championships today, 61, 57, 64, 36, 62. Osborne ranks 12th in the United States.

title: Twins to Activate Oliva
description: BALTIMORE, June 6. (AP)Tony Oliva, the Minnesota Twins' slugger, will be activated Thursday when Steve Brye, a rookie outfielder, leaves for two weeks of military duty. Oliva has been on the disabled list all season.

title: Teachers Will Bar Parent Intruders
description: Members of the United Federation of Teachers have voted to walk out of their classrooms if community school boards or principals allow groups of parents to come in to observe and evaluate their performance.

title: 2 Inmates Slightly Injured As Ossining Convicts Fight
description: OSSINING, N. Y., June 6 (AP) Two inmates were treated for minor cuts today after a fight broke out at. Ossining Correctional Facility

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP) The United States acknowledged today that it had received a note from the Philip pines on the use of military bases. It declared that no longrange missiles had been in stalled in the Philippines and that there were nd plans to install any.

title: Draft Calls for Ecological Responsibility
description: STOCKHOLM, June 6The concept that countries have new international responsibilities toward each other for actions affecting the environment received strong support today as the United Nations environmental conference got down to its first full day of business.

title: Sabena Chief Urges a Fare Rise On Trans.Atlantic Airline Route
description: The president of Sabena Belgian World Airlines said yesterday that the scheduled transAtlantic airline industry was on the brink of a huge and collective bankruptcy and must raise fares and reduce capacity through self control to survive.

title: Gordon Parks to Get Medal
description: Gordon Parks, the author, film producer and photographer, has been named to receive the 57th Spingarn Medal that is awarded annually to the man or women of African descent and American citizenship who shall have made the highest achievement during the preceding year or years in any honorable field of human endeavor. Mr. Parks will receive the gold medallion on July 4 in Detroit during the 63d annual convention of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People.

title: Monetary System Intact
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (Reuters)  Monetary officials here believe the surge in the freemarket price of gold, will strengthen rather than weaken the operation of the twotier gold system, which began on March 17, 1968.

title: Red Smith
description: Riva Ridge had finished his morning exercises and Was cooling out on a sandy walking ring in the Belmont barn area. If this were Derby Week in Kentucky or Preakness Week in Baltimore, television cameras would be recording every move he made and any time ,he stepped out of his stall there would be front 10 to 100 witnesses looking on. This, though, is BelmontWeek in New York, and exactly two visitors, stood chatting With Lucien Laurin, the trainer. The little man was talking about, the colt's last hill dress rehearsal for the shoWcase event of New York racing.

title: Gas Concern Sees Net Rise
description: The Northern Illinois Gas Company expects a reasonable increase in 1972 earnings from the $2.80 a share in 1971, C. J. Gauthier, chairman and president, said yesterday at the annual meeting in Chicago. Mr. Gauthier added that the company had committed about $30million for gas exploration on offshore Louisiana acreage.

title: Texas Collects 14 Safeties in 63 Triumph
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., June 6The New York Yankees debut on Texas soil in a majorleague game developed,into a crushing reception tonight as they were outslugged by the Texas Rangers, 63.

title: Price Cuts Ordered
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI) The Price Commission today ordered three companies to reduce prices. The commission accused the Pittston Company, a New Yorkbased coal concern, and. Mallinckrodt Chemical Works of St. Louis of violating profit margin guidelines.

title: Police Dump Confiscated Weapons into Atlantic
description: One Thompson submachine gun, used; three crossbows with arrows; 105 sawedoff shotguns and machine guns; 539 rifles and fulllength shotguns; and a carbine on which a loving hand had scratched the name Emilia.

title: Islanders Spend Millions for Defense in N.H.L. Draft
description: MONTREAL, June 6  In an expansion draft punctuated with shouts of Who'i that? Long Island and Atlanta were admitted today to the National Hockey League, forming new clubs and swelling the league to 16 teams.

title: Finnegan Keeps Ring Title By Stopping Lubbers in 8th
description: LONDON, June 6 (AP) Chris Finnegan, a British light heavyweight, knocked out Jan Lubbers of the Netherlands after two minutes of the eighth round tonight and retained his European boxing crown.

title: Monetary ReServes Show Rise in West Germany
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, June 6 (Reuters)  West Germany's net monetary reserves increased by about 200million marks to around 64.1 billion in the week ended May 31, the Bundesbank announced today.

title: Books of The Times
description: I get restless in my chair when people start talking about death and rebirth as therapeutic techniques. Mr. Barrington includes fragmentation too, assuming that all us uptight types need to be exploded and strung back together more loosely. His book takes off from the idea of the psychopath and what we can borrow from him. With a little luck, we can shake off the anxiety engendered by "a godless universe..We can step off our linear path to the void and relax in a more circular state of being. Acquisition, advancement, and amassing prestige can all be put behind Us; as we learn to live without time or responsibility, to perform with grace, to heighten our sensations through indifference. There's only one hitch: as the author's hero, Timothy Leary, put it, we may have to go out of our minds to use our heads.

title: Stauffer Increases 3 Chemical Prices; Olin and Vulcan Act
description: The Stauffer Chemical Company announced yesterday it would increase prices of phosphoric anhydride by $2 a hundredweight and prices of electroless nickel and technical grades of sodium hypophosphite monohydrate by $3 a hundredweight effective July 1. Phosphoric anhydride is used as a chemical intermediate and sodium hypophosphite monohydrate is utilized in elec. troless plating. Stauffer said the price schedule for phosphoric anhydride was $20 a hundredweight in truckloads; $22 a hundredweight in less than truckload quantities, and $17.75 for truckload quantities in buyers drums. It said the premium for 60pound drums had been increased by $1 to $3.

title: Ellsbeig Defense Is Upheld by Judge On Pretrial Point
description: LOS ANGELES, June 6The defense won a partial victory in Federal District Court here today in pretrial arguments over the Pentagon papers.

title: U.S. Seeks to Cut Share Of Contributions to U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 6The State Department has laid down a stringent new policy aimed at reducing the share of the United States contributions to international organizations.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT Power. The. President signed a bill giving the Atomic Energy Commission authority to issue temporary operating licenses for nuclear power plants in areas threatened by power shortages. The interim licensing will mainly affect operation of new plants in Eastern and midwestern areas threatened by potential brownouts in times of peak power demand this summer, next winter and the summer after. An A.E.C. spokesman said it would take a little time to determine the plants that will receive the interim licenses.

title: ASBESTOS CODE KEPT DESPITE A WARNING
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Occupational Safety and Health Administration ordered today a continuation of asbestos dust exposure limits for four more years despite the recommendations by a scientific panel that they be cut by more than half.

title: Rockefellers Visit Johnsons
description: FREDERICKSBURG, TeX., June 6 (AP)Governor and Mrs. Rockefeller visited formec President and Mrs. Lyndon B. Johnson at the LBJ ranch today and joined their thosts for a round of golf at the Lady Bird Johnson Municipal Park in Fredericksburg.

title: War Seems Remote on Cruiser in the Gulf
description: ABOARD U.S.S. NEWPORT NEWS, off North Vietnam, June 2Seaman Walter Olivier is embarrassed that his shipmates call him killer. A slight boyish sailor With a :shock of blond hair that falls in his eyes, Seaman Olivier pulls the small brass trigger that fires this ship's huge, computeraimed 8inch guns. the heaviest afloat, in any navy.

title: 2 Rich Yonkers Races Off; Foreign Stars Won't Come
description: YONKERS, June 6The $100,000 Martin Tanenbaum International Pace at I  miles and its companion piece, the $50,000 Good Time Pace, have been canceled for this season. The Tanenbaum had been listed I for Aug. 4 and the Good Time for the following week at Yonkers Raceway.

title: FRAUD IS CHARGED TO APPLIANCE MEN
description: The city's Consumer Affairs Commissioner, Bess Myerson, and Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell charged yesterday that consumers played Russian roulette when they used washingmachine repairmen.

title: FRANK GARBELLANO
description: Frank Garbellano, former treasurer of the United ItalianAmerican Labor Council, who retired in 1968 as business agent of Local 89 of the International Ladies Garment Workers Union, died Monday in St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at 1140 81st Street, Brooklyn.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Brooklyn Prisoner a Suicide A 25yearold prisoner in the Brooklyn House Detention for Men hanged himself yesterday in his cell using a bedsheet attached to the cell door. The prisoner, Garry Enge of 475 21st Street, in the South Brooklyn section, had been detoxified with methadone. He was found dead at 6:20 A.M. He was admitted to the institution May 9 in lieu of $1,000 bail awaiting trial on charges of forged instruments and criminal possession of stolen property and drugs.

title: Lay Leader of Southern Baptists Owen Cooper
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 6When the Southern Baptist Convention ends it threeday annual meeting here on Thursday, the man who will take over the gavel as its newly elected president will be a tall, selfassured, hardnosed.businessman from Mississippi named Owen Cooper. Mr. Cooper, elected today to head the nation's largest Protestant denomination, as the first layman in the post since 1959. But his preaching style, polished over the course of 22 years as a Sunday school teacher and superintendent in his native Yazoo City, is said to rival that of any practicing min ister.

title: Roundup: Blue's Roommate Helps Get Him Off Hook
description: The Oakland Athletics are still waiting for Vida Blue's first victory, but they're doing nicely without his help.

title: Year of Tampa Busing Finds Adults Wary, Pupils Content
description: TAMPA, Fla.  For nine months now, the 110,000 students and teachers in the Hillsborough County school system have lived at peace with one of the country's most volatile sociopolitical issues;the use of busing to achieve racial balance.

title: ... and Heedless Unions
description: Disregarding the extent to which the city's budget crisis stems from raising wages without return employe productivity, the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association is bent on starting a new pay scramble in municipal unionism.

title: Reynolds Securities to Buy a Coast Firm
description: Reynolds Securities, Inc., an investmentbankingand brokerage firm, agreed in principle yesterday to acquire Brush, Slocumb & Co., Inc., a San Franciscobased securities firm next month. It has a net worth of $1.1million.

title: Advertising:
description: The staff of The Harvard Lampoon, which in the recent past has parodied Playboy, Time and Life, was faced with the difficult decision of what to take on next Sports Illustrated or Cosmopolitan. They opted for Cosmo. How else could they use a male nude centerfold?

title: Screen: 'The Green Wall'
description: Armando Robles Godoy's "The Green Wall" is probably the first, truly native Peruvian feature most of us have ever seen, since only three or four Peruvian features have been made in the last 25 years, none of which, to the best of my knowledge, have been shown in New York, at lease outside Spanish language theaters.It is a sincere, solemn movie, technically first-rate and terribly well-meaning, about a young Lima salesman who, with his wife and baby son, abandons city life to hack a farm out of the jungle. Robles Godoy, who himself did just that for eight years, mixes a liberal social conscience with a mystical appreciation for rugged individualism and the beauties of nature, which usually evoke a Bach cantata on the soundtrack. On the other hand, the horrors of city lifeslums, flat tires, telephones that don't work, cripples, government bureaucracy  evoke modern jazz, which says a lot less about flat tires and whatnot than I suspect the director thinks it does.Julio Aleman, a leading Mexican actor, and Sandra Riva, a nonprofessional Peruvian actress, are quite fine as the reasonably courageous, modern pioneers. That their love for each other, their child and their land is not more deeply felt is the result of the kind of overly imaginative directorial approach that, on one occasion, puts the audience into the body of a snake in the grass. Robles Godoy substitutes ornamentation (eccentric camera angles, filters, freeze frames, soundtrack music) for a rigorous style that might have communicated some sense of what the movie is all about.Although "The Green Wall" comes to us via festivals in Chicago and Karlovy Vary, Czechoslovakia, where it was reportedly acclaimed, I found it dull, and maybe even a little less humanistic than it pretends.It could be that stories about people fleeing civilization don't appeal to me. Such gestures are romantic, but less important than trying to make civilization work, than the changes and accommodations that must be effected if somehow we are all to survive.

title: CONNALLYINCARACAS ON FIRST TOUR STOP
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, June 6 (AP)  Treasury Secretary John B. Connally arrived in Caraces today for talks with President Rafael Caldera on United States oil interests.

title: TwoYear Term
description: First black governor of the Big Board.... Named United States Ambassador to Sweden in 1970.... Formerly president of Hampton Institute, a black college in Virginia, for 10 years.... 62yearold native of Auburn, N. Y., which last year named a high school stadium in his honor.... Nickname is Brud.... Worked his way through Cornell, where he majored in sociology and was AllAmerica football end.... Member of National Football Hall of Fame.... Won Ph.D. in sociology at University of Pennsylvania in 1950....Director of Eberstadt Fund, Firemen's Insurance Company.... On boards of Cornell, M.I.T. and College of the Virgin Islands.

description: The New Riders of the Purple Sage, a country rook group that has had strong professional and spiritual ties with, the Grateful Dead, revealed both the assets and the debits of that association at Carnegie Hall on Sunday and. Monday,.

Advertising:

description: The Federal Government will provide up to $300,000 to the city for a preliminary study of an area in the Crown Heights section,; of Brooklyn that may pave the wayfor a series of national _experiments, it was ,an flounced yesterday.

The clerk, Richard V. Anderson, said his workers would start tabulating tomorrow morning.

title: A. ADRIAN ALBERT, ALGEBRA EXPERT
description: CHICAGO, June 6 (AP)Dr. A. Adrian Albert, a mathematician and a member of the University of Chicago faculty for 41 years, died today at the age of 66.

description: MANILA, Suns 6 (UPI)The Philippines has called for toplevel talks with the United States to ascertain how long the United States intends to use its military bases in the Philippines and whether it has installed longrange missiles in the bases or is planning to do so.

title: OneYear Term
description: Chairman of Toledobased OwensIllinois, Inc., nation's largest manufacturer of glass containers and a leading manufacturer of paper containers... 1971 sales: $1.5billion.... Born in San Francisco 62 years ago... Majored in economics at Stanford and graduated from Harvard Business School... Entire business career with OwensIllinois... Became president in 1965 and chairman in 1968.... Director of AllisChalmers, Marathon Oil, National Petro Chemicals, Ohio Citizens Trust Company.

Received bachelor's and law degres from Stanford University... As Army colonel in 1942, supervised evacuation of JapaneseAmericans from the West Coast; also served in Europe.. Special assistar to James Forrestal, first Se,. retary of Defense... Assistant Secretary and Under Secretary of the Army during Korean War ,.. Joined Champion Papers in 1952 and became chairman in 1965; company merged, with U.S. Plywood in 1967.

description: SAIGON, Wednesday, June 7 (AP)United States officials said yesterday that the North Vietnamese, with their harbors mined, their two railways to China cut and much of their highway system severed, were turning more to small craft and barges to move supplies.

description: Chairman and chief executive officer of the RCA Corporation, whose multibilliondollar operations range from electronics and broadcasting to car rentals, carpets arAci book publishing.... Son of the late David Sarnoff,, who built the Radio Corporation of America into a major enterprise.. 53 years old and a native New Yorker.. Graduated from Harvard in 1939... Navy officer in World War II.... joined National Broadcasting Company, an RCA subsidiary, in 1948 and became its president in 1970.

description: The problemit has hundreds of variationsgoes something like this: In a twodifference train, what connects to a large, thin, red circle:

title: CANDIDATE'S SON IS SLAIN IN TEXAS

title: Reporter's Notebook: Isolated North Korea Isolates Visitors, Too
description: PYONGYANG, North Korea To visit North Korea is like entering some remote kingdom of ancient times, possi. bly that hermitlike Chosen from which the present country evolved. In the 19th century the Kingdom of Chosen fought fiercely against all Westerners who sought to open it to trade and commerce, sank and burned ships, including those of Americans, and massacred missionaries in an effort to preserve an independent life and culture.

They added that French officials would not be able to attend such a meeting.

It was especially fitting that he should do so at a Harvard convocation com memorating the 25th anniversary of Secretary of State George C. Marshall's proposal of the European recovery program.

title: Letters to the Editor

No mention was made anywhere in the article of the action already taken to deal with this problem. When The Times reportslhat public safety is endangered, it Seems reasonable that your readers sheigd be told whether or not steps have,beett taken to protect them against such danger.

description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (Reuters)Senate leaders today decided on a showdown vote Thursday on the nomination of Richard G. Kleindienst to be Attorney General.

Althougha bill to give the Taxi and Limousine Commission authority to license the gypsies is bottled up in the City Council, Al Kanner, president of the Independent Taxi Owners Council, reportedly told the meeting that the fight against the bill far from over.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Combined Insurance Company of America yesterday announced through its public relations representatives that it has filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission covering a proposed secondary offering of 2,000,000 of the company's common shares. The shares, traded on the over ,the counter market are, being sold, the announcement said, by Mr. and Mrs. W. Clement Stone, the W. Clement and Jessie V. Stone Foundation, and Combined Registry Company, which is owned, by Mr. and Mrs. Stone. W. Clement Stone is chairman and chief executive officer of Combilled. According to the announcement W. Clement Stone indicated that the reason for the share offering was his desire to fulfill and continue longstanding philanthropic commitmeats, tax considerations and other financial undertakings. The company presently has 25,292,209 common shares outstanding. The stock closed yesterday on the counter market at 2727, down .

description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 61 (UPI)  Lebanon will not nationalize a pipeline owned by the Iraq Petroleum Company though Baghdad took over the company in Iraq last week, Lebanon's Premier, Saeb Salam, said today.

The additional invitations thus mitigated an embarrassment that arose last Saturday when the Penn eight won the national title impressively at Syracuse.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Reading an OpEd article in your newspaper of May 27 by Fred Lovgren, national coordinator of the Student Mobilization Committee and coordinator of the National Peace Action Coalition, I am moved to ask a few questions to which I don't really expect answers:

title: FREDERICK HAGEN JR.
description: RIDGEWOOD, N.J., June 6Frederick Hagen Jr., a recruiting and placement administrator for. International Business Machines Corporation, died today in the Valley Hospital. He was 45 years old and lived at 230 Bedford Road.

title: BAY STATE DRIVERS MUST AWAIT REBATE
description: BOSTON, June 6 (AP)Massachusetts motorists can expect a long wait before getting the premium rebates on compulsory bodily injury insurance resulting from yesterday's ruling by the State Supreme Court.

description: DETROIT, June 6Detroit's School Board adopted a budget plan today that would reduce the academic year by 35 per cent for Detroit's 291,000 public schoolchildren.

title: Hypocrisy on Rhodesia
description: Forty Senatorsonly twofifths of the membership but a slim majority of those present and votinghave dealt another blow against the credibility of the United States and the prospects for building an effective United Nations. On the spurious arguments of Senator Harry Byrd and others, they have voted in effect to require this country to continue to breach the sanctions invoked with American support by the U.N. Security Council against the white racist rulers of Rhodesia.

title: LEVITZ PRESIDENT RESIGNS HIS POST
description: Leon J. Levitz resigned yes terday as president of the Levitz Furniture Corporation, which is currently facing charges by the Securities and Exchange Commission that it has violated securities laws. A Inew fiveman executive committee was named to help administer the affairs of the retail furniture company.

title: A White House View of McGovern
description: WASHINGTON  President Nixon's journey to Moscow provides an excellent prism through which to view recent demands by Democratic hopefuls for a precipitous withdrawal from Vietnam. Their broadly publicized notion that we can simply pack up and pull out with a claim that we have done all that could be expected harkens back to the unusual ethical proposition advanced by Pilate who thought he could cleanse his conscience by washing his hands.

title: Cities Service Will Halt Some of Its Manufacturing

title: OPEN QUALIFIERS PACED BY HARNEY, LETELLIER AT 142
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 6 I really don't look forward to ,playing at Pebble Beach because they tell me the rough is afoot high, said Paul Harney today after he was assured he had qualified for the United States Open. The golf tournament begins June 15 at Pebble Beach, Calif.

title: KENNY'S MACHINE LOSES IN HUDSON
description: A coalition of reformminded mayors and insurgent Democrats defeated the organization of the aging party boss John V. Kenny yesterday In a hotly contested primary election in Hudson County.

title: Holder and Girlfriend Sentenced to Up to 12 Years for Conspiring to Murder Mrs. Holder
description: MINEOLA, L. I., June 6Howard Holder, a former Brooklyn school principal, and his girl friend, Mrs. Lynnor Gershenson, were sentenced today to up to 12 years in prison for conspiring to murder Mrs. Joan Holder nearly two years ago.

title: Eastland Renominated With 70% of Vote
description: JACKSON, Miss., June 6 Senator James 0. Eastland, a conservative Democrat, easily defeated two rivals for the Democratic nomination, and James H. Meredith, the nationally known black, civil rights activist, failed to win the Republican nomination for the Senate in the Mississippi primaries today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: When the Lockheed Corporation de veloped money trouble, it went to the Federal Government and got money to stay in business.

title: First Squadrons of Navy's F14 Jet Due in Fall
description: WOODBURY, L. I., June 6The chief of Grumman's F14 program said today that the first fighter squadrons of the controversial new Navy jet would be formed sometime this fall in California.

title: Pacemaker Proves Best Friend of Man's Best Friend
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 6The guest of honor came to the picnic here today wagging his tail and wearing a pacemaker to stimulate his ailing heart.

title: Rites Held at Robert Kennedy's Grave
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 Family members and about a hundred invited guests attended memorial services for Senator Robert F. Kennedy under gray skies at Arlington National Cemetery early today on the fourth anniversary of his death.

title: Judge Is on Trial in Brooklyn Charged With Buying His Post
description: A Suffolk County State Supreme Court justice went on trial in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday on charges related to allegations that he bought his nomination for, the post for $50,000.

title: RUTH MUMBAUER, 57; NUTRITION EDITOR
description: Ruth K. Mumbauer, nutrition j editor of Family Circle magazine, died of cancer on Friday in St. Vincent's Hospital. She was 57 years old and lived at 12 East 12th Street.

title: SURVIVORS WILL GET ISRAELI PAYMENTS
description: JERUSALEM, June 6 (AP)The families of the 25 victims in the Tel Aviv airport massacre last week will receive compensation equal to a living wage in Israel, a spokesman for the national health insurance program said today.

title: Jack Gets 3 Months and $5,000 Fine For Conflict in Food Promotion Plot
description: Asemblyman Hulan E. Jack was sentenced yesterday to three months in prison on conflictofinterest charges of promoting food products in Harlem grocery stores.

title: Opera: Verdi Festival
description: The Metropolitan Opera's Verdi Festival began auspiciously Monday night with what Is arguably the composer's finest work, Otello, and with singing of a quality to make that argument stick. James McCracken's conception of the title role seemed far more subtly conveyed in the voice than it was only a few weeks ago when the Franco Zeffirelli production was introduced at the Metropolitan. The husky tenor acted with more restraint than In the past, too, evidently having discovered how little visual dramatizing is necessary in a score so musically telling as this one.

title: Baptists Are Taking to the Screen to Spread the Word
description: The American Baptist Convention is attempting this week to crack the New York metropolitan motionpicture market with a saturation showing of a film called The Cross and the Switchblade in more than 40 theaters.

title: OUTPUT OF JAPAN UP 5.7% FROM '71
description: TOKYO, June 6  Japan achieved a gross national product in real terms equivalent to $180.8billion in the fiscal year ending in March, up 5.7 per cent from the previous year.

title: TwoYear Term
description: A representative of investment institutions, an increasingly dominant influence on stock ownership and trading. Heads Teachers Insurance and Annuity Association and College Retirement Equities Fund, which provide insurance and pensions for college teachers and have a folio of about $4billion.... Both groups have been taking a stronger stance on social responsibilities of corporations in which they have investments.... Born in Indianapolis 57 years ago... Phi Beta Kappa graduate of Indiana University.... Master's and doctor's degrees from Harvard.... Navy officer in World War II... Married, three children.

title: Bills Sign Patulski
description: BUFFALO, June 6 (AP)The Buffalo. Bills announced tonight the signing of Walt Patulski, the No. 1 pick in the draft. The allAmerica defensive end from Notre Dame received a multiyear contract but refused to disclose its terms.

title: PAY BOARD DENIES DOCK UNION PLEA
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Pay Board declined today to restore the 15 cents an hour it sliced last month from negotiated wage increase in the East and Gulf Coast longshore industry.

title: M'GOVERN NEARS NOMINATION MARK

title: Epidemic of Typhoid Spreading in Central Mexico
description: Public Health Service officials said yesterday that the epidemic of typhoid fever that has spread through four central states of Mexico since last January was the largest in the world in several decades.

title: Militancy and Suspicion Mark Guineans
description: CONAKRY, Guinea  The visitor coming here from other African countries is struck by the militancy of the masses and a strong mood of suspicion.

title: KNOWLES LEADS IN GOLF WITH 71
description: RYE, N.Y., June 6Jim KnOwles, 56 years old and the young member of, a good fatherion golfing team, took a big step toward retaining his United States Seniors Golf Association title by gaining a twostroke lead in the first round of the association's 68th annual tournament today.

title: McGraw StarAgee's Hit in 7th Decides
description: A relief pitcher's triumphant moment is the brisk, confident, satisfied walk to the dugont after posting the final out of another onerun victory, and Tug McGraw enjoyed it twice at Shea Stadium last night, even though the New York Mets played only a single game, beating Cincinnati, 32.

title: Japan Sheds Quantitative for Qualitative Goals
description: TOKYO, June 6On the eve of the eagerly awaited arrival in Tokyo of Presidential adviser Henry A. Kissinger, the Japanese Government and business community are just beginning to get their bearings after the Nixon shock of last July 15 and Aug. 15the starting dates of the President's new China policy and new economic policy that ultimately led to the steep revaluation of the Japanese yen.

title: BODY IS CLAIMED BY CHINESE AT U.N.
