title: Donohue Challenges McLaren Team
description: The CanAm script is the same as it has been for the last five years, but the giantkiller role has been recast for the opening of the 1972 series on Sunday in Mosport Park at Bowmanville, Ontario. This year the man'assigned to challenge the dominance of the Gulf McLaren team is Mark Donohue, whose last regular season of CanAm racing was 1968. In his most recent tests on Mosport's 2.5mile course, Donohue broke the lap records for both CanAm and Formula One machineryand this in a Porsche that had never run before last Thursday.

title: Village Art Show: 1,000 Exhibitors, 2,000 Problems
description: The line of supplicants in the Fifth Avenue apartment that serves as headquarters for the Washington Square Outdoor Art Exhibit was seven deep the other day.

title: Shortstop From Oregon Is First Choice in Draft
description: Dave Roberts, a 21yearold shortstop from the University of Oregon, became the No. 1 selection in the nation yesterday as the major leagues held their eighth annual summer draft of amateur baseball talent.

title: Columbia President Calls for a Pullout From Vietnam
description: Dr. William J. McGill, president of Columiyia University, called yesterday for an immediate end to American involvement in the Vietnam war.

title: Market Place: Short vs. Long Business Views
description: It is no doubt true that the most widely watched figure in Wall Street, is the earningsper share result posted periodically by corporations.

title: Hijacker Found Guilty
description: SALT LAKE CITY, June 6 (UPI)Donald L. Colenian was found guilty today of air piracy and interfering with flight attendants on an American Airlines jetliner last Dec 26.

title: State and City to Meet Tomorrow on Welfare Dispute
description: An increasingly bitter dispute over ineligibility on the city's welfare rolls took a sudden turn for better understanding yesterday when the city's Human Resources Administrator, Jule M. Sugarman, and the state's Welfare Inspector General, George F. Berlinger, arranged for senior aides to meet on their contrasting views.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended May 30 as follows:

title: PRICES ARE LOWER ON AMEX AND 0TC
description: Once again American Israeli Paper Mills held center stage in an otherwise dull show at the American Stock Exchange. It was the most active issue with 564,500 shares traded.

title: Farmingdale Graduation
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., June 6The first liberal arts graduates in the history of the State University of New York Agricultural and Technical College at Farmingdale, the oldest twoyear college in the State Un,lversity system, received degrees today at the school's 53'd commencement ceremonies. Of the 1,693 graduates, 125 were granted the association arts diploma.

title: Incentives Program in Welfare One of 2 Reapproved by H. E.W.
LYNN. F. BARNETT
description: Lynn F. Barnett, president of ASTServo Systems Company, distributors of electric components and a division of Vernitron Corporation, died Monday of cancer in Orange (N.J.) Memorial Hospital. He was 55 years old and lived at 480 Ridgewood Avenue, Glen Ridge, N.J.

title: Albert Won't Preside At Democratic Parley
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI) House Speaker Carl Albert says he does not want to serve as chairman of this year's Democratic National Convention, a task he performed in 1968 in Chicago.

title: Contributions of U.S. To U.N. and Agencies
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Stine 6The United States contributions to the regular budget and specialized'agencies of the United Nations, for 1972 make up the following percentages of their budgets:

title: DANCEDRAMA CASTS 7 5 ONSTAGE AS DOLLS
description: The Barbara Gardner Construction Company Presented a tantalizingly allusive but ultimately elusive dancedrama Monday evening at the Theater for the New City. The work blended texts by Kafka and .William Burroughs, constructions by Torn Gardner and choreography by Miss Gardner in a nonlinear fantasy production.

title: 3,428 Roll Calls
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI) Representative Charles E. Bennett, Democrat of Florida, claims the record for serving the longest period in Congress without missing a rollcall vote. Mr. Bennett completed his 21st year without missing a vote yesterday. He said he had participated in 3,428 consecutive rollcall votes.

title: Rare Picasso Work For Modern Museum
description: Pablo Picasso, who 16 months ago made a gift of his unique 1912 cubist sculpture called Guitar to the Museum of Modern Art, has now made it possible for the museum to acquire another rare example of his constructed metal sculpture. The work is called Construction in Wire, and was first executed in 192829 as the maquette for a monumental sculpture.

title: U. of Michigan Dean Named
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., June (AP)  Dr. David V. Ragone, dean of the Thayer School of Engineering at Dartmouth College, will become dean of the University of Michigan School of Engineering Sept. 1, it was announced today. Dr. Ragone will succeed Dean Gordon Van Wylen, who will become president of Hope College in Holland, Mich., July 1.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The question now, after the California,Presidential ,iprimary election, is whether the American voters are ready for a radical change in U.S. foreign and domestic, policy.

title: SAIGON REPORTS GAINS AT KONTUM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, June 7The South Vietnamese command said today that its forces had driven out all but a handful of the remaining enemy troops in the city of Kontum in the Central Highlands and that 200 enemy troops were killdd in six clashes in the area yesterday.

title: Nixon Flies to Camp David
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP) President Nixon flew by helicopter to the Catoctin Mountains in Maryland late today for a midweek stay at Camp David. The , deputy press secretary, Gerald L. Warren, said he did not know when Mr. Nixon would return to the White House, He said the President would work largely on domestic matters while at Camp David.

title: Princeton Honors Its Retiring Head Degrees to 1,425
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 8In a departure from its commencement tradition, Princeton University today momentarily denied its outgoing president, Dr. Robert F. Goheen, his opportunity to close the twohour ceremony until he had been awarded and accepted an honorary Doctor of Laws degree with maximum respect.

title: Study Finds 30 Days Not Enough for G.I. Addicts
description: WASHINGTON, June 6A study made for the Department of Defense concludes :that the Nixon Administration's plan to extend the tour, of, military service of drug addicts for 30 days of compulsory treatment in Veterans Administration hospitals is unlikely to work,

title: Castro, in Poland, Said to Show Signs of Heart Trouble
description: WARSAW, June 6 (AP)Polish Government sources said tonight that Fidel Castro was showing signs of heart trouble after the Cuban premier arrived in Poland for stop on a ninenation tour. trouble after the Cuban Premier Castro, aged 44, Was in a state prior to a heart infarct, indicating belief that he might suffer a heart attack.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The George A. Fuller Company yesterday was named to handle the construction management contract for the $100million first phase of the New Jersey sports complex in the Hackensack Meadows in New Jersey.

title: A Campaign Against McGovern Mounted by Republican Chiefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP) Many Republican leaders appear to have all but conceded the Democratic Presidential nomination to Senator George McGovern and are already mounting the generalelection campaign against him.

title: OneYear Term
description: First woman governor of the Big Board.... James B. Duke Professor of Economics at Duke University, where she also serves as dean of the women's college and Assistant Provost.... A specialist on labor and manpower, income distribution and problems of the aging. Graduate of Berea (Ky.) College; received master's and doctor's degrees from Duke. Married to Dr. Clifton H. Kreps Jr., a Professor of Banking at the University of North Carolina; they have three children.... Director of J. C. Penney.

title: SUPPORT OF PACTS IS LINKED BY LAIRD TO NEW ARMS FUND
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that he Could not support the recently concluded armscontrol agreements with the Soviet Union if Congress refused to proceed with the modernization of the offensive strategic forces proposed by the Nixon Administration.

title: Hope Chest Appeal
description: Multiple scleitsis is chronic disease.the central nervous system. It distorts or blocks nerve impulses from activating muscles vital to such functions as speech, movement and Akin. The National Multiple Sclerosis Society, now conducting its annual Hope Chest appeal, finances research into the cause, prevention and cure of the disease.

title: GOLD ISSUES GAIN AS MARKET SLIPS
description: Goldmining issues glittered yesterday as Wall Street's favorite group, while airline stocks continued to tumble in generally weak marker.

title: Sihanouk Interviewed in Peking, Opposes GenevaStyle Parley to End Indochina War
description: PEKING, June 6  Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the exiled Cambodian leader, said in an interview here today that he was unalterably opposed to any Genevastyle conference to end the Indochina war.

title: Integration and the Court
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 Once again the Supreme Court is on the spot regarding school desegregation. For 18 years it has spoken with a unanimous voice on this highly emotional subject, but now the political pressures for a change in direction are enormous. Today's decision by the United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit was expected. A district court ruling that the schools of Rich mond and two suburban counties must be integrated was reversed by a 5 to 1 vote. The case will be appealed.

title: Budget Slashed by $5.5Million, Ocean Hill Bids Central Board Take Over Schools
description: Assemblyman Samuel D. Wright announced yesterday that.the Ocean HillBrownsville Community School Board 23, which he heads, would suspend operations until $5.5million was restored by the central Board of Education to the district's budget for next year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I read with amusement your recent news story which quoted Mayor Lindsay as being deeply distressed over the conditions in the streets and parks, after what he had seen during the past weekend. His politically expedient remark stems from the vantage point of a sound truck from which he was expediently addressing the marchers in the latest Fifth Avenue parade.

title: Rodino and Daniels Take Jersey Races; Krebs Beats Caby
description: Representatives Peter W. Rodino Jr. of Newark and Dominick V. Daniels of Union City won renomination yesterday, withstanding primary challenges brought about by the reapportionment of New Jersey's Congressional Districts.

title: A PRINT IS FOUND IN COLOMBO CASE
description: A single fingerprint has been discovered on a.38caliber derringer pistol recovered Monday after a reported earlymorning ambush attempt outside the Bay. Ridge, Brooklyn; home of Joseph A. Colombo Sr., the reputed Mafia boss.

title: Pilots'
description: The Air Line Pilots Association declared a boycott of airline service yesterday to any nation giving sanctuary to hijackers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your emotional plea for more laws to harass lawabiding gun owners [editorial May 18] has no logical basis. The fact that Britain has strict laws and low crime rates does not mean at all that these led to low crime.

title: P. B. A. Plans a Job Action to Gain Pay Raise
description: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association announced plans yesterday for an unspecified job action aimed at forcing the city to grant policemen higher pay than firefighters and sanitationmen as well as other contract improvements.

title: Police Chief Will Publicize Names of Young Offenders
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 6 (Reuters)  Police Chief Clarence B. Giarrusso announced today his decision to decide personally which juvenile offenders in this city should remain anonymous.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I much regret the decision of the Council of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences to deny Ezra Pound a literary award (Notes on People, May 25). The academy did not divorce merit from political stance and correct weltanschauung. It effectively defined correctness as what pleases the powers that bethe Staatsrat or the Counciland it dragged the concept of correctness from the heights of philosophy to the gutters of sociology.

title: Liquefied Gas Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI) The House Merchant Marine and Fisheries Committee will conduct hearings June 1415 on a proposal to authorize construction of 40 ships to haul liquefied natural gas.

title: New York Races
description: Representative James J. Delaney, a hardy perennial in Queens, and his insurgent opponent, City Councilman Thomas J. Manton, accused each other yesterday of unfair campaign tactics in their contest for the Democratic nomination.

title: FUTURES PRICES OF PLATINUM FALL
description: Platinum futures prices reached a high in early trading yesterday on the New York Mercantile Exchange but fell sharply later in the day on reports that Russia was selling platinum in the world market.

title: OneYear Term
description: Chairman and chief executive officer of American Electric Power, one of the nation's largest utility holding companies... Former chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission.. Became president of American Electric in 1961 and chairman last year... A 63yearold native of Escanaba, Mich.... Received bachelor's and master's degrees from University of Michigan, law degree from George Washington University... A New York City dweller, he has been a critic of Con Edison's service.

title: PRESS GROUP TOLD OF A THREAT IN U.S.
description: MUNICH, West Germany, June 6 (UPI)  An American broadcaster told the International Press Institute today that harassment of the networks by the Nixon Administration presented an actual threat to free press in the United States.

title: Valenti and Three Indicted In Upstate Extortion Case
description: BUFFALO, June 6 (UPI) Frank J. Valenti, reputed leader of organized crime in the Rochester area, and three other men were indicted today by a Federal grand jury on conspiracy and other charges connected with an alleged extortion case involving a Buffaloarea contractor and a streetpaving job in Batavia.

title: SOUTH AFRICA BANS STUDENT PROTESTS
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, June 6The South African Government announced today a monthlong ban on protest processions, gatherings and open air political meetings at all university centers.

title: TwoYear Term
description: Former chairman of the General Motors Corporation, the world's largest industrial corporation.... Retired from that post, one of the highest paid in American industry, last December at the mandatory retirement age of 65. Graduated from Elgin (Ill) High School in 1923; did not go on to college because he had to work to help support his family.... Joined G.M.'s Cadillac division in 1927 and became its general manager 30 years later.... Elected a director of G.M. in 1962, president in 1965 and chairman in 1967.... In 1966, publicly apologized for company's effort to discredit Ralph Nader.

title: Radio: Black and White at 2 Ends of the AM Dial
description: At one end of the radio dial there is WMCA. At the other end, there is WWRL. WMQA piros its programming at a general audience. WWRL is beamed at a black community On Mon'day evening, from 8 to 10, the stations came together to present simulcast called Black and White.

title: A dvertising:
description: The agency business, which is taking enough heat for advertising generally, is not willing to take any more from advertising for political candidates. So it has strengthened the position it took in 1968.

title: House Inquiry Members Oppose Samuels on Bets
description: WASHINGTON, June. 7 People who oppose the legalization of sports gambling aren't living in the real world, Howard J. Samuels told the House Select CoMmittee on Crime today.

title: Army Names Five Blacks Among 62 Colonels for Promotion to General
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI)The Army picked five more blacks today for promotion to general, including one who said he did not even expect to make sergeant when he enlisted in 1940.

title: Buckley to Join Nixon's Drive; Bids Conservatives Help Also
description: Senator James L. Buckley of New York yesterday endorsed the candidacy of President Nixon and said he would campaign for his reelection.

title: RETARDED ORDERED TO A STATE SCHOOL
description: MINEOLA, L. I., June 7State Supreme Court Justice Sol Wachtler today directed that two mentally retarded persons who had been refused admittance by, the Suffolk. State School because of overcrowding there be placed in a state institution or in a licensed private facility at state expense.

title: Faces of the Vietnaim, War By Photographers Who Fell
description: Wars are photographed in the faces of men, dead or aliVe, Mice no one can take a picture of a flying bullet.. Larry Burrows, a 44yearOld Briton who was a Life photograpker, used to say that. And in the nine years he covered the war in Vietnamgoing back again and again to be in ithe never stopped looking at these faces.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: ROME, June 7  Pressmen struck La Stampa and Stampa Sera of Turin today to prevent them from printing a publisher's statement on labor conflict in the newspaper industry.

title: MRS JOHN C. WILLEY
description: NORWALK, Conn., June 7Mrs. Fern Morrison Willey, wife of John C. Willey, a vice president and editor in chief of William Morrow & Co., the book publishers, died yesterday at Norwalk Hospital. She was 62 years old and lived at 3 Midrocks Drive.

title: A School Integratioin Suit Filed by A.C.L.U. in Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, June 7 (AP)A United States District Court suit was filed today to broaden Atlanta school desegregation by merging the schools of the Georgia capital with those of predominantly white suburban counties.

title: Steelworkers to Back Bid To Oust Arizona Governor
description: PITTSBURGH, June 7 (UN)  I. W Abel, president of the United Steelwoikers of America, said today that his union would back efforts to remove Gov. Jack Williams of Arizona from offce and support a natOnwide lettuce boycott.

title: Daley Challengers Complete Credentials Unit Testimony
description: CHICAGO, June 7 (UPI)Persons challenging the seating of Mayor Richard J. Daley and 58 other uncommitted delegates to the Democratic National ConVention have completed their case.

title: Britain Protests to Soviet
description: LONDON, June 7 (AP)Britain today accused the Soviet Union of violating international law by arranging to, purchase oil from a British field taken over by the Libyan Government.

title: Amex Votes to Reshape Its Structute
description: The American Stock Exchange announced yesterday that its membership had voted approval of a series of constitutional amendments providing for a reorganization of the exchange's governing structure.

title: I.M.F. Credit for Honduras
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (Rau ters)The International Monetary Fund said today it had approved a further standby arrangement for Honduras to purchase foreign exchange up to the equivalent of $15million in special drawing rights over the next 12 months in support of the country's stabilization program, which was initiated last year.

title: Tito in Moscow
description: That was certainly a warm welcome the Soviet leaders gave President Tito when he arrived in Moscow, warmer than President Nixon had received. We may doubt, however, whether Tito was overly impressed. He has had too long and too stormy a relationship with the Soviet Union not to remember that previous friendly receptions were followed by bitter denunciations, such as were unleashed against him and Yugoslavia in 1948, 1956 and 1968.

title: Pay Board Reduces Rises For Philadelphia Butchers
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 The Pay Board today ordered three supermarket chains in Philadelphia to roll back part of a wage increase they are paying in the second year of a threeyear contract with meat cutters and butchers.

title: New Electric Institute Head
description: Frank M. Warren, president of the Portland General Electric Company, Portland, Ore., was elected chairman of the Edison Electric Institute yesterday. He assumed the office at the closing session of the Institute's 40th annual convention in San Diego, Calif. He succeeds Shearon Harris, chairmanpresident of the Carolina Power & Light Company,

title: Senate Race In Doubt
description: PIERRE, S. D., June 7 (UPI) Republican leaders said today, that a recount of the primary vote Tuesday may be needed to settle the disputed race for the party's Senatorial nomination.

title: USAC Panel Turns Down Appeal of Gurney and Grant
description: INDIANAPOLIS, June 7 (UPI) A special United States Auto Club panel denied today Dan Gurney's appeal of the demotion of his driver, Jerry Grant, from 2d to 12th place for taking fuel from Bobby Unser's gasoline supply tanks in the Indianapolis 500 May 27.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Surf Angling
description: If on glances down the ranks of surf fishermen on a warm June evening, the chances are that all will be using spinning gear.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: New York Races
description: Allard K. Lowenstein, who is trying to deprive Representative John J. Rooney of a 15th term in Congress, said yesterday that he had asked the Justice Department to, investigate whether Mr. Rooney had, violated Federal laws in accepting campaign contributions.

title: SILVER FUTURES LOWER AT FINISH
description: Another record price paid for gold touched off commis sion house shortcovering at the beginning of the trading in silver futures on the New York Commodity Exchange here yesterday. However. a lack of followthrough touched off profit taking and liquidation that brought, prices to their lows by early afternoon in moderate trading.

title: Man in the News
description: When Andrei A. Zhclanov, Stalin's arbiter in cultural matters, launched a scurrilous attack on the poet Anna Akhmatova in the midnineteenforties, Iosif A. Brodsky. who was born in 1940 and was later her disciple, was too young to be included in the official wrath. In 1964 he more than made up for it, for he was subjected to a trial in Leningrad as a parasite (some called him, in Russianstile, a militant parasite). Convicted, he was given. five years at hard labor at a camp in the Russian north. He was freed after 18 months.

title: Hearings on RollCall Bill
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) A Senate subcommittee will open hearings June 30 on a proposed constitutional amendment that would force the removal of any Representative or Senator who missed 40 per cent of the rollcalls during a session of Congress. The amendment sponsored by Senator Margaret Chase Smith, Republican of Maine.

title: BRISCOE ACCEPTS DOLPHINS'
description: Marlin Briscoe, the little wide receiver who caught 133 passes for Buffalo the last three seasons, agreed to play for Miami yesterday, and the Dolphins gave the Bills their No. 1 draft choice for next year in compensation. The 28yearold Briscoe, who broke into pro football as a quarterback with the Denver Broncos in 1968, had played out his option on his Buffalo contract and he became a free agent last May 1.

title: Imminent Jeopardy
description: Among the measures awaiting Governor Rockefeller's decision to sign or veto on this last day for gubernatorial action on bills passed by the last session of the Legislature is one which declares:

title: A FOURTH ANARCHIST SEIZED BY GERMANS
description: BONN, Stine The Hamburg police today announced the arrest of a leading member of a band of anarchists that has claimed responsibility for bomb blasts that killed four American servicemen and injured 30 persons last month. The arrest is the fourth in West Germany in a week.

title: Seal HarVesting Ban Sought
description: WASHINGTON; June 7 (UPI) Commerce Secretary Peter G. Peterson said today that the United States would seek to ban fur seal harvesting on St. George Island, one of the two main Pribilof Islands in order to carry out research on seal populations.

title: Just How Far the Advisers Go
description: SPRINGFIELD, MassThe whipping boys of politics today are political consultants. We are accusedon these pages as well as many other placesof trying to sell candidates like soap or toothpaste, of creating falie images for candidates, of packaging them, of trying to present serious problems in 30second spots and, eschewing longer, more substantative programs, and of various mysterious practices, few of them benevolent or beneficial.

title: Kremlin Aides Hold Talks in Lithuania Where Riots Flared
description: MOSCOW, June 7The Communist party leader of Lithuania and officials from the party headquarters in Moscow have held a special political meeting with local leaders in a Lithuanian city where young people rioted in midMay.

title: WEEKLY PAY RISES 78 CENTS IN AREA
description: Gross weekly pay and net spendable earnings rose on the average by 78 cents and 61 cents, respectively, in April, over the previous month for fulltime and parttime factory production workers in the New York metropolitan area, Herbert Beinstock, the Regional Director of the Department of Labor's Bureau. of Labor Statistics, reported yesterday.

title: South African Police Break Up Two Demonstrations by Students
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, June 7 (Reuters)Policemen using dogs and rubber truncheons today broke up two university protests against a Government ban on outdoor demonstrations.

title: City Budget Proposal Is Termed Fiscal Folly by a Civic Group
description: The Citizens Budget Commission yesterday termed fiscal folly a proposal to divert $99million earmarked for collective bargaining settlements to help balance a proposed $9.4billion budget, and then borrow to pay the salary increases.

title: House Panel Favors Plan to Extend Debt Ceiling
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) The House Ways and Means Committee agreed tentatively today on a bill extending the present $450billion national debt ceiling through Oct. 31, assuring that Congress will again consider the issue this year.

title: Pressman Quits WNBC for Channel 5
description: Gabe Pressman, who in more than 17 years as a roving reporter for WNBCTV became one of the city's bestknown newsmen, resigned yesterday to join the reporting staff of WNEW.

title: STOCKS RETREAT ON PRIMARY NEWS
description: The shadow of Senator George McGovern, who swept to victory in four Demooratic Presidential primary elections on Tuesday, cast something of a pall across the stock market yesterday.

title: Air Force Graduates 749
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, June 7 (UPI)Air Force Secretary Robert C. Seamans told graduates at the Air Force Academy exercises here that, while winds of peace are stirring as America ends its involvement in Vietnam, it would be extreme folly to reduce American military force.

title: HEISKELL SCORES PUBLIC SPENDING
description: Declaring that the upper limit of Federal spending on urban problems was being approached with no solutions in sight, Andrew Heiskell, chairman and, chief executive officer of Time Inc., urged businesses last night to monitor the governmental process.

title: Antitrust Implications Seen
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) The Chairman of the Senate securities subcommittee said today that he saw antitrust implications in the action by 17 brokerage houses to seek to close the PhiladelphiaBaltimoreWashington stock exchange to institutional members.

title: U.S. STRENGTHENS FORCE IN THAILAND
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, June 7 The United States has increased its armed forces contingent here from 32,000 men a few months ago to 40,000. Most of the increase results from strengthening of the Air Force contingents at six Thai bases to counter the Communist offensive by bombing in South and North, Vietnam.

title: ANLOC IS REACHED BY A RELIEF UNIT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, June 8A Saigon command spokesman reported this morning that an advance element of the South Vietnamese relief column that has been trying for two months to break through to surrounded Anloc shook hands yesterday afternoon with a rear element of the government garrison there.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: A secondary offering of 402,220 common shares of the Crane Company.was completed yesterday, according to a group of. underwriters including Walston & Co., Inc., duPont Glore );organ, Hornblower & WeeksHemphill Noyes & Co., Paine Webber Jackson & Curtis and Spencer Trask & Co. The company's stock, traded on the New York Stock Exchange, was down  at 22 at the close of, yesterday's session.

title: School Budget Approved
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., June 7 Clarkstown Central School District by a vote of 2,279 to 1,776 today approved a budget of S23,043(270, which was $79,500 less than the budget the district voters defeated May 3.

title: Olmedo Scores Again
description: CHICHESTER, England, June 7 (UPI)Alex Olmedo of Los Angeles continued his winning ways today by eliminating South African, Terry Ryan, 62, 4.6, 75, en route to the quarterfinals of the Rothman's grass tennis tournament.

title: Massachusetts Legislature Approves Plan on Abortions
description: BOSTON, June 7 (UPI)Without debate, the Massachusetts legislature, acting as a joint constitutional convention, gave initial approval today to an amendment to the state constitution prohibiting abortions by guaranteeing every child, from the moment of conception, the rights of all citizens.

title: Common Market Agency Protests U.S. Plans for Antidumping Law
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Executive Commission of the European Common Market has formally protested proposed United States regulations under the antidumping law and has repeated complaints about Tariff Commission determinations, under the law, of injury to domestic producers.

title: General Motors Subsidiary In Korea HaS Inauguration
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 7 (AP)General Motors Korea, a subsidiary of the General Motors Corporation, was inaugurated here today as the first automobile maker in South Korea with a direct American investment.

title: Deere to Expand Plant
description: MOLINE, III., June 7 (AP)A $3million expansion program was announced today by Deere & Co. for its factory in Horicon, Wis. Completion of the addition a year from now will double the plant's capacity for the manufacture of snowmobiles.

title: Environmental Action Aims To Unseat 12 Legislators
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI)  Environmental Action, a private organization, named 12 House members today and promised to campaign for their) defeat In hopes that stronger antipollution legislation would result.

title: City Bank Wins Cuba Case in High Court
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) The Supreme Court today upheld a New York bank's decision to confiscate funds of Cuban baniti to offset losses incurred when the Havana Government nationalized 11 of its branch banks

title: Philadelphia Takes Griscom Cup Golf; New York Second
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., June 7In a contest that wasn't decided until the last threeHome had reported, Philadelphia's team of seven women golfers won the Griscom Cup today, defeating New York and Boston.

title: City Considering Auction of North Brother Islancll
description: North Brother Islarid, a 20.gacre bldb of land in the East River off the South Bronx, may be up for sale to the highest bidder soon. The Board of Estimate voted in executive, session yesterday to place the issue on its calendar for a public hearing at its June 22 meeting.

title: Price Panel Approves Increase In The Times Advertising Rates
description: The New York Times announced yesterday that with the approval of the Price Commission it would raise advertising rates by an overall average of slightly over 6 per cent.

title: From Behrman's Diary, a New Book
description: Fanny Brice once said, that lie wrote like a silk herring, and when he congratulated Ina Claire, for reading a speech in one of his plays particularly well she thanked him but said, Sam, I didn't understand one word of it.

title: NIXON URGED TO LIFT BEEF IMPORT LIMITS
description: WASHINGTON, June 7Two consumer advocates and a New York Representative made public today a letter they have sent President Nixon expressing growing alarm over the relentless rise in the price of food, particularly beef, and urging unrestricted beef imports.

title: 3 IN GAY UNIT SEIZED AT A KAYE HEARING
description: Two members or the Gay Activists Alliance were arrested for assault in the second degree in Manhattan Criminal Court yesterday as they and about 100 other homosexuals demonstrated after the court appearance of Michael Mayo, president of the Uniformed Firefighters Association. A third was arrested on lesser charges.

title: Denying the Youth Vote
description: The Court of Appeals of the State of New York, this state's highest court, yesterday followed the newly conservative United States Supreme Court in snatching from young people the right of franchise granted them by prior court decree and the Twentysixth Amendment to the Federal Constitution. In what has become a succession of retrograde decisions, the courts have sided with backward political elements in rearguard actions to preserve the status quo. The impact of these decisions must be devastating to youthful wouldbe voters, eager, to bring change through the orderly processes of government.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 Extracts from a political columnist's diary:

title: F.D.A. Warns Against Drug Used to Prevent Dysentery
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) The Food and Drug. Administration has advised physicians not to prescribe iodochlorhydroxyquin for prevention of amebic dysentery because it said that prolonged use of the drug might occasionally cause severe eye problems.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF AS TRADING SUPS
description: Institutional trading in the formof 15 large blocks of stock livened the American Stock Exchange yesterday morning. Then, from noon on, trading tended to die down, so that by day's end the volume amounted to 3.9 million shares, well below Tuesday's level of 4.9 million. As measured by the Amex index, prices slid to 27.56., down 0.09.

title: Meredith Seeks House Seat
description: JACKSON, Miss., June 7 (AP)The Democrats outpolled the Republicans 10 to 1 in the Mississippi primary yesterday, and Senator James 0. Eastland got 70 per cent of the Democratic vote in his bid for a sixth term. He will face Gil Carmichael; the Republican nominee, in the November election.

title: Appeals Court Invalidates State Vote Residency Law
description: The Court of Appeals yesterday unanimously declared unconstitutional New York State's 90day residency requirement for voting and said that a 30day residency requirement gave election officials adequate time to determine instances of possible voter fraud.

title: White Youth Seized. in a Jersey Shooting Spree
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., June 7The police arrested a 19yearold white youth last night and charged him with the sniper slaying early Sunday morning of a black teenager and the wounding of five other persons.

title: Hope Fades for 428 Rhodesian Miners
description: WANKIE, Rhodesia, June 7Hope faded today for the rescue of 428 coal miners trapped 400 feet underground here yesterday by a violent explosion.

title: Personal Finance
description: Fire insurance rates may soon be coming down for thousands of New Yorkers, and possibly for thousands more across the country.

title: Susan Madden Wed To E. A. Samson Jr.
description: Miss Susan Brown Madden, an offBroadway actress, and Earl A. Samson Jr., a vice president of the United States, Trust Company of New York, were married here yesterday afternoon at the Georgian Suite, 1A East 77th Street. Surrogate Millard L. Midonick performed the ceremony.

title: Herbert Golf Lead Taken By Mrs, Chadsey's Team
description: PURCHASE, N. Y., June 7Mrs. Carl T. Chadsey Jr. of Round Hill and Regina Hawes of Westchester Country Club had a gross card of 37, 3875 at Century Country Club today to take a onestroke lead in the annual Grace Herbert Memorial Trophy betterball Championship of the Women's Tricounty Golf Association.

title: 31 Firemen in City Are Given Medals for Heroism
description: I don't think of the danger when I'm on my way to a fire, or when I'm at it, It's just after wards that I think about it.That is how Lieut. Richard R. Hamilton, the most decorated firefighter in the history of the city's Fire Department, spoke yesterday, of his 21 years of service.

title: SCHOOL BOARD KEEPS PUBLIC MEETING BAN
description: Franklin Nieves, acting chairman of the board of Community School District 6 in Upper Manhattan, said yesterday that the board had received. no response to its April 21 appeal for proper police protection at its public meetings.

title: Governor Signs Bill Giving Foster Parents Legal Right
description: ALBANY, June 7  Legislation allowing foster parents to intervene in official proceedings involving the foster child has been approved by Governor Rockefeller, his office announced today.

title: University Witnesses in Peking Recall Bloody Red Guard Battles
description: PEKING, June 4On April 22, 1968, Red Guard students at Tsinghua University opened fire from the roof of the 10story administration building on another faction barricaded in the science building, and for three months open warfare raged, with occasional interludes.

title: Baptists Say Films Are Lacking in Social Value
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 7The Southern Baptist Convention, the largest Protestant denomination in the United States with 11.8 million members, today called many contemporary motion pictures utterly degrading, lacking in redeeming social value and vehicles for gross moral depravity.

title: SHOP TALK
description: A twowoman batik center is a little like a oneman band, or so Laura Adasko and Alice Huberman are find ing it. They are part of the legion of ambitious, creative young people who try to make a place for themselves in the big city.

title: Times Study:Debates Hurt McGovern
description: LOS ANGELES, June 7Substantial voter displeasure with his positions on defense spending reductions and welfare reform appeared to have cut deeply into Senator George McGovern's margin of victory in yesterday's California Presidential primary.

title: Montanans Approve New Constitution, Authorize Gambling and Retain Hanging
description: HELENA, Mont., June 7 (AP) Montana voters have approved by fewer than 3,000 votes a new state constitution the first in 83 years. In a primary election yesterday they also authorized the state legislature to legalize gathbling.

title: DAVID LYALL LED MEDICAL SOCIETY
description: Dr. David Lyall, a surgeon and past president of the New York County Medical Society, died Tuesday of a heart attack at the Union Club. He was 61 years old and lived at 320 East 72d Street and at Centre Isladd, Li.

title: Market Place: And Little Guys Levitz Offering
description: When a stock gets into trouble while an offering of additional shares is pending, who is to tell the Little Guy what to do?

title: Study Critical of Busing Scored
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 7 A recent report by a Harvardbased researcher that busing of black children to suburban schools has produced few of the expected benefits is being disputed by other scholars at Harvard, who say it is based on unscientific methods and dubious data

title: Gentry Reached EarlyTolan, Perez Excel
description: When Tug McGraw pitched against Cincinnati 24 hours earlier, he tried to change the rules by, giving the Reds only two outs in the ninth inning. Last night the Mots would've been better off if they had altered the leftfield foul line.

title: Argentina Bus Fall Kills 15
description: PARANA, Argentina, June 7 (AP)At least 15 persons died today When a bus phmged into a stream close to thiS provincial capita1 350 miles north of Buenos Aires the police reported.

title: HAMPTONS  Beaching, sunning, peopling at THE HUNTING INN's special rates(516) 3240410ADVT.
THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Betty Friedan, a founder and past president of the National Organization for Women, said yesterday that the women's movement was quietly raising money to support its friends and oppose its enemies who were running for public office.

title: GOLDMAN TAKES U.S. SENIOR GOLF
description: RYE, N. Y., June 7  David (Spec) Goldman of Dallas, who has been collecting golf trophies since Prohibition days, added more silverware today when he won the 68th annual United States Seniors Golf Association title by shooting the only subopar round on this second day of the 36hole competition.The 63yearold Texan, who won this tournamentin 1970, scored 36, 3571on the par72 Apawamis Club course to go with a 75 shot over the Round till course in Greenwich, Conn., yesterday. His total of 146 enabled him to win by two strokes over Jim Knowles, the 1971 champion, and Ed Meister Of Willoughby, Ohio.

title: CITY MAY SUE U.S. ON WELFARE TESTS
description: The city is considering whether to go to court to try to block the start of two federally sponsored state demonstration programs testing ways to encourage or to require certain welfare recipients to work.

title: Barnard's Brother Warned
description: CAPETOWN, South Africa, June 7 (Reuters)  Dr. Marius Barnard, the brother of Dr. Christiaan A. Barnard and a member of his heart transplant team at Groote Schuur Hospital, has been warned that he could be charged with misconduct under the terms of the Hospital Service Ordnance as a result of having addressed a student protest metting. Dr. Christian Barnard said tonight that if his brother lost his job he would close up shop and leave with him.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Summer Guest Scores In Feature at Belmont
Fuller Company to Manage Meadowlands Construction
description: The construction management contract for the more than $100million first phase for the stadium and arena complex on 750 acres of the Hackensack Meadowlands has been awarded to the George A. Fuller Company, David A. Werblin, chairman of the New Jersey Sports Authority, announced yesterday.

title: Merger News
description: The $65million acquisition of United States Lines, Inc., by R. J. Reynolds Industries, Inc., which has been pending since the proposal was made in November, 1970, may finally receive approval from the Federal Maritime Commission. The commission stated yesterday in Washington that it was prepared to approve the proposed purchase from U.S. Lines's parent Walter Kidde Co., subjeCt to conditions that would maintain the ocean carrier as an independent operation. It noted that the prospect of dismemberment of U.S. Lines in the acquisition would be very real without its prescribed conditions.

title: SINATRA TO SHUN INQUIRY ON CRIME
description: WASHINGTON, June 7Frank Sinatra is not expected to appear at a hearing scheduled for tomorrow before the House Select Committee on Crime.

title: COURVILLE VICTOR IN HOCHSTER GOLF
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., June 7Jerry Courville, one of the outstanding amateur golfers in the metropolitan area, won the 39th annual Hochster Memorial golf tournament today with a 36hole total of 150.

title: Rate Request Trimmed
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 The Price Commission cut back today an advertising rate increase sought by The New York Times.

title: Tel Aviv Massacre Distresses Japan
description: TOKYO, June 7  For the Japanese, the massacre last week at the Tel Aviv airport by three Japanese terrorists has been an agonizing experience involving the honor and responsibility of the entire nation. The reaction to the incident, sociologists say, has been a striking example of the unusual behavior patterns characteristic of this country.

title: Farewell Federal Aid?
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y.The stunning word from Washington that the Federal Government would not be able to fund new social programs without imposing new or higher taxes came too late to temper the budgetmaking process in Albany and New York City. So the Rockefeller budget and the Lindsay budget, as worked over by the lawmakers, reflect the wishful thinking that Federal revenuesharing is an almost immediate certainty, good for $400 million to the state and $100 million or more to, the city. Borrowing against these remittances from Washington was authorized.

title: Hijacked Truck Driven to Brooklyn Garage Staked Out by Police
description: A tractortrailer truck carrying an estimated $200,000 worth of color television sets was hijacked in Glendale, Queens, yesterday and then driven to a Brooklyn garage that city pellicemen and Feleral agents had been quietly watching for three months.

title: Heart Like Iron,  Castro Says in Poland
description: WARSAW, June 7Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba left Warsaw today for a threeday tour of Polish provincial areas, scoffing at a report that he was showing signs of heart trouble.

title: Whitelaw Links a Halt in Terror To Release of Internees in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 7As violence flared in Belfast, William Whitelaw, Ulster's administrator, warned today that Irish Republican Army attacks could halt the further release of Roman Catholic internees.

title: RIVA RIDGE'S ENTRY OTB FAVORITE AT 21
description: The city's Offtrack Betting Corporation begins accepting bets today at 2 P,M. on the 104th running of. the $125,000 Belmont Stakes. The threehorse entry of Riva Ridge, Upper Case and Spanish Riddle is the morningline favorite at odds of 21.

title: ROBERTO VICTOR IN EPSOM DERBY
description: EPSOM DOWNS, England, June 7John W. Galbreath, who was born 74 years ago in Derby, Ohio, won the 193d Epsom Derby for the first time today with Roberto, an Americanbred colt, who outlasted Rheingold in a spectacular drive to take the $271,310 race by less than a nose.

title: Army Discloses Plans For a Homey Barracks
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI)In a continuing program to make military life more like home, the Army disclosed today plans for a anew type of barracks that will eliminate the familiar buildings with row upon row of bunk beds.

title: 2 BURNED TO DEATH IN BROOKLYN CRASH
description: A man and a woman were burned to death last night rin a taxicab that was struck by a car on the BrooklynQueens Expressway at Steuben Street near the Brooklyn Navy Yard.

title: Study Finds as Legal Abortions Rise, Safer Procedures Are Sought More
description: The first major study of legal abortions in the United States has demonstrated that as abortions become more readily available, they have become safer procedures and have been sought in increasing numbers by married women, black women and the poor.

title: Motion Lost in Killing Case
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., June 7 (UPI)  A visiting Superior Court judge denied today a defense motion to suppress evidence against Juan V. Corona, a mass murder suspect. The judge, Richard E. Patton, denied the motion by Richard Hawk, Corona's attorney, to suppress the search warrants used to collect evidence against Corona when he was arrested more than a year ago.

title: CANADA'S DOLLAR MOVES UP TO $1.02
description: TORONTO, June 7Canada's dollar has jumped to $1.02 (United States), the highest since 1960, as a result of new foreign investor confidence in the Canadian economy. Provinces with major cash requirements (chiefly Quebec) as well as a severe shortage of shortterm funds and major de velopment projects planned for the mid1970's are all bringing in foreign capital.

title: Holdout Tenants in Chelsea Take In 26 Squatters
description: Holdout tenants in the Chelsea area, who have vowed to block the conversion of their tenement into a highrent build ing, yesterday took into their apartments five women squatters and their 21 children in preparation for defiance of an eviction deadline Saturday.

title: SovietIraqi Economic Pact Is Signed
description: MOSCOW, June 7  The Soviet Union and Iraq announced today the signing of a trade and economic accord that is presumed to provide for at least some Soviet refining and marketing of Iraq's newly, nationalized oil.

title: New Mexico Vote Jolts Party Leaders
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., June 7 New Mexico's top Democratic officials may not get to participate in their party's national convention in Miami Beach this year.

title: Commerce Chief Bids U.S Compete Better for Trade
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., June 7 Secretary of Commerce Peter G. Peterson, in an address at the graduation exercises of the United States Merchant Marine Academy here today, told an audience of 2,000, that the United States must improve, its competitive positron in the world.

title: U.S. Doubles Welfare Aid To the State and Its Cities
description: The Federal Government has approved an allocation of funds more than doubling its aid for social services in New York State, including New York City and other localities, to $590million for the year that started last April 1.

title: Ken W. Purdy, Writer on Cars For Playboy, Is a Suicide at 59
description: Ken W. Purdy, a leading writer on classic cars and automobile racing, died early yesterday of a selfinflicted gunshot wound at his home on Ridgefield Road in Wilton, Conn. He was 59 years old.

title: Federal Study Calls for an End To Dumping Near Harbor Here
description: A fouryear Federal study has recommended that the dumping of sewage sludge and dredged material in the ocean just off New York harbor be ended because it is killing marine life.

title: Gene Rayburn's Home Burns
description: OSTERVILLE, Mass., June 7 (AP)A threealarm fire caused damage estimated by the fire chief at $150,000 to the home of Gene Rayburn, the television personality, last night.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE GOALIE'S ANXIETY AT TI PENALTY KICK. By Peter Handhe. Translated by. Michael Roloff, 133 pages, Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $6.95.

title: Bridge: A PickUp Foursome Leads In World Mixed Team Event
FREDERICK W. HAINS
description: SEMINOLE, Fla., June 7Frederick W. Hains, a former commander of the. New York District Attorney's detective squad, died yesterday at his home here. He was 68 years old.

title: John Reardon, ExNewsMan; Operated Bradford (N.H.) Inn
description: John Reardon, a former copy editor in the sports department of The New York Times, died last evening in Allegany, N. Y., of a stroke. He was 77 years old.

title: Price Changes
description: Price increases for two industrial chemicals  methylene chloride and methyl chloridewere announced yesterday by major corporations, following a pattern initiated on May 26 by the Dow Chemical Company,

title: Presbyterian Texas Synod Asks AbortionCurb Repeal
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., June 7 (UPI)The United Presbyterian U.S.A. Synod of Texas urged Texas and Louisiana today to repeal laws against abortion and leave the matter up to the woman and her doctor.

title: P.S.A.L. RULING VOIDS DABNEY'S 880 MEDAL
description: Bill Dabney, Boys High's outstanding junior halfmiler, will have to return the gold medal he received last Saturday for winning the 880yard run in 1 minute 53.2 seconds at the Public Schools Athletic League track championships at Downing Stadium, Randalls Island.

title: French Accept Situation
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June (UPI)France has told Iraq she did not object to Baghdad's nationalization of the westernowned Iraq Petroleum Company and was ready to enter talks about the preservation of French oil interests in the Arab State, the official Irasi.,News Agency Said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Roundup: Orioles Stop a 5Game Slide
description: The Baby O's helped turn things around for Baltimore last night as the American League champions routed the Minnesota Twins, 112, and snapped a fivegame losing streak, the Orioles longest since 1969.

title: GENERAL DYNAMICS SETS NEW CONCERN
description: The General Dynamics Corporation announced yesterday the formation of a new operating company to handle all its commercial activities.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: GRETCHEN M. NICHOLAS
description: Mrs. Gretchen McElwain Nicholas, a former judge of the toy group of dog breeds and secretary of the Interstate Kennel Association in the 1940's, died yesterday in White Plains Hospital. She was 76 years old and lived at 16 Ridgeview Avenue, White Plains.

title: Times Report0 Acquitted On Drug Charge on Coast
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., June 7 (AP) Earl Caldwell, a reporter for The New York Times, was acquitted today on a charge of marijuana possession. The charge was made after he underwent a routine search March 6 at the Angela Davis trial.

title: Notes on People
description: The outgoing Secretary of the Treasury, John B. Connally, flew into Bogota, Colombia, and tried to clarify what he said in Venezuela and why he isn't going to Chile. On the second stop of the 15nation aroundtheworld tour he is making at the bidding of President Nixon, Mr. Connally also conferred with President Misael Pastrana Borrero at the Presidential Palace in Bogota.

title: Westmoreland, at Point, Cites New Problems Facing the Army
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., June 7  Gen. William C. Westmoreland, addressing the class of 1972 at the United States Military Academy today, told the graduates that they must provide the leadership to help solve the problems that he said threatened both America's and the Army's peace and security race, drugs and crime and the question of respect for authority.

title: Marcus Testifies Ruggiero Accepted $2,500 Payment to Influence a Bus Company
description: James L. Marcus testified yesterday that Joseph E. Ruggiero accepted $2,500 in cash, to influence a buscontract decision by the state's Public Service Commission.

title: P.B.A. Is Rebuked On. Pay Differential
description: John J. DeLury, president of the Uniformed Sanitationmen's Association, chided the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association yesterday, suggesting that the police union stand on its own feet rather than on the shoulders of the sanitationmen.

title: GOLD PRICE RISES TO $65 IN LONDON
description: LONDON, June 7 (AP)Buying, sparked by rumors of a secret deal between the United States and the Soviet Union, increased the price of gold to new highs on Europe's free bullion markets today and weakened the American dollar.

title: 7 Hurt as Plane Crashes Through Supermarket Roof
description: FARMINGTON, Mich., June 7 (AP)A private plane carrying four persons smashed through the roof of Farmer Jack's supermarket last night.

title: COURT, 54, LIMITS RIGHTS IN LINEUP
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Supreme Court sharply limited a major liberal criminal, riding of the Warren Court to day, holding 5 to 4 that suspects normally are not entitled to counsel at lineup identifications.

title: BURUNDI REPORTS TRIBAL WARFARE
description: UNTIED NATIONS, N. Y., June 7The Government of Burundi, reversing its official position, conceded today that tribal warfare had taken tens of thousands of lives in that central African country.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Tickets may be obtained at the public desk, main lobby, United Nations Headquarters. Tours: 9 A.M. to 4:45 P.M.

title: Laird at Annapolis
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 7 (AP)  Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird today praised President Nixon's efforts to reduce world tensions, but he warned the graduating class at the United States Naval Academy here that the only path toward peace in the world was through strength at home.

title: Summary of Actions Taken by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 7 (AP)Mervin D. Field said today that he thought his widely publicized California Poll, showing Senator George McGovern scoring a landslide victory before the California Democratic primary, helped Senator Hubert H. Humphrey make a fore respectable showing.

title: BEVERLY CHEW
description: GENEVA, N. Y., June 7 (AP) Beverly Chew, retired president of the Shuron Optical Company, died on. Monday at Geneva General Hospital. He was 86 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.N. Parley Endorses Air Monitoring Net
description: STOCKHOLM, June 7A proposal to set up a global network of 110 specially equipped stations to monitor changes in the world's climate and the level of air pollution was endorsed here today by delegate's to the United Nations Confeience on the Human Envirenment.

title: Executive Changes
description: Brig. Gen. James A. McDivitt who is retiring as manager of the Apollo spacecraft program, has been elected senior vice president of the Consumers Power Company, Jackson, Mich., effective July 1.

title: Nastase Beats Gulyas
description: HAMBURG, Germany, June 7 (UPI)Ilie Nastase of Rumania defeated Istvan Gulyas of Hungary, 63, 26, 6.4, and Karl Mailer of West Germany ousted Ion Tiriac of Rumania, 98, 2.6, 63, in the German tennis championship today.

title: Tito Arrives in Latvia
description: MOSCOW, June 7 (Reuters)President Tito of Yugoslavia arrived in the Latvian capital of Riga today, the third day of his visit to the Soviet Union, the Soviet press agency Tass reported.

title: Group Will Study Changes In JewishChristian Contacts
description: A comprehensive review of developments in JewishChristian relationssince World War II will be undertaken by the Synagogue Council of America, the organization's president, Rabbi Irving Lehrman of Miami Beach, announced yesterday.

title: NIXON CRITICIZED ON UNSPENT FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Nixon Administration was severely criticized today for returning to the Treasury about $400million from the food stamp program.

title: Islanders Get De Jordy From Canadiens
description: MONTREAL, June 7  Sam Pollock, the National Hockey League's candyman, dispensed some goodies to the NeW York Islanders. today in exchange for the Islanders compliance in not drafting a good young Montreal Canadiens prospect.

title: John Jay College Reoeives $476,886 for New Program
description: WASHINGTON, 7 June (AP) The Nationat Endowment for the Humanities announced today an outright grant of $476,886 to the John Jay College of Criminal Justice in New York City.

title: President Supports NoFault in States
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 Preside,nt Nixon described nofault, automobile insurance today as idea whose time has come, and a vast improve Ment over the present system.

title: I.P.C. Complains to Syria
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, June 7 (Reuters)The westernowned Iraq Petroleum Company. has complained to Syria about the nationalization, of its Interests in the country, it was,officially announced today on the staterun Damascus radio.

title: Lexicography (n.) the Controversial Art of Making a Dictionary
description: Three hundred lexicographers gathered on the second flbor of the New York Hilton this week to discuss common probleins, but, in contrast to neighboring conferencegoers an, assenthiage of hairstylists and some. incindrator salesmen who sported yellow buttons saying Garbage Peweethe Wdedstniths had some difficulty in defining Major aspect of their subject.

title: BVS HIGH TAKES TRACK TEAM TITLE
description: Kevin McCarey of Cathedral Prep and a fleet foursome from John Bertram High of Philadelphia turned in record performances yesterday in the 16th annual Eastern States track championships at Downing Stadium, Bandalls Island.

title: TOP DEMOCRAT ASKS KLEINDIENST DEFEAT
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., June 7 (AP)Senator Robert C. Byrd, Democrat of West Virginia, announced today that he would vote against the nomination of Richard G. Kleindienst as Attorney General of the United States.

title: 6 Runs in Third Start Rangers to Downfall
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.,. June 7Sparky Lyle, the spunky Yankee southpaw obtained from the Boston Red Sox before the season's start, did it again tonight.

title: EAST BERLIN ROLE OF BIG 4 DISPUTED
description: BONN, June 7  A new controversy has broken out here over the rights and responsibilities of the four victorious powers of World War II in the eastern portion of divided Berlin.

title: Police, Snipers Trade. Shots
description: ALTON, M., June 7 (AP)Policemen and snipers exchanged gunfire early today in a black neighborhood where firemen were kept busy throughout the night extinguishing fires that authorities said had been started by incendiary devices. No arrests were made.

title: Panel Urges Strict Ethics Code for Judges
description: A tough and broadranging code of conduct for the nation's judges  from the Supreme Court down to the local justice of the peace  was proposed yesterday by a special committee of the American Bar Association.

title: Martin Marietta Gives P. B. S. $600,000 for the Boston Pops
description: Arthur Fiedler's Evening at Pops, whose third season of 12 programs on the Public Broadcasting Service will begin July 4, will be underwritten by the Martin Marietta Corporation at a cost of $600,000.

title: House Votes A.E.C. Bill
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) The House passed and sent to the President today a bill authorizing appropriations of $2.6billion to finance operations of the Atomic Energy Commission in the 12 months starting July 1. The rollcall vote was 367 to 2.

title: Brewery Talks Mediated
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 7 (AP)Leaders of strilcing bottlers and brewers unions, met today with a Federal mediator to try to bring an end to a threeday strike against C. Schmidt and Sons, a Philadelphia brewer. The strike has shut down all of the company's breweries. A company spokesman said that the unions were not satisfied with a number of issues concerning working conditions.

title: HIGH COURT BACKS F.C.C. ON CABLE TV
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) The Supreme Court strengthened the Federal Communication Commission's authority to regulate cable television with a ruling today that the regulatory agency had authority to order cable operators to originate some of their own programing.

title: RIGHTS UNIT ATTACKS JOB QUESTIONNAIRE.
description: The AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith objected yesterday to a New York State Civil Service Commission questionnaire that it said asks Civil Service job applicants about, their ethnic background.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: The 20yearold daughter of the late Robert F. Kennedy toured Brooklyn and the Bronx yesterday, her long hair flying and her hand outstretched, telling voters that Senator George McGovern of South Dakota was a man you can trust to carry out her father's objectives.

title: Textile Union Picks Chief
description: PITTSBURGH, June 7 (UPI)  Sol Stetin, secretary treasurer of the 210,00a member Textile Workers Union of America, was elevated today to the union's presidency, succeeding William Pollock. Delegates to the union's convention selected him unanimously. Mr. Pollock, 72 years old, chose not to run for reelection.

title: Wider Birth Curb Aids Backed by Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Senate Finance Committee voted today to penalize sharply states that failed to provide birth control counseling, devices and pills to the poor.

title: No Change, U.S. Says
description: WASHINGTON, June 7State Department officials said tonight that there had been no change in the United States interpretation of the rights and responsibilities of the four powers in all sectors of Berlin.

title: Advertising:
description: The news today from Batten, Barton, Durstine & OSborn will interest those who like to read about faraway places. To begin with, it concerns the agency's San Francisco office.

title: Canada Sells More Wheat. To Brazil, Completing Pact
description: OTTAWA, June 7 (Canadian Press)  Canada has sold 11 million bushels of wheat, worth about $20 million, to Brazil, Otto Lang, minister responsible for the Canadian Wheat Board, announced today.

title: WILLIAM BONNER, 79, CHUBB &
description: William A. Bonner, retired senior vice president and director of Chubb & Son, Inc., insurance underwriters, died yesterday at a hospital in Hightstown, N. J. He was 79 years old and lived at 200 East 66th Street.

title: REV. DONALD A. PANELLA
description: BELLOWS FALLS, Vt.; June 7  The Rev. Donald A. Panella, a Roman Catholic priest who was: professor of, sacred studies at S. Joseph's Seminary, Yonkers, was killed yesterday in an automobile accident. He was 40 years old.

title: Arab Meeing Pestponed
description: BEIRUT, June.7 (Reuters)The emergency conference of the Arab organization of petroleum exporting countries has been postPoned to. Sunday, the secretarygeneral, Suhall, Sadawi, announced today.

title: Bank Merger Advances
description: The Mercantile Bankshares Corporation said yesterday tentative agreement for the acquisition of the Bank of Somerset, Princess Anne, Md., has been approved by both boards, subject to approval by regulatory agencies and Somerset bank shareholders. Terms call for the exchange of 4.65 Mercantile common shares for each of the 31,000 outstanding capital shares of Bank of Somerset whose assets total $22million.

title: Insiders'
description: The New York and American Stock Exchanges yesterday issued their latest reports of changes in shareownership by major stockholders, directors and officers of their listed companies. The changes include the following:

title: BALL, IN 1964 MEMO, OPPOSED WIDER WAR
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) George W. Ball in a memo randum dated Oct. 5, 1964, when he was Under Secretary, of State, urged a negotiated settlement in Vietnam and warned the Johnson Administration against intensifying the war.

title: JUSTICES TO RULE ON PUPIL FUNDING
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Supreme Court agreed today to rule in the term beginning next October on one of the most controversial issues facing public educationwhether school financing systems that result in less spending in poor school districts than in wealthy ones violate the Constitution.

title: In Kitchen of a Queens Home, the Ancient Art of Indian Cookery
description: Indian cooking is much more than a series of throatcauterizing curries, This major cuisine has drawn from the culinary wisdom of a huge geographic area over a period of centuries. It encompasses a vast range of ingenious breads, condiments, desserts and main dishes of the highest quality. But, the most important contribution of the subcontinent to the world's menu is with spices.

title: Support Sought for Gun Bill
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP)  A statewide drive for one million signatures to legislation making it a Federal offense to use a gun in the commission of a crime was announced today by Representative Roman C. Pucinski, Democrat of Illinois. He said at a news conference that he hoped the Illinois campaign would become part of a nationwide drive.

title: Schisgal to Be Honored
description: Murray Schisgal today will receive the American Academy of Drarnatit Arts/Pace College Playwrights award for his contribution to comedy in the American theater at the Schimmel Center of, the Arts in Pace College, Park Row and Spruce Street, Dustin Hoffman, Eli Wallach, Anne aJackson and Alan Arkin, who a appeared in plays by the playwright, will participate in the presentation.

title: Blue Cross Rise Rejected
description: TRENTON, June 7 (UPI)The New Jersey State Insurance Commissioner, Richard C. McDonough, rejected today a 14.3 per cent rate increase request for Blue Cross. The rate increase was requested in April and would have become effective on July 1. About 29 per cent of Blue Cross's 3.7 million subscribers would have been affected by the new rates.

title: Additional Funds Voted
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) Accusing President Nixon of failing to provide the money to achieve the goals he has set,, the House Appropriations Committee today voted additional funds for major health care programs ranging from birth control to care of the aging.

title: An Art Tribute to Reuther

The bust was done 20 years ago by Oskar Stonorov, a friend of Mr. Reuther who died in the same plane crash that took the life of the longtime U.A.W. leader more than two years ago.

title: Interway Is Sued by REA On '68 Sale of Subsidiary
description: REA EXpress, Inc., has filed suit in Federal District Court in Philadelphia against the Interway Corporation. The suit asks $27,425,710 (plus costs and attorney's!fees) for damages arising from, the 1968 sale, of REA's subsidiary, the REA Leasing CorpOration, to Interway.

title: News of Dogs
description: Mrs. Constance Vanacore of Mendham, N. J., has an Irish setter pup that probably would attract more attention at a dog show than the top winners. For the 7weekold was whelped in Moscow and herfourgeneration pedigree reads like a Who's Who in Soviet dogdom. How aid Mrs. Vanacore happen to get a pup from the U.S.S.R.? Two years ago I read about dog shows in Russia, she replied. The name of a hunting society in Moscow was listed. I wrote and said I was interested in Irish setters. Much to my surprise I received an answer from Mrs. Tatiana Krom, who has Irish setters, is a leading judge of the breed and is the geneticist for the society.

title: Everybody Well, AlmostAttended A Mammoth Party on Fashion Ave.
description: The fashion industry likes nothing better than a party,, especially when it has something to celebrate. Last night, at a mammoth block party held in its honor, there was a lot of joy and optimism in the air, wafting around with the less lofty scent of pizzas, hot dogs, knishes and egg rolls.

title: M'GOVERN VOWS A VISIT TO HANOI
description: LOS ANGELES, June 7Senator George McGovern promised today that if elected President he would go to Hanoi or Paris, if necessary, to negotiate an end to the Vietnam war and a release of American prisoners.

title: Pat Boone Plays Preacher-Hero in 'Cross and Switchblade'
description: A Baptist-owned feature movie like "The Cross and the Switchblade" prompts two questions as it shows how a street minister brings two New York City gangs to Christ. Is it convincing? And how hard does it hit? Answers: convincing and hard enough. I liked it.Don't expect blistering, savage realism, although the story is based on the work of the Rev. David Wilkerson, a veteran of local slums. Rather methodically, the picture moves to a predictable conclusion, as the persistent preacher-hero, played by Pat Boone, converts the two bloodied gangs with nothing more than a five-minute speech."I really don't dig this scene at all," says the one holdout. Neither did this preacher's son, though I dug most of the rest.The earnestness of the project goes without saying. Nor is it the least bit amateurish technically. Don Murray (who once made an admirable Norman Vincent Peale in a pulpit movie), is co-author of the script, which has a pungent, savvy edge and some amusing dialogue. As director, Mr. Murray neatly conveys the harsh slum atmosphere with some sharp vignettes of drug addiction and the festering hatred between the two gangs. The color photography is excellent, and a brisk soundtrack of rock hymns does no harm at all.With persuasive simplicity, Mr. Boone is obviously saying what he feels throughout the film. Three of the youngsters can really actErik Estrada as a gang leader, pretty Jackie Gircux, who has an astonishing scene of drug-craving agony, and Jo-Ann Robinson, as an impish tomboy. Credit this film for showing one way to surmount the mire without wallowing in it.

description: NOTTINGHAM, England, June 7 (AP)The best of the United States beat the best of Britain today as Mrs. Billie Jean King downed Virginia Wade, 67, 6.3, 64, in the John Player roundrobin tennis tournament.

title: IN THE NATION
description: In December of 1970, newly elected as the junior. Senator from Minnesota, Hubert Humphrey looked over the political scene and declared that in December of 1971, if one man is ahead, Democrats ought to join ranks and get him nominated for President. The party, he said as its titular leader, cannot go through what it did in 1968. Weare not so rich in votes, talent or money that we can afford to squander any of it on fratricidal conflict.

There, in the Joseph curran Annex Auditorium, he gave a concert sponsored by P.S. 3 for the benefit of Hudson River Restoration, Inc., to help meet the expenses of the sloop Clearwater, in which Mr. Seeger and a singing crew have been cruising up and down the river giving concerts for the last three years.

title: 'Black Belly of the Tarantula' and 'Weekend Murders' Teamed
description: Every few weeks there ought to be a film with a title like "The Black Belly of the Tarantula" just so you know imaginations are alive and kicking in movieland. It will help if film and title have no relation to each other. Or, if there is a relation, it should be strained, as in Paolo Cavara's "The Black Belly of the Tarantula," which actually sports one hairy tarantula and several smooth bellies, but for the most part deals with the not so exotic killing of some beautiful young women in Rome.There is a plot, which makes very little sense and ultimately doesn't matter anyway, and rather too much visual style, and dubbing at the usual low level that often makes Italian action movies in English seem worse than they are. Mr. Cavara has an interesting sense of his city, which is cool, malevolent, almost deserted until the final frames. But his sense of drama is very weak, and everything good he can do with his camera seems to betray him as soon as an actor appears in front of it.On balance, however, the pleasures probably outweigh the pains, and, as long as you are not too much of an old prude about watching five and a half sadistic murders, you may find "The Black Belly of the Tarantula," which opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters, a mildly inoffensive diversion.But "Weekend Murders," on the same bill, is wholly offensivewhether more for the spinelessness of its total submission to the zoom lens or for the effrontry of its 10-second quotation from the rabbit hunt in "Rules of the Game," I find it difficult to decide.It is set in an English country house, and it has to do with who wants to eliminate whom among a group of ravenous relatives gathered together for the reading of a rich old man's will. Its elements are wholly conventionalgreat house and gardens, creepy cousins, creaking doors, bungling policeand it is clear that with all its ersatz eccentricity it means to invoke the favored aura of British mystery tales. But under Michele Lupo's heavy direction and with the glowering faces of a cast that includes Anna Moffo, Marisa Fabbri, Orchidea de Santis, and Quinto Parmaggiana (I mention the names for atmosphere only), it feels more like a mad closet drama about the violent takeover of some minor Italian dukedom.

description: WASHINGTON, June 7 Joseph A. Duffy, executive director of the American Booksellers Association since 1952, died this afternoon after suffering a heart attack during the association's annual convention at the Shoreham Hotel. He was 68 years old.

Canton shrine by that model of propriety, Byron (Whizzer) White. They were an odd couple then and they still aro.

description: GENESEO, N. Y., June 7Playing tennis and politics, Mayor Lindsay made a relaied visit upstate today, more than pleasing two Struggling Democratic county chairmen who found him a profitable attraction at county fundraising dinners.

description: LOS ANGELES, June 7The defense in the Pentagon Papers case said today that it would call 18 witnesses, including former special assistants to Presidents, staff men from the White House, Department of Defense and the Central Meldgence Agency as well as Washington newspaper correspondents, to prove that the leaking of classified Government documents was a common practice.

title: MIAMI BEACH VOTES CURB ON PROTESTERS
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 7 (AP) The Miami Beach City Council, facing the prospect of mass demonstrations this summer during the Presidential nominating conventions, passed today an ordinance with stiff penalties. for protesters who march on city streets without a permit.

description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 7  Secretary General Waldheim has begun a new effort to ease frictions between the ethnic Greek and Turkish elements in Cyprus, who are living in an uneasy state of truce supervised by United Nations forces.

title: U.S. Bids Airlines Stiffen Resistance to Hijackers
description: The Government's aviation security chief complained yesterday that hijackers were too often coddled, and demanded increased resistance to hijackers within safety limits.

description: PARIS, June 7Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union will make an official visit to Paris next week, the Foreign Ministry announced today. The visit on June 1215, will be in the framework of regular FrenchSoviet consultations. French officials hope Mr. Gromyko will give them details of the recent SovietUnited States summit conference.

title: U.S. RADIO ABROAD WINS SENATE TEST
description: WASHINGTON, June 7Despite the objections of its chairman, the Senate Foreign Relations, Committee voted overwhelmingly today to approve an Administration request far$38.5million to extend the life of Radio Free Europe and Radio Liberty for at least another year.

description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) The Supreme Court declined today to speed its consideration of an appeal by Mr. Russo to block his prosecution on charges of helping Ito steal the Pentagon Papers.

title: The McGovern Sweep
description: The most astonishing climb out of obscurity in recent American political history has carried Senator McGovern almost within grasp of the Democratic Presidential nomination. His sweep of all four primaries Tuesday, plus the virtual certainty of another big victory in New York June 20, makes it probable that he will enter the convention next month only 200 delegates short clinching the nomination on the first ballot.
