description: LOS ANGELES, June 7Senator George McGovern of South Dakota, convinced that his four primary victories yesterday assured him of the Democratic Presidential nomination, plans to devote the rest of the month to the work of reconciliation in his party.

title: HUMPHREY INSISTS HE WILL NOT QUIT
description: HOUSTON, June 7Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota insisted today that he would not withdraw from the race for the Democratic Presidential nomination, but he sounded at times like a man who thought the end of his campaign was near.

title: Nations. Asked to Agree on Principles Before Talks on Barriers
description: WAFHINGTON, June 7President Nixon's chief trade negotiator proposed today that the industrial countries agree on a new trade charter consisting of several basic principles before they attempt detailed negotiations next year for reduced trade barriers.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: A heavy favorite even before she begins pounding the pavements here, Senator George Mc Govern will open his campaign for New York's 278 Democratic National Convention delegates, the largest state bloc, tomorrow.

title: No Gold Accord, U.S. Says
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Treasury, and later the White House, denied today that President Nixon had made any agreement with the Soviet Union in Moscow last week involving a higher price for gold.The Treasury also denied as without foundation European rumors of the impending resignation of Mr. Volcker as Under Secretary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs. Mr. Volcker is a strong advocate of gradually phasing out the role of gold in the world monetary system.

Carloadings last week totaled 477,925, down 3.5 per cent from the corresponding week last year, The American Trucking Association, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 5.9 per cent above last year.

description: LONDON, June 8 (AP)The price of gold again hit record highs on European bullion markets today but later slipped back as speculators took their profits. The United States dollar was slightly weaker on most key, exchanges.

Nixon had sought the SovietAmerican arms agreements partly because of electionyear tactics, but that the significance was that American politics now required detente with Moscow rather than the antiCommunism of past campaigns.

title: English, Not Dialect
description: Bright young white teachers from good schools and financially secure homes often play down the importance of teaching reading and the other basic tool skills to the poor black kids in the ghetto. They see the effort as an endorsement of the establishment. So much of school time ought to be spent playing the bongo drums or rapping, or just listening to masterpieces from the underground press. But young white teachers from good schools and financially secure homes are not the only advocates of this do your own black thing. Black teachers and black poets and black editors have joined the crusade to make little black boys and girls happy in their hangups with the classroom.

title: Stockholder Revolt Cited by Concern
description: LONDON, June 8The Rank Organisation today withdrew its takeover bid of $1.17billion, the largest ever made here, for Watney Mann, Lt., the multinational brewing distilling and pub group.

title: Pentagon Confident of Bombing Effect!
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  An admiral, and an Air Force general presented favorable assessments of the air war over. North Vietnam today and acknowledged that fewer targets are considered off limits than in past campaigns.

title: Books of The Times
description: Later, he will be a grotesque, but now Ile is beauty in its rigid, most fleeting sense. This is Josh Greenfeld, a writer in his 40's, looking at his autistic son Noah, who is 3 years old and who will probably always be 3 years old. When Noah's father wrote this line, he was neither exaggerating nor being sentimental. I received a picture with of the book and the childis beautifulnot only in the ordinary way, of a boy who just happens to be goodlooking, but in another, unearthly way as well. He has that look of innerdirected innocence or purity of heart that you see on the faces of angels and Renaissance paintings.

title: Lilit Gampel, 12, Violinist Plays Like Mature Artist
description: On Wednesday night a young girl walked out on the stage of Philharmonic Hall to the soloist's spot next to the conductor Wearing a dark blue and white dress, suitable for school, she looked all of her 12 years. She bobbed her head awkwardly in response to the audience's applause lifted a threequartersize violin to her chin and proceeded to play Bruch's G minor Violin Concerto as if she were a mature artist of 32.

title: RollCall in House on Education Measure

The shares dropped 5 points to close at 32, and even though, trading was stopped for an hour or so the shares changing hands totaled 106,100, making it the second most actively traded issue.

title: GEN. C. E. RYAN, 76, SERVED IN 3 WARS

title: Big Balloon to Study XRays

Tony Smathers, the laboratory's chief scientist on the project, said today the balloon would be 700 or 800 feet tall on the ground just before it lifts off. It will expand to 464 feet in diameter.

He was 68 sears old and lived at 8835 164th Street, Jamaica, Queens. Until he entered Flower Fifth Avenue Hospital on May 12, he had been singing on weekends at the Half Note, Spring and Hudson Streets.

Train, at 8 P.M. today through next Wednesday excluding Monday when there is no performance but including tomorrow, when there is also matinee at 2.

title: Cry of the Vanishing Whale Heeded in Stockholm
description: STOCKHOLM, Sweden, June 8The crusade for a resolulution drew an oddly assorted group of environmental protectors out into the Swedish countryside last night to hear the lugubrious cry of whales across the pinestudded landscape.

title: F.C.C. Orders Rules Into Effect To Bar Syndication by Networks
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) The Federal Communications Commission today ordered into effect rules designed to reduce network dominance over television progratiii and to encourage comPetition in syndication of programs.

title: Charles Ireland, C.B.S. President, Dies
description: Charles T. Ireland Jr., who last Oct. I gave up his job as senior vice president of International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation to become president of Columbia Broadcasing System, Inc., died in his sleep Wednesday night at his home in Chappaqua, N.Y. He was 51 years old.

title: Court Again Rejects Atlanta Busing Plan For Racial Balance
description: ATLANTA, June 8 (AP)For the second time in a year, United States District Court has found the Atlanta school system unitary and rejected busing as a means of achieving racial balance.

title: Advertising: Vitamin E Underarm Assault
description: Judging from the location (the Chemists Club) and the press turnout (at least 30) it was obvious that there would be an announcement of a scientific breakthrough in an area of national concern. Nobody was disappointed.

title: LAIRD DISCLOSES SOVIET MIRV TEST TO SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Secretary of Defense Melvin, R. Laird, in secret testimony before the Senate. Armed Services Committee, has disclosed that the Soviet Union is flighttesting a missile that can fire several warheads at individual targets. Thus far, such missiles have remained an American monopoly.

title: Liberal Ulster Leader Resigns His Posts in Protestant Party
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 8A powerful Protestant figure and former Cabinet minister shook political leaders, here today by resigning from his posts in the Unionist party.

title: Cynthia Ann Levy Bride at West Point
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., June 8Miss Cynthia Ann Levy was married here this evening to Second Lieut. Peter Aloysius McDonald, U.S.A., who was graduated from the United States Military Academy yesterday. The Rev. Robert Balonas performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in the Roman Catholic Chapel of the Most Holy Trinity at the academy.

title: DOZEN MAY ENTER BELMONT STAKES
description: The lineup for the 104th running of the Belmont Stakes tomorrow will be defined today with the likelihood that a dozen names will be sent through the entry box. The chances are great, however that the list will be reduced by the time the field gets away for the $125,000added event for 3yearolds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH DRINK DEWAR'S William Lawson's 86.8 Proof Blended Scotch Whiskies. Imported by Palmer Re Lord. Ltd. Syosset, N. Y.Advt.

title: Bank Board Counsel Set
description: George E. Allen, associated with the Washington, D.C., law firm of Hogan & Hartson since 1968, has been named general counsel of the Federal Home Loan Bank Board and the Federal Savings and Loan Insurance Corporation, effective July 1, it was announced yesterday. He succeeds Arthur W. Leibold Jr., who is returning, as partner in the Washington office of the law firm of Dechert, Price & Rhoads.

title: MISS EVERSON SINGS UPSTAIRS AT MAX'S
description: Singer Joyce Everson's debut Upstairs at Max's Kansas City Wednesday night unfortunately told us more about Joni Mitchell than it did about Miss Everson.

title: MUSICAL PLANNED ON 1212 CRUSADE
description: A musical adaptation of Henry Myers's 1939 novel, Our Lives Have Just. Begun, dealing with the medieval Children's CCrusade is scheduled for Broadway presentation in midNovember under the coauspices of E. Y. (Yip) Herburg and Loretta and Ronald Marshall.

title: BOLSHOI BALLET SCORED IN PRAVDA
description: MOSCOW, June 8The Bolshoi Ballet has been taken to task in Pravda for the poverty of its repertory, on grounds that this is crimping the style of its talented young dancers.

title: NEW RELIEF PLAN HELPS CUT FRAUD
description: By FRANCIS X. CLINES

title: DiningTo Spend A Lot or a Little
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: New York Races
description: Of all the choices that voters in the city will be presented With in the primary elections on June 20, probably the least noticed will be those for the post of Civil Court judgean office that has a 10year term, an annual salary of $30,750 and deals with the problems of everyday life.

title: HOUSE VOTES BILL TO BLOCK BUSING; SENDS IT TO NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The House of Representatives gave final Congressional approval today to legislation that would delay for up to 18 months the implementation of lower court orders that require busing to desegregate schools.

title: Theater: Eyes of Chalk
description: Kevin O'Connor is able to portray not only a person gofug mad but madness itself In the emotional and physical intensity of his impersonation he is something of an American Nicol Williamson.

title: Bank Acquisition Completed
description: The First National City Corporation said yesterday it had completed its acquisition of the State Bank of Honeoye Falls, N. Y., renamed Citibank (MidWestern). It will be headed by J. Garrard Holt, formerly a vice president of the First National City Bank.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISA dual dilemma shared by advanced countries today is the combined need for technological development and unskilled labor. If there is an insufficient force of the latter, the former is unlikely to fulfill its potential. This problem is more visible in the capitalist world because the only advanced Communist state is the U.S.S.R.

title: Jersey Reform Sweep
description: Returns from across New Jersey as well as those from bossridden Hudson County show that voters in Tuesday's primaries strongly favored reform and a fresh start. Two men proved the big winners  Senator George McGovern, who may gain virtually all of the state's delegates to the Democratic Presidential convention, and Mayor Paul Jordan of Jersey City, who put together coalition slate that soundly defeated the stillstrong John V. Kenny machine;

title: Bombing of Dikes Denied
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 Two highranking military officials denied today that the North Vietnamese dikes had been targets of the bombing campaign.

title: Senate Panel Puts Some Drugs Under Medicare
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 The Senate Finance Committee approved today a plan to cover under Medicare most of the cost of certain prescription drugs for chronically ill older persons.

title: The Mills Brothers Roll Back Decades At the Maisonette
description: After 45 amazingly consistent years as a popular singing act the Mills Brothers have accumulated such a collection of songs that are associated with them by listeners of all ages that their performances are quite logically made up of the musi cal milestones that dot their history.

title: Hanoi Says Dikes Are Bombed; 2 Top Pentagon Aides Deny It
description: PARIS, June 8North Vietnam charged today that the United States had been intentionally and heavily bombing its dikes, an action that could provoke major floods in its most populous rural areas.

title: Bill Fixing the New Parity Of Belgian Franc Advances
description: BRUSSELS, June 8 (Reuters)  The Belgian Chamber of Deputies today approved Government bill fixing the new Belgian franc parity at 0.0182639 grams of fine gold, or 44.8159 Belgian francs to the United States dollar.

title: CITY AGAIN REFUSES LINK ON UNION PACTS
description: The city refused again yesterday to include language relating to pay. differentials with other unions in a proposed contract with the Uniformed Fire Officers Association.

title: Mrs. Anita K. Friedlander, 74; Pioneered in Health Services
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., June 8Mrs. Anita Kriegsman Friedlander, a pioneer in mental health services in this area, died yesterday in Orange Memorial Hospital at the age of 74. She was the wife of Ftank V. Friedlander, a retired manufacturer of coated paper, and lived at 320 South Harrison Street.

title: Islanders Choose TopRated Junior
description: MONTREAL, June 8Billy Harris a strapping 20yearold right wing considered the top player in Canada's enormous pool of amateur talent was drafted today by the New York Islanders who had the first pick of the National Hockey League's amateur draft.

title: Rangers Top Yanks, 62; Stottlernyre Drops No.
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., June 8The New York Yankees were deep in the hearts of the Texas Rangers tonight as they departed from their first regularseason visit to the Lone Star state as 6.2 losers in the finale of a threegame set.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Complaint Cites South African Ads The City Commission on Human, Rights announced yesterday that it had filed complaints against eight travel agencies and carriers advertising tours to South Africa on the grounds that such tours would result in discrimination against black people and that, by inviting segregated participation, they violated the city's Human Rights Law.

title: South Vietnamese Drop Napalm on Own Troops
description: TRANGBANG, South Vietnam, June 8  Standing in the company command post here today, Sgt. Nguyen Van Hai watched incredulously as a South Vietnamese plane mistakenly dropped flaming napalm right on his troops and a cluster of civilians.

title: AirPolluting Landlords Facing Rent Reductions
description: Landlords of rentcontrolled buildings who have not upgraded their incinerators or fuel burning equipment will face rent reductions, the city's Department of Rent and Housing Maintenance and Department of Air Resources said yesterday.

title: BRITISH BANKS LIFT LOAN RATES TO 5%
description: LONDON, June 8Three of Britain's biggest banks raised their base lending rates today from 4 to 5 per cent.

title: DR. KNOWLES SCORED BY MEDICAL SOCIETY
description: BOSTON, June 8 (AP)Dr. John H. Knowles, presidentelect of the Rockefeller Foundation, has been censured by a Massachusetts Medical Society committee after saying that 30 to 40 per cent of the country's doctors make a financial killing in medicine.

title: JAPAN AIDE WARNS OF TRADE EMPHASIS
description: TOKYO, June 8 (Reuters)Bank of Japan. governor Tadashi Sasaki said today there was a danger of the world's attention being focused on an imbalance in trade between Japan and the United States.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Horse Drugging, Illegal Betting in Italy Leave Fans and Tax Men at Gate
description: ROME, June 8The police reinforced by veterinarians are investigating a series of horse drugging scandals that are enraging bettors and worrying stable owners racing officials and tax men here.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: An offering of 1,283,200 common shares of the White Motor Corporation at $19.25 per share was announced yesterday by an underwriting group managed by Lehman Brothers Inc. and Lazard Freres & Co. According to the managers of the public offering 1,250,000 of the shares are being sold by the company and the remainder by certain selling shareholders.

title: Ethnic Cambodians Again Go on Patrols in North
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 8  Longrange ground reconnaissance patrols in North Vietnam and Communistheld areas of Laos, and Cambodia are being resumed tinder United States direction after hiding been suspended three and;;a half years ago, informed sources said today.

title: U.N. Parley Backs China On Call to Review Draft
description: STOCKHOLM, June 8 China, in an unexpected victory at the United Nations environmental conference here today, obtained unanimous approval for her proposal that the meeting's draft declaration of international environmental principles be reopened for revision.

title: $78411Ilion Trade Surplus Is Disclosed by Britain
description: LONDON, June 8 (UPI)Britain's trade balance showed a $78million surplus for the first quarter of the year, figures from the Central Statistical Office showed today.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., June 8 (UPI)Mr. Brodsky, who emigrated from the Soviet Union following nearly a decade of controversy involving his writing, has been offered a position as poet in residence at the University of Michigan.

title: 10 Killed in Karachi Clash
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, June 8Ten persons, including a woman and a child, were reported killed today when the police opened fire on mill workers carrying the coffin of a worker who was among three persons slain yesterday in an attempt to occupy a textile mill.

title: 3 Killed in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Friday, June 9 (AP)Bombs and gunfire killed three more persons and seriously wounded a fourth in Northern Ireland last night.

title: Red Smith
description: Herb Shultz's letter bore a caption, Humpy Report, which may call for explanation. Herb Shultz husband Bolly is a member of a fishing club whose property includes a small mountain lake that is matted with brook trout The fish don't run big but they are agreeably gullible, lovely to look upon and highly palatable. They are all wild homebreds for no stream gives access to the lake and it has not been stocked in more than 35 years.

title: Panel Is Appointed To Settle Dispute In Hospitals Here
description: Louis L Levine the State Industrial Commissioner yesterday appointed a threeman board of arbitrators In a deadlocked contract dispute between the League of Voluntary Hospitals and Local 1199 of the Drug and Hospital Union.

title: DOW CHEMICAL LIFTS PRICES ON 7 ITEMS
description: Dow Chemical, U.S.A., a subsidiary of the Dow Chemical Company, announced yesterday that it had increased prices by 5 cents to 8 cents a pound on seven Dowicide antimicro

title: Broadway Is Bringing Box Office to Main Street
description: With the lines at the box office growing shorter, some of those who run Broadway's show business have finally realized that modern business methods can help the show go on.

title: Harriman Proposes A LendLease Plan For Helping Israel
description: W. Averell Harriman proposed yesterday that the United States provide arms to Israel on the principle of lendlease rather than demand payment in full.

title: Askew Not Interested In 2d Spot on Ticket
Connally to Everywhere
description: Former Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally obviously relishes the reputation he once ascribed to himself of being a sort of bully boy on the manicured playing fields of international finance. That he did, indeed, build such an image and that he enjoyed living up to it are only two of the reasons why he was the wrong man to send at this time on a trip to nearly score of foreign countries to discuss international economic problems and to brief their governments on President Nixon's meetings in the Soviet Union.

title: Senate RollCall Vote Approving Kleindienst
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) Following is the 64 to 19 rollcall vote by which the Senate confirmed today the nomination of Richard G. Kleindienst to be Attorney General.

title: McNamara Defends Growth
description: STOCKHOLM, June 8 (AP)Robert S. McNamara, president of the World Bank, told the United Nations environment conference today that the war on pollution should not be allowed to slow the economic growth of the poorer nations.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, June 8 Secretary Connally flew from here today to Brasilia, the third stop of his tour. His first stop was Caracas, Venezuela.

title: Market Place: A Case Is Made For Generalists
description: A while back you read about the return of the industry specialist to Wall Street  the analyst who knows his industry and sticks to It.

title: McGovern's Flying Corps Here to Press Campaign
B52's Hit North Vietnam For First Time in 7 Weeks
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, June 9For the first time in nearly seven weeks, United States B52's have bombed North Vietnam, the American command in Saigon has announced.

title: JAMES G. FRUGONE
description: James G. Frugone, who was a mailer for The New York Times between 1951 and 1965, died Wednesday in Kings County General Hospital. His age was about 70 and he lived at 3302 Avenue D in Brooklyn.

title: TV: Refreshing MusicVariety Hour in Premiere
description: A. couple seasons ago, a young woman named Melba Moore made it big on Broadway, in the musical Purlie. This season, a young man named Clifton Davis is making it big in the Musical Two Gentlemen of Verona.

title: G.M. Asks Court to Delay Auto Code
description: DETROIT, June 8  The General Motors Corporation asked the United States Court of Appeals in Washington today to order a oneyear suspension of the 1975 Federal auto emission standards.

title: State Bar Exams Passed By 524 of 888 Applicants
CLOSING IS URGED FOR TRENTON PRISON
description: Calling the New Jersey State Prison at Trenton an archaic, infamous dungeon, the Fortune Society proposed yesterday that state authorities close it and transfer its prisoners to other institutions, parole them or place them in antidrug programs.

title: 9 Stabbed in Fight Outside Lower East Side School
description: A father escorting his teenage daughter for protection allegedly stabbed nine boys yesterday during a fight outside a Lower East Side junior high school.

title: All Hope Is Abandoned in Rhodesia for 422 Men Trapped by Explosion in Coal Mine
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia,. June 8  Hope was abandoned today for the 422 miners entombed by an explosion Tuesday deep in a colliery in northwestern Rhodesia.

title: Fish and Soup Recipes to Try Over the Weekend
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: MONEY EXPANSION SLOWED IN MONTH
description: Monetary expansion, which was very rapid during the first four months of 1972, slowed markedly in May, the Federal Reserve System reported yesterday.

title: 19 Are Hurt in Derailment Of New Haven T rain Here
description: At least 19 commuters were injured yesterday morning when the lead car of a Penn Central commuter train inbound from New Rochelle with 575 passengers jumped the track under the WaldorfAstoria Hotel, smacked into an abutment and plowed along a tunnel wall. Two of the passengers, includng a pregnant woman, remained hospitalized at Bellevue.

title: Harvard Accepts Imprisoned Slayer
description: HARTFORD, June 8Warren A. Kimbro, a highschool dropout who pleaded guilty in the murder of a fellow Black Panther three years ago, has been accepted as a graduate student at Harvard.

title: Common Market Warned on Trade Bias
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 A high United States trade official served notice on the European Common Market today that its attitude during current technical negotiations connected with British entry into the market will profoundly influence the much broader trade negotiations scheduled for next year.

title: 60 Guards Walk Off. Jobs At The Daily News Building
description: Sixty security guards at The Daily News abruptly walked off their jobs yesterday afternoon, but publication of the paper was not affected.

title: Researchers'
description: PARIS, June 8Early next year Robin Clarke, a science writer, and his family and several other young families will move to a farm in Wales and found a commune. Except for the fact that the adults are mature, successful, scienceminded professionals, this is not unusual. What may be unique, though, is that the commune will be dedicated to research in soft technologythe kind that leaves the earth at least as rich as it finds it.

title: COTTON FUTURES CLIMB IN PRICE
description: Cottonfutures prices rose 40 cents to $1.10 a bale yesterday on the New York Cotton Exchange.

title: IRWIN BENJAMIN
description: BOSTON, June 8 (AP)Irwin Benjamin, former president and cofounder of BenBruk Distillers, Inc., predecessor of Old Mr. BostonDistiller, Inc., died yesterday after a brief illnss. He was 72 years old.

title: U. S. Challenge Cup Presented Here
description: Sixty years ago Sir Thomas Dewar founder of the Scottish distillery donated a trophy to the United States Amateur Football Association to encourage football (soccer) in the colonies. Yesterday with United States soccer officials as guests, Dewar's grandson John Dewar celebrated the trophy's birthday with a luncheon and a 60candle cake at Al & Dick's restaurant.

title: Jean S. Sinnot, Charles Drew Wed in Jersey
description: RUMSON, N. J., June 8Miss Jean Stewart Sinnott, a student at Radcliffe College, and Charles Davis Drew, who will be graduated Thursday from Harvard, were married here this evening in St. George's by the River Episcopal Church.

title: Showing Off the City: One Father's Ideas For Children's Tour
description: When John F. Burns takes his pigtalled daughters on.a tour of the city they travel more sedately than he did when he was their age some 30 years ago. His favorite perch was on the back of Railway Express trucks, though, he didn't disdain trolleys. 'The trucks were better because they had a platform on the back and handles on the doors you could hang on to, he recalled the other day at the start of one of his explorations with, Sarah, 8 years old, and Eleanor, 9. You never knew where you'd endupsometimes they'd take you over the bridge and into Queens.

title: EGYPT RESUMES TIES WITH WEST GERMANY
description: BONN, June 8 (AP)West Germany and Egypt announced today that they had resumed full diplomatic relations for the first time since Bonn's 1965 recognition of Israel triggered a break with 10 Arab nations.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Senate Backs Kleindienst In Attorney General Post
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Senate approved by a 64to19 vote today the nomination of RiChard G. Kleindienst to be Attorney General, thus bringing to an end the most prolonged controversy over a Cabinet appointment in the Nixon Administration.

title: F.T.C. Complaint Likens Koscot to a Lottery Deal
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commission today announced formal complaints charging Koscot Interplanetary, Ins., with running a deceptive lotterytype sales operation for doortodoor sales of Koscot cosmetics.

title: Pilots May Strike if U.N. Doesn't Act, on Hijacking
description: The international pilots' organizatiOn threatened yesterday a. global 24hour shutdown of airline service on June 19 unless the United Nations took effeetive action to stop hijacking.

title: Scott Commission Subpoenas 4 Aides of City Housing Agency
description: The state commission investigating the operations of the city government has begun an inquiry into the city's Housing and Development Administration, and began questioning H.D.A. personnel at a private hearing yesterday.

title: ALBANO IS LINKED TO RUGGIERO CASE
description: Herbert Itkin testified yesterday that efforts to influence state contracts for bus service and housing construction in 1967 involved Vincent F. Albano Jr., the New York County Republican party leader.

title: Mrs. Williams Loses
description: NOTTINGHAM, England June 8 (AP)Pam Teeguarden of Los Angeles defeated Britain's Joyce Williams 63, 61, in the John Player tennis tournament today and raised the morale of the United States Wightman Cup team.

title: ROLLINS EARNINGS CLIMB TO RECORD
description: Rollins, Inc., achieved record revenues and profits in the fiscal year ended April 30, with net income up 20 per cent from a year earlier on an increase of 11 per cent, the company reported yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: McGovern to Campaign At 2 City Areas Today
Bridge: Three Aces Among Winners Of World Mixed Team Title
description: MIAMI BEACH June 8Three of America's reigning world champions captured the world mixed team championship title here this afternoon narrowly shading a New York foursome in an exciting finish.

title: HARWOOD CHILDS, TAUGHT POLITICS
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 8Dr. Harwood L. Childs, a professor of politics at Princeton University for 35 years until his retirement in 1966, his wife and his sister were killed yesterday in an automobile accident near Turner, Me.

title: Marbles Tourney Dropped
description: PITTSBURGH, June 8 (UPI)The city has decided to,phase out its marbles program and no longer will send representatives to the national marbles championships In Wildwood, New Jersey.

title: Building on Sand
description: Under plans approved by the Board of Estimate more than a year ago, a wellconceived middleincome, subsidized housing project called HarbOur Village is to be constructed on what has been vacant, debrisstrewn land near the Mill Basin section of Brooklyn. If Brooklyn Borough President Sebastian Leone has his way, however, the Board of Estimate will act today to rescind the approval it gave this promising project.

title: Major Provisions of the Measure on Aid to Education and Limits on Pupil Busing
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Following are the major provisions of the Education Amendments of 1972 as cleared by Congress today:

title: Notes on People
description: Meyer Lansky, reputed American underworld gambling figure, asked the High Court in Jerusalem for the right to live peacefully in Israel. Quoting what he said was a Federal Bureau of Investigation report that he has not been active in gambling for years, Mr. Lansky appealed the Government's decision to deny his application for Israeli citizenship.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week was an estimated $801,000,000, 14 per cent above the yearearlier $700,000,000. Total retail store sales totaled about $8,421,000,000, 11 per cent above the year earlier $7,560,000,000.

title: Judo Expert Has His Pupils Flipping
description: An hour after the workout began sweat dripped from Anton Geesink's chin yesterday to the mat in the Judo Room of the New York Athletic Cub.

title: No Le Hace Is Early Belmont Choice in 0Th Wagering
description: Despite a $50 win bet on Riva Ridge by Paul Anka No Le Hace became the early favorite for tomorrow's Belmont Stakes as offtrack wagering on the 1mile test opened here yesterday. The odds on No Le Hace were 6 to 5.

title: Campus Aid Victory
description: Final approval of the higher education aid bill by House vote of 218 to 180 represents a victory of common sense in a controversy distorted by the entirely unrelated antibusing amendment tacked to the bill. The central issue before Congress was whether a constructive, longrange course of Federal support for the nation's colleges and universities and for their needy students could be charted in time to deal with the deepening depression that threatens the existence of many institutions and has already begun to undermine the academic quality of most others.

title: Executive Changes
description: Milton S. Gould has been elected chairman of Elgin National Industries, Inc., succeeding L. Alan Schafler. Richard G. Miller Jr., was reelected president and chief executive.

title: Common Market Allows Spain To Attend Currency Seminars
description: PARIS, June 8Spain has been permitted into the technical information sessions on the working of the currency bloc of the European Common Market.

title: To Move or Remain in City: 2 industries, 2 Conclusions
description: After months of soulsearching as well as sitesearching for green pastures in the suburbs, Seagram executives decided that the grass was, after all, greener on the city side of the fence..

title: $58Million in Cash Involved in Deal
description: The Greyhound Corporation plans to sell the Standard Steel and BLH Electronics units in the next 30 to 60 daysplus the Eddystone industrial equipment plantfor about $58million cash, it was disclosed yesterday in Chicago. The buyer was not identified.

title: City Rewards Suggestions
description: Nine city employes whose suggestions for increasing productivity saved the city more than $190,000 in the first year of their implementation, received $7,000 in cash awards from Mayor Lindsay yesterday at a ceremony in City Hall. Five of the suggetsions involved the subway system.

title: MARKET DECLINES 4TH STRAIGHT DAY
description: The sagging stock market posted its fourth straight loss of the week in yesterday's session, which saw a brisk midday rally flounder in the afternoon.

title: ESTEP TRIUMPHS IN BRITISH TENNIS
description: MANCHESTER England June 8 (AP)Mike Estep Of Dallas beat Denis Matthews of South Africa, 36, 97, 60, today to reach the semifinals of the Northern tennis tournament one of the traditional British preludes to Wimbledon.

title: Kissinger to Tokyo
description: Henry Kissinger's belated trip to Japan, crucial as it is, conies too late to restore to full health America's most vital alliance in Asia. The confidence and trust in the United States that existed before last year's three Nixon shocks on China, currency and textile trade cannot be revived by a threeday visit after eleven months disregard. But there is an opportunity nevertheless stop the rot and begin the search for anew, if more wary, form of partnership.

title: Louisiana House Votes to Repeal Jim Crow Laws
description: BATON ROUGE La. June 8 (UPI)  Louisiana House members voted nearly, :unanimously today to repeat the state's segregation laws, which prohibited Negroes and whites from dancing together, marrying or using the same rest rooms.

title: 4Run First Propels Reds Past Mets, 5 to 3
description: If anybody finds Tom Seaver's fastball darting up and down Broadway or along Northern Boulevard please return it to the Mets pitcher in care of Shea Stadium.

title: CARL GOLDBERG, 57, A CLINTON PRINCIPAL
description: Carl Goldberg, chairman of the art department of De Witt Clinton High School in the Bronx since 1954 and its acting principal in 197071, died of cancer yesterday in Delafield Hospital. He was 57 years old and lived at 3820 Sedgwick Avenue in the Bronx.

title: Books of The Times
description: Those who feel that American foreign policy since the end of World War II, especially as it reveals itself in Vietnam, is signal success will not much enjoy Richard Barnet's critical investigation of who is making that policy and how it is done. For it is his thesis that there has been great shift of responsibility in the functioning of our government, and that the wrong men, the military, are looking after matters that should be the concern of the civilian arm. He is not interested in locating individual culprits. In his opinion it is the system that is to blame, if it allows one agency of government to dominate the thinking of others to the point, he maintains, that frequently no other alternatives are considered. The time has come, he believes, when we should scrutinize the results of that influence with a more critical eye, and this book his contribution to that scrutiny.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Pnompenh Hit by Rockets
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia (UPI) Communist forces hit Pnompenh and the provincial capital of Ta Khmau, eight miles to the south, with a barrage of rockets early today. North Vietnamese troops followed up the rocket attack with a ground assault on Ta Khmau.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PRICES OF BONDS NARROWLY MIXED
description: Bond prices were narrowly mixed as activity slowed yesterday, but there appeared little reason to conclude that the sharp downward move this week has been arrested, Some longterm rates continued to edge higher and little progress was made in selling the two principal items of inventory

title: Nuptials for Linda Buch
description: Miss Linda Felice Buch, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Seymour L. Buch of Stamford, Conn., was married here yesterday evening to Branche Alvin Lubart, son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Lubart of Brooklyn. Rabbi Joseph Ehrenkranz performed the ceremony in the Cotillion Room of the Pierre. The bride and her husband were graduated with the class of 71 from Boston University. She received a master's degree Tuesday from Columbia University.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, June 8George McGovern is now at a really critical point in his run for the Presidency. Having dealt with adversity, he now has to deal with the more complicated problems of success and listen to all the losers telling him how to amend his winning program in order to avoid losing to President Nixon in November.

title: Brewer and Jamieson Tie in Golf at 67
description: WHITEMARSH, Pa., June 8 Last April while Jack Nicklaus was winning the Masters at Augusta Ga., Gay Brewer was in a nearby hospital after withdrawing from the tournament because of an ulcer attack.

title: 26 ARE INDICTED IN PRISON INOUIRY
description: MINEOLA, L. L., June 8A holdover Nassau.County ,grand jury today indicted 24 Nassau County Jail guardsmore than 10 per cent of the total staff and two alleged organizedcrime figures on a variety of charges ranging from assault and attempted sodomy to trafficking in dangerous, drugs;

title: 68 Wiretapping Act Held Constitutional By an Appeals Panel
description: ST. LOUIS, June S (AP) Four days after a Federal judge in Philadelphia ruled that the 1968 Federal law allowing wiretapping was unconstitutional, a Federal appeals court in St. Louis ruled that it was constitutional.

title: Orantes, PhillipsMoore Win
description: (UPI)Manuel Orantes of Spain and Barry PhillipsMoore of Australia were among the players reaching the men's singles quarter finals at the West German international tennis championships today.

title: OilHungry France Mutes Reaction to Iraq's Seizure
description: PARIS, June 8France's principal interest in the dispute over nationalization of the Iraq Petroleum Company is to assure that she continues to get oil from Iraq, Paris oil sources said today.

title: New York's Pentagon Surplus
description: There is a fresh opportunity for transforming new priorities from political cliche into workable reality. In place of the Administration's new money request of $85.4 billion for the Pentagon, Senator George McGovern has formulated an alternative defense budget requiring 36 per cent less money, or $54.8 billion. If Americans opt for prudent defense rather than Mr. Nixon's planning for a nuclear war plus two conventional wars at the same time, New York and other cities could benefit from the smaller Pentagon allotment.

title: MGOVERN WEIGHS COMPROMISE STEP
description: LOS ANGELES, June 8 Senator George McGovern, whose reform pledges have helped to carry him to a commanding lead in the race for the Democratic Presidential nomination, appears ready to alter some specifics of his economic proposals in a bid to unite the Democratic party behind his candidacy. In a long breakfast interview here yesterday, a few hours after Mr. McGovern finished first in primaries in California and three other states, he expressed a willingness to make some minor adjustments in his programs without altering their basic thrust.

title: An Admission Charge Urged at Some City Parks
description: Plagued by little money, inadequate maintenance, vandalism, overuse and litter, some of the city's 1,153 parks, according to the Parks Council, should charge admission.

title: ROCKEFELLER SEEKS AID FOR REID FOE
description: Backing up his irritation over Representative Ogden Reid's defection to the Democrats, Governor Rockefeller is trying to raise a $100,000 campaign fund for Mr. Reid's probable Republican opponent, Westchester District Attorney Carl A. Vergari.

title: Tokyo Intensifies Security In Face of Terrorist Threat
description: Tokyo, June 8Intensified security precautions here have provided new evidence that the. Japanese police are taking seriously the possibility of a terrorist outbust in Japan similar to last week's massacre at Tel Aviv.

title: GOVERNOR VETOES SCHOOLBUS BILL
description: ALBANY, June 8Legislation requiring local school boards to obtain permission Efrom the State Education Department before allowing school buses to cross unguarded railroad crossings has been vetoed by Governor Rockefeller.

title: National Council of Churches Reports It Cut Its Staff a Third to Economize
description: The country's economic pinch has forced the National Coun cil of Churches to cut its staff by nearly onethird in the last four years, it was reported yes terday by Dr. R. H. Edwin Es py, the council's general sec retary.

title: Gold Boom
description: European speculators got an abrupt reminder yesterday that gold prices can go down as well as up. Through a process of pushing the free market price of gold to new highs every day, they had gotten the price up this week to $67 an ounce as against the official $38 price. In the first five months of 1972 the free market quotation had appreciated roughly 50 per cent, thus providing rich profits for some and causing endless headaches for the jewelry industry here and abroad. Yesterday, reports that Russia had sold several tons of gold unleashed a wave of profittaking that sent the price of gold down to $62.50.

title: Six Erroneously Listed In House RollCall Vote
description: Six House members were erroneously listed in some editions of The New York Times yesterday as having voted against the omnibus education measure. The six, who should have been listed as not voting, were Re publican Representatives Der winski, McClory and Springer of Illinois and Democratic Representatives Metcalfe and Mikva of Illinois and Chap pell of Florida.

title: Hearings on the Platform Set the Stage
Canadian Asserts Morton Spurned Pipeline Studies
description: WASHINGTON, June 9  A member of the Canadian Parlia ment told a Congressional com mittee today that Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Mor ton had shown no interest in studies being conducted by Canada on a duel pipline sys tem to transport oil and gas from Alaska's North Slope and the Canadian Arctic.

title: Del Bissonette, Dodger Slugger In the '20's and '30's, Is Dead
description: AUGUSTA, Me. June 9 (AP) Del Bissonette the slugging first baseman of the Brooklyn Dodgers from 1928 to 1933, died today at Augusta General Hos pital of a selfinflicted gunshot wound. He was 72 years old.

title: Miss Hogan Gains Final
description: MANCHESTER, England, June 9 (AP)  Patti Hogan of La Jolla, Calif., advanced to the final of the Northern tennis tournament today by defeating Marci Louie of San Francisco, 6.2, 61.

title: Skyscraper Serves As a Vertical City
description: CHICAGO, June 9Thomas Ramsier awakened in his downtown apartment here yesterday and buzzed Charlie, the doorman downstairs, to find out what the weather was like.

title: Special Civil Court to Hear HousixigViolation Cases
description: Prosecution of housingviola tion cases will be moved from criminal court to a special housing part of Civil Court next April under a new measure that Governor Rockefeller's office announced yesterday that he had signed into law.

title: RIVA RIDGE IS 75 IN BELMONT TODAY
description: The expected shuffling of the lineup for the 104th running of the Belmont Stakes came to pass at the entry box yester day morning, but Riva Ridge is still the probable favorite in the classic 1 mile test.

title: 89 ARTISTS IN STATE CHOSEN FOR AWARDS
description: Eightynine artists from New York State who work in the fields of painting, sculpture, graphics, photography, music, choreography, filmmaking, video, playwriting and multi media presentations will re ceive a total of $240,390 in public commissions to create new works and perform com munity services on a state wide basis.

title: Waste in Ocean to Be Studied
description: BOSTON, June 9 (AP)The New England Regional Commis sion has contracted with the Woods Hole Oceanographic In stitution at Woods Hole, Mass., for $50,000 to do research into the effects of solid waste dis posal in a deep ocean environ ment, Gov. Francis W. Sargent announced today.

title: Lipchitz Show Is Autobipgraphy, Too
description: The big Jacques Lipchitz exhibition that opened at the Metropolitan Museum Tuesday begins back in 1912 and comes on up to todaya long stretch indeed. Sur prises can hardly be expected in the retrospective of an artist whose work has been conspicuously exhibited and much written about for GO years, but what this one lacks in surprise as an art retrospective, which is ev erything, it makes up in its unusual character as a com bination of visual, written and spoken autobiography.

title: A.A.U. Handball Set Today
description: The semifinals of the Ama teur Athletic Union's national onewall handball champion ships will be played today at the Brighton Beach Baths, 3205 Coney Island Avenue, Brook lyn. Al Torres of the Browns ville Handball Club will meet Ruby Obert of the New York Athletic Club at 11 A.M. and Steve Sandler of the Brighton Beach Baths, the defender, will play Dan Flickstein of the Brownsville Handball Club at P.M.

title: At the U.N., a Decline in Internationalism
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 9  This headquarters on the East River projects a warmth not conveyed by the Palais des Nations in Geneva, where the old League of Na tions had its headquarters. There is a richness of woods and draperies and carpeting here, a blend of browns and reds and blues that creates a feeling of solidity and permanence and strength. In contrast, the Palais in Geneva somehow gives an impression of coldnessstone and mar ble and metal.

title: Market Place:Fairchild Camera And Its Future
description: How well is Fairchild Cam era & Instrument doing these days?

title: Indians Try to Save Old College Building
description: PEMBROKE, N. C.  A visitor to this Lumbee Indian town cannot miss the Save Old Main signs and placards.

title: Attempt to Bar a Judge From Bronx Surrogate Race Is Rejected
description: A State Supreme Court Jus tice rejected yesterday an at tempt to bar Civil Court Judge Louis Fusco Jr. from running in the June 20 primary for the Democratic nomination for Bronx. Surrogate on the ground that he was not a legal resident of the county.

title: Hope to Avert Strike
description: GENEVA, June 9The Inter national Air Transport Associa tion, to which 107 airlines be long, said today it hoped that the threatened strike by pilots over the issue of hijackings would not take place.

title: U.S. Waging Wider Air War Than in '68
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 United Statet military leaders are being permitted to wage the air war as they want in Indochinasealing off North Vietnam's coast and harbors with mines, followed by the systematic and relatively unre stricted destruction of military and industrial targets through out the country.

title: San Francisco Posts Gain
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 9 (UPI)Tourists and conven tioneers spent $272million in San Francisco during 1971. Louis S. Simon, president of the city's Convention and Visi tors Bureau, said today that it was a 2 per cent gain from 1970, when 3.7 per cent more people visited the city.

title: Yesterday's Brides: Not Always in White
description: The June bride who puts aside her T shirt and blue jeans long enough to walk down the aisle in a tradi tional long white wed ding dress might be surprised to know the tradition doesn't go back very long.

title: Stock Groups Back a Single Data Unit
description: Most of the nation's major (stock exchanges and the Na tional Association of Securities Dealers have endorsed the con cept of a single, central or ganization to receive, process, and transmit data for a new national stock market.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: There is an ominous and generalized silence about our military actions in Vietnam. Not that one fears the Viet namese are going to invade California; but one has to know that our Govern ment is blowing women and children to pieces every day of the week and not saying anything about it.

title: Cleveland Election Unit Ousted After Primary Balloting Fiasco
description: CLEVELAND, June 9  All four members of the Cuyahoga County Board of Elections were dismissed today from their parttime posts by Ohio Secre tary of State Ted W. Brown, the state's chief election offi cial.

title: Miss Gonnerman Defeats Miss Stockton in Net Final
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y., June 9 Louise Gonnerman of River Edge, N. J., successfully defend ed her New York State women's tennis championship today by defeating Donna Stockton of Port Washington, L. I., 62, 6.0, in the final at the Beach Point Club.

title: McGovern, in City, Says Humphrey Distorts Stand
description: Senator George McGovern, apparently concerned over his standing in the Jewish community, opened his New York Presidential primary campaign yesterday by accusing Sen ator Hubert H. Humphrey of unscrupulous, underhanded distortions of his record on Israel.

title: Pay Board Eases Its Nonunion Rules In Building Trades
description: WASHINGTON, June 9The Pay Board ruled today that non union construction workers may receive wage increases equiva lent to raises received by union workers in the same area, even if these raises are in excess of the board's wage guidelines.

title: Prison Protest Ends
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., June 9 (UPI)A fivehour protest by inmates who wanted to grow long hair and mustaches ended at Nevada State Prison yester day when they were trans ferred to the maximum security section. The protest shut down the mess hail, a medical center and a classroom.

title: Washington Spurs World Move to Halt Airliner Hijackings
description: WASHINGTON, June 9The United States Government an nounced today that it regarded the halting of air piracy as most urgent matter and was organizing a special State De partment task force to spur ac tion by the world community.

title: Pollution Program Starts
description: DULUTH, Minn., June 9 (AP) A harbor pollution control program designed to serve as guide for all Great Lakes ports began officially today in Du luth.

title: Americans, at Meeting, Say Japan Clings to Old Ties
description: SHIMODA, Japan, June 8A group of leading Americans told a similar group of Japa nese at a meeting today that Japan had not come to grips with the manycentered world of the nineteenseventies but continued to think in terms of the nineteensixties special re lationships between Washing ton and Tokyo.

title: Notes on People
description: The McGrawHill Publish ing Corporation was granted a claim of $776,000 against Clifford Irving, the writer whose autobiography of Howard R. Hughes turned out to be a hoax The action by Supreme Court Justice Arnold Fraiman in Manhattan, also named Mr. Irving's wife Edith.

title: GOLD PRICES FALL ON PROFIT TAKING
description: PARIS, June 9Hit by a sudden wave of profit taking spurred by reports of selling by the Soviet Union, the price of gold plummeted in European centers today. The dollar, which had been slightly weak er in the spectacular gold run up but which was never under pressure, was stronger against the major currencies as the gold price weakened.

title: Atom Plant Gets License
description: BOSTON, June 9 (AP)The Boston Edison Company says that the Atomic Energy Com mission has granted it a tempo rary license to operate its Pil grim Station nuclear power plant up to 20 per cent of its 657,000kilowatt capacity.

title: SOVIET ADVANCES ON MIRY DISPUTED
description: WASHINGTON, June 9The State Department, somewhat irked by a statement made by Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird, said today that while the Russians may have tested a missile capable of carrying several independently targeted warheads, they had not yet tested the warhead system itself.

title: 200 YACHTS START TWODAY REGATTA
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R. I., June 9 Moderate westerly winds pro vided a good start for the 35th Off Soundings Club 220boat, twoday race series in seven classes today. Later in the day, however, strong southwest winds brought out spinnakers.

title: Career Approached Legend
description: In a war largely without he toes, John Paul Vann was one of the few men in South Viet nam whose career approached legend.

title: Blender of Politics and Learning Richard Elliott Neustadt
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 9Richard Elliott Neustadt has never forgotten the thrill of growing up as a teenager in Washington during those heady early days of the New Deal. The Government was considered so honorable and decent that it seemed to him then that a halo was visible over the White House at dusk. It is that faith in the machinery of leadership that he hopes to help restore as acting chairman of the Platform Committee of the Democratic National Convention.

title: Olmedo, Miss Durr Lose
description: CHICHESTER, England, June 9 (Reuters)  Alex Olmedo of Encino, Calif., and Francoise Durr of France, the men's and women's topseeded players, were eliminated in the semifi nals of the Rothmans tennis tournament today.

title: Lawyer Accused of Heading A Washington Call Girl Ring
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (UPI) A Washington lawyer was indicted today on charges of running a call girl ring whose clientele allegedly included prominent members of the Washington legal community.

title: Mayor Bets Key to the Mint As Budget Deadline Nears
description: Batting 500 for the first two parts of the Triple Crown, Mayor Lindsay switched horses yesterday and put a $2 offtrack bet on Key to the Mint to win today's Belmont Stakes.

title: REV. ARTHUR WOEHREL
description: PITTSBURGH, June 9The Rev. Arthur F. Woehrel, asso ciate pastor for the last year of St. Mark's Roman Catholic, Church, 65 West 138th Street, New York, died of cancer in a nursing home here yesterday. He was 53 years old.

title: Vann, a Top U.S. Adviser In Vietnam, Dies in Crash
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sat urday, June 10  John Paul Vann, a senior American ad viser and one of the most expe rienced United States officials ever stationed in South Viet mum, was killed in a helicopter crash last night.

title: Industry in Karachi Halts As 16 Are Killed in Clashes
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, June Industry came to a stand still today after two days of armed clashes between police and workers in which 16 peo ple were killed.

title: MRS. PAUL LITCHFIELD
description: AKRON, Ohio, June 9Mrs. Florence Printon Litchfield, widow r.d. Paul W. Litchfield, chairman of the board of Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company, died Wednesday at her home here. She was 92 years old.

title: Rail Service Will Resume On Brooklyn's Waterfront
description: A string of 13 box cars, idle since May 30 on a siding in the Brooklyn Army Terminal, will be loaded on Monday with 3,600 bales of rubber. It will mark the restoration of service important to the Brooklyn waterfrontrail service in stead of lighterage.

title: Mayor and Governor Lobbying For U. S. RevenueSharing Bill
description: WASHINGTON, June, 9 Mayor Lindsay and Governor Rockefeller, who have not conducted many joint ven tures lately, are industriously lobbying New York represent atives these days with a common goalto win House approval of Federal revenue sharing next week. The Mayor sent telegrams this week to all the repr esenta tives from New York City, urging them to be on hand next week when the House is scheduled to take up revenue sharing, and asking them to support the socalled closed rule, which would permit the House to consider the rev enue sharing bill without any amendments from the floor.

title: WIDER HORIZONS URGED ON JEWS
description: The president of the World Jewish Congress has asserted that the democratic nations are losing their influence and that Jews therefore must increase contacts with the Communist bloc and the Third World.

title: Kissinger, in Tokyo, Showered by Leaflets
description: TOKYO, Saturday, June 10 (AP)Henry A. Kissinger, in Japan on a twicepostponed visit, was showered with anti American leaflets today.

title: Kerner Trial Data To Be Denied Media Under Secret Pact
description: CHICAGO, June 9 (AP)Attorneys for both sides in the trial of Judge Otto Kerner and four other persons have signed an agreement not to release any information to the news media.

title: GOVERNOR PRESSES FOR MASS TRANSIT
description: Despite what was described as intense' opposition from the New York financial com munity, Governor Rockefeller has signed a bill designed to free surplus income of the Port of New York Authority for mass transportation projects.

title: Magee to Be Tried Aug.1
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June (AP)Ruchell Magee, charged with murder, kidnap and con spiracy in the abortive Marin County courthouse escape at tempt in 1970, has been or dered to stand trial Aug. 1. Magee, 33 years old, is charged with the murder of Judge Har old Haley, one of four who died in the shoot out.

title: Policeman and 15 Others Seized In Drug Raids in College Point
description: A policeman under suspen sion and 15 other persons were arrested Thursday night and yesterday as the police cracked down on alleged narcotics pushers in the middleclass neighborhood of College Point, Queens.

title: Dance: Near Perfection
description: The search for the perfect program is something con tinually occupying the minds of ballet administratorsor if it isn't it certainly should be On Thursday night at the New York State Theater the New York City Ballet came up with a program that could well serve as a candidate for that impossible achievement.

title: A Vicious Hitter Who Wouldn't Bruise a Tomato
description: Rusty Staub the newest sports hero in town, is a tall 28yearold bachelor from New Orleans with wavy red hair, a soft voice the good looks of Rhett Butler, a batting average of 300 and a baseball salary of $100,000 a year Now, if only he could cook.

title: ROOKER OF ROYALS DOWNS YANKS, 10
description: KANSAS CITY, June 9The New York Yankees did things a little differently tonight. They suffered their latest de feattheir eighth in 11 current road games  quicker than usual.

title: Retail Sales Climbed 2.5% To a Record Level in May
description: WASHINGTON, June 9Re tail sales boomed to a record in May, up 2.5 per cent from April, the Commerce Depart ment reported today on the basis of preliminary estimates.

title: AMTRAK WEIGHING MONTREAL ROUTES
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., June 9 (AP)For the first time in five years, a passenger train from Montreal pulled into Springfield's Union Station last night. It was one hour and 10 minutes late.

title: Apollo 17 Test Delayed
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., June 9 (AP)Failure of a pressure device has forced a sixday delay in manned altitude chamber tests of the Apollo 17 command ship. Apollo 17 is scheduled for launching to the moon, Dec. 6 and the space agency said the pressure trans ducer problem would not affect the launching date.

title: A Federal Force Urged
description: BOSTON, June 9 (AP)Secor D. Browne, chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board, pro posed today creation of a spe cial Federal force for airport security.

title: Libya Summons Oil Men
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, June 9 (Reu ters)  An American oil man, Nelson Bunker, has arrived here for his first visit to Libya since before King Idris was over thrown almost three years ago, usually reliable sources said.

title: Whaling Halt Urged in Stockholm
description: STOCKHOLM. June 9A rec ommendation for a 10year moratorium on commercial whaling was approved over whelmingly today at the United Nations Conference on the Human Environment here de spite persistent efforts by Japan to block it.

title: ROCKEFELLER SIGNS RUNOFFVOTE BILL
description: ALBANY, June 9Govemor Rockefeller has signed into law a bill requiring a two candidate runoff election in New York City when no can didate for Mayor, City Council President or Controller re ceives more than 40 per cent of the vote cast in his party's primary, the Governor's office announced today.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Rents. The President an nounced the appointment of Anthony R. Henry of Wash ington to the Rent Advisory Board. Mr. Henry, 33 years old, director of the Tenants Information Service, will suc ceed Mrs. Rosetta Wylie, who resigned last week. The board serves as an advisory agency for the Price Commis sion, which has control over rental fees.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: How can Thomas R. Kanza be taken seriously as an analyst of the forth coming American Presidential election when he so far ignores fact as to state in his May 28 OpEd article that no President in power has been defeated during his reelection campaign? What of the failure of the following incum bents to retain their office: John Adams in 1800, John Quincy Adams in 1828, Martin Van Buren in 1840, Grover Cleveland in 1888, William H. Taft in 1912 and Herbert Hoover in 1932? Mr. Kanza also completely ig nores the record when he writes that even when the President has been assassinated, the Vice President who takes over the White House has been always elected. What of Andrew Johnson in 1868 and Chester Arthur in 1884, who had become so unpopular as Presidents that they didn't even dare run for the office on their own? Thus Mr. Kanza's deduction, that if history has any relevance, one can say that the reelection of President Nikon is virtually certain, is totally mis leading. It is certainly no valid test record.

title: Presley Draws 2 Generations of Fans
description: In mink and in denim, in bleached blond bouffant and in shoulderlength shags the fans of 37yearold Elvis Presley Hocked to Madison Square Garden last night to see the first live concert ever given in New York. by the King of Rock n Roll.

title: LINDSAY OPPOSES STATE BOND ISSUE
description: Mayor Lindsay said yester day that he could not support, in its present form the $1.15 billion environmental bond is sue proposed by the state be cause there were not enough guarantees on where the money would go.

title: RIESSEN DOWNS ASHE BY 75 62
description: STAMFORD, Conn,, June 8Marty Riessen assured himself of a spot in Sunday's final of the $10,000 Clark Gum Tennis Classic by downing Arthur Ashe, 75, 62, tonight. It was Riessen's second straight vic tory in the fourplayer, round robin tourney.

title: South Vietnamese TV Man Killed in Clash Near Hue
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 9 (AP) A cameraman for the South Vietnamese na tional television network was killed yesterday while filming fighting near the Mychanh de fense line north of Hue.

title: Debutantes Presented on L.I., In Westchester and in the City
description: Private school graduations are over and the round of June debutante parties has begun. Last night six young women were presented at the 10th annual Debutante Cotil lion of the Junior League of the North Shore on Long Island, 10 debutantes from Westchester and Fairfield counties curtsied to Terence Cardinal Cooke at the St. Vincent Debutante Ball and Miss Rabin Lynn Russell was honored at a supper dance at the St. RegisSheraton Roof.

title: Nixon, in Sudden Trip, Back at White House
description: THURMOND, Md., June (AP)President Nixon, leav ing his wife behind, made a sudden trip back to the White House from nearby Camp David tonight. A spokesman said there was no crisis.

title: One Saigon Advance Unit Breaks Through to Anloc
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, June 10The South Vietnamese Army reported yes terday that one of its units, stalled for weeks while trying to break through to besieged Anloc only one mile away, had finally succeeded in reaching the town.

title: MRS. LARRY L. KING
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 Mrs. Larry L. King, wife of the write, died of cancer yes terday at the National In stitutes of Health in Bethesda, Md. Mrs. King, the former Rosemarie Coumaris, was 43 years old.

title: Canada Asks U.S. Payment For Oil Spill on West Coast
description: OTTAWA, June 9 (UPI)Canada notified the United States today that she expected full and prompt compensation for damage to the British Columbia coast caused by an oil spill originating in Washing ton State.

title: New York Races
description: The elderly man on the bench in Poe Park on the Grand Concourse in the Bronx looked at Representative James H. Scheuer yesterday and asked: Why can't we vote onehalf for you and onehalf for the other guy?

title: Roundup: Blass's  3Hitter Keeps the Pirates Rolling
description: Steve Blass, the Pittsburgh Pirates righthander, may have put it best earlier in the season when he said, Win ning produces harmony; losing produces lost games.

title: White House Voices Doubt Antibusing Bill Will Work
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (AP) The White House said today that President Nixon felt the antibusing provisions, attached to the omnibus higher educa tion bill are not effective and will not be effective.

title: A.F.L.C.I,0, SCORES REVENUE AID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, June 9The A.F.L.C.I.O. announced to day, that it was opposed to the revenuesharing bill in its present form.

title: Cleveland Firemen Protest I.R.S. Ruling Against Raise
description: CLEVELAND, June 9Cleve land firemen began a work slowdown today to protest decision by the Internal Reve nue Service that bars an annual pay increase of $773.

title: Gannete Buys Texas Paper
description: ROCHESTER, June 9 (AP)The Gannett Company, Inc., has completed acquisition of The El Paso Times, a morning newspaper In Texas, for $26.7 million worth of Gannett stock.

title: THRIFTRATE CURB NOW IRKS BRIMMER
description: WASHINGTON, June 9In an openly admitted switch of position, Andrew F. Brimmer, a member of the Federal Re serve Board, disclosed today that he now thinks Govern mentimposed ceilings on the interest that can be paid to savers by banks and thrift in stitutions have more disad vantages than advantages.

title: Music: Levine Steps In
description: James Levine the young man who becomes the Met ropolitan Opera's principal conductor in the 197374 sea son, performed the fireman's rescue trick Thursday night when he took over the first Falstaff of the Verdi Fes tival on a few days notice from an indisposed colleague. Mr. Levine, who had not pre viously conducted the work at the Metropolitan, settled in like a veteran and led a lovely, lively performance Since in his new position he is sure to find himself thrust into many such tight spots, is success seemed a healthy Portent for the Gentele re gune at the Met.

title: 2 Women Call Bar Bell Test Unfair
description: Marilyn Sontag is a graphic artist at Hunter College. She has a master's degree, has studied in Italy and Germany and has had a number of onewoman exhibitions. At Hunter, she designs posters, makes titles for film strips and advises professors on how best to illustrate their lectures with audiovisual aids.

title: Antiques
description: The Barnum & Bailey Cir cus posters dating from 1894 to 1916, now on exhibition set the Kennedy Galleries, 20 East 56th Street, are evi dence of the popular ap proach to poster design that is too often ignored by col lectors.

title: Ruggiero's Former Testimony Is Read at His Trial
description: Joseph E, Ruggiero, a former Republican party county offi cial, testified before a special grand jury that he could not recall knowing Jack Mc Carthy, a convicted labor rack eteer, according to transcripts of testimony read in Federal court yesterday.

title: Board of Estimate Delays Vote. On Mill Basin Housing Project
description: The Board of Estimate voted yesterday to delay until June 22 a decision on whether to rescind its approval of the con troversial Harbour Village mid dleincome housing develop ment in the Mill Basin section of Brooklyn. The decision touched off a wild demonstra tion by some 50 residents of the community who oppose the project.

title: Jamieson's 136 Leads by Shot as Ailing Trevino Quits
description: WHITEMARSH, Pa., June 9Jim Jamieson holed out with an ace today and took the lead by one stroke in the $150,000 Philadelphia Golf Classic. Sev eral hours earlier, an ill Lee Trevino withdrew and left his defense in next week's United States Open championship an uncertainty.

title: THEODORE GREENEBAUM
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., June 9 Theodore Greenebaum, pres ident for 35 years of the Beek man Paper Company, Inc., of 137 Varick Street, New York City, died yesterday in White Plains Hospital after a brief ill ness. He was 59 years old and lived at 206 Rock Creek Lane.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: ALDEBURGH, EnglandOn the sea front late the other night there were fireworks to celebrate 25 years of the Aldeburgh Festival. People watched from the stony beach, huddled behind fishermen's shacks for shelter from the cold North Sea wind. As the first rocket went up and loosed a shower of stars, the crowd went ooh and aah and then, amused by the sounds, re peated them selfmockingly with each new display.

title: 4, including Drug Smuggler, Acquitted in Conspiracy Case
description: Louis Cirillo, a heroin dealer who was said to have supplied onesixth of the heroin used in the United States each year, and three other men were ac quitted yesterday by a Federal District Court jury of charges of conspiring to obstruct jus tice. Cirillo was convicted and sentenced to 25 years in prison for smuggling heroin.

title: Peking Takes Stock of Wall Street Ways
description: PEKING, June 9The Chinese revolution has met Wall Street and quite possibly neither will ever be exactly the same again.

title: SHOP TALK
description: If you fly to Rome you can buy sheets and pillow cases, curtain and drapery fabrics as well as table and cookwares designed by Valentino, the Italian couturier. The designs are all available in the boutique he opened late last month at 13 Via Condotti.

title: $50,000 GOLF LED BY MISS MILLER
description: SUTTON, Mass., June 9 (AP) Sharon Miller, seeking her first victory on the women's professional golf tour, posted a 72 today for a 36hole total of 146 and a twostroke lead in the $50,000 Eve Ladies Profes sional Golf Association cham pionship.

title: Bridge:  World Team Olympiad Beset By Organizational Problems
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., June 9The fourth World Bridge Team Olympiad began here this afternoon amid some organizational confusion. Amid other minor problems, the VuGraph was out of commission and the players had to wait long periods for boards.

title: Swinging Srinagar Awaits Return of Lion of Kashmir
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir, June 7Countless little candles flickered in rows on every battered window sill in the oldest quarters of Srinagar this week, casting restless yellow light on decrepit brick buildings that seemed about to collapse from old age. Ex ploding firecrackers rever berated in the narrow, winding streets, which are said to be 2,000 years old and look it. With most of the celebrating crowds in flowing Moslem garb, and many of the men sucking gurgling water pipes, the scene seemed to belong more to the Arabian Nights than the Himalayan setting of Kashmir.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: This letter on the grave and tragic events in Vietnam is written on be half of Labor Action for Peace, which is sponsored by eighty British Mem bers of Parliament, by union leaders, clergy and others.

title: DES Found in Two Steers
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (AP) The Agriculture Department said today that residues of di ethylstilbestrol had been found in the livers of a steer grown in California and another in Oregon. This brought to 24 the number of DES residue cases in cattle and sheep since tight ened regulations were put into effect last January.

title: OIL NATIONS BACK IRAQ'S TAKEOVER
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 9The 11 nations of the Organi zation of Petroleum Exporting Countries, meeting heie in emergency session, gave their unanimous support today to Iraq, which nationalized the Iraq Petroleum Company on June 1.

title: Soviet Takes 10 Lead
description: WARSAW, June 9 (UPI)The Soviet Union took a 10 lead over Poland today after the first day of Davis Cup Group A semifinal matches.

title: Connally Meets Brazilians On World Monetary Reform
description: BRASILIA, June 9 (UPI)John B. Connally, President Nixon's special representative, ended a discussion of interna tional monetary problems with Brazilian experts and flew to Silo Paulo today. The former Treasury Secretary, who is on a 15nation tour, arrived here yesterday from Colombia. He met for two hours this morning with Finance Minister AntOnio Delfim Neto and other Govern merit and bank Officials.

title: Musical to Be Transferred
description: Don't Bother Me, I Can't Cope, the Edward Padula and Arch Lustberg musical produc tion, will be transferred Tues day from the Playhouse on West 48th Street to the Edison Theater on West 47th Street.

title: New Currency System
description: PARIS, June 9Six months after the currency realign ment that ended the gravest monetary crisis since the great Depression, the Western world, at least in crudest economic terms, is a better place in which to live.

title: Diplomat and Merchant Get 10 Years in Drug Smuggling
description: A 59yearold Philippine dip lomat and a 61yearold Chi neseborn Bangkok, merchant were each sentenced to 10 years in prison yesterday for smuggling $13million worth of heroin into the United States last November.

title: Tribute From Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 Ronald L. Ziegler, White House press secretary, read a tribute to Mr. Vann in President Nixon's behalf today, It said:

title: POLICE GET GUNMAN IN BRONX TO GIVE IN
description: A man with a 22caliber semiautomatic rifle exchanged a dozen shots with the police from the windows of his Bronx apartment yesterday and held police reinforcements at bay for nearly three hours before surrendering peacefully. No one was injured in the incident.

title: Albert Is Hospitalized Following Chest Pains
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, June 9 (AP)Representative Carl Al bert, who as House Speaker holds the nation's third high est elective office, suffered chest pains tonight before a Democratic dinner and was taken to a hospital.

title: Soviet Orbits Cosmos 492
description: MOSCOW, June 9The So viet Union launched today the unmanned spacecraft Cosmos 492, which is believed to be an observation satellite. The craft was launched into an orbit of 212 by 130 miles at an angle to the Equator of 65 degrees. The orbit has been character istic of a series of large mili tary observation satellites that are generally recovered after about 12 days in orbit.

title: Korvette Plans to Close Thirty Furniture Stores
description: About 30 furniture stores, with total space of about 1 mil lion square feet, will be closed by the Korvette discount de partment stores In the next (three years and the furniture operations will be transferred to nearby or adjacent regular Korvette stores, Marshall Rose, president, said yesterday.

title: ExPoliceman, Burglary Victim, Helps to Catch Queens Suspect
description: A retired policeman returned to police work Thursday night to try to end a series of burglar ies of the catering establish ment he owns in the Little Neck section of Queens. His tactics led to a chase and the arrest of a man charged with burglary, criminal possession of stolen goods and possession of bur glar's tools.

title: Mets Lose Third in a Row, 4 to 2
description: Tommie Agee sat out last night's game because Manager Yogi Berra said Agee was feel ing sluggish, but it was Cleon Jones who played as if he were sluggish as the Astros handed the Mets their third straight de feat, 42.

title: Firemen Sick Calls Put 15 of 390 Units Out of Service Here
description: The number of firemen and their officers reporting sick or injured after fires rose sharply yesterday, forcing 15 of the city's 390 fire companies out of service temporarily and prompt ing Fire Commissioner Robert 0. Lowery to issue a warning on the consequences of any concerted job action.

title: Man and Woman Indicted In Jet Hijacking to Algeria
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June (AP)9A Federal grand jury in dicted a man and woman to day on charges stemming from the hijacking of a Western Air lines jet to Algeria on June 1.

title: $100,000 in Stolen Goods Found on Lower East Side
description: More than $100,000 worth of stolen property, including oil paintings, jewelry and men's clothing, was recovered by the police yesterday when they en tered two apartments at 151 Second Avenue on the lower East Side.

title: MRS. INGERSOLL, 91, EARLY SUFFRAGETTE
description: NORTHPORT, LI., June 9Mrs. Marion Crary Ingersoll, an, early leader in family planning and in women's suffrage, died today at a nursing home here. She was 91 years old and lived here and at 1 Beekman Place, New York.

title: U.S. Women Take Lead In Curtis Cup Golf, 5 3
description: WESTERN GAILES, Scot land, June 9 (AP)  The Unit ed States, after trailing, 12, in the morning foursomes, rallied in the afternoon singles today to lead Britain, 5 3, at the end of the first day of the Cur tis Cup women's golf competi tion.

title: Blin Outpoints Urtain to Win European Heavyweight Title
description: MADRID, June 9 (AP)Jur gen Blin of West Germany out pointed Jose Manuel (Urtain) Ibar of Spain tonight in a 15 round boxing match and won the European heavyweight championship. This was Ur tain's first defense of the title he regained from Jack Bodell of Britain last Dec. 17.

title: Cold Camera Designed for Astronomers
description: WASHINGTON, June 9A cold camera suitable for photographing the stars was patented this week by two young men, one of whom was only 17 years old when the invention was made. Patent 3, 667,358 went to William D. Wil liams Jr. of Mah wah, N.
