description: Joseph E. Ruggiero testified yesterday that he bad accepted a cash payment of $2,500 as a legal fee to help the Carey Transportation Company in 1967 when he was an official of the New York County Republican party.

title: U.S. Women Triumph
description: BECKENHAM, England, June 12 (AP)Sue Stap of Deerfield, Ill., defeated Glynis Coles, 63, 26, 86, in the final singles matches, breaking tie and leading the United States Junior Wightman Cup tennis team to a 42 victory over Britain today.

title: Full Halt to Atomic Testing Urged at Stockholm Parley
description: STOCKHOLM, June 12A call for a halt to all testing nuclear weapons, denounced as a source of global pollution, was overwhelmingly approved at the United Nations environmental conference here today. The vote, on the resolution was 48 to 2, with 14 nations abstaining, among them two nuclear powers, the United States and Britain.

title: ASBESTOS RULINGS HEED INADEQUATE
description: WASHINGTON, June 12An authority on asbestoscaused cancer said today that tens of thousands of workers exposed to asbestos would die because of inadequate regulations issued by the Government's Occupational Safety and Health Administration.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Blanket condemnations of the American judicial system are certainly unfair and unrealistic, but can anyone begrudge Angela Davis a moment of bitterness considering what she has just gone through?

title: Treasury Bill Rates Fell at Weekly Sale
Humphrey Drops Out of Mainstream for a Dip at Lake Home
Lazar Names Gold as Deputy
description: Taxi Commissioner Michael J. Lazar has named Stanley L. Gold first deputy commissioner for administration at a salary of $33,710. Mr. Gold, a career city employe, :lad been assistant administrator, office of programs and systems analysis, in the City Transportation Administration. Mr. Lazar said yesterday that the post had been created for Mr. Gold because the Taxi and Limousine Cornimissioner was moving forward into areas where we need management expertise.

title: STOCKS EDGE UP IN SLOW TRADING
SHOP TALK
description: With all that talk about gold (its price on the world market seems to be setting new highs with 18karat regularity), no wonder Leslie Rankow is optimistic about her new gallery of the East Side specializing in the art of the goldsmith.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I am responding to your May 20 editorials A Newspaper's Function and The Pentagon Bombing. I share your abhorrence of Government regulation of the news through threats, censorship or repression as well as your abhorrence of violence as a means of registering dissent from the violence of war. However, these simplistic editorials fail to see the problem and are morally deficient.

title: Yankees Call Up Sanchez and Send Hinton to Syracuse
description: Hoping to inject some offensive power into their lineup as they open an eightgame home stand, the Yankees called up Celerino Sanchez, a third baseman with a 329 batting average, from their Syracuse club in the International League yesterday.

title: Texas Democrat Asks Ouster of Key Official
Jersey Labor to Reconsider Rejection of Tax Reform
description: TRENTON, June 12Leaders of the state A.F.L.C.I.O. met for three hours today with Gov. William T. Cahill and agreed to reconsider their rejection of his tax reform package.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: Olympic Sail Trials Off
description: PORT ABINO, Ontario, June 12 (AP)  Rain and shifting winds forced a oneday postponement today of the United States Olympic trials for Flying Dutchmen on eastern Lake Erie.

title: Mrs. John Marshall Harlan, 76, Widow of Supreme Court Justice
description: WESTON, Conn., June 12Mrs. Ethel Andrews Harlan, widow of Associate Justice John Marshall Harlan of the United States Supreme Court, died today at Little Mountains, her home here. She was 76 years old.

title: M'DONALD TO SELL 46 SUPERMARKETS
description: The E. F. MacDonald Company, noted for its tradingstamp and incentiveprogram operations, is planning to sell its supermarket business to Fisher Foods, Inc.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a practicing anesthesiologist, read Harry Schwartz's June 4 Week in Review article AcupunctureThe Needle PainKiller Comes to America with great interest. I have also been following the evermultiplying articles in the medical literature.

title: Connally in Bolivia
description: LA PAZ. Bolivia, Tuesday, June 13 (AP)  Mr. Connally arrived here late yesterday from Buenos Aires.

title: VICTOR HOO DEAD; U.N. OFFICIAL, 78
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 12Dr. Victor Chitsai Hoo, a Nationalist Chinese who was one of the topranking officials of the United Nations for 26 years until his retirement this spring, died Friday night at Yonkers Professional Hospital at the age of 77.

title: KLEINDIENST GETS PRAISE BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 President Nixon, at a swearingin ceremony for Richard Kleindienst, described his new Attorney General today as man of honesty and integrity. He said that Mr. Kleindienst's long ordeal in gaining confirmation in the Senate had only strengthened the President's confidence in him.

title: Daily News Delayed by Strike; Shutdown by Thursday Feared
description: Delivery of early editions of today's Daily News was delayed for nearly an hour last night by a strike of guards that has cut off delivery of newsprint to the newspaper and has led the management to forecast a total shutdown by Thursday night.

title: Merger Bid Made For Upstate Bank By Manufacturers
ENVOY HINTS U.S. WORD WELCOME NEW PEACE TALKS
description: PARIS, June 12William J. Porter, chief American negotiator at the Vietnam peace talks, returned here today after almost a month's absence and announced renewed interest in resuming the stalled negotiations.

title: 4 STOLEN PAINTINGS ARE BACK IN MUSEUM
description: WORCESTER, Mass., June 12 (AP)  Four stolen art works valued at more than $1million were recovered here today by the police and agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Syracuse Unit Drops Challenge To Transfer of a TV Station
description: WASHINGTON, June 12  A group of citizens in Syracuse withdrew today their challenge of a transfer of ownership of a Syracuse television station after they had received assurances from the prospective owners that they would improve the station's treatment of minorities and women.

title: Federal Warning Issued On Volkswagen Wipers
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP)  The Department of Transportation warned motorists today that windshield wiper failures had been occurring without warning on certain Volkswagens manufactured over a 22year period.

title: Aussie Rower Is Killed; 2d Tragedy for Team
description: SYDNEY, Australia, June 12 (AP)Australia's Olympic rowing team suffered its second tragedy today when Brian Denny was electrocuted.

title: JOSEPH A. FITZGIBBON
description: Joseph A. Fitzgibbon, who retired in 1967 as vice president of Albert FrankGuenther Law, the advertising and public relations firm with which he had been associated since 1929, died Sunday at his home, 8707 Dalny Road, Jamaica, Queens. He was 67 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In reference to your June 1 editorial Death for Sale, might this not be an interesting deterrent: in addition to arresting a guncrime's perpetrator, fine the seller and manufacturer. That could make them scan credentials more carefully.

title: KJARTANSSON, ENVOY OF ICELAND TO U.N., 55
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 12Hannes Kjartansson, Iceland's chief delegate to the United Nations since 1965 and consul general in New York died yesterday at New York, Hospital. He was 55 years old.

title: CURTIS PUBLISHING FILES WITH S.E.C.
description: The Curtis Publishing Company filed yesterday its previously announced recapitalization plan with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The company also released details of its previously announced plan to acquire the Review Publishing Company, a publisher of 10 children's and trade publications, from Beurt R. Ser. Vaas, chairman and president of Curtis.

title: WALLACE DELEGATES BACKED IN A STUDY
Stockton 64, 61 Victor
description: ATHENS, Ga., June 12 (AP) Favored Trinity University, led by topseeded Dick Stockton, took a share of the lead after two rounds in the 88th annual National Collegiate tennis championships today.

title: Executive Changes
description: J. Edwin Matz has been elected senior executive vice president of the John Hancock Mutual Life Insurance Company, Boston.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Since The Times has had seven editorials in recent months, the latest being on June 7, concerning Congressional action in breaching the trade embargo against Rhodesia, perhaps you would grant me a little space to present certain facts:

title: Annual Powell Award Planned by Black Caucus
U.S. Cites Controls
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 Senior administration officials said today that computers and other navigational and bombing control systems made it unlikely that United States aircraft attacking North Vietnam would accidentally, stray over Chinese territory.

title: RUSHING RITES DRAW 300 INCLUDING BASIE
description: More than 300 mourners, among them Count Basie, BenGoodman, Erskine Hawkins,) Buck Clayton and Al Hibbleri attended the funeral yesterday of Jimmy Rushing at St. Peter's Lutheran Church, Lexington Avenue and 54th Street.

title: Rockwell Slayer Loses Pleal
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) The Supreme Court unanimously turned down today an appeal by John Patler from his conviction in the 1967 sniper slaying of George Lincoln Rockwell, commander of the American Nazi party. Patler, 33 years old, was sentenced to 20 years in prison. The appeal centered on the identification of him first from a newspaper photograph and later in the hallway of a police station.

title: Books of The Times
description: One of the dangers of becoming famous is that even your best friends won't tell you when you're terrible. The contents of your wastebasket belong to literary history, and if you've sentimentally held onto any of your youthful extravagances, sooner or later someone is sure to publish them. To the literary historian, these early works may be useful in elucidating certain ambiguities in the writer's later classics, but all too often they merely serve to show how sophistication and surer technique have pancaked over an adolescent acne.

title: Chess: Fischer Displays Confidence In Comments on Title Match
Badillo in the 21st
description: Representative Herman Badillo, one of the city's ablest Congressmen, is being challenged in next week's Democratic primary in the Twentyfirst District. His opponent, Assemblyman Manuel Ramos, has already been endorsed by a vindictive Republican party unhappy with what Mr. Badillo has been saying about Governor Rockefeller's priorities and, more specifically, about his role in the Attica prison tragedy.

title: McGovern, in City, Hits Nixon's Credibility
DuroTest Corp. to Invest In HighSpeed Equipment
description: The DuroTest Corporation announced yesterday that it was investing more than $1. million in highspeed manufacturing equipment to increase production of a newly patented fluorescent lamp. Walter H. Simson, president, said that the company had recently received a United States patent covering sunlightsimulating light sources and would manufacture its new lamp, VitaLite, under these patents.

title: ClevelandDismissalsDelayed
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 12 (AP)The Ohio Supreme Court granted a writ of prohibition today to prevent the dismissal of two Republican members of the Cuyahoga County Board of Elections in Cleveland, where a massive ballot snarl occurred in the May 2 Ohio primary.

title: PENSION OF BRYDGES COULD BE $29,000
description: ALBANY, June 12 UPI)The retiring State Senate majority leader, Earl W. Brydges, Republican of Niagara Falls, could collect a state pension worth up to $29,000 a year it was disclosed today.

title: MOBILE HOME FUNDS INCREASED BY BOARD
description: The Federal Home Loan Bank Board acted yesterday to double the amount of money that Federally chartered savings and loan associations may invest in the financing of mobile homes.

title: Consumer Court System Backed by Bar Group Here
description: Neighborhood consumer courts that would handle routine disputes between shoppers and merchants should be set up in New York and other major cities, the ASsociation of the Bar of the City of New York said yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I read with interest Miss Angela Davis statement that she will work to free political prisoners all over the world.

title: In North India's Summer, Choking Dust Is a Relief
description: NEW DELHI, June 12In the yearly hell of a North India summer, blinding dust storms so thick that all traffic must stop are a welcome phenomenon. For, while they last, the whirling brown clouds blot out the deadly sun.

title: Bruder of Brazil Captures Star Class Crown in Kiel
description: KIEL, West Germany, June 12Jeorg Bruder of Brazil won the Star Class sailing title with two firsts, a second, a third, and a fourth as Kiel Week ended today for the fleet of 48 from 14 nations.

title: 11 HURT AS BOMB GOES OFF IN PLANE
description: DETROIT, June 12 (UPI)A bomb exploded in the baggage compartment of an airborne jetliner carrying 67 persons tonight, tearing a huge hole in the floor of the passenger section and badly damaging the landing equipment. The plane landed safely moments later. Eleven persons were injured, apparently none seriously.

title: Edmund Wilson Dies
description: TALCOTTVILLE, N. Y., June 12Edmund Wilson, who read and wrote with encyclopedic thoroughness on literature, history, anthropology and economics, died here today in the 172yearold stone house that served as the setting of his last published book: Upstate, Records and Recollections of Northern New York. He was 77 years old.

title: Chile's $160Million Debt At U.S. Banks Refinanced
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The Chilean Embassy announced today the signing in New York of an agreement with 28 United States private banks refinancing for eight years Chile's $160million debt to them.

title: YOUTHFUL IS WON BY LINDA'S CHIEF
description: At the head of the stretch in yesterday's $27,775 Youthful Stakes at Belmont Park, five of the six contestants were fanned out across the track like chariot team.

title: GERMAN OFFICIAL COOL TO U.S. BOXER
description: MUNICH, Germany, June 12 (UPI)Bobby Lee Hunter, one of the 12,000 athletes expected here for the Olympic Games, will not receive a cordial welcome.

title: Report That Soviet Dancer Was Jailed Again Is Denied
description: MOSCOW, June 12 (AP)A man identifying himself as a friend of the Leningrad dancer Valery Panov, who was dismissed from the Kirov Ballet after applying to emigrate to Israel, said today that Mr. Panov had not been given a second jail term for petty hoolliganism, as was reported yesterday.

title: Utility Sets Spending Plans
description: The TransCanada Telephone System announced yesterday in Ottawa that it planned to spend $23million in 1973 to build major new facilities and improve existingswitching equipment.

title: Ailey Will Choreograph Met's Opener, Carmen
description: Alvin Ailey will choreograph the dances for the new production of Carmen that will open the Metropolitan Opera's 197273 season on Sept. 19. The Bizet work will be staged by the company's new general manager. Goeran Gentele, with Leonard Bernstein as conductor.

title: Prison and Strict Parole Are Held Aid in Drug Cases
description: A 20year followup study of the first 100 New York City heroin addicts admitted to the Public Health Service Hospital in Lexington, Ky., has found that prolonged imprisonment followed by strict parole was strikingly useful in helping addicts achieve abstinence.

title: Soviet Jew Seized After Bride Leaves for U.S.
description: MOSCOW, June l2A young Soviet Jew who had sought to avoid military service was detained here today shortly after saying goodby to an American woman he married Thursday in a private Orthodox ceremony.

title: PEYSER BLAMES FOE FORDIRTYDOZEN LIST
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 Representative Peter A. Peyser, Republican of Westchester, charged today that his being included on a list of a dirtydozen Congressmen by an environmental group here was result of pressure from those supporting his opponent.

title: Little League Series Pairs Latin America and Canada
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., June 12 (UPI)  Latin America will face Canada, while the United States North will meet the South on the opening day of the Little League World Series on Aug. 22.

title: Nomination of McGovern Predicted by Hanoi Paper
Refugees Stream South As Siege of Anloc Loosens
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, June 13 (AP)Thousands of refugees, mostly montagnard tribesmen, moved southward out of Anloc yesterday as the North Vietnamese grip on the devastated provincial capital loosened after 67 days of siege.

title: Easy Does It
description: The first step is usually the hardest on any journey. But it is an easy step for the purchaser of United States Savings Bondsjust as far as the office where he works, to join its payroll savings plan. And this is the only step: the rest, provided the purchaser stays with the plan, is easyand the money grows.

title: Wall Street Populism
description: With antiestablishment sentiment an increasing force in national politics, the New York Stock Exchange wisely decided to make a gesture to the current populist trend by putting ten public representatives on its policymaking board.

title: Gene Cavallero, Restaurateur Who Owned Colony, Dies at 84
description: Gene Cavallero, who bought the Colony Restaurant 51 years ago and turned it into one of the city's most fashionable eating places, died in his sleep Sunday night at the home of his daughter, Mrs. Vincent de Venoge, of Manhasset, L. I. He was 84 years old.

title: District 50 Votes to Merge With Steelworkers
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) Members of the 170,000member District 50, Allied and Technical Workers, have voted to merge with the United Steelworkers of America, informed sources said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In his May 26 letter, Prof. M. R. Killingsworth states that with or without [an investment] tax credit, there is no reason for firms to buy new machinery if a substantial part of their existing machinery is idle, as is the case today.

title: Speculators Take Gold Profits
description: LONDON, June 12 (UPI)Gold speculators cashed in some profits on Europe's free markets today and initially sent gold prices skidding.

title: American Express in Broker Bid
description: The American Express Company, one of the nation's largest unlisted corporation, announced yesterday plans to purchase a 25 per cent interest in Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, Inc., the institutionalinvestment firm that was the first member of the New York Stock Exchange to become publicly, owned.

title: Bridge: Italian Olympiad Teams Lead In Open and Women's Series
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 12Italy headed both the Open and Women's Championships at the end of this afternoon's play in the World Team Olympiad, but both American teams improved their prospects.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: No Moral Obligation
description: Former Attorney General John Mitchell, now President Nixon's campaign manager, demonstrates contempt for public opinion in his refusal to disclose the names of preApril 7 contributors to the G.O.P. Before the new Federal campaign expenditure law went into effect two months ago, Republican money raisers led by former Secretary of Commerce Maurice Stans had hustled about and collected more than $10 million to help underwrite Mr. Nixon's bid for reelection.

title: REV. WILLIAM J. M'CLYNN
description: CEDARHURST, L. I., June 12 The Rev. William J. McGlynn, pastor of St. Joachim's Roman Catholic Church here since 1969, died today in the rectory of heart. attack. He was 51 years old.

title: Four Western Countries Meet On Iraqi Oil Nationalization
description: PARIS, June 12 (AP)Highlevel officials of the four Western countries directly involved in Iraq's nationalization of the Iraq Petroleum Company met behind closed doors here today, while an Iraqi oil delegation arrived, apparently for separate talks with France.

title: One of the Great Men of Letters
description: In 1963 Edmund Wilson wrote: The knowledge that death is not so far away, that my mind and emotions and vitality will soon disappear like a puff of smoke, has the effect of making earthly affairs seem unimportant and human beings more and more ignoble. It is harder to take human life seriously, including one's own efforts and achievements and passions. Harder, but not impossible. Even as he wrote those lines in his diary, he was working on The Cold War and the Income Tax. He would go on to rediscover this continent's north in O Canada, to publish a third volume of literary chronicles, The Bit Between My Teeth, to write plays and a memoir, Upstate, and to finish a book on Russian literature, A Window on Russia, which will appear in August. He was, as The Times Literary Supplement noted last month in a frontpage essay on Upstate, one of the great men of letters in our century"the American Montaigne.

title: Chile's Cabinet Offers to Resign As Allende Considers Changes
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, June l2 (AP)The Cabinet of President, Salvador Allende Gossens offered to resign today amid growing antiMarxist opposition in Chile and internal dissension in the leftist Government.

title: Trevino Will Fly to Open; Star Weakened by Illness
description: EL PASO, June 12 (Reuters) Lee Trevino, recovering from a bronchial illness, said today he felt weak, but still hoped to be able to defend his title in the United States Open golf championship starting Thursday in Pebble Beach, Calif.

title: Roundup: Brock Big Gun as Cards Win
description: Lou Brock, the fleet St. Louis outfielder, put his bat to good use last night, driving in what proved to be the winning run in the fifth inning to carry the Cardinals to a 32 decision over the Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: Jury in Ruggiero Perjury Case Will Begin Deliberations Today
description: Joseph E. Ruggiero was described as a devious liar by the prosecution and as a reputable lawyer by the defense in the summations yesterday at his perjury trial in Federal Court here.

title: Price of Gold Is Erratic
description: LONDON, June 13 (UPI)The price of gold moved erratically on Europe's bullion markets today before closing generally, higher than yesterday.

title: FRANCE ASSURED OF OIL FROM IRAQ
description: PARIS, June 13Iraq has assured France of continued supplies of Iraqi petroleum in the hectic diplomacy now under way over nationalization of the Westernowned Iraq Petroleum Company, informants said today.

title: New Davis Rally Slated
description: DETROIT, June 13 (UPI)Turned down in their bid to hold an Angela Davis victory celebration at the University of Detroit, supporters of the black militant announced today that the Michigan state fairgrounds would house the rally. Miss Davis was given the site to speak by the Michigan chapter of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference in connection with its Black Expo 72. She was acquitted of murder, kidnapping and conspiracy charges in California recently.

title: FloodPeriled Town Evacuates Infirm
description: STURGIS, S. D., June 13Hospital patients and old persons were evacuated from this Black Hills town today as engineers three miles away struggled to take pressure off a floodweakened darn that was holding back 20million gallons of water.

title: ACCORD ON TRADE AS A TOPIC LOOMS
description: PARIS, June 13A dispute between the United States and France over the role of trade in monetary reform negotiations appeared today to be close to settlement. Conference sources at a meeting of the deputies of the Group of 10 disclosed today that France had bowed to American pressure.

title: Conferees in Accord on Rural Development Bill
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (UPI) A SenateHouse conference committee agreed today on compromise rural development bill designed to stem the rush of Americans into a few giant cities.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Shane Stevens vivid Junk City OpEd article on Memorial Day is yet another futile case history of a mugging. Fine reporting, but where is the therapeutic plan to eliminate this plague? Or shall we abandon and flee the city?

title: British Court, in Blow to Labor Law, Bars Union Fine
description: LONDON, June 13The British Government's industrial relations policy suffered a severe setback today with a court ruling that could open the way to more wildcat strikes.

title: PRINCETON TO BUILD $13MILLION DEVICE
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 13 The Atomic Energy Commission has authorized Princeton University's Plasma Physics Laboratory to build a $13million device to study controlled fusion, Dr. Melvin B. Gottlieb, director of the laboratory, announced today.

title: Opera: 2 Aidas in 1 Night
description: A Verdi festival without Aida would have been a pleasant novelty, but the Metropolitan Opera thought otherwise about its current tribute to the composer. It even went to the trouble of reviving the work, although it had not been in last season's repertory.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISAs the intensity of Vietnam fighting shows some signs of diminishing, there are indications that a serious negotiation May soon resume.

title: Jersey Candidate Quits: He's Not Yet a Citizen
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., June 13 (AP)Joseph O'Dougherty, an Irishborn Democrat, withdrew tonight as a candidate for The House of Representatives from New Jersey's 13th District because he was ineligible to serve in the House.

title: Louis Prima Sound Retains the Flavor Of Armstrong Era
description: Louis Prima, lest we forget, was once a part of the jazz world. He had one of the earliest jazz groups on 52d Street, a group that included Pee Wee Russell and George Brunis. That was 37 years ago but there is still a strong and authentic echo of that period in Mr. Prima's career when. he opens his program these evenings at the Rainbow Grill with When You're Smiling.

title: Dublin Jails 3 in I.R.A.
description: DUBLIN, June 13  Three members of the Irish Republican Army were jailed here today in the first convictions by the Irish Republic's new special criminal courts.

title: DESTROYER GEAR INCREASES IN COST
description: The Navy has admitted that proposed electronic warfare gear for its DD963class destroyers soared in cost from $75million to almost $200million, Representative Les Aspin disclosed yesterday.

title: HERMAN MERGENTHALER
description: HARRISON, N.Y., June 13 (AP)Herman C. Mergenthaler, son of Ottmar Mergenthaler, inventor of the linotype, died yesterday in his suite at the Westchester Country Club. He was 85 years old.

title: U.S. Musk Oxen, Recuperating, Draw Crowds in the Peking Zoo
description: PEKING, June 13  Well, let's face it: The musk oxen are never going to take any beauty prizes from the giant pandas. But at least they are well enough now to face the crowds at the Peking Zoo.

title: SIX DANCES STAGED BY WETZIG TROUPE
description: The Wetzig Dance Company gives the impression of a group whose members like to dance together and have established a good sense of one another's movement. It is warming to see such rapport, but it would be even better if the works the group performs had more imagination. Monday night at the Cubiculo the company presented a program of six dances.

title: C.B.S. Cameraman Wounded
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 13Do Xuan Lien, a cameraman for the Columbia Broadcasting System, was wounded today seconds after landing in a helicopter at the provincial capital of Anloc, 60 miles north of Saigon. C.B.S. said he was hit in the forehead by a chunk of shrapnel, helped back aboard the helicopter and flown to a military hospital outside Saigon, where he was treated and released.

title: Autex President Challenges Move for SIAC Services
description: Alan F. Kay, president of Autex Inc., challenged yesterday the recent proposal by major stock exchanges to have all lastsale price data on listed stocks reported through the Securities Industry Automation Corporation.

title: HighRanking State Legislators Facing Challenges in Primaries
description: A number of highranking State Senators and Assemblymen of both major parties are facing primary battles on issues ranging from their positions on abortion to charges by challengers that they are too freespending.

title: Memphis Bond Firm To Close Office Here
description: UMIC, Inc., a Memphisbased taxexempt bond firm that has operated a New York City office for three years, announced yesterday that it would scale down its activity here and eventually close completely.

title: ENFORCEMENT CITED BY ANTITRUST CHIEF
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (UPI)  The Justice Department's outgoing antitrust chief today delivered a major defense of the Nixon Administration's tough enforcement of antitrust laws during the Senate's long fight over confirming Richard G. Kleindienst as Attorney General.

title: McGovern Won 47.2% Of Votes in California
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 13 (AP)Senator George McGovern's victory margin for California's 271 winnertakeall Democratic National Convention delegates was 175,013 votes.

title: Police Here Issued New Bullets; Flat Tip Called Safer, Efficient
description: Onethird of the city's policemen have been issued flattipped bullets for their.38caliber pistols, police officials reported yesterday.

title: Warning on Parrots Issued
description: ATLANTA, June 13 (UPI) The Department of Agriculture warned owners of pet birds of the parrot family today not to take them to southern California, southern Florida or western Arizona. Quarantines have been placed on the areas because of Newcastle disease, an ailment fatal to birds and poultry.

title: Sadat Clings to Hope for Peace But Is Preparing for New War
description: CAIRO, June 13President Anwar elSadat, according to officials here, is conducting a twopronged policy: He is making preparations for a new round of fighting with Israel while clinging to the hope that, in the end, war will not be necessary to regain the Egyptian territories held by Israel.

title: CHICAGO EDISON BUYS TURBINE GENERATORS
description: The Commonwealth Edison Company announced yesterday that it had placed orders worth more than $120million with three suppliers for seven turbine generators to be installed in two new power stations.

title: Guerrillas Fading From Base in Lebanon
description: RASHEIYA FAKHAR, Lebanon, June 12The Palestinian commandos remaining in this section of southern Lebanon, known until recently as Fatahland, scowl angrily at Lebanese soldiers and outsiders, pass unmolested through army checkpoints in Land Rovers or on foot and openly carry automatic weapons.

title: Brezhnev Is Sending A Hydrofoil to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, June 13President Nixon is expected to receive a Sovietmade hydrofoil boat soon as a gift from Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party chief a White House spokesman said today.

title: Hanoi and Vietcong Ask Renewal of Paris Talks
description: PARIS, June 13The Vietnamese Communist delegations to the peace talks asked the United States and South Vietnam today to resume negotiations.

title: HARTFORD TROOPER, SUSPENDED, LEAVING
description: HARTFORD, June 13 (AP)A Connecticut state trooper who was suspended last month on charges of neglect of duty for failing to discover a fatally injured couple along the heavily traveled Connecticut Turnpike has applied for retirement July 1.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Newark City Council overrode Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson's veto of its 50 per cent pay raises yesterday by a vote of 6 to 2. The six votes were the minimum necesary to override the veto. The measure increases the Councilmen's salary from $10,000 to $15,000 a year. was their first pay raise in six years.

title: Merger News Nicholson File Co. in Pact With Cooper Industries
description: The Nicholson File Company, which makes hardware and other industrial products, and which has been sought by several companies, has reached merger agreement with Cooper Industries, Inc., a diversified Texasbased company.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Put together a roadracing program with foreign and domestic names like David Hobbs, Jackie Oliver, Brian Redman, Derek Bell, John Cannon, Sam Posey, George Follmer, Milt Minter, John Morton, Peter Gregg, Horst Kwech, Bill Scott, Harry Ingle and others, and you have the makings of a namedropping festival for the fans. The occasion is this weekend's double header at Watkins Glen in upstate New York, two days of racing with four types of machinery to open the Glen's silveranniversary season. In addition to the races on Saturday and Sunday, there will be a full day of practice and qualifying on Friday.

title: A TouchSmell Garden for the Blind Dedicated Here
description: A garden of plants to be touched and smelled was dedicated yesterday for blind people in a courtyard of the Jewish Braille Institute at 110 East 30th Street.

title: FEDERAL TRIAL IS SET JULY 17 FOR BREMER
description: BALTIMORE, June 13 (AP)A trial date of July 17 for Arthur H. Bremer on charges of shooting Governor George C. Wallace of Alabama, and Secret Service agent was set today by United States District Judge Edward S. Northrop.

title: New Chicago Store Is Set By Abercrombie &
description: Abercrombie & Fitch, sportinggoods chain, will open its first Chicago suburban store this fall with a branchstore unit in the Oakbrook Shopping Center. William E. Humphreys, president, said that the company, which already operates a store in downtown Chicago, expects the new unit to be the first of many to open in areas where Abercrombie is already represented by a downtown unit.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Dow Corning Corporation has elected John S. Ludington president, chief operating officer and a director. He succeeds William C. Goggin, who continues as chairman and chief executive officer.

title: Memphis Pros Are Sold to Finley
Forums on Recreation Set
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (UPI) The Interior Department said today that it had scheduled a series of forums in various cities where private citizens, organizations and state and local governments can present their ideas on what outdoor recreation facilities and programs should be provided for the American people, especially in the cities. The forums will begin in Denver June 23 and end in Washington July I I.

title: Bridge Aces Defeated by Taiwanese In the World Team Olympiad
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 13The United States team scored well yesterday in the World Bridge Olympiad, winning 56 victory points out of a possible 60. This included victories over India and Sweden, both of which started strongly in the tournament here.

title: Texas Convention Still. Big, But All Else Is Different
Hochuli of Syosset Vaults 152 to Break State Mark
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., June 13John Hochuli of Syosset High School polevaulted 15 feet 2 inches tonight to break the state record he set Saturday when he cleared 15 in the state public high school championships.

title: The DeEscalation of Criticism
description: WASHINGTONThe war in Vietnam has escalated. The voices of criticism in Washington have not..

title: Edwards May Shun Miami
description: BATON ROUGE, La., June 13 (AP)Gov. Edwin Edwards said today that he will resign from the Louisiana delegation to the National Democratic Convention if George McGovern had enough votes to win the Presidential nomination on the first ballot.

title: U.S. Prods Agency on Civil Aviation To Coordinate Actions on Hijacking
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 The United States moved today to prod the International Civil Aviation Organization, a United Nations agency of 120 members based in Montreal, into helping coordinate effective international action against aerial hijacking.

title: British Trade Gap Narrowed in May
description: LONDON, June 13Britain's May trade balance continued in substantial deficit, with imports exceeding exports by $11.8million.

title: A Museum for Children Will Rise in Brooklyn
description: Politics and community Satisfaction were prominent yesterday at groundbreaking ceremonies for the new $4million Children's Museum to be erected in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn by December, 1973.

title: Vann to Be Buried Friday At the Arlington Cemetery
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP) John Paul Vann, the senior American adviser in South Vietnam who was killed in a helicopter crash last week, will be buried Friday in Arlington National Cemetery.

title: British Reject a Truce Offer in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Juno 13Ulster guerrillas today offered the British a sevenday ceasefire and peace talks, but the offer was brusquely rejected.

title: GRANTS AWARDED FOR GENETIC STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, June 13The National Institutes of Health awarded grants today for the establishment of reIsearch centers in genetics at seven medical institutions, including two in New York City.

title: Greens at Pebble Beach Shortest in Club's History for U.S. Open
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., June 13They've done some trimming for the United States Open golf championship. The rough has been cut and is no longer a foot high, but it is still sturdy and substantial. And some of the greens have been cut so short at this majestic Pebble Beach course along the Pacific Ocean that officials are concerned about the future growth of the grass on the putting surtaces.

title: FUNERALS START IN DAKOTA FLOOD
description: RAPID CITY, S. D., June 13 Funerals were held today in this city's churches for many of the men, women and children drowned in last Friday's flash flood as search teams continued to look for additional victims.

title: Hospital Workers Rally In City Despite Injunction
description: Thousands of hospital workers, members of Local 1199 ofthe Drug and Hospital Union,jammed the City Hall area yesterday for a rally aimed atproving that the nurse's aides and medical technicians hold some of the most important jobs in the world.

title: LARGE SAIGON UNIT LANDS NEAR ANLOC; END OF SIEGE SEEN
description: LAIKHE, South Vietnam Wednesday, June 14Large numbers of fresh South Vietnamese troops were flown into the Anloc area yesterday as an epic battle for the little provincial capital seemed to be nearing an end.

title: 100 Mothers Claim Boy With Amnesia At Florida Resort
description: KEY WEST, Fla., June 13 (AP)A hundred mothers with missing sons want to claim teenager who swam ashore here a week ago without memory or a name, the police say.

title: Farm Income at Peak
description: GALVESTON, Tex., June 13 (AP)Farm income will reach $2billion this yearan alltime highbut the average per capita income of farm families will still trail the rest of the population, Secretary of Agriculture Earl Butz said today.

title: CONSERVATIVE RABBI SEES UNION POSSIBLE
description: GROSSINGER, N. Y., June 13The spiritual leader of the Conservative branch of American Judaism told Reform rabbis today that talk of merger between the Rabbinical Assembly (Conservative) and the Central Conference of American Rabbis (Reform) was premature, but the time had come to work together.

title: Books of The Times
description: The man and the legend meet in Howard Teichmann's life of George S. Kaufman and they are one. Everything we thought we knew about the playwright turns out to be true. The lover, the wit, the passionate (and profitable) card player, the croquet demon and the curmudgeon are just where we expect to find them. For a man as shy, private and withdrawn as the author keeps telling us Kaufman was, it is astonishing how much of the man has entered the public domain. To be sure Mr. Teichmann, one of Kaufman's many collaborators (The Solid Gold Cadillac) and a good friend, gives us the record in depth and sometimes puts it straight. He has collated the impression of dozens of people who knew Kaufman and laces it all with enough stories, anecdotes and examples of word play to enable an astute dinerout to live well all winter unless his host has read the book first, which will be likely.

title: Marine Midland Bank Gets a New Chief
description: Crocker Nevin, the 49yearold chairman of Marine Midland BankNew York. was replaced yesterday as chief executive officer of his institutionthe largest operating unit in Marine Midland Banks, Inc., an $8.7billion bank holding company with operations throughout New York State.

title: PENTAGON CANCELS WOLF FUR CONTRACT
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP) The Pentagon has canceled an order for more than a quartermillion parka hoods lined with wolf fur in an effort to save North American vanishing timber wolves.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:During the past week, your news and editorial columns have carried prominent mention of the tragedy now occurring in the small nation of Burundi, in the heart of Africa.

title: Advance Publicity In Antitrust Case Ordered by Judge
description: WASHINGTON, June 13In the first such order ever issued, a Federal judge Is requiring the Government to publicize widely the terms of settlement of an antitrust case before the settlement becomes final.

title: MISUSE CHARGED ON SOVIET PATENT
description: WASHINGTON, June 13Patent Management, Inc., of Washington filed today what it described as the first legal action brought in this country for infringement of a United States patent granted on a Russian invention.

title: A dvertising:
description: Twenty years ago, James J. McCaffrey looked on the American Association of Advertising Agencies as representing more of the age of the dinosaur than being with it.

title: Nutritional Illiteracy
description: We are a nation of nutritional illiterates. Despite a wealth of scientific knowledge of nutrition, too many of us do not know what a balanced diet is and are ignorant of the essential nutrients we need and the foods that contain them. We have an abundant food supply, yet our eating habits are deteriorating. And it is not just the poor who are affected, though lowerincome families undoubtedly fare less well nutritionally than the average.

title: Pollution Laid to Paper Mill
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP)  The Justice Department charged a Massachusetts paper mill today with pollution of the Connecticut River. The civil suit, filed in United States District Court in Boston, seeks an injunction against the Marcal Paper Mill, Inc., of South Hadley, and Robert L. Marcalus, its president.

title: Roundup: Royals Sink Red Sox, 42, With 4 in Ninth
description: The Kansas City Royals may be several seasons away from winning the American League pennant, but they certainly play like champions against the Boston Red Sox.

title: MRS. WILLIAM MAURER
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 Mrs. Madeline Sara Ann Cherdron Maurer, wife of William H. Maurer of The Washington Daily News circulation staff and former assistant circulation director of the old New York WorldTelegram and The Sun, died Sunday in Prince George Hospital, Riverdale, Md. She was 58 years old.

title: April Business Inventories Rose
description: WASHINGTON, June 13Total business inventories rose $550million in April, a little more than in March but still below what the vigorously expanding pace of the economy would normally imply, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: JET BLAST LINKED TO AN OPEN DOOR
description: DETROIT, June 13 (UPI)The explosion that crippled a DC10 jetliner and sent it back to an emergency landing at Detroit's Metropolitan Airport last night was caused by cargo door's blowing open and not by a bomb, officials of American Airlines said today.

title: Gustavus Ohlinger, Author, Lawyer in Toledo, Was 94
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, June 13 Gustavus Ohlinger, a lawyer, an educator and an author, died yesterday in a nursing home at the age of 94. He retired from his law practice three years ago.

title: Labor Relations Board Can't Fill $29,600 Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP)Jobs with the National Labor Relations Board with starting pay of $29,600 year are going begging, the board said today.

title: JACQUES E. EHRMANN, YALE PROFESSOR, 41
description: NEW HAVEN, June 13 Jacques E. Ehrmann, associate professor of French at Yale University, died at YaleNew Haven Hospital on Sunday after a long illness. He was 41 years old and lived at 123 Armory Street in Hamden.

title: U. S. Expands Drug Program for Veterans Here
description: WASHINGTON, June 13The Federal Government announced today a major expansion of efforts to treat veterans in the New York City area who have drug problems.

title: Questions and Answers on Arms Pacts
description: By ROBERT B. SEMPLE Jr. Special ta The New York Times

title: Rank and File Seize Convention in Texas
INTELSAT LAUNCHED TO INDONESIAN POST
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Junel 13. (UPI)A Intelsat 4 commerI cial communications satellite rocketed into space today to serve as a switchboard in the sky for onethird of the world around the Indian Ocean.

title: Rangers Lose No. 1 Pick To Minnesota W.H.A. Club
description: ST. PAUL, June 13 (AP)Bob MacMilliam, despite lastsecond pleas from Emile Francis, coach of the New York Rangers, signed a contract today with the Minnesota Fighting Saints of the World Hockey Association.

title: Rooney Reports Federal Grant For a Brooklyn Industrial Park
description: Representative John J. Rooney yesterday announced a $1.35million Federal grant to help develop a vertical industrial park that he said would create 500 ,to 600 jobs in Brooklyn.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: On Sunday evening,. June 4, at approximately 9:08 P.M., I telephoned 911 for emergency ambulance service.

title: A Newark Group Seeks Investigation of Primary
description: NEWARK, June 13 (AP)The Committee for a United Newark has asked United States Attorney Herbert J. Stern to investigate irregularities that the group charges occurred during last Tuesday's primary in the 10th Congressional District.

title: Outbreak of Typhoid Fever Under Control, Mexico Says
description: MEXICO CITY, June 13 (AP) Mexican health authorities said today that an outbreak of typhoid fever may be considered under control.

title: Boyd Will Retire Sept. 30 As Chrysler Vice Chairman
description: DETROIT, June 13 (UPI)Virgil E. Boyd, a salesman who started his automotive career as a clerk in an accounting department, today announced his retirement from the Chrysler Corporation, where he has served as vice chairman of the board for the last two years.

title: Caucus Calling Meeting July 9 Of Black Democratic Delegates
England Defeats Australia In Cricket Test by 89 Runs
description: MANCHESTER, England, June 13 (Reuters)John Snow and Tony Greig bowled England to victory by 89 runs over Australia in their first cricket test today. They took four wickets each as Australia was bowled out for 252 runs in its second innings.

title: CHARLES E. SMITH,
description: NORTH PLAINFIELD, N. J., June 13Charles E. Smith, retired superintendent of the meter division of the Elizabethtown Water Company, died yesterday at his home, 654 I ownsend Place. He was 79 years old.

title: MIKE TURNESA JR, VICTOR IN PLAYOFF
BinghamScheuer Debate: Question of Emphasis
description: Differences

title: BRUNSWICK OBTAINS LICENSE ON WANKEL
description: The CurtissWright Corporation announced yesterday that it had signed a definitive agreement with the Brunswick Corporation, licensing Brunswick on a non exclusive basis to develop, manufacture and market Wankeltype rotary combustion engines for use in marine power plants.

title: An Appraisal
description: There are no flies on New York's Bronx Zoo. It entertains, informs, instructs and proselytizes, and it uses the tool of architecture to do so with singular skill. The World of Birds, being officially unveiled this week, is the second spectacularly specialized exhibit building to be constructed by the New York Zoological Society in three years following the highly successful World of Darkness, for nocturnal animals, in 1969. After members previews today and tomorrow, as part of the annual garden party, it will open to the public on Friday. The $4million structure is the gift of Mrs. Lila Acheson Wallace, cofounder of Reader's Digest.

title: Plan for Coordinating Unit Backed at Ecology Parley
description: STOCKHOLM, June 13  A plan for a new permanent organization in the United Nations to coordinate international environmental activities was completed here today at the United Nations Conference on the Human Environment.

title: Land for Indians Urged
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP)  Senator Gordon Allott, Republican of Colorado, introduced a bill yesterday to give 403,572 acres of Federal land to Indian tribes in nine states.

title: PRICES HELD ILLEGAL ON TRANSFORMERS
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP) The Treasury Department ruled formally today that large power transformers imported from France, Italy, Japan, Switzerland and Britain are being sold in the United States at illegal prices.

title: Blanket Convictions Barred
description: DENVER, June 13 (UPI)Discovering drugs in a house where several people live is not sufficient evidence to convict all of them for narcotics possession, the Colorado Supreme Court ruled yesterday. The court overturned 13 of 21 guilty verdicts stemming from a drug raid on a house occupied by members of the Devil's Disciples Motorcycle Club in Black Hawk, Colo.

title: The Bronx Surrogate
description: While campaigning in the East Bronx, one of the judicial candidates in next Tuesday's primary heard voters ask, What's a Surrogate? Good question, but the candidate could hardly reply that the Surrogate's Court Is an anachronism that serves as a haven of patronage. Until such time as the functions of the Surrogatewho sees to it that wills are probated and estates administered fairly  are consolidated into the Supreme Court, citizens will be wise to vote for the candidate who is most likely to be free of partisan personal attachments in appointing guardians and has the greatest judicial qualifications.

title: DOGFIGHT ERUPTS IN MIDDLE EAST
description: JERUSALEM, June 13Israeli and Egyptian planes clashed over the Mediterranean today in the first air battle since the ceasefire went into effect in the Suez Canal area 22 months ago.

title: Recreation Areas Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP) Legislation to establish a system of primitivetype recreation areas in the national forests of the East was introduced today by Senator George D. Aiken, Republican of Vermont, and Senator Herman Talmage, Democrat of Georgia.

title: 2 Overcome in Subway Fire
description: Two women were overcome by smoke from a fire yesterday at the 145th Street station of the Broadway IRT line, the Fire Department reported. Officials said that the fire started from a shortcircuit in a telephone cable on the station's platform about 3:30 P.M., and that all riders in the station were evacuated. The women were treated and released at the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center.

title: U.S. Assures Chinese Bombing of Vietnam Does Not Peril Them
description: WASHINGTON, June 13The United States assured the Chinese today that its bombing of North Vietnam close to their border was in no way intended to threaten their security.

title: Medical Claims Put 16 Fire Companies Out of Action
description: The Fire Department reported yesterday that 16 fire companies had again been forced out of service for periods ranging from a halfhour to three hours as a result of fire fighters and fire officers reporting sick or injured after fires.

title: 110 Chileans to Stay in U.S.
description: SAN DIEGO, June 13 (AP)Nine men and a boy who say they fled communism in Chile will be allowed to stay in the United States indefinitelY while their request for politiCal asylum is studied, a Federal official said today.

title: Man hi the News
description: WASHINGTON, June 13For most of his 32 years in the Air Force, John Daniel LaVelle managed to avoid the public eye, moving quietly and efficiently through a number of managerial jobs on his way to a fourstar general's assignment last year as commander of all Air Force units in Southeast Asia. The general has burst into prominence in the last few days with the disclosure that he had taken it upon himself to stretch the rules and order the bombing of unauthorized targets in North Vietnam, later reporting the assaults as protective reaction strikes.

title: KLEINDIENST SAYS HE'LL BACK RIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, June 13Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst said today that the Supreme Court's decision yesterday affirming the legal right of private clubs to exclude Negroes as guests would not impede the Justice Department's enforcement of laws prohibiting discrimination in places of public accommodation.

title: British Pilots Back Strike
description: LONDON, June 13 (Reuters) The British Airline Pilots Association urged its members today to support the proposed worldwide pilots strike.

title: Refugees Are Attacked
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, June 14 (AP) North Vietnamese troops along Route 13 fired on a column of 1,000 civilians moving south out of Anloc yesterday, reportedly killing 5 to 10 and wounding 30 to 40.

title: New S.E.C. Rule Requires Brokers to Add to Capital
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 The Securities and Exchange Commission adopted a new rule today that would require many stockbrokers to add significantly to the capital they keep available for use in their business.

title: Notes on People
description: After a week in Poland, Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba flew to East Germany, leaving his Polish hosts somewhat Irritated and embarrassed. For one thing, Mr. Castro spent much of his publicspeaking time castigating the United States and President Nixon, only a week after the President had visited Warsaw. Then there was the Cracow incident, when Mr. Castro canceled a reception in order to play baseball.

title: Dismissal of a Detective Voided as Unduly Harsh
description: The Appellate Division overturned yesterday the dismissal of a New York City police detective, John P. Tolan, and held that a, threeyear suspension dating from his dismissal in November, 1970, would be sufficient punishment.

title: FOUR ARE CONVICTED FOR PRISON RIOTING
description: Four men who had directed their lawyers to sit mutely through the trial were convicted yesterday of charges growing out of rioting at the Adolescent Remand Shelter on Rikers Island on Feb. 27.

title: SALT's Secrets
description: The socalled secret clauses of the initial SovietAmerican strategic arms limitation (SALT I) agreements, as submitted to Congress by President Nixon yesterday, strengthen the case for speedy ratification.

title: PENNZOIL IS ACCUSED OF ILLEGAL PRICING
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (UPI) The Price Commission today accused Pennzoil United, Inc., of Houston, a leading petroleum producer, of making illegal price increases for wholesalers and ordered immediate refunds to customers.

title: Man Gets 14to20 Years In Police Station Bombing
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., June 13 (AP)Jaan Karl Laaman, 21 years old, was sentenced to 14 to 20 years at hard labor in the State Prison today on charges of bombing the city's police and fire headquarters.

title: Wisconsin Unit for Wallace
description: MADISON, Wis., June 13 (UPI) A Wisconsin Citizens for Wallace group filed incorporation papers yesterday with the Secretary of State. Edward S. Friend of Milwaukee, chairman of the group, said it was an independent organization not affiliated with any political party and would hack Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama. Inc President.

title: Times Square Getting Giant Mural
description: A mural 102 feet long and 40 feet high will be put up on a billboard in Times Square to publicize the flavor of city parks.

title: Ellis Knocks Out Brooks
description: MIAMI, June 13 (UPI)Jimmy Ellis, the former heavyweight champion, knocked out Reco Brooks of Phoenix, Ariz,, in 2 minutes 50 seconds of the second round of a scheduled 10round bout tonight at Miami ?? ??

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The House of Representatives, acting on the recommendation of Representative John Rooney's subcommittee on the Department of State budget, has slashed the appropriations for United States assessed contributions to the United Nations for 1972 by $13.2 million. It has also cut the appropriations to the World Health Organization by $5.5 million, to the Food and Agriculture Organization by $3.1 million and to UNESCO by $1.9 millionall in gross violation of United States treaty obligations. Mr. Rooney wants to limit the maximum regular contribution of the United States to the U.N. and its agencies to 25 per cent of the total by Congressional fiat.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Ray Arcel, whom they called The Meat Wagon when he was toting Joe Louis's used challengers out of the ring like cordwood, is back in boxing and the Sweet Science the sweeter for it. The first gentleman of fistfighting helping Roberto Duran get ready for a shot at Ken Buchanan's world lightweight championship in Madison Square Garden June 26. It will be Arcel's first evening in fighter's corner on this continent in 18 years. He has come back out of friendship for Carlos Eleta, the wealthy Panama industrialist who owns and operates Duran. I got to know Carlos more than 25 years ago when he sent me a boy named Frederico Plummer, Arcel said. I took care of Frederico around New York and he did fairly well and Carlos and I always remembered each other. A few months ago. Carlos telephoned to invite Steve [Mrs. Arcel] and I to Panama City. He said he had a boy fighting for the junior welterweight championship of the worlda synthetic title. Last time I'd heard of it was 1930, when I went to London with Jackie Kid Berg against Mushy Callahan.

title: Robert Condon, 51, Writer For TV and Radio, Is Dead
description: Robert Condon, an author and TV and radio writer, died of heart failure yesterday at St. Luke's Hospital. He was 51 years old and lived at 395 Riverside Drive.

title: Hearing and Speech Agency Is Planned by Boys Town
description: OMAHA, June 13  Boys Tow, officials announced today plans to establish a $30million institute to help children with hearing and speech disorders.

title: Helene Maiorano Wed to G. J. Rees 3d
description: NEW HAVEN, June 13Miss Helene Marie Maiorano, daughter of Mrs. Joseph F. Maiorano Jr. of Orange and the late Dr. Maiorano, was married here this evening to Grover J. Rees 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Rees Jr. of Bethesda, Md. The ceremony was performed in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. James Keating.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: Until Now, These Jobs Were Strictly for Coeds
description: Daniel Droz and Bruce Inglis are going around with a well, we made it look on their faces this month.

title: Jersey Announces a Stringent Code on Eating Places
description: POINT PLEASANT, N. J. June 13A new and stringent sanitary code covering New Jersey's public eating places was announced here today by Dr. James R. Cowan, the state's Commissioner of Health.

title: STATE SETS PLAN FOR BICENTENNIAL
description: Heritage 76, a program for celebrating the nation's bicentennial through New York State owned historic sites, was announced yesterday by Governor Ftockefeller at a meeting of the New York State Historic Trust at the Museum of Modern, Art.

title: Frederickson Retires From Football
description: Tucker Frederickson announced his retirement from football yesterday. The 29yearold fullback, one of college football's biggest star at Auburn in 1964, inrormed.the New York Giants that he would not continue his injuryplagued career because I can't play the way I want to any more.

title: Rockaway Group Wins Subway Fare Hearings
description: After 16 years of trying, Queens group from the Rockaways has succeeded in getting the courts to agree to a hearing on a suit against the Transit Authority over the double subway fare on the Rockaway line.

title: Horan and Parris Winners Of Virginia Primary Races
description: RICHMOND, June 13 (AP)Robert F. Horan Jr., a Democrat, and Stanford E. Parris, a Republican, won their parties nominations in the state's only Congressional primary today. Both men are seeking the House seat for the Eighth District.

title: Brooklyn Woman Stabbed Several Times by Burglar
description: An 83yearold Brooklyn woman was stabbed several times with an ice pick and seriously injured early yesterday by a burglar who entered her apartment through the basement bedroom, the police said.

title: STATE POWER UNIT IS STUDYING M.T.A.
description: The State Power Authority reported yesterday that studies had begun on the load patterns, current facilities and projected power needs of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.

title: Small Claims Courts Called Unavailable to Consumers
description: WASHINGTON, June 13The country's small. claims courts are either unavailable, unusable or invisible to most consumers, a study group reported today.

title: Man Slain on Birthday
description: SOMERVILLE, Mass., June 13 (AP)Arthur W. MacLeod, 40 years old today was found shot to death tin the front seat of his car parked behind a cocktail lounge. Deputy Police Chief Raymond Gleason said MacLeod had a long record of breaking and entering and bookmaking.

title: They Joined Their Men in Canadian Exile
description: MONTREALLike their husbands and boyfriends, American women in exile here seem to be caught up in an emotional debate about whether they are copping out, or being true to their principles, by remaining in Canada.

title: Guards at News End Strike and Agree to Talks
description: Striking guards who had cut! off supplies of newsprint and ink to The Daily News removed their picket lines and returned to work yesterday at the request of a state mediator, thereby ending, at least temporarily, the threat of a shutdown of the newspaper.

title: Veterans Aid Bill Gains
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP) The House, Veterans Affairs Committee approved today a bill to increase from $12,500 to $17,500 Federal grants for construction of special homes for severely disabled veterans. The Senate has passed a bill to raise the grant to $20,000.

title: REVENUE SHARING NEAR HOUSE VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 Governor Rockefeller and representatives of the nation's other Governors and Mayors apparently persuaded the House leadership today that it had enough votes to pass a revenuesharing bill next week.

title: Testing Service Head Named
description: George F. Baughman, president of the College Foundation in Sarasota, Fla., has been elected chairman of the board of trustees of the Educational Testing Service for 197273. Dr. Baughman succeeds Dr. John H. Fischer, the president of Teachers College of Columbia University in the post at the nonprofit testing and research organization in Princeton, N. J.

title: Reuss on Gold Buying
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (Reuters)Representative Henry Reuss, Democrat of Wisconson, proposed that the international monetary fund should stop buying gold from South Africa as a move to curb speculation in world gold markets.

title: A Fixer Describes Drugging Hundreds of Race Horses
description: WASHINGTON, June 13Fixing horse races is like taking ice cream from a baby if you have the right connections and the right drugs, selfdescribed swindler told the House Select Committee on Crime today.

title: CAROLINA LUNCHEON WARMS HUMPHREY
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., June 13Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, searching for support in the nonprimary states, had lunch at the Governor's mansion today with South Carolina's delegation to the Democratic National Convention.

title: INSURANCE SETTLED IN BASEL BANK LOSS
description: The United California Bank of Los Angeles disclosed yesterday that an insurance claim against the Fidelity and Casualty Company of New York, arising out of the failure of the bank's Swiss subsidiary, has been settled.

title: Rome Extends Its Test Of FreeRide Transit
description: ROME, June 13The city government announced today that the experiment of free rides on municipal buses and streetcars that was scheduled to end on Thursday would continue until the end of the month.

title: PRESIDENT URGES SUPPORT OF PACTS AND FUND ON ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, June 13President Nixon formally asked Congress today to approve the two strategic arms limitation agreements he signed in Moscow last month and to continue appropriating funds for weapons systems not covered by the accords.

title: Cargo Shed Opens In Brooklyn as City Revitalizes Piers
description: The city yesterday dedicated a refurbished cargo shed at Northeast Terminal, the first of several pier projects planned for the Brooklyn waterfront.

title: Air Express Extended
description: Air Express, a service provided jointly by 32 of the nation's scheduled airlines and REA Express, Inc., for the expeditious movement of small shipments, yesterday was extended for six months to Dec. 31, 1972. The agreement provides for doortodoor movement nationwide and gives Air Express shipments priority space aboard aircraft. The service is used most often for packages weighing less than 100 pounds.

title: V.F.W. Aids Flood Victims
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., June 13 (AP)The Veterans of Foreign Wars, through its national headquarters, has given $10,000 for flood relief at Rapid City, S.D. The, V.F.W. Auxiliary has given $2,000 additional.

title: Visitors Bureau Terms Image OF the City Unjustly Tarnished
description: Does New York City have to be sold in the hinterlands? Has New York's image unjustifiably soured, from Fun City to Crime City?

title: Wendy L. Worth Married to C. L. Janis
description: Miss Wendy Lee Worth, owner of Wendy's Store, a children's boutique, was married here yesterday afternoon to Carroll Lott Janis, an associate director of the Sidney Janis Gallery, which is owned by his father. The Rev. Dana Klotzle performed the ceremony in All Souls Unitarian Church.

title: Senate Bars Redaction Of Aid for Bangladesh
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (UPI)Rejecting the Foreign Relations Committee's recommendations, the Senate voted today to provide the full $100million for economic aid to Bangladesh that the Administration requested.

title: SHYER FUTURES FINISH DAY LOWER
description: Prices of precious metals futures yesterday continued the seesaw performances of the last several trading sessions.

title: WOMAN IS INJURED BY A GETAWAY CAR
description: An elderly Bronx woman was gravely injured yesterday evening when she was struck by car being chased by the police at high speeds after the car's occupants allegedly robbed grocery store.

title: Market Place: Forecasts Due For Earnings?
description: You've heard a lot about earnings forecasts latelyyou know that companies make them in Britainit is likely that companies will be making them here.

title: SYDNEY J. BRY'MER
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., June 13  Sydney J. Brymer, a retired member of the staff of Bell Laboratories in Murray Hill, N.J., died here on Saturday. He was 68 years old. He formerly had lived in West Hempstead, L.I.

title: PENSION TAX RISE IN 1973 APPROVED BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 The Senate Finance Committee voted today to raise Social Security taxes next year as it completed work on the most farreaching and costly pension and welfare bill in the nation's history.

title: Queens Dinosaur
description: Desperation seems to have taken command of efforts by backers of Representative James J. Delaney to extend the already overlong period of his backward service Washington. The 71yearold incumbent, first elected to Congress in 1949, is being challenged in the Ninth Congressional District in Queens by 39yearold Thomas J. Manton, a firstterm member of the City Council.

title: Honduras Hijacking Suspect Indicted on Wide Charges
description: NEWPORT NEWS, Va., June 13 (AP)  Frederick William Hahneman of Easton, Pa., has been indicted by a Federal grand jury here on charges of hijacking an Eastern Airlines jet and bailing out over Honduras with $303,000 in ransom.

title: Russo May Obtain A Separate Trial In Pentagon Case
description: LOS ANGELES, June 13Separate trials for Anthony J. Russo and Dr. Daniel Ellsberg in the Pentagon papers case became a possibility today.

title: GROMYKO CONFERS WITH PARIS LEADERS
description: PARIS, June 13France and the Soviet Union agreed today that the proposed European security conference should be kept separate from talks on the mutual reduction of forces on the continent.

title: LEFTY PHILLIPS, LED ANGELS TEAM
description: ORANGE, Calif., June 13 (UPI)Harold (Lefty) Phillips. who rose from the ranks of scouting to become a major league manager with the California Angels, died last night after an asthma attack. He was 53 years old and lived in Fullerton.

title: HOUSING IS SCORED BY MRS. CHISHOLM
John Smith, War Ace, Dies; Won Medal of Honor in 42
description: ENCINO, Calif., June 13 (AP) John Lucian Smith, a retired Marine Corps colonel, Medal of Honor winner and World War II air ace, died Friday. His age was 57.

title: U.S. Olympic Aide Sees No Bar To ConvictBoxer's Qualification
description: If Bobby Lee Hunter qualifies for the Olympics and is certified as a member of the United States team, he will stay in the Olympic Village with other members of the American contingent, Arthur G. Lentz, executive director of the United States Olympic Committee, said yesterday.

title: HOUSE PANEL BARS ENDWARMEASURE
description: WASHINGTON, June 13The House Foreign Affairs Committee, by a onevote margin, today rejected endthewar legislation proposed by Democrats and instead adopted Republicansponsored resolution endorsing President Nixon's policy in Vietnam.

title: STANDARD &
description: The Standard & Poor's Corporation announced yesterday a study of municipal bond ratings and credit quality to be performed by the Municipal Finance Study Group at the State University of New York at Albany.

title: City Now Sees Relief I.D. Card Savings
description: City welfare officials estimated yesterday that 30,000 to 50,000 welfare cases might get notices of closing this fall for failure to comply with requirements that they get photographs attached to their identification cards.

title: Suburbs Vote on School Boards and Funds
description: Voters in various communities in Nassau, Suffolk and Westchester Counties went to the polls yesterday to vote on school budgets and related matters.

title: 30 Injured by Explosion In Coal Mine in Alabama
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Wednesday, June 14More than 30 persons were injured in an explosion at the Concorde coal mine early today.

title: Mrs. King Extended
description: BRISTOL, England, June 13 (AP)  Topseeded Mrs. Billie Jean King recovered from a poor start to beat Pam Teeguarden, 46, 63, 64, but Jim Connors, expected to be a strong contender at Wimbledon, was upset by David Lloyd, 64, 63, in the first round of the West of England grass tennis tournament today.

title: An American Tragedy
description: The life and death of John Paul Vann, for years a nearlegendary military and civilian adviser in Vietnam, symbolized the idealistic hopes and tragic failure of the American intervention in Vietnam.

title: Tenants Air Complaints on Facade of Sheets
description: The best grade of percale sheets, lettered with complaints to the landlord, flapped from balconies at 210 Central Park South yesterday as tenants of the 24story luxury building borrowed a tactic from tenement rent protests.

title: Citizens'
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy was awarded the William J. Schieffelin Award for uncommon dedication and ability by the Citizens Union last night at its 75th annual dinner at the Roosevelt Hotel.

title: Chelsea Aims to Preserve Neighborliness
description: Katie Kelly was alone in her West 21st Street brownstone one Saturday night naked except for my sneakers. when she heard a loud banging. It turned out to be somebody battering down her front door then her apartment door.

title: Massachusetts Unit Stands On Elks Liquor License Ban
description: BOSTON, June 13 (UPI) The head of the State Alcoholic Beverages Control Commission, which revoked liquor licenses of Elks lodges in Massachusetts because national bylaws ban nonwhite membership, says a United States Supreme Court ruling involving Moose lodges will not affect the Elks case.

title: LIE TEST IS BARRED FOR PHILLIPS TRIAL
description: State Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh yesterday denied a defense motion to allow a lie detector test taken by William R. Phillips, a suspended patrolman and a Knapp Commission witness, to be used in his forthcoming trial on charges of murdering a procurer and an 18yearold girl in 1968.

title: 2 Pupils Among 88 Arrested in Jersey As Sellers of Drugs
description: LYNDHURST, N. J., June 13 More than 100 law enforcement officers, staging early morning raids in 10 New Jersey communities in three counties, arrested 88 persons today on charges of trafficking in hashish, marijuana, cocaine, LSD, methadone, amphetamines and barbiturates.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: This is what Mr. McGovern proposes for those over 65:

title: Monday Night Fights
description: New York (Felt Forum)Dario Hidalgo, 149 pounds, Dominican Republic, outpointed Angel Espada 146, Salinas, Puerto Rico, 10 rounds.

title: Richard Loomer Hall Weds Mrs. Ethel Coles
description: MANCHESTER, Mass., June 13Mrs. Ethel Febiger Coles, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Sellers Febiger of Bryn Mawr, Pa., was married this afternoon to Richard Loomer Hall of Manchester. The Rev. James McCloy, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony at the home of the bridegroom.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Boston Edison Company yesterday filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission a registration statement covering its proposed offering of 1,066,813 common shares. According to the underwriters, headed by Eastman Dillon, Union Securities & Co. the shares are being offered for subscription, expiring July 25, 1972, by shareholders of record on July 6 on the basis of one additional share for each seven shares held as of the record date. The underwriters said the net proceeds will be used by the utility to reduce shortterm borrowings. The company's stock, traded on the New York Stock Exchange closed at 34 down 3/4 at the close of trading yesterday.

title: MRS. W. E. CONRAD JR.
description: KENILWORTH, N. J., June 13Mrs. Mary Ferry Conrad, wife of Mayor William E. Conrad Jr., a vice president of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, stockbrokers, died yesterday at St. Elizabeth's Hospital in Elizabeth after a brief illness. She was 43 years old and lived at 42 Dorset Drive.

title: Perth Amboy Elects Mayor And Five City Councilmen
description: PERTH AMBOY, N. J., June 13 (UPI) Alexander Jankowski defeated his schoolteacher opponent by some 3,000 votes today in the runoff election for Mayor of Perth Amboy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The recent wave of skyjacking makes one wonder: Where, in the name of heaven, is the Civil Aeronautics Board? What are they waiting for? Aren't they supposed to look out for safety in flying?

title: ZOO LITHUANIANS REPORTED JAILED
description: MOSCOW, June 13A second youth in two months has burned himself to death and about 200 young people are in jail awaiting trials in the aftermath of two days of rioting in Soviet Lithuania last month, Lithuanian sources reported today.

title: Hijackers Death Urged
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 13 (AP)Gov. Ronald Reagan says he favors swift administration of the death penalty for convicted airplane hijackers.

title: Pompidou's Pardon Of a Gestapo Aide Stirs Wide Protest
description: PARIS, June 13Paul Touvier, an officer of the Vichy militia in Lyons during World War II, has received a presidential pardon, an action that has brought distress to the families of his victims and embarassment to the Elysee Palace and the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Wary McGovern Opens Drive for Upstate Votes
YANKS DEFEATED BY WHITE SOX, 20, ON MAY'S HOMER
description: There were reinforcements on hand at Yankee Stadium last night, but they couldn't prevent the Yankees from suffering their 10th loss in the last 14 games.

title: 5 Who Joined in Rahway Riot Escape
description: YARDVILLE, N. J., Wednesday, June 14Five prisoners under indictment for taking part in last November's Rahway State Prison riot escaped last night from the Yardville Reception Center, where they were being held under maximumsecurity conditions.

title: Job Accord for Blacks Is Set in New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 13 (Reuters)  Hundreds of new union jobs will be opened to blacks as a result of an agreement announced today between New Orleans labor unions, building contractors tractors and the Federal Government.

title: Dr. Kenneth Kurihara Is Dead; Economist Taught at State U.
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., June! 13Dr Kenneth K. Kurihara, distinguished professor of economic theory at the State University of New York campus here, died of cancer yesterday in Our Lady of Lourdes Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived here.

title: Trinity and Stanford Share Lead in N.C.A.A. Tennis
HOFFA MAKES PLEA ON PRISON REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, June 13James R. Hoffa was applauded today in the Senate caucus room as an expert witness on prison conditions and reform. His expertise was the result of a 58month jail term whose origins could be traced to hearings conducted 15 years ago in that same lofty marble chamber.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, June 13The Government of the United States is saying some odd things to the American people these days, and the case of Gen. John D. Lavelle and his private war on North Vietnam is only the latest chapter in a very strange story.

title: DR. HELMUTH CORDS, RESEARCH CHEMIST
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 13 Dr. Helmuth Cords, a research chemist who was director of process development at the Squibb Institute for Medical Research in New Brunswick, died Sunday while playing tennis with his family. He was 52 years old and lived at 12 East Shore Drive.

title: JOSEPH KNAPP
description: Joseph Knapp, chairman of the FoxKnapp Manufacturing Company, a producer of men's and boys outerwear and sportswear, died on Monday at his home, 5 Peter Cooper Road. He was 72 years old.

title: C. C. Allen Weds Elizabeth Heath
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 13Miss Elizabeth Nightingale Heath, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Parker Heath of Darien and Bay Head, N. J., was married here this morning to Clinton Capwell Allen, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Capwell Allen of Darien.

title: A LOSING DRIVER SEES SUNNY SIDE
