description: BRUSSELS  About three years ago, a daring notion took seed in the inner, secret circle of the Guid Michelin. A council of three summoned Marcel Kreusch to Paris and warned him that if he carried on as he had been, he might have great expectations.

title: Patman Asks Regulation Of Institutional Investors
description: Representative Wright Patman called yesterday for sweeping new legislation to regulate the activities of all institutional investorsbank trust departments, foundations, pension funds, insurance companies and the likethat collectively control portfolios worth hundreds of billions of dollars.

title: CARL OTTO, DESIGNED BROOKLYN BUILDINGS
description: Carl L. Otto, the architect of several banks, churches and office buildings in Brooklyn, died yesterday at his home, a restored 200yearold house at 225 Mayfair Avenue, West Hempstead, L. I. He was 95 years old.

title: At Attica, the Bread, Is a Saving Grace
description: I don't expect these men to be happy, said William Dickinson, head of programing at the State Correctional Facility at Attica. Even if you had gourmet meals in here, they wouldn't like them. Any time you curtail a man's freedom, it's that way.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: PITTSBURGH, June 20 (UPI)Roberto Clemente got two standing ovations in the eighth. inning last night after hitting a tworun homer against the Los Angeles Dodgers to break the Traynor's club record of 1,273 runs batted in. But the Pittsburgh outfielder didn't come out of the dugout to acknowledge the applause of 15,430 fans who have watched him break just about all the Pirates batting records over the last 18 seasons.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Tales of massive voting confusion and delays here emerged even before the polls closed in yesterday's primary election.

title: M.I.T. Studies Appliances
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass,, June 20 (AP) Massachusetts Institute of Technology researchers will begin July 1 a twoyear, $377,900 study, aimed at improving the servicing, rehability and maintenance, of such goods as washers, driers, power mowers and television sets.

title: Van Reenen Remains Man Without Country
description: LOS ANGELES, June 20 (UPI)John Van Reenen of South Africa, the discus thrower, has given up hope of finding another country before the Olympic Games.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: KANSAS CITY, June 20 (UPI)Ewing Kauffman, the Kansas City Royals owner, hoping he has made his point, changed his stand today of playing the National Anthem only on Sundays, holidays and special occaSions.

title: Players to Make Next Pitch to Congress
description: The battleground has shifted from the courts to the halls of Congress in the intensifying struggle between professional athletes and their employers for stronger bargaining positions, and it will be a different sort of conflict in the new setting.

title: OPTIMISM VOICED BY AWED STORES
description: Sales and earnings of the Allied Stores Corporation in May and June are very encouraging, continuing the improved trend of the first fiscal quarter, Thomas M. Macioce, president of the 152unit department store chain, said at the annual shareholders meeting in the Waldorf Astoria Hotel yesterday.

title: Metropolitan Area Faces More Floods
description: The sodden metropolitan region was threatened yesterday by the prospect of renewed downpours and flooding even as thousands of residents endeavored to recover from destructive rains that began last weekend.

title: ExG.O.P. Aide Rebuffs F.B.1. Queries on BreakIn
description: WASHINGTON, June 20E Howard Hunt Jr., former parttime White House consultant, has refused to answer questions by the Federal Bureau of Investigation in connection with last Saturday's breakin at the Democratic National Committee offices here.

title: Democrats Urged to Pledge Shift in Federal Spending
description: DENVER, June 20 (AP)A former White House science adviser called today for Democratic platform pledge to give more Federal financing to energy, transportation and ecology problems and less to research and development outlays for the defense and space programs.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., June 20The April term of the Sullivan County grand jury reported its findings to Judge Howard J. Hughes this afternoon, handing up indictments against Stephen Block, Harold Gillis, Thomas Gerafano and Stanley Stein charging them with sports bribing and thirddegree conspiracy.

title: Gypsy Moth Quarantine Put On Mobile Home Movements
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP) The Agriculture Department placed quarantine restrictions today on the interstate movement of mobile homes and recreational vehicles from areas by gypsy moths.

title: H.E.W. UNIT REJECTS PROABORTION STAND
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI) At the urging of an Administration spokesman, a Government advisory panel voted, today against endorsing a liberal abortion stand vigorously opposed by President Nixon.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis, Inc., as manager of the underwriting group, announced yesterday the public offering of 556,656 shares of McDonald's Corporation common stock at $60.875 a share. All shares are being sold for certain stockholders.

title: Merger News
description: Guest, Keen & Nettlefolds, Ltd., a British maker of steel engineering and fastening products, said in London yesterday that it, had reached an agreement to acquire Firth Cleveland, Ltd., an English manufacturing and engineering company.

title: Party Leaders Briefed On Antiriot Measures
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI)  Democratic and Republican leaders received a briefing today on security plans to prevent another Chicago from occurring at the national political conventions this summer in Miami Beach.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, June 20 (Reuters)Jean Rey, a former president of the European Common Market Commission, said today that the market was badly governed and its institutions were out of date.

title: Dublin Court Frees I. R. A. Chief Charged With Illegal Recruiting
description: DUBLIN, June 20Joe Cahill the 52yearold leader of the militant Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army, was acquitted here today by a special criminal court on a charge of inciting people to join the I.R.A.

title: LowIncome State Housing Due in Rural Westchester
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 20The State Urban Development Corporation announced today that it was prepared to override local zoning regulations to build 100 units of lowandmoderateincomb housing in each of nine Westchester County towns

title: THE 1972 COMPAIGN
description: INDIANAPOLIS, June 20 (UPI)  Former Gov. Matthew E. Welsh won a chance at another term today by defeating Secretary of State Larry Conrad in a race for the nomination of the state Democratic convention.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I have a few comments to make on the letters of Paul G. Dembling and Senator Proxmire, published June and 9, respectively, which comment on my letter published May 21.

title: NOFAULT MEASURE IS SIGNED BY CAHILL
description: TRENTON, June 20 (AP)Gov. William T. Cahill signed legislation today enacting a state nofault automobile insurance system that is designed to save motorists $90million in premiums next year.

title: Bingham and Ryan
description: New York City's Democrats showed careful judgment in two of the most difficult contests in yesterday's primaries. In returning Representatives Jonathan Bingham and William F. Ryan to Congress, they recognized the outstanding records of two legislators whose services were of unusually high quality.

title: DOW INDEX UP 6.39 AS VOLUME RISES
description: Strength in select glamour issues and the volatile airline group carried the stock market upward yesterday as prices finished at their best level of the session.

title: BadilloRamos
description: Representative Badillo's overwhelming victory in yesterday's 21st District primary assured his reelection to Congress.

title: M'GREGOR. SMITH, POWER EXECUTIVE
description: MIAMI, June 20 (AP)McGregor. Smith, a director and chairman of the executive committee of the board of the Florida Power & Light Company, died yesterday. He was 73 years old.

title: City Official Quits in Ethics Case And Is Rehired as a Consultant
description: The deputy director and counsel of the Parking Violations Bureau violated the city's Code of Ethics by maintaining his private law practice at the same time, the city's Board of Ethics ruled yesterday.

title: Talk With Chou Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, June 20Ronald L. Ziegler, the Presidential press secretary, reported today that Mr. Kissinger had met with Premier Chou since his arrival in Peking yesterday and had been in contact with the White House.

title: Closing of Rochester Schools, Ends Furor on Busing
description: ROCHESTER, June 20The premature closing today of all secondary schools here brought to a stormy end the city's controversial mandatory busing program, which was already scheduled for termination.

title: EL PASO GAS LOSES DIVESTITURE CASE
description: DENVER, June 20 Judge Hatfield Chilson of the Federal District Court ordered the El Paso Natural Gas Company today to divest itself of most of its interest in the Pacific Northwest Pipeline Company and to sell its interest to the Colorado Interstate Gas Company.

title: AIRLINE SHARES ON AMEX MOVE UP
description: There was a rush to buy T.W.A. warrants on the American Stock Exchange yesterday, with the result that trading was halted for about two hours. At the end of the session the warrants, in which volume totaled 59,200, closed at 37, up 3. Each warrant entitles the holder to purchase a T.W.A. share at $22.

title: Abortion Reform Bill Loses
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., June 20. (AP)The Pennsylvania House of Representatives defeated today a bill to legalize abortions during the first 16 weeks of pregnancy, but refused to accept another proposal to outlaw all abortions. By a vote of 112 to 87, the House amended the latter bill to allow abortions if a hospital board decided that pregnancy endangered the physical life of the mother.

title: A.M.A. Would Drop Serious Marijuana Penalties
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 20The American Medical Association substantially softened its position today on the smoking of marijuana.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A special Runway Unit to cope with the large number of runaway youths here, both local and out of town, was established yesterday by the Police Department.

title: Guerrillas Resume Attacks On Israelis From Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, June 20Arab guerrillas resumed incursions from Lebanon today after fourmonth lull, according to military sources.

title: VENEZIA CAPTURES 4 AQUEDUCT RACES
description: Mike Venezia, Brooklyn's foremost contribution to the current ranks of topflight jockeys, enjoyed one of his finest days at Aqueduct yesterday since 1964, when he was a triple bug boy. Competing in all nine races on the card, Venezia came through with four victories, including part of an exacta that paid $1,275.20.

title: Raids Impact Overstated,ExAir Force Men Say
description: WASHINGTON, June 20A number of former Air Force photo interpreters  the men who help pick future bombing targets and assess results from previous raids  believe that the military has consistently exaggerated the effectivenss of bombing results in North Vietnam.

title: Prices and Politics: Nixon Aides Seek Proper Blend
description: WASHINGTON, June 20The Nixon Administration is discovering that the problem of soaring meat prices cannot be kept hidden until after the November election.

title: SENATE MODIFIES A CHILDCARE BILL TO BAR NEW VETO
description: WASHINGTON, June 20The Nixon Administration won major concessions today as the Senate passed a modified bill creating a vast network of daycare centers and childdevelopment services. The vote was 73 to 12.

title: Advertising:
description: The TV and print people got their Clios and Effies couple of weeks ago. Yesterday it was radio's turn.

title: Hurricane Damage Weighed in Florida
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., June 20 (AP)Hurricane Agnes, which claimed the lives of 18 persons, was downgraded to a tropical depression today, and Florida officials began taking stock of damage that first reports placed as high as $15million.

title: WORKER HURT HERE IN TUNNEL ACCIDENT
description: A 40yearold construction worker suffered a broken right arm and leg last night when he was hit by a falling 150pound rock in a water tunnel being dug under the Harlem River at 181st Street, th epolice said.

title: DelaneyManton
description: Representative James J. Delaney was, in effect, guaranteed reelection yesterday to his 14th term in Congress by beating Councilman Thomas J. Manton in the Democratic primary in the Ninth Congressional District.

title: A.&P. Finds Switch to Discounting Costly
description: BOSTON, June 20  The switch to food discounting in 2,930 A. & P. stores has produced very high losses in the fiscal first quarter, totaling possibly as much as $22million after taxes, stockholders were told here today.

title: CHALLENGERS VIE FOR ALBANY SEATS
description: Scores of legislative primary Contests in both parties throughout the state yesterday pitted political newcomers against a number of highranking State Senators and Assemblymen who campaigned hard, sometimes unsuccessfully, to retain their choice leadership posts and lucrative committee assignments.

title: Woman Judge Headed for Appellate Nomination
description: The bid by Family Court Judge Nanette Dembitz for a Democratic nomination for the State Court of Appeals  on which no woman has ever servedshowed signs of succeeding as returns were counted from about a fifth of the state's election districts.

title: On Another Street Without joy, U S. Advisers Are Still Dying
description: CHONTHANH, South Vietnam, June 20It is only 15.6 miles from here to Anloc, but for two months more than 3,000 South Vietnamese troops and several American advisers have been killed or wounded trying to get there.

title: COCOA FUTURES DECLINE IN PRICE
description: In the heaviest trading thus) far this year, cocoa futures fell 95 to 82 points  hundredths of a cent a pound  under pressure of speculative liquidation yesterday on the New York Cocoa Exchange. A total of 2,952 lots were traded, compared with 2,665 lots on April 11 the previous busiest day.

title: 5 CHICAGO POLICE TIED TO 6 KILLINGS
description: CHICAGO, June 20Five Chicago policemen, one a sergeant, were reported today to be prime suspects in the gangstyle slayings of at least six men in connection with the op erations of a narcotics ring that included policemen.

title: FARM RESEARCH BACKED BY BUTZ
description: WASHINGTON, June 20Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz and leading representatives of the nation's big landgrant universities opened counterattack today against criticism that their agricultural research favored large producers and corporations while slighting consumers and rural people.

title: I.T.T AND OTHERS SETTLE S.E.C. SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, the investment banking concern of Lazard Freres R Co., and all other defendants agreed today to settle a suit brought by the Government on Friday charging that illegal sales of I.T.T. stock had been made.

title: Belfast Prison Strike Ends
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 20 (AP)Thirtyone I.R.A. prisoners ended a monthlong hunger strike today following concessions by William Whitelaw, Britain's administrator in Ulster.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: AMSTERDAM, The NetherlandsNowadays in Western Europe one keeps hearing talk about a gradually widening gap between this area and the. United States. The difference, it is said, comes not so much in words but in actionsor their lack. Familiar platitudes about an Atlantic community and transAtlantic harmony continue to echo, but they are beginning to have a tinny sound.

title: ExBank President and a Contractor Charged With Embezzlement in Jersey
description: NEWARK, June 20A Federal grand jury today indicted Gotthold Rose, the former Mayor of Garfield and the former president of the Garfield Trust Company, and a construction contractor on charges of embezzling more than $3million of the bank's funds from 1965 to 1969.

title: Monday Night Fight
description: Los AngelesArmando Muniz, 151 pounds, Los Angeles, knocked out Cassius (Bo) Greene, 150, Dallas, 6 rounds.

title: WEST SIDE PLAYERS OPEN SEASON INSIDE
description: After the deluge, the soggy, muddy ground. So, on Monday night the directors of the West Side Orchestral Concerts felt that it was best to move their first program of the season indoors.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: CLEVELAND, June 20 (AP)Nick Mileti, rebuffed recently in his efforts to obtain a National Hockey League franchise, announced tonight that he had obtained a World Hockey Association team for Cleveland.

title: AddabboFriedman
description: In the Seventh Congressional District in southern Queens, Joseph F. Addabbo, the sixterm Democratic incumbent, handily defeated his primary opponent, Seymour Friedman of Flushing. With almost half the election districts reporting, he led by more than a 2to1 margin.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 20Three of the leading candidates for the Democratic Presidential nomination brought their campaigns before the nation's bigcity Mayors today, but only Senator Hubert H. Humphrey won their unabashed support.

title: Appeals Court Reinstates Democrats Reform Rules
description: WASHINGTON, June 20The United States Court of Appeals here overturned tonight a dayold decision by a Federal District Court that had threatened to undercut the Democratic party's efforts to reform its national convention.

title: Men Up to No. 75 In the Draft Lottery Face Call in August
description: WASHINGTON, June 20The Selective Service System announced today that men with lottery numbers through 75 would be drafted in August.

title: French to Raise Car Prices
description: PARIS, June 20 (Reuters)French car manufacturers will raise prices 2 per cent on next year's models, the Vehicle Manufacturers Association said today. The rise, to go into effect on July 1 and Sept. 1, was made to cover the cost of installing antipollution devices and compulsory safety equipment. In the past 18 months the French car makers have raised their prices 13 per cent.

title: Billy Joe's Bridge Collapses
description: MONEY, Miss., June 20 (AP) The bridge followed Billy Joe McAllister into the Tallahatchie River today. The bridge from which Billy Joe jumped in Bobby Gentry's song, the Ode to Billy Joe fell into the river during the night. The authorities said they did not believe anyone was on the bridge when it collapsed.

title: The Great Crippler
description: Because multiple sclerosis usually strikes in the prime career and familybuilding years between 20 and 40, it is called the great crippler of young adults. To date, the Na tional Multiple Sclerosis Society has approved more than 516.8million for research grants and fellowships. To accelerate new research leads that show promise, the society is conducting a $10million appeal, solely for research.

title: Traffic Safety Act Funds
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP) A bill authorizing $37Amillion for a oneyear extension of the 1966 National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act was approved by the House Commerce Committee today.

title: What This Country Needs Is a Touch of New Isolationism
description: WASHINGTONIn a classic critique of American foreign policy, Walter Lippmann declared: For over a century Americans have believed that the undesirability of alliances was so selfevident as to be outside the pale of discussion. Now an objection which men will not examine and debate is a prejudice. What Lippmann wrote thirty years ago of the American attitude toward alliances may with equal justice be written toddy of the prevailing attitude toward isolationism.

title: Pacification Hopes Battered in Vietnam
description: QUANGNGAI, ,South Vietnam, June 19Late in the afternoon the Communists came down to the camp and told us to move all our belongings out, because they were going to bUrn everything down, an old man said, sifting through the.charred rubble of the Sonloc resettlement camp. He had called the camp home for four years because the Government had moved him there.

title: Ketch Leads Tahiti Race
description: LOS ANGELES, June 30 (UPI)  Graybeard, a 73foot ketch from the Royal Vancouver (British Columbia) Yacht Club, continues to hold the lead in the TransPacificTahiti yacht race. When the seven entries checked in yesterday by radio, the crew pf Graybeard reported she was 2,776 miles from Tahiti. Pen Duick HI, a 57foot sloop from France, was the handicap leader in the 3,571race that began last Thursday.

title: OTB Shops to Get New Scoreboards For $2 ,848 ,000
description: The Offtrack Betting Corporation will install a $2,8million computer system to facilitate the display of race information at its more than 100 offices here, the OTB president, Howard J. Samuels, announced yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: According to my figures Herman Gray's June 14 letter distorts Senator McGovern's position on the elderly.

title: Hudson Democrats Will Gather Again To Pick Chairman
description: JERSEY CITY, June 20 (UPI) The Hudson County Democratic Committee, whose meeting last Tuesday ended in chaos after 20 minutes, will try next Tuesday night to select a new county chairman.

title: Food Not an Issue At Danbury Prison
description: The popsicle prison is what one inmate called the Federal Correctional Institution at Danbury. And compared to Attica or the Brooklyn House of Detention, it is a soft deal. Guards wear no uniforms and do not constantly intrude. on life. In nice weather, the men can see visitors on a hill outside the prison. And the food strikes almost everyone as reasonably good.

title: Rites Friday for Mrs. Black
description: A funeral service, following cremation, will he held for Mrs. Irma Simonton Black at 11 A.M. Friday at the Episcopal Church of the Ascension, Fifth Avenue and 10th Street. The Rev. Donald Goodness, the rector, and the Rev. John C. Anderson, rector of Christ Church in Sparkill, N. Y., will officiate. In lieu of flowers contributions may be made to the Irma Black Memorial Fund of Bank Street College of Education, 610 West 112th Street. Mrs. Black, who was chairman of the publications department of the college, was found dead of stab wounds Sunday in her Greenwich Village apartment.

title: SPOFFORD TEACHERS PROTEST VIOLENCE
description: The 42 teachers at the,Spofford Juvenile Center in the Bronx ended a brief work stoppage yesterday afternoon after city officials, in a 90minute meeting, indicated they were sympathetic to demands for a code of conduct aimed at stemming unruly behavior by the youthful detainees.

title: VOLVO PLANTS TO USE TEAMS OF WORKERS
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, June 20 (AP)Volvo, A.B., said today it would abolish assembly lines in two auto plants now under construction and replace them with working teams of 15 to 20 members.

title: StravinskyDiaghilev Museum Is Set
description: A Venetian museum of music, dance and design, conceived as a memorial to Igor Stravinsky and Serge Diaghilev, is being planned by the Russian composer's widow, Vera Stravinsky, and Parmenia Migel Ekstrom, a writer and authority on ballet.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Anthony Lewis keeps telling us things we don't wish to hear about our actions in Vietnam. His reports and the television and radio coverage have brought this detestable war home to us even when we did not want to recognize what we were doing.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Shopping centers and malls continue to grow in importance as components of the American way of life. As the hub of American living moves from the cities to the suburbs, facilities for cultural and intellectual growth do not necessarily spring up there too.

title: Credit Markets
description: The bond market traced an indecisive course yesterday that produced mixed changes in interest rates. Taxexempt securities came under continuing downward pressure, but the market for corporate securities managed a slight advance. Treasury issues were largely unchanged. In the money market, a host of banks increased their posted rates on certificates of deposit, bringing them into closer alignment to the actual levels where business has been done recently.

title: Military Insurance Widens
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP) President Nixon signed today a bill to extend servicemen's group life insurance to cadets and midshipment at the Army, Navy, Air Force and Coast Guard academies.

title: Badillo Rangel, Delaney And Podell Renominated
description: Emanuel Celler, dean of the House of Representatives, was defeated early today, based on unofficial returns, by 30yearold Elizabeth Holtzman in a Democratic primary that also saw Representative William F Ryan defeat Representative Bella S. Abzug.

title: RyanAbzug
description: The applause and cheers began at the headquarters of Representative Ryan only minutes after the polls closed as word was announced that he had defeated Representative Abzug in her home. election district.

title: Yanks Beat Royals, 42, For 5th Victory in Row
description: Bobby Murcer hit his eighth home run of the season and Sparky Lyle put in his 21st relief appearance to help the Yankees defeat the Kansas City Royals, 42, before a sparse crowd of 7,806 at the Stadium last night.

title: F111'S GROUNDED FOR THE 7TH TIME
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 The Air Force ordered today suspension of flights by all 215 F111 fighterbomber airplanes based in the United States in effect, grounding them except in emergencies.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The excessive and indiscriminate emphasis on acts of terrorism by the I.R.A. in Northern Ireland has substantially discredited the movement and has revealed the previously unsuspected existence of a silent majority of Catholics which, while opposed to Protestant domination, is equally opposed to the increasingly anarchistic tactics of the I.R.A. This majority may be willing to cooperate in a negative sense, through Sir William Whitelaw, with the silent majority of Ulster Protestants who are frightened by the prospect of real upheaval if the Stormont system is restored.

title: French Fear Death Toll Of 120 in Derailments
description: SOISSONS, France, June 20 (AP)The death toll in Friday's collision of two passenger trains in a tunnel near here may exceed 120, officials said today.

title: U.S. Warns City U. to List Sex and Race of Personnel
description: The Federal Office of Civil Rights warned the City University yesterday that it must provide certain employment information, including data on the sex and race of all staff members, or face the loss of $13million in Government research contracts.

title: Gold Scores House Group; Terms Charges Reckless
description: The Brooklyn District Attorney, Eugene Gold, criticized the House Select Committee on Crime yesterday for permitting a narcotics patrolman to come before it and make what Mr. Gold called reckless and irresponsible allegations about his office.

title: Economic Analysis
description: The No. 1 international economic worry of the United States, said David Rockefeller, chairman of the Chase Manhattan Bank, in Tokyo this week, is this country's $3billion trade deficit with Japan. To be precise, the United States trade deficit with Japan last year was $3.2billion. The United States, however, had a surplus of $400million with the rest of the world, thus reducing its global deficit to $2.8billion.

title: Podgorny's Promise
description: Peace in Vietnam is not around the corner, but an early resumption (3,4 serious negotiations in Paris, the vital prerequisite, should now be possible. With its sea supplies cut off by the American blockade, with China obstructing Soviet land shipments and with both its major allies putting their relations with Washington above their ties with Hanoi, the North Vietnam Government is under increasing pressure to explore a diplomatic settlement.

title: Pound Plunges by 60 Points in London
description: LONDON, June 20  The pound fell in heavy selling today in a sharp reaction to the statement yesterday of Denis Healey, the Labor party spokesman on finance, that Britain would have to devalue within two months.

title: Cub Scout Gambling Seen
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa, June 20 (AP)Cub Scouts will be in violation of Iowa gambling laws if they charge for bean bag or ring tosses at their carnival this year, according to Linn County Attorney William Faches. A Cub Scout official has asked Mr. Faches for a ruling on the issue.

title: Fiery Prosecutor Eugene Gold
description: In 1936, when a 12yearold Brooklyn boy named Eugene Gold graduated from Public School 135, he summarized his life's ambition in his school yearbook in a single misspelled word: lawer.

title: 8 STATES PLAN USE OF NEW SATELLITE
description: WASHINGTON, June 20Eight states are planning to use data collected in space to help set statewide policy in land use, managers of the Earth Resourceg Technology Satellite program said today.

title: Sandy Smith, O.D.
description: At the age of 17 I had a habit. I was addicted to heroin. I began using heroin shortly after my 17th birthday at the insistence of a friend who had long been going that route himself.

title: 6 Paterson Inmates Indicted For Attempt to Flee in May
description: PATERSON, N. J., June 20 (UPI)A Passaic County grand Jury returned indictments today against six inmates allegedly responsible for a May 30 disturbance at the county jail here, but found no fault with operations or personnel at the prison.

title: Officials Elected in 29 L.I. Villages;
description: While enrolled voters in most of the state went to the polls to settle contests for party nominations in primary elections, voters in several Long Island communities took part in main events as wellgeneral election of village officials.

title: TOWN TURNS DOWN LILCO GENERATOR
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I. June 20 The Huntington Town Board today denied permission to the Long Island Lighting Company to build a fourth generating unit at its fossilfuelburning plant in Northport.

title: Arab Chiefs Parley Delayed
description: CAIRO, June 20 (UPI)The Libyan Premier, Col. Muammar elQaddafi, has undergone minor surgery in Tripoli, forcing the postponement until tomorrow of a conference of the leaders of Egypt, Syria and Libya, the Cairo radio said tonight.

title: RangelWingate
description: Representative Charles Bernard Rangel tightened his hold on the inherited mantle of the late Adam Clayton Powell, easily turning back the challenge of Livingston L. Wingate in the 19th District.

title: Soaring Food Prices...
description: A new upsurge in food prices threatens to wreck family budgets and defeat the Administration's hope cutting the inflation rate to 3 per cent or less before the end of this year.

title: Business Briefs
description: AUSTIN, Tex., June 20 (UPI)  The Texas Railroad Commission today ordered the state's oil wells into their fourth straight month of maximum production as the commission's chairman warned that a national energy crisis was approaching. Byron Tunnell, the head of the commission, which set the July oil allowable production at 100 per cent for most Texas fields, warned that America facing an energy shortage that is going to become more severe, one so severe our very national security may endangered.

title: A Pox on You, Riverdale
description: Everyone knows that cities are the heart and brains of a society. Surely people should want to live where the action is. Instead the inner cities are being abandoned.

title: Pennsy Trimmed Loss by. 29.7% in May
description: The Penn Central Transportation Company, the bankrupt railroad.subsidiary or the Penn Central CoMpany, reduced its net loss in May, by 29.7. per cent to $13,009,677 from a deficit of $18,500,774 in May, 1971, the trustees report disclosed yesterday.

title: Tito and Gierek Meet, Seem to Disagree
description: WARSAW, June 20President Tito of Yugoslavia and Edward Gierek, the Polish party leader, moved today into the substance of their official talks, with some disagreement apparent on political and security matters.

title: Executive at Republic Corp. Quits in Compensation Rift
description: LOS ANGELES, June 20 (AP) The Republic Corporation announced today the resignation of Gerald Mansbach, vice president, saying Mr. Mansbach had complained he had not been fairly compensated.

title: Chou Gives Banquet
description: HONG KONG, June 20 (Reuters)Chinese press agency reports monitored here today said that Mr. Kissinger attended banquet given by MT. Chou. They said Foreign Minister Chi Pengfei and other top officials were present.

title: Port Authority's Name To Include New Jersey
description: TRENTON, June 20 (AP)Gov. William T. Cahill signed legislation today that will give New Jersey equal billing in the twostate Port of New York Authority.

title: Urologist Named Chairman
description: Dr. Joseph E. Davis, an authority on male contraception, has been named professor and chairman of the department of urology at New York Medical College, it was announced yesterday. An alumnus of the college, he succeeds Dr. George R. Nagamatsu who retired after having served as chairman since 1958.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT Troops. The White House announced that the President would make a new announcement on troop withdrawals from Vietnam before the end of the month. Activities. The President met with John D. Ehrlichman, his chief adviser for domestic affairs, to discuss the $19billion omnibus education bill.

title: TV: Study of da Vinci Marred by Reverential Tone
description: On TV these days it's Leonardo time. If nothing else, if represents some progress from the days of Howdy Doody time. Beginning in August, the Columbia Broadcasting System will present a fivepart dramatic series called The Life of Leonardo da Vinci, produced by RAI, Italy's TV network. To avoid Cultural suicide, the National Broadcasting Company last night jumped into the artistic breach with a Leonardo: To Know How to See.

title: Nixon on Stockholm Talks
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI)  President Nixon said today that the United States had achieved most of its objectives at the recent United Nations conference on the environment in Stockholm,

title: Police Widen Patrol in Hunt for Queens Slayer
description: The police increased the number of unmarked patrol cars yesterday in the Jamaica, Queens, neighborhood where 15yearold girl was stabbed to death in her bed Saturday.

title: Kissinger Meets Again With Chou and Other Aides
description: PEKING, Wednesday, June 21 (Reuters) Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser on national security, had about four hours of talks with Chinese leaders here yesterday on the second day of his visit.

title: DAKOTAN STRONG
description: Senator George McGovern scored a decisive victory yesterday in the state Presidential primary, winning at least 207 of the 248 Democratic National Convention delegates elected.

title: Marines Moving Planes From Danang to Thailand
description: HONOLULU, June 20 (AP)The Marine Corps commandant said that Marine A6 intruder planes began operating today from a newly prepared base in northern Thailand, where the corps is moving its air operations from Danang, South Vietnam.

title: 49 in Congress Urge Ban On Leaded Gasoline by 77
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI)Fortynine members of Congress urged the Environmental Protection Agency today to order all lead removed from gasoline within five years.

title: Mujib Says Trials Are Set for Pakistani P.O.W.'s
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, June 20 (Reuters)Sheik Mujibur Rahman, Prime Minister of Bangladesh, says he inonds to go ahead with the trial of some 1,500 Pakistani prisoners on charges of war crimes.

title: ExRep. James Canfield Dies; Served Passaic Area 20 Years
description: HAWTHORNE, N.J., June 20 Former Representative James Gordon Canfield, who for 20 years represented 400,000 residents of Passaic County, died) in his sleep today at his home here. He was 74 years old.

title: New Plan Is Outlined for Tapping Geothermal Energy
description: LOS ALAMOS, N. M., June 20 Scientists at the Los Alamos scientific laboratory believe they have found a way to expand greatly the nation's usable source of geothermal energy, the heat from molten rock in the earth's interior that can be converted to electricity.

title: Brandt and Hesburgh Win New Niebuhr Fund Award
description: West German Chancellor Willy Brandt and the Rev. Theodore M. Hesburgh, President of the University of Notre Dame, yesterday became the first persons honored by the Reinhold Niebuhr Award Fund.

title: 3 in J.D.L. Plead Not Guilty In Bombing at Hurok Office
description: Three members of the Jewish Defense League pleaded not guilty in Fderal court to charges of using incendiary bombs that caused one death and several injuries in the offices of the impresario Sol Hurok last January.

title: Goodrich Agrees to a Fine For BelowStandard Tires
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI)The Government said today that the B. F. Goodrich Tire Company had agreed to $17,500 fine for selling tires that failed to meet the Government's safety standards.

title: ... and Rents Up, Too
description: The jolt of a 15 per cent rent increase is scheduled to hit tenants in 400,000 rentcontrolled apartments the end of next week. Painful as such a rise will be in this period of escalating food prices, the city's decision to authorize it represents a realistic accommodation not only to a court order but to a hopelessly complicated administrative snarl.

title: BURNED CHURCHES REBUILT IN TEXAS
description: TEXARKANA, Tex.On a gusty March night in 1971, arsonists tried to destroy every black Baptist church in this city of 54,000 people. They burned two churches to the ground and their fire bombs caused slight damage to three other churches.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Speaking for the Committee for the Reelection of the President, John N. Mitchell has told the American people that he is under no obligation to reveal the names of contributors to the Republican's $10million campaign chest. According to the former Attorney General, there is no necessity for doing so because the fund was amassed before the new Federal law on election financing and disclosure took effect two months ago.

title: Fire Sick Calls Halt 15 Units
description: The Fire Department said that 120 fire officers and firemen asked for medical IeaVe after fires in the 24 hours ended at 6 A.M. yesterday. As a result, the department said, 15 fire companies were forced out of service for periods tip to two and onehalf hours. Fire officers, who have been reporting sick or ill in greater number than usual since June 2, have been attempting to put pressure on the city to meet their contract demands.

title: Woman Pastor Ordained
description: FREEPORT, Pa., June 20 (AP) Judith Hird, 26 years old, was ordained today as America's first woman parish pastor in the Lutheran Church. Miss Hird, a graduate of Thiel College and the Gettysburg Lutheran Theological Seminary, has been named pastor of Holy Cross Lutheran Church in Toms River, N. J.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a native of the Adirondack region and partowner of wilderness land which has been privately preserved for over 100 years, I am appalled at the proposed Horizon Corporation development described in a recent edition of The Times. (May 23).

title: BankHagan
description: In the 10th Congressional District, which includes the Throgs Neck section of the Bronx and Astoria, Queens, Michael S. Bank ledJohn Patrick Hagan for the Liberal party nomination. With less than onethird of the election districts reporting, his margin was more than 2 to 1, but the votes were few.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: TOKYO, June 20 (AP)Masao Ohba of Japan unleashed a flurry of lefts and rights and knocked out Orlando Amores of Panama in two minutes of the fifth round to retain his world flyweight title tonight.

title: BinghamScheuer
description: Representative Bingham won predominately Jewish Coop City to defeat Representative Scheuer in the newly drawn 22d District in the Bronx.

title: RooneyLowenstein
description: In recent years, Representative Rooney, now 68 years old, has had some tough ones. This primary was no exception, but amid charges of rampant irregularities against his machine, he won again yesterday.

title: Upstate Contests
description: In upstate primaries for Congressional seats, the victories went to the candidates commonly regarded as frontrunners or topcontenders.

title: Defense Powers Voted
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI) The Senate passed and sent to the House today a bill to extend for two years the President's emergency powers to allocate materials for defense contracts and make loans and purchases to maintain defense capacities. The powers are scheduled to expire June 30.

title: Troy For Kennedy For Vice President On McGovern Slate
description: City Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr. will announce today that he is supporting Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts for the Democratic VicePresidential nomination.

title: A Food Critic Appraises Meals at Three Prisons
description: Prison food has always had a bad name. Countless crime movies have shown stripeclad inmates banging metal cups and refusing to eat the swill served up by hostile and incompetent kitchen staffs. But the bloody riot at Attica last fall focused public attention on real food in a real prison. Fortythree men died as result of that insurrectionand food was a major inmate grievance.

title: Jockey's License Revoked for 5 Years for Use of Electric Whip
description: CHICAGO, June 20 (AP)The jockey license of Lane Suire of Erath, La., one of the nation's leading riders this year, was revoked for five years today by the Illinois Racing Board for his alleged use of a whip with an electrical device to prod a mount.

title: Britain to Phase Out 34 Open Hearths
description: LONDON, June 21Conceding that the day of the open hearth furnace is ending, the British Steel Corporation is planning to phase out 34 such furnaces in four Scottish plants over the next five years, with a loss of 6,500 to 7,500 jobs.

title: Chess: The Disparaged Drawn Game Is Worthy of Consideration
description: Sometimes the most important or interesting games of a tournament do not make the chess columns of newspapers and magazines because they end in draws. Journalists choose not to present them because they believe, rightly or wrongly, that the public would not like them as much as games with decisive results.

title: James Holler Jr. Weds Miss Swift
description: GEORGETOWN, Me., June 21Miss Marguerite Milne Swift, a freelance photographer, was married here this afternoon to James Koller, Jr., a poet and publisher of Coyote Books and.Coyote's Journal in Berkeley, Calif. The Rev. John Karsten; rector of St. Philip's Episcopal Church in Wiscasset, performed the ceremony in the spruce woods of Georgetown Island at the mouth of the Kennebec River.

title: Drop in Grocery Prices Here Holds Down General Cost Rise
description: With grocery prices showing what may be only a temporary decline, consumer prices in the metropolitan area rose modestly last month, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yesterday.

title: N.F.L. Owners Reported to Bar Further Negotiations
description: MINNEAPOLIS, June 21 (AP) Edward R. Garvey, director of the National Football League Players Association, said today that N.F.L. owners had told him repeatedly that players have no rights to negotiate under their current contract.

title: MAYORS, IN SHIFT, BACK WAR POLICY
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 21 a reversal of policy, the United States Conference of Mayors voted today to support President Nixon's current strategy in Vietnam.

title: Mrs. Straub, Mrs. Hart Reach Metropolitan Golf Semifinals
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I.,June 21Three Long Island players and one from New Jersey reached, the semifinals of the 69th annual Women's Metropolitan Golf Association championship today.

title: TURNER ARRAIGNED ON FRAUD CHARGES
description: FLINT, Mich., June 21 (AP) Glenn W. Turner, the multimillionaire, was arraigned today on charges of conspiracy to cheat and defraud in connection with a pyramid franchiseselling scheme known as Dare To Be Great.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI)Dr. Arthur F. Burns, the chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, met with President Nixon today to discuss his coming twoweek trip four LatinAmerican nations. He will leave Friday for Argentina, Peru, Venezuela and Brazil.

title: Bugging Is No Joke
description: White House spokesman Ronald Ziegler's flip dismissal of the attempted bugging of Democratic party national headquarters is in keeping with the Nixon Administration's casual attitude toward the issue of electronic Surveillance. The abortive espionage, Mr. Ziegler would have us understand, is nothing more than a thirdrate burglary unworthy of comment.

title: PRICE PANEL MAPS STEPS TO CONTROL RAW FARM GOODS
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 The Price Commission decided today to recommend that raw agricultural products, now ex empt from the economic stahilization regulations, be placed under controls to slow the rising price of food.

title: Colgate Adds 2 Coaches
description: HAMILTON, N. Y., June 1 (AP)Don Fudge and Bob Colbert were added today to Colgate University's football staff

title: Dance: More Glimpses of Stravinsky
description: Why does not George Balanchine have the common charity to revive his complete version of Le Baiser de la Fee? Last night at the New York State Theater, the New York City Ballet offered usall too grudgingly in this cornucopia of Stravinskiana, although I am partly teasing merely the Divertimento from the complete ballet.

title: QE2 BombThreat Suspect Held
description: A 48yearold shoe store proprietor from Beacon, N.Y., was arrested yesterday by the Federal Bureau of Investigation and charged with threatening to blow up the Queen Elizabeth 2 last month while the luxury liner was in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Senate Approves by 10 New Safety Agency That Would Take Over All F.D.A. Functions
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 Legislation to create an independent Federal agency with broad authority to establish mandatory safety standards for consumers, products was approved tonight by the Senate, 69 to 10.,

title: SENATE UNIT VOTES EDUCATION FUNDING
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) The Senate Appropriations Committee approved today a $29.5billion bill to fund the Department of Health, Education and Welfare and the Department of Labor, an increase of $860million over the House bill.

title: West Europe Seeks New Identity
description: PARIS, June 21  Western Europe is groping for a new Identity with two opposing conceptions still fighting for dominance: a European Europe and an Atlantic Europe.

title: Johnson Rites Tomorrow
description: A funeral service for Howard Dearing Johnson, who founded the Johnson empire of roadside restaurants, motels and snack shops, will be held tomorrow at the First Parish Unitarian Church in Milton, Mass. Mr., Johnson died Tuesday at the age of 75 at Lenox Hill Hospital. He had retired in 1959.

title: FloatGlass Plant Is Set
description: Combustion Engineering Inc., announced yesterday that its CE Glass division will construct a $20million floatglass manufacturing plant in Cinnaminison, N.J., five miles north of Camden, N. J. The plant will produce approximately 75 million square feet of float glass annually, and will initially employ 165 people.

title: SATURNINA FIRST IN AQUEDUCT MILE
description: Marco Castaneda picked up a mount at Aueduct yesterday, and it turned out that his pickup won the feature race on the program. Riding Rafael Escudero's Saturnina as a lastminute replacement for Eddie Belmonte, Castaneda kept the 5yearold mare in the lead most of the way to take the onemile Bewitch Purse by 1'/z lengths.

title: 75canHour Raise Sought in New Pact By Garment Union
description: The Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America asked yesterday for a wage increase of 75 cents an hour and other improvements in benefits for 125,000 workers in the cotton garment industry.

title: Mr. McGovern's Dilemma
description: Any lingering doubts over the probability of Senator McGovern's success in capturing the Democratic Presidential nomination have been all but dissipated by the size and strength of his victory in the:New York primary. Winning 230 of the state's 248 elected delegates, the South Dakota Senator now appears to be within easy striking distance of a firstballot nomination.

title: Equity Financing;
description: The Public Service Electric & Gas Company yesterday offered its common shareholders 4,386,071 shares at a subscription price of $21.50 a share, on the basis of one share for each nine shares held. The offering, scheduled to expire July 12 is being underwritten by a group represented by Merrill Lynch Pierce Fonner & Smith Inc. The utility's stock, traded on the New York Stock Exchange closed yesterday at 22, down

title: A Customs Inspector Finds Waistline Revealing
description: Because an airport customs inspector thought a woman's waistline looked too thick and because a pier longshoreman discovered a supposedly empty crate was rather heavy to lift, four persons were accused of narcotics smuggling yesterday in two separate incidents.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Tickets may he obtained at the public desk, main lobby, United Nations Headquarters. fours: 9 A.M. to 4:45 P.M.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Albert A. Moyer, commenting on the OpEd article by the former president of the Association of ArabAmerican University Graduates, Dr. Naseer Aruri, begins his June 2 letter with an appeal to racialism when he speaks about an Arab psychology  baying and bombast. before battle.

title: House and Senate Units Assail U.S. Housing Policy
description: WASHINGTON, June 21Federal housing ,policies were the target of criticism on both sides of Capitol Hill today as a Senate subcommittee heard testimony concerning New York and a House subcommittee issued a report on Detroit.

title: DurableGoods Orders Dip From Record Set in April
description: WASHINGTON, June 21New orders for durable goods declined slightly in May but remained higher than in any month prior to April, the Consumer Department reported today. The statistics for this important leading indicator of the economy have been significantly revised going back many months, based on new benchmarks.

title: U.S. Becomes Owner of Ship On Bottom of St. Clair River
description: PORT HURON, Mich., June 21 (AP)The United States Government has become the owner by default of the sunken steamship Sidney E. Smith Jr.

title: TRIUMPH IN STATE BRINGS M'GOVERN WIDENING SUPPORT
description: Major elements of a likely firstballot victory for Senator George McGovern of South Dakota began to fall into place yesterday following his smashing triumph in New York.

title: Pentagon Papers Case Scheduled to Begin July 5
description: LOS ANGELES, June 21 The trial, of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr. in the Pentagon papers case is tentatively set to begin July 5.

title: Business Briefs
description: Mutual fund customers have been selling far more than they're buying but the Delaware Group of Philadelphia Delaware, Decatur Income, Delta Trend and Delchester has had just the opposite experience, it reported yesterday. J. P. Schellenger, president, said the group had not had a net redemption situation at all in the last year.

title: PETER A. FRANKEN, PHYSICIST, 411 DIES
description: BOSTON, June 21Dr. Peter Allen Franken, an acoustical physicist and a scientist, died. today In Massachusetts General Hospital after a brief illness. He was 41 years old and lived in nearby Bedford.

title: Advertising:
description: Dan Seymour's confidential memo is the most imaginative copy we have seen from the agency in a year, was the response of the Singer Company to the J. Walter Thompson house memo following the loss of the Singer domestic business.

title: Celler Loss Alters Committee Picture
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 The defeat of Representative Emanuel Celler of Brooklyn in yesterday's Democratic primary raised the prospect today that New York City may be without a committee chairman in the House next year for the first time since 1954, the last year the Republicans controlled the House.

title: A B. C. Near a Decil With Paar For Series of Filmed Specials
description: James Duffy, president of the American Broadcasting Company television network, said yesterday that A.B.C. and Jack Paar, the former, latenight talkshow host, were close to a final deal under which Mr. Paar would appear in a series, of onehour filmed specials for the network.

title: 4TH HELIPORT SET TO START SERVICE City Facility on E. 34th St. to Offer Flights to L.I.
description: The city's fourth heliport, a 150by60foot plot of East River waterfront at 34th Street, is beginning to stir with activity.

title: Cowles and 5 Subsidiaries Will Halt a Sale Practice
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commission announced today a consent order barring deceptive magazine sales practices by Cowles Communications and five subsidiaries.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: With reference to the letter by. T. M. Hsiehpublished on your April 24 OpEd page under the heading From TaiWan should like to call your attention. to the following facts:

title: Firemen Gather in Boston
description: BOSTON, June 21 (AP)The first contingents of some 10,000 firemen expected from across the country arrived today to attend the funeral mass tomorow for nine Boston firemen who died during a fire at the Hotel Vendome Saturday.

title: Speedy Crown Is 52 In $92,505 Realization
description: WESTBURY, L.I.,June 21 In today's draw for Saturday's $92,505.02 Realization Trot for 4yearolds at Roosevelt Raceway, Speedy Crown, the 1971 Hambletonian winner, gained the No. 3 post position and was named the early 52 favorite.

title: $50,000aYearforLife Lottery Due
description: A new summer special lottery with a grand Prize of $50,000 a year for life and a guarantee of a minimum of $1million to the winner, was anflounced yesterday by the Naw York State Lottery Commission.

title: U.S. Provides Funds To Aid Construction Of 2d Ave. Subway
description: WASHINGTON, June 21The Federal Government announced a grant of $25million today to start construction of the Second Avenue Subway.

title: Young Air Officer Formally Accuses Lavelle of Misconduct for Raids on North
description: WASHINGTON, June 21A young Air Force officer, acting because my superiors and fellow officers have failed to come forward, formally accused Gen. John D. Lavelle today of criminal misconduct in connection with unauthorized strikes on North Vietnam and the falsification of official reports.

title: Advertising:

title: Congressman SayS U.S.O. Is Covering Up Wrongdoing
description: WASHINGTON, June 21Representative Les Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, charged the United Service Organizations today with covering up illegal activities by, its director and with playing down the extent of corruption by its employes in Vietnam.

title: Jersey Standard Takes Giant Step
description: There's nobody ia, a telephone operator at the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), the world's largest oil company, said yesterday afternoon.

title: Loyang, Ancient Capital, Less Tense and Political Than Most Chinese Cities
description: LOYANG, ChinaThe small boy stood there at the front of the crowd, staring up in silence at the strangers on the bus outside the department store in the suburbs of this pleasant provincial city.

title: 5 U.S. EN GAIN IN LONDON. TENNIS
description: LONDON, June 21  Stan Smith, the defending champion, led five Americans into the quarterfinals of the London grasscourt tennis championships today and had the most trouble of them all.

title: Nanette Dembitz
description: She was a top scholar and an editor of the Columbia Law Review; she was pretty and slight and just a bit of a Southern belle; she was a cousin of Supreme Court Justice Louis D. (for Dembitz) Brandeis and back in 1938, when Nanette Dembitz was finishing law school and looking for work, none of it helped at all. At the law firm the partners delighted in interviewing her. Not one of them, however, offered her a job except, of course, for the man who asked if she could type, saying that perhaps he could find her a spot as a secretary.

title: Personal Finance
description: Whenever a person gets sick enough to go to a hospital, one of his firsi reactions after the shock of being there in the first placeis his concern about the cost. Is he covered?

title: Advice and Consent
description: The Senate vote to cut off funds for new military base deals with Portugal. and Bahrain, unless the executive agreements are submitted to the Senate as treaties, strengthens the Congressional effort to regain a voice in shaping the nation's foreign and defense commitments. The Administration took note of, then ignored, a 50to6 vote in March approving a Senate resolution to the same effect. The new vote, though only 41 to 36, is an effort to put teeth in that resolution.

title: Notes on People
description: President and Mrs. Nixon celebrated the 32d anniversary of their wedding yesterday at a quiet family dinner in the White House. One of their daughters, Tricia, and her husband. Edward F. Cox, who are living at the White House, were at the dinner. The other daughter, Julie, was with her husband, Lieut. (jg.) David Eisenhower, who is stationed in Florida.

title: MRS. ELSE HAUDEK
description: Mrs. Else Goldstein Haudek, a psychotherapist who was with the Community Guidance Service of New York, died yesterday at her apartment, 1080 Fifth Avenue. Her age was 65.

title: TWO WOMEN GAIN IN ALBANY DRIVE
description: The final tallies of two hotly contested Democratic legislatittte primaries yesterday increased the prospects that Woman would be elected to the State Senate for the first time since 1965.

title: Sports News in Brief&
description: LONDON, June 21 (AP)Nearly 50 yachts battled huge seas and gale force winds tonight in the singlehanded transAtlantic race. Anne Michail of France, one of three women in the race, reported she was exhausted after fighting a Force 9 gale in her 30foot boat, P.S.

title: Big Board Tightens Rules On Trading of Big Blocks
description: New capital requirements and new trading procedures for the handling of large block transactions have been established by the New York Stock Exchange in an effort to assure fair treatment for small investors.

title: A NATIONAL PRIMARY URGED BY SENATORS
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) A constitutional amendment providing for a national Presidential primary to be held in early August was urged today at the start of Senate hearings on proposals to reform the present system of selecting party candidates for President.

title: CURB IS ADVOCATED ON COSTS OF HOMES
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI) Unless inflation is curbed, the average cost of a onefamily home in the United States may skyrocket to $120,000 by the end of the century, a banker told a Congressional committee today.

title: It's a New World for Norman Cousins
description: The first issue of World Magazine, which calls itself a review of ideas, the arts and the human condition, appeared on newsstands this week, bringing with it the return of Norman Cousins, his globalism and a reunion with those people he thinks of as family.

title: Statements of Principals In Dispute on Publication
description: Seymour Statement

title: Wallace Condition Improves
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., June 21 (AP)Gov. George C. Wallace's doctors reported today that the Alabamian had progressed so well since Sunday's surgery that they would allow him to sit up at bedside and to resume physical therapy.

title: DR. ROBERT M'LEOD OF CORNELL FACULTY
description: ITHACA, N. Y., June 21Dr. Robert B. MacLeod, Susan Linn Sage Professor of Psychology at Cornell University since 1948, died here Monday in Tompkins County Hospital. He was 65 years old and had planned to retire July 1.

title: Film:
description: A good, blunt Western like The Revengers is easy to take on its own terms. Let's start with good, blunt William Holden as a postCivil War rancher scouring the Mexican border country for the man who massacred his wife and four children. Now add six cutthroat derelicts, salvaged from a chain gang, who help him in spite of themselves.

title: A Former Creedmoor Mental Patient Is Charged in Slaying of Queens Girl
description: A 31yearold man who had been released on Jan. 21 as a mental patient from Creedmoor State Hospital was charged yesterday with one of four knife murders of women in Queens that have terrorized large sections of the borough.

title: PHILIP GORDON, 49, LIAISON FOR CHASE
description: FORT LEE, N.J., June 21philip Gordon, assistant treasurer and community liaison officer for the Chase Manhattan Bank, died today at his home, 2150 Center Avenue. He was 49 years old.

title: Personalities: Hull Is Flattered
description: The Bobby Hull guessing game continues. The Chicago Black Hawks left wing went to Winnipeg with his golf clubs and speculation continued whether his hockey sticks would follow. Hull is considering a fiveyear deal that reportedly would give him $1million to sign with the Winnipeg Jets of the World Hockey Association and an additional $1.5million over the life of the contract. I think probably that I'm a little past my prime and I think that kind of offer from the Jets at this time is tremendous, said the 33yearold Hull, who has had an outstanding 15season career in the National Hockey League. We're still negotiating with the Black Hawks, but it could be that I'll be

title: Zack and Pierson Post 72's To Tie for Jersey Golf Lead
description: CHATHAM, N. J., June 21Michael Zack 3d of Warrenbrook and Howard Pierson of Riverdale equaled par 72 today at the 6,579yard Fairmount Country Club course to tie for the lead after a raindrenched opening round of the 71st New Jersey amateur championship.

title: Sports News in Brief&
description: CLEVELAND, June 21 (UPI)Nick J. Mileti, who owns a professional baseball and professional basketball team, will have two professional hockey teams this fall, one the newly formed World Hockey Association and one the American Hockey League. Mileti, 41yearold owner of the Cleveland Indians and the Cleveland Cavaliers, said today his Barons of the A.H.L. and the new W.H.A. entry will both play their home games at the Cleveland Arena, whicli:he also owns.

title: Anything Can Happen (Cont.)
description: Here is another collection of stories proving nothing, that New Yorkers are telling.

title: Israeli Thrust in Lebanon Seizes 5 Syrian Officers;
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 21An Israeli armored force, striking into southern Lebanese territory today, captured five Syrian officers within 100 yards of the border, along with a Lebanese officer and three military policemen. At the same time, Israeli jets and artillery attacked a southeastern Lebanese area where Palestinian guerrillas have long been based.

title: FOREIGN NEWSMEN WARNED IN SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 21The Government issued a veiled warning to the foreign press today to stop writing what Saigon considers distorted; negative reports on the was situation.

title: To Save the Magazines
description: WASHINGTONWe are grateful for this opportunity to present our views on the impact of the proposed postal rate increases on an invaluable and indispensable channel of communicationthe secondclass mail. We believe the secondclass rate increases proposed by the Postal Service, averaging about 127 per cent over the next five years, pose one of the gravest threats to freedom of communication even faced by this country.

title: Tax Exemption Affirmed For Political Fund Units
4 Being Hunted in Inquiry Into Raid on Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, June 21The authorities are searching for four men who rented rooms at Washington's Watergate Hotel with four oilier men who have been accused of breaking into the headquarters of the Democratic National Committee last Saturday.

title: Gunman Kills 6 in Jersey; He Wounds 6 and Himself
Jersey Center Names Head
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 21 (UPI)A former Rutgers University president Dr. Mason W. Gross, has been elected chairman of the eightman board of trustees of the Center for the Analysis of Public Issues, it was announced today. The trustees of the center set policy for the Princetonbased organization, which does research on state and local policy questions, including a study of pollution control programs and public health services.

title: Five Rooney Brothers Take Charge of Yonkers
description: YONKERS, June 21  A glassenclosed grandstand, with heat and airconditioning; a refurbished ceiling, and improved lighting are foremost in the plans of the five Rooney brothers of Pittsburgh for Yonkers Raceway.

title: Phelps Dodge Lifts Prices
description: The Phelps Dodge Tube Company announced yesterday that it had increased distributor prices for copper plumbing tube nd related products by decreasing wholesale discounts by 5 per cent.

title: Chinese Refugees Swim Across a Perilous Bay to Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG. June 21 Laufaushan, a sleepy little village on the shore of Deep Bay in Hong Kong's New Territories, men, woman and young children squat near the water's edge opening oysters for the visitors who come on outings from the urban areas of this British colony.ratio is less because most refugees are aware that they will not be deported so many voluntarily report to police stations to speed up contact with friends or relatives.

title: Gene Farmer, a Senior Editor Of Life Magazine, Dead at 52
description: Gene Farmer, who became Life magazine's London bureau chief at the age of 31 and who later, as a senior editor, excerpted the memoirs of General of the Army Douglas MacArthur and Soviet Premier Nikita S. Khrushchev, died Tuesday night of a heart attack at his home in Lexington, Mass. He 52 years old.

title: AMEX PRICES DIP AS OTC EDGES UP
description: Going its own way, the American Stock Exchange index declined a little yesterday, while the DowJones average covering Big Board shares and the NASDAQ index of overthe counter shares showed gains.

title: For Rent: Madison Sq. Garden Lounge for 10
description: For the corporation that has everything, Madison Square Garden has something new: $50,000ayear boxes, each accommodating 10 persons in airconditioned privacy, complete with bartender or waiter.

title: Curtis Browns Skip 1937 Rose BowlWithout a Regret
description: Curtis Brown saved for weeks to buy tickets for the 1937 Rose Bowl game. But his goal wasn't achieved. Instead a cocker spaniel crossed his path.

title: JUDGE DEMUR BESTS HER RIVALS
description: Family Court Judge Tanette Dembitz topped the list of tandidates in Tuesday's Democratic primary for nomination to the State Court of Appeals. If she wins in November, she will become the first woman to sit on New York's highest bench.

title: Bankers Trust Elects
description: The election of Vernon E. Jordan Jr., executive director of theo National Urban League, as a director of the Bankers Trust Company and the Bankers Trust New York Corporation the National Urban League, as was announced yesterday by the hank and the corporation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: If Leon Davis, president of Local 1199 of the Drug and Hospital Union, were seriously concerned about: the appalling danger of a hospital strike in this city, he would not have used the columns of The Times to obfuscate the issues with deliberate misstatements of fact in his letter (June 15).

title: SETH BINGHAM, 90, ORGANIST, IS DEAD
description: Seth Bingham, a composer, teacher and for 35 years the organist and music director at the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church, died last night at his residence, Amsterdam House, on Morningside Heights. He was 90 years old.

title: Apartment House Is Destroyed by Fire
description: An explosion and fire that Fire Commissioner Robert O. Lowery called highly suspicious destroyed the interior of a fivestory, apartment house at 75 West 68th Street yesterday and forced dozens of famMeg into the streets.

title: Woman Detective Tells House Unit Schools in City Are a Drug Haven
description: WASHINGTON, June 21An undercover narcotics agent who said she had worked for mere than three years in the New York City schools told The House Select Committee on Crime today that they were a haven for drug sales and use

title: Shift of Planes to Thailand Stirs Concern
description: DANANG, South Vietnam June 19The United States Air Force is transferring three tactical fighterbomber squadrons from Danang to Thailand in a move that officers of the squadrons say will hamper their ability to fly airsupport missions in the crucial northern region of South Vietnam.

title: Executive Changes
description: The International Paper Company has named Francis W. Theis as executive vice president.

title: Black Bloc Decides To Back McGovern
Tel Aviv Toll Rises to 27
description: TEL AVIV, June 21 (AP)An Israeli wounded in the Tel Aviv airport massacre of May 30 died today, raising the death toll to 27. He was identified as Isador Stern. Fifteen wounded still are hospitalized, but all are described as out of danger.

title: DR. THOMAS J. ENGLISH
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 21 Dr. Thomas J. English, chief of obstetrics and gynecology at St. Agnes Hospital, died yesterday in the hospital at the age of 70. He lived in Villanova.

title: Bridge: 3 Teams Vie for Last Spots For Semifinals of Olympiad
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 21The last day of qualifying play in the World Team Olympiad here today became a threeway race for third and fourth positions.

title: The Annual Fanfare Over Coty Awards
description: For the past few months, the fashion industry has been patting itself on the back because of the return of real clothes. The announcement yesterday that John Anthony, a 34yearold exponent of hard tailoring, was the recipient of the Coty American Fashion Critics Winnie for 1972 was proof that the industry puts its awards where its heart is.

title: Hanoi Spokesman in Paris Stresses Direct Negotiation
description: PARIS, June 21  North Vietnam charged today that President Nixon was seeking to weaken and divide the forces supporting Hanoi's war effort and said that the maneuver would not succeed.

title: Democratic County Chiefs Win 3 District Primaries
description: The Democratic county leaders in Brooklyn, Queens and the Bronx, who were challenged in Tuesday's primary, appeared yesterday to have survived the tests.

title: Summer Drizzles In but More Storms Are Forecast
description: The first day of summer began with. only a modest drizzle here yesterday  almost a relief for waterlogged New York  but the prospects were for more of the downpours and flooding that have occurred off and on since last weekend.

title: Order is Implemented
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation took another step yesterday in the divestiture program ordered by the Federal Government as part of an antitrust settlement that allowed it to keep the Harford Fire Insurance Company.

title: U.S. JETS STRIKE AT MISSILE SITES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, June 22 (AP) American jet aircraft attacked North Vietnam's air defense network lust north of the demilitarized zone Tubsday for the sixth day, the United States command announced yesterday.

title: GIVE A KID A BREAK. THE FRESH AIR FUND.
Mets End Astro Streak, 54; Marshall Helps With Homer
description: HOUSTON, June 21Although plagued by injuries and ineffective hitting, the Mets still can joke among themselves.

title: Another Rainout Adds To Yanks August Slate
description: The steady rain added another postponement to the Yankees schedule yesterday and the club is now faced with a program of nine games on six home playing dates in the last week of August.

title: Nixon Brother Booed Off a Stage by Blacks
description: DALLAS, June 21 (UPI)George Nixon, a brother of President Nixon, was booed off the stage today at the 39th quadrennial session of the general conference of the African Methodist Episcopal Church.

title: Intelligence Is Cited
description: TEL AVIV, June 21A senior Israeli staff officer, who may not be identified, said today that the operations against Lebanon were connected with information we had in recent weeks of preparation for more guerrilla attacks from Lebanese territory.

title: U.S. Troops to Be Sent To Area of Conventions
The New Politics
description: While it would be foolhardy to draw sweeping conclusions on the basis of the somewhat mixed results in the local primary contests, voters in New York City:. and elsewhere in the state seemed to show careful discrimination in their choices, to be willing to break out of traditional.molds, to prefer youth over age and to give women an expanded political role.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., June 21 (UPI)Earl Anthony, a southpaw from Tacoma, Wash., captured his second straight professional bowling championship last night, winning the $45,000 Japan Starlanes open tournament. The 34yearold pro widened his lead through 24 games headtohead play. At the end he showed a 72pin margin over 'Bob Hood of Daly City, Calif.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Alewives Produce Large Stripers
description: WARWICK, R. I.If Capt. Freddy Fredrek's technique with coiffures is as inspired as his approach to stripedbass fishing, his future is assured.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your issue of June 13 had two columns, side by side on the front page, one in regard to General Lavelle, who testified that he authorized twenty bombing raids on North Vietnam without orders, and the other entitled China Calls Raids Threat, to Border.

title: Elizabeth Holtzman
description: A few weeks ago Elizabeth Holtzman turned up at a community meeting in Brooklyn's Crown Heights section and asked the chairman to introduce her.

title: Results of Primary Contests in City and Suburbs
IRVING KANOFF
description: Irving Kanoff, president of TenDa Brand Frozen Foods, Inc., in Garfield, N. J. died here yesterday in Memorial Hospital after a brief illness. He was 53 years old and lived at 41 Garfield Avenue in Clifton, N. J.

title: World Bank Backs Iraq Loan
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (Reuters)The World Bank approved a $13million loan for Iraq despite opposition from the United States, World Bank sources said today. They said the loan, which is for education projects, would be formally announced tomorrow. Approval of the loan yesterday was opposed by the United States because of the Iraqui Government's move to expropriate Western oil operations, the sources said.

title: ISRAELI CABINET FACING BREAKUP
description: JERUSALEM, June 21Two of the political parties in Premier Golda Meir's coalition decided today to defy the leadership of the Labor party, which she heads, and press for the limited introduction of civil marriage in Israel.

title: OBSERVER
description: It was a vast noisy dull place with a television set in every other room which people tuned to another channel whenever Dick Cavett came on, and there were gales of automobile exhaust fumes.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, June 21 (Reuters)The British pound took another beating in late trading on foreigncurrency markets today, losing more ground to the United States dollar following recent talk of a sterling devaluation. At one point the pound tumbled here to $2.5750its lowest level since last Januaryand closed for the night at $2.5775. This represented a loss of threequarters of a cent on the day.

title: FIVE NATIONS ADDED TO ROGERS JOURNEY
description: WASHINGTON Jan. 21 (AP)William P. Rogers, Secretary of State, will visit three Eastern European and two Persion Gulf nations, and Greece, at President Nixon's request to talk to their leaders about prospects for improvements in cooperation and security.

title: Prices Climb Moderately For Third Month in Row
EIIRLICHMAN SCORES PAPERS PUBLICATION
description: WASHINGTON, June 21A senior White House aide in. sisted today that the publication of the Pentagon papers last year had weakened the Administration's ability to negotiate with other countries, despite President Nixon's subsequent diplomatic successes in Peking and Moscow.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., June 21 (AP)  Mr. Turner, a Florida businessman whose companies have come under legal scrutiny in several states, has filed a $500million suit here against more than half the nation's state Attorneys General and the Council of Better Business Bureaus.

title: RESERVE ADOPTS BANKING CHANGES
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 The Federal Reserve announced today the adoption, with relatively minor revisions, of the major changes in bank reserve requirements and check collection procedures proposed last March 28.

title: 30 Firemen Report III
description: Only 30 members of the Fire Department reported ill or injured at fire scenes during the 24 hours that ended at 6 A.M. yesterday, a department spokesman said. The figure was one of the lowest since the fire officers began to put pressure on the city to grant their contract demands early this month. As a tactic, they announced at that time the removal of our dedication and began to report all injuries and sicknesses after fires.

title: 1,500 ESCAPE FLOOD ON ISLAND OFF COAST
description: RIO VISTA, Calif., June 21 (AP)  Water from a broken levee virtually swamped a small recreation and farm island in the Sacramento Delta today, causing at least $10million damage. Rescuers evacuated 1,500 persons and hunted for possible victims.

title: Tom Little, Cartoonist, Dies; Won Pulitzer Prize in 1957
description: NASHVILLE, June 21 (AP)Tom Little, a Pulitzer Prizewinning editorial cartoonist for The Nashville Tennessean, died yesterday. He was 73 years old.

title: MARYLAND DROPS 7 BREMER CHARGES
description: UPPER MARLBORO, Md., June 21The state dropped today seven charges against Arthur Herman Bremer stemming from the attempted assassination of Gov. George C. Wallace but continued to press for a July 12 trial on the remaining 17 counts.

title: Laird Denies Abrams Knew
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (Reuters)Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that General Abrams did not know of unauthorized air strikes on North Vietnam in late 1971 and early 1972.

title: Henriette Roosenburg, a Writer Who Fought Nazis, Dies at 56
