description: Henriette Roosenburg, Dutch citizen who recorded her experiences in the underground, fighting the Nazis, in The Walls Came Tumbling Down, died yesterday in her home in PoetLaval, in the South of France.

title: Man Accused of Helping Plane Hijacker Is Freed
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., June 21 (AP)A Federal jury acquitted Bobby Wayne Wallace tonight of air piracy charges and three lesser counts in connection with a TennesseetoFlorida hijacking o( a chartered plane last October that resulted in the death of three persons.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 21Spending by Americans on foreign travel and spending by foreigners in this country both rose about 7 per cent last year, and a huge United States travel deficit of $2.7billion remained, the Commerce Department reported today. Total United States spending abroad was $4.3billion, and an additional $1.3billion was paid to foreign sea and air carriers, for a total of $5.6billion.

title: Impotence on Hijacking
description: The toothless condemnation of aerial hijacking that finally emerged from the Security Council this week after ten days of backstage maneuvering exemplifies the international impotence that drove many of the world's frustrated airline pilots to walk off their jobs Monday.

title: Credit Group Fills Post
description: Mrs. Virginia B. Kostelak has been elected corporate secretary of the National Association of Credit Management. She is also secretary of the N.A.C.M. Service Corporation, an affiliate of the 36,000member national organization of business credit executives.

title: T.W.A. REGISTERED A PROFIT FOR MAY
Montgomery Board Shifts on Renaming Street for Dr. King
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 21Faced with mounting opposition from the white community, the Montgomery City Commission has voted to rescind its action of two weeks ago naming a street fdr the late Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Regional Plan Association Backs State Housing Plan
description: The Regional Plan Association announced yesterday that it has endorsed New York State's Urban Development Corporation plan for housing in Westchester County.

title: S. S. Kresge Shareholders Approve 3for1 Stock Split
description: Shareholders of the S. S. Kresge Company approved a 3for1 stock split and an increase in the authorized common shares to 250 million from 60 million at yesterday's annual meeting in Detroit.

title: TRADE ENVOY FINDS CURRENCY STABILITZ
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (Reuters)President Nixon's chief trade negotiator, William D. Eberle, said today he expects last December's currency arrangement to hold up until international trade reform talks get under way late next year.

title: Sports News in Brief&
description: LOS ANGELES, June 21 (UPI)The 73foot ketch, Graybeard, from the Royal Vancouver Yacht Club British Columbia, had completed 889 miles is Winds picked up on the seventh day of the 3,571mild transPacifictoTahiti race today. The 57foot French sloop, Pen Duick III, was the handicap leader, 825 miles out.

title: N.B.C., Life, 2 Papers Get A.M.A. Journalism Awards
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 21 (UPI)The American Medical Association yesterday gave its 1971 journalism awards to Life magazine, the National Broadcasting Company, The Hays (Kan.) Daily News and The Fort Lauderdale News.

title: Essex College Breaks Ground for New Buildings
description: NEWARK, June 22  As a light rain fell, officials of Essex County College turned a spade of dirt today in a corner lot on Springfield Avenue to signal the start of the most ambitious construction program in the immediate area since the 1967, riots.

title: Stabilization Board Orders Cut in Rent For 200,000 Units
description: Tenants in 200,000 rentstabilized apartments will have their rents cut slightly in the year that starts July I as a result. of an order issued yeterday by the Rent Guidelines Board.

title: Marijuana Goes to Oxford
description: OXFORD, England (AP)The student magazine Isis said a survey it had conducted reported 28 per cent of the 1,1,000 Undergraduates at Oxford University smoked marijuana regularly and more than half of the students had experimented with it.

title: Scientists to Go to Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) A group of American scientists and industrialists will go to the Soviet Union July 2 to lay the groundwork for scientific and technical projects with the Soviet Union. The meeting results from President Nixon's summit meeting with Soviet leaders last month.

title: CAMBODIAN LEADER FORMS OWN PARTY
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 21 (UPI)The newly elected President, Lon Nol, already head of Government and supreme commander of the armed forces, took another step today toward oneman control by announcing the formation of a political organization with himself as its head.

title: Lazard Tells Policy
description: Lazard Freres & Co., an investment banking firm that agreed Tuesday to settle a Government suit charging a violation of the securities laws, issued on Tuesday the following statement, which was inadvertently omitted from yesteradys editions.

title: Graduation Styles: A Time of Change
description: A lot of English sheep, Over the years, literally gave their skins for American college diplomas. But they rarely do any more.

title: U. S. SAYS NORTH GETS SOME CARGO
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 21 (AP)United States military sources said today that North Vietnam was trying to circumvent the mining of its harbors and rivers by unloading supplies from Chinese ships anchored offshore and hauling them inland aboard barges.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES STAGE A COMEBACK
description: Ending a decline that had sent prices down 6 to 7 cents a bushel earlier this week, soybean futures staged a comeback yesterday and closed higher on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: 90,000 See Santos Win
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, June 21 (AP)Santos of Brazil, led by Pele, scored a 32 soccer victory over an Indonesian national team tonight before more than 90,000 fans.

title: Primaries at a Glance
description: PRESIDENTIAL: Senator George McGovern added 230 delegates to his total in the election Tuesday as he defeated opposing slates across New York State. Twelve uncommitted delegates were chosen, Representative Shirley Chisholm won four delegates and Senator Edmund Muskie won one or possibly two votes.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: LONDON, June 21 (UPI)Stan Smith of the United States, top seeded for the men's singles title at Wimbledon next Week, was given the easiest task of any of the leading players, when the draw for the championships was made at Wimbledon today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Police to Watch Schools in Summer

title: AIDES TO ABRAMS SILENT ON RAIDS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 21  United States Air Force and Army oficers in Saigon are maintaining silence on the controversy about unauthorized bombing raids on North Vietnam last winter, despite the implications for Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, who has been nominated to be Army Chief of Staff.

title: Mrs. Abzug Sees False Issue
description: It was the false issue of her right to run against William F. Ryan that defeated Bella S. Abzug in the Democratic Congressional primaryaccording to Mrs. Abzug. In the victor's camp, the view was predictably different yesterday: Hard work by mr. Ryan is how they saw it.

title: Seagren Just Misses 186
description: WALNUT, Calif., June 21 (UPI)The Olympic champion, Bob Seagren, cleared 17 feet 8 inches today in a polevault competition at Mt. San Antonio College. Seagren nicked the bar twice in failing to clear 186 in a bid for a world record. He shares the pending world mark of 184 with Sweden's Kjell Isaksson.

title: Market Place: 2 Ways to Deal With a Broker
description: Some time ago, an article in this space told about broker who earned well in excess of $100,000 a yearyear after year. The broker said that in his view, customers ought to give their broker complete discretion and keep their views to themselvesthe Wall Street equiv elent of Don't call us, we'll call you.

title: Books of The Times
description: I guess you'd best forget trying to understand the rationale behind Hunter S. Thompson's Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas: A Savage Journey to the Heart of the American Dream, Never mind if you don't wholly agree with him when he writes that Every now and then when your life gets complicated and the weasels start closing.in, the only real cure is to load up on heinous chemicals and then drive like a bastard from Hollywood to Las Vegas. Don't worry if it strikes you as odd to respond to the nightmare of certain middleAmerican realities by internalizing them with the aid of grass, mescaline, acid, downers, screamers, laughers, tequila, rum, beer, ether and amylsso that the Nevada desert is suddenly full of what looked like huge bats, all swooping and screaming and diving around the car, and the Las Vegas Mint Hotel seemed inhabited by huge pterodactyls lumbering around the corridors in pools of fresh blood.

title: U.N. Press Chief Resigns In Dispute With Waldheim
description: UNITED NATIONS, June 21 (UPI)The head of the United Nations press division resigned his $40,000ayear job today in a policy dispute with Secretary General Waldheim that involved the exclusion of two Chinese Nationalist correspondents.

title: U.S. Explains Move
description: WASHINGTON, June 21A Defense Department spokesman said today that the Air Force squadrons being moved out of South Vietnam will still be able to carry out their effort from Thailand.

title: FrontRunner Opens a Campaign to Unite Democrats
Jean Kerr Comedy, Finishing Touches, Is Due
description: Finishing Touches, a new comedy by Jean Kerr, will be sproduced on Broadway in Jan nary by Robert Whitehead and Roger L. Stevens.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, June 21His victory in the New York primary puts Senator Geotege McGovern on the brink of the Democratic Presidential nomination. That Makes it all the more necessary that those who believe the McGovern crimpaign promises the right directions for the nation should insist that he himself live up to that promise.

title: Moscow Seizes Vocal Advocate Of More Civil Rights in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, June 21  The Soviet security police today arrested Pyotr I. Yakir, a prominent campaigner for broader civil rights, in what may be a renewed drive against political dissent in the Soviet Union;

title: Kleindienst Sees a Decline in Wiretaps
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst said today that last Monday's Supreme Court decision on wiretapping would reduce the Government's intelligence about subversive activities, but not to an extent that will damage our national security.

title: Robon Is Among Class Winners in Race to Bermuda
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, June 21The ocean race to Bermuda wound toward a conclusion today as 101 of the yachts had finished or were accounted for by sunset. This left 77, mostly slower yachts 40 feet in length or less, still out on the race course.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your June 5 editorial suggests that an, 'integrated America is the only rational goal for black Americans. By citing Roy Wilkins integrationist position and his, rejection of the Positions taken by the National Black Political Convention, it is implied that Mr. Wilkins knows whit is best for blacks.

title: Chief of Todd Sees Profit for Quarter; Order Backlog Up
description: John T. Gilbride, president of The Todd Shipyards Corporation, expressed more optimism yesterday for American shipbuilding prospects and company operations this year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I am writing because of an item it The London Daily Express about the Boy Scouts of America. I am an hoporary member of the Boy Scouts of America and they are being remodeled as the British Scouts were in 1966.

title: DR. JEROME VAN ESS, POLYCLINIC SURGEON
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., June 21 Dr. Jerome Van Ess, for 40 years a surgeon on the staff of Polyclinic Hospital in New York, died last evening of a massive coronary attack at his home here, 21 Sunny Brae Place. He was 65 years old.

title: RevenueSharing Plan Passes Crucial Test in House
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 Supporters of revenue sharing won a crucial vote in the House of Representatives today, making almost certain the passage tomorrow of this new form of Federal financial assistance to state and local governments.

title: House Panel Finds Failure of Radicals To Subvert Military
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI) Representative Richard H. Ichord, Democrat of Missouri, chairman of the House Committee on Internal Security, said today efforts by radical groups to subvert the military have been a total failure.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI)Preston Martin, the chairman of the Federal Home Loan Bank Board, says the real estate settlement business is marked by inefficiency, confusion, and a variety of unethical, even illegal practices. In a letter to Representative Wright Patman, the Texas Democrat who is the chairman of the House Banking Committee, Mr. Martin said the board supported most major provisions of legislation to crack down on kickbacks, excessive closing costs and various other practices. The letter, written June 14, was made available today.

title: 2 Arrested as Blast Wrecks A Sex Boutique in Tel Aviv
description: TEL AVIV, June 21 (AP)An explosion wrecked a sex boutique in Tel Aviv today, and the police arrested two religious students.

title: DR.MORGANP.NOYES, PASTOR WAS WRITER
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., June 21The Rev. Dr. Morgan Phelps Noyes, pastor emeritus of the Central Presbyterian Church in Montclair, N.J., died in his sleep yestrday at the home here of his daughter, Mrs. Peyton H. Mead. He was 81 years old.

title: Roundup: Gibson Breaks Haines's Cardinal Record
description: When Bob Gibson lost his first five starts of the season, there was some speculation that the fireballing St. Louis righthander was in a decline. It has happened before.

title: McGovern Victory a Blow To State's Party Leaders
description: Senator George McGovern counted his winnings yesterday 230 national convention delegateswhile New York Democratic leaders tallied their losses in Tuesday's state Presidential primary.

title: MEXICO PROMOTES FAMILY PLANNING
description: MEXICO CITY, June 10Late in February President Luis Echeverrfa Alvarez was asked what he thought about a Governmentsponsored program to help control Mexico's rapidly increasing population, estimated at 51 million an dgrowing some 3.4 per cent a year

title: SHORT INTEREST UP FOR BIG BOARD
Port Authority to Spur Mass Transit
SUN HOLDS TALKS WITH KOLLSMAN
description: Standard Kollsman Industries, Inc., and the Sun Chemical Company announced yesterday that they were holding merger discussions.

title: SEYMOUR ASSAILS TINES AND NEWS
description: United States Attorney Whitney North Seymour Jr. declared yesterday that The New York Times and The Daily News had seriously damaged a major corruption investigation by making premature disclostaves about it.

title: Phone Independents Expected to Show Revenue Increases
description: Revenues of the independent telephone industry this year should climb to $3.8billion from $3.4billion last year, Charles Wohlstetter, chairman lof the Continental Telephone Corporation, said yesterday.

title: 215,579 Wallace Votes Are Counted on Coast
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 21 (AP)Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama received 215,579 writein votes for the Democratic Presidential nomination in the California primary, according to an Associated Press survey of final unofficial returns.

title: ARLAN'S SIGNS PACTS ON REVAMPING DEBTS
description: Arlan's Department Stores, Inc., a discountstore chain, has Signed previously announced agreements in principle with the company's bank and institutional lenders that restructure $22.5million of shortand longterm debt, Edward Spector, chairman and president of Arlan's, announced yesterday.

title: 2Year Voter Registration Is Overturned in Michigan
description: LANSING, Mich., June 21 (UPI)Democrats won a major legal and political victory yesterday when the Michigan Supreme Court declared the state's twoyear voter registration law unconstitutional.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Some 15 years ago the Supreme Court upheld the bruised sensibilities of Bill Radovich, a muscular member of the Detroit Lions, and an antitrust suit against the monopolistic practices of the National Football League. Since  precedent generally has considerable weight with most decisions, the noble jurists naturally scrutinized the 1922 landmark opinion of Oliver Wendell Holmes when baseball was ruled exempt from antitrust in a case involving the deceased Federal League.

title: COLLEGE DEAN HERE IS SLAIN IN BEDROOM
description: Prof. Thomas H. Shaw, dean of students of New York City Community College in Brooklyn, was found slain yesterday in his apartment at 505 La Guardia Place in Greenwich Village.

title: There Are Only Victims in Ulster
description: LONDONI have set Myself to make use of every possible approach diplomatic, blunt, direct, politeto persuade as many. people as possible to join hands with me in making Northern Ireland a.. place where the man who wants to.draw attention to his point of view doesn't have to depend on a loaded gun or a bomb for the purpose.

title: MARKET IS MIXED; DOW INDEX UP 3.39
description: The stock market, losing some of its earlier strength, ended on a mixed note yesterday. The DowJones industrial average rose 3.39 to 951.61, but declining issues outnumbered the gainers on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Fulbright and Laird Clash at Hearing on Arms Limitation Accords
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 Senator J. W. Fulbright, chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, accused Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird today of threatening the whole spirit of the new agreements limiting strategic arms by pressing Congress to approve new offensive programs at the same time as the accords.

title: Boyle Sentencing Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) Federal District Judge Charles R. Richey today deferred until Tuesday the sentencing of W. A. Boyle, president of the United Mine Workers, who is hospitalized with a back ailment. Boyle was convicted March 31 on 13 counts of making illegal political contributions, conspiracy and illegal conversion of union funds.

title: Knight Newspapers Board Approves Issue of Stocks
description: AKRON, Ohio, June 21 (UPI) Directors of Knight News. papers, Inc., today adopted a resolution amending the articles of incorporation to permit the issuance of common shares in exchange for the company's 196,665 outstanding preferred shareS.

title: No Breakfast Likely for New Day Care Children
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 More than 15,000 children in New York City day care programs will have to go without breakfast in the coming school year because of a freeze on Federal spending, the Senate select. Committee on Nutrition and Human Needs was told today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Now the farmers are saying that the additional monetary costs engendered by the banning of D.D.T. will be passed along to the consumer. For the last quartercentury the poisonous costs were being passed along, not only to the consumers but to the whole en vironment.

title: INTEREST RATES CONTINUE TO RISE
description: Interest rates continued their gradual but persistent upward course yesterday in most sectors of the money and capital markets.

title: Menetrey Retains Crown
description: COPENHAGEN, June 22 (UPI) Roger Menetrey floored Joergen Hansen twice before knocking out the Danish challenger at 2 minutes 26 seconds in the 10th round tonight to retain his European welterweight title. The 26yearold Frenchman was far behind on points and boxed with a swollen lefteye, but stormed back in the ninth round.

title: Business Briefs
description: Helped mostly by the continuing housing boom, profits of manufacturers of building products in the first quarter registered a 23 per cent improvement over the comparable period of 1971. George A. Christie, vice president and chief economist of the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company, which conducts quarterly surveys of the manufacturers, said that the buildingmaterials industry has made an excellent recovery from last year's weak earnings level. He added that nine out every 10 companies surveyed had reported higher earnings.

title: Thousands Protest Court Ban on Pickets
description: NORRISTOWN, Pa., June 22 Tens of thousands of union construction workers marched seven miles through pouring rain today to protest a court ruling on picketing at nonunion construction sites.

title: FASHION TALK
description: His chiffon dresses still waft gracefully, but George Stavropoulos obviously has new passion going for fall.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP)Secretary of Commerce Peter G. Peterson said today that he expected the mounting United States trade deficit to hit a new high at the end of this month and then start going down. Mr. Peterson told the House Foreign Affairs Committee he had no figures on the deficit expected for the second quarter ending this month, but said the figures for April were not very happy. The Commerce Department has announced that the deficit through April was $2.1billion. The firstquarter trade deficit was $1.5 billion.

title: 71 STUDENTS TO GET SCRIPPSHOWARD AID
description: Seventyone undergraduates in the field of journalism will have part of their college expenses paid in 197273 through a record number of grants announced yesterday by Matt Meyer, president of the ScrippsHoward Foundation.

title: BEAME SEES FLAW IN SEEK EXPENSES
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame yesterday disallowed $65,000 in expenditures for SEEK officials and students who had sought reimbursement for trips in the United States and abroad, as well as for $10 and $20 tickets purchased for a tribute to black heroes.

title: 3 Sail for Test Area
description: PARIS, June 22 (Reuters)Three protesters in a 31foot ketch sailed toward the French nuclear testing area in the South Pacific today, ignoring French Government warnings that they would enter the area at their peril.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: HOUSTON, June 22 (UPI)The Houston Rockets of the National Basketball Association will play their 197273 home games in Hofheinz Pavilion at the University Houston.

title: Conferees Split on Capitol
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP)Senate and House conferees failed today to reach compromise on whether to restore the West Front of the Capitol or expand it to provide more office space for Congressmen.

title: Surviving Japanese Terrorist Gets Initial Hearing in Tel Aviv
description: TEL AVIV, June 22 (Reuters) The first stage of the trial of Kozo Okamoto, only survivor of the three Japanese guerrillas who killed 27 persons at Is rael's international airport, opened before a military tribunal today.

title: GOVERNOR WEIGHS CORRUPTION MOVE
description: Governor Rockefeller announced yesterday that he was reviewing a number of investigations and allegations of corruption among policemen, prosecutors and judges in New York City to determine what action, if any, would be appropriate.

title: AbdulJabbar a Father
description: MILWAUKEE, June 22 (AP) Kareem AbdulJabbar of the Milwaukee Bucks has become father, the National Basketball Association club announced today. The Bucks said his wife, Habiba, had given birth to daughter, also named Habiba.

title: PENSION STRATEGY SHIFTS IN CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, June 22Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, was reported today to have agreed to a strategy for pushing an immediate 20 per cent increase in Social Security payments through Congress.

title: Michael B. Novok, Served With Roughriders in Cuba
description: Michael B. Novok, who served with Theodore Roosevelt's Roughriders in the SpanishAmerican War, died yesterday at the Veteran's Administration Hospital in Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn. He was 90 years old on Wednesday and had lived at the Harbor View Hotel in Brooklyn.

title: Radar Dish on Top of Skyscraper Tracks the Storm
description: The sentry for the New York area's weather watch is a 12footwide radar dome on the roof of 30 Rockefeller Plaza, 70 floors up.

title: Executive Changes
description: Fred Heller has been elected chairman of the board and chief executive officer of Lightolier, Inc. William F. Blitzor becomes president and chairman of the executive committee. E. H. R. Blitzer continues as chairman of the board.

title: Market Place: A Case Against Profit Forecasts
description: Will the investing public suffer if corporations are required to predict earnings?

title: Democrats Lose Keys For the Convention Hall
Church Record Is Claimed
description: RHINEBECK, N. Y. (AP) A group of young people conducted services in the Dutch Reformed Church in this Hudson Valley community for 56 consecutive hours one weekend, breaking what they said was the church marathon record by eight hours.

title: Lynne Schumsky Bride of Eric H. Grant
description: CEDARHURST, L. I.Tune 22At the Sephardic Temple here this evening Miss Lynne Roberta Schumsky, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Morton Schumsky of Freeport, was married to Eric Hill Grant, son of Mrs. Diane Grant of Hewlett Bay Park and New York and Richard Grant of Providence, R. I. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Bernard Zlotowitz, assisted by Cantor Jack Brown.

title: War Hero for McGovern
description: ROCKFORD, Ill., June 22 (UPI)  Lieut. Col Anthony Herbert, retired, the most decorated enlisted man in the Korean war, has announced his support for Senator George McGovern for the Democratic nomination for president. Colonel Herbert, who prompted a nationwide controversy when he leveled charges of dereliction of duty against his commanding officers in Vietnam in 1971, said yesterday that his decision to support the South Dakota Senator was his alone.

title: British Cruise Ship Canberra To Be Based Here Next Year
description: The 45,000ton Canberra, the flagship of P & O Lines, the world's largest passenger ship operator, will be based here as a cruise ship early next year.

title: F.P.C. Urged to Bar Bias in Gas, Electric Utilities
description: WASHINGTON, June 22The Federal Power Commission was formally requested today to apply a code of fair employment practices to the electric power and natural gas companies subject to its, jurisdiction.

title: Loan Rates Raised by London Bank
description: LONDON, June 22The Bank of England raised its basic lending rate  the socalled bank rateto 6 per cent from 5 today. But the move did not strengthen the pound, which fell again in heavy, erratic trading on continuing fears of an impending devaluation.

title: French Train Toll Now 107
description: SOISSONS, France, June 22 (Reuters)  The death toll in last Friday's train collision near here rose to 107 today when the body of an engineer was hauled from his wrecked diesel engine, officials said. The last of eight coaches involved in the tunnel collision was expected to be dragged out late today.

title: Screen: Spy Melodrama:Johnson's 'Groundstar Conspiracy' Opens
description: "The Groundstar Conspiracy," which opened rather modestly at neighborhood theaters Wednesday, is an espionage melodrama of such skill and intelligence that I should rank it not too far below Hitchcock's "Frenzy" among the few genuine pleasures in recent movies. It is equally rare in being an action film that appreciates the value of action, and of retreat from action; and if you tend (as I do) to yawn through most chases, terrors and moments of peril, it may come as a salutory surprise to learn again that there may after all be some point to dangerous excitement generated on the screen.The film opens with an explosion triggered by the theft of secret data from a space project somewhere in the Pacific Northwest. The thief survives  just barely  but his memory does not. And when he has been pieced back together by the doctors, and analyzed and shocked and tortured almost to death, he still does not know who he is or where he came from or who hired him to sack and steal from Project Groundstar.He has no more than a face and bodypretty much courtesy of the surgeonsa voice, unaccountably a few words of Greek, and the fleeting memory or dream of a young woman swimming in a sunlit ocean. But he also has an enemy, a man named Tuxan, security officer of the project; ruthless, humorless, wholly manipulative. And he has a friend, an unattached young woman put in his way by Tuxan, who suspects that she may be able to expose his prey.The story that develops among these three is very rich (and slightly incredible), and there is some point in not revealing it because in "The Groundstar Conspiracy" to be surprised by what comes next really does contribute to understanding and delight. In this respect, in its concern with memory and in the beautiful precision of its editing, it looks a little like a popular variation on the great remembered-time mysteries of Alain Resnais ("Muriel," "La Guerre Est Fini," etc.) or Chris Marker's science-fiction short "La Jete."That is the stylistic universe of "The Groundstar Conspiracy." But its physical worldthe stark, gorgeous land and seascapes of the locations on Vancouver Island and the mainland of British Columbiaare like nothing else I have seen in the movies.As the steely, overbearing Texan, George Peppard is so efficiently hateful that it may be difficult to realize that he is also very good. Michael Sarrazin as the hapless alien, Welles, creates an unusually complete character, playing against the pathos and hysteria inherent in his role. And Christine Belford, very lovely and virtually new to movies, brings a kind of sensible grace to a figure that is necessarily part improbability and part dream.I have seen only two films directed by Lamont Johnson. One, "The McKenzie Break," was perhaps the best under-publicized movie of 1970. In its own way, "The Ground-star Conspiracy," equally underpublicized, seems just about as good. Mr. Johnson begins to look like one of the ornaments of the industry, and I think it more than time that he was discovered.

title: In the Face of the Storm
description: So, we boast, man can split the atom or fuse it; he can rocket a crew to the moon and back; he can bomb a city off the map; he can harness the forces of nuclear destruction. He can astonish himself with his own achievements, both good and bad. But he still can't tame the weather. Wind and water, among the simplest of elemental forces, can outdo anything man has yet contrived.

title: Japan Deplores French, Chinese Tests
description: GENEVA, June 22 Japan sharply rebuked China and France today for seeking to improve their nuclear arsenals by exploding atomic bombs in the atmosphere while refusing to participate in, the efforts at the Conference of the Committee on Disarmament here to curb the arms race.

title: MRS. DYE VICTOR IN EASTERN GOLF
description: PINEHURST, N. C., June 22 (AP)Mrs. Paul Dye of Delray Beach, Fla., firstround leader with a 75, added a 77 today and won the 66th annual tournament of the Women's Eastern Golf Association.

title: Look on the Bright Side
description: About two centuries ago, Adam Smith said about the times lived in: When people in the same trade meet together, even for merriment and diversion, the conversation usually ends in a conspiracy against the public or in some contrivance to raise the prices.

title: The Toll in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 22 (UPI)The ceasefire offer by the Provisional wing of the outlawed Irish Republican Army today came after nearly three years of violence in Northern Ireland that killed 383 persons and wounded more than 3,000.

title: Marine Keeps Pistol Title
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., June 22 (AP)Frank Higginson, a Marine Corps warrant officer from Placerville, Calif., retained his United States centerfire pistol title today with a score of 250.

title: KISSINGER LEAVES CHINA AFTER TALKS
description: PEKING, Friday, June 23 (Reuters)Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser on national security, flew from Peking the morning 10 hours after a final midnight talk with Premier Chou Enlai at the conclusion of a fiveday visit.

title: Soviet Physicist Proposes Bill of Rights And a Redirection of Economic Policies
description: MOSCOW, June 22 (AP)Andrei D. Sakharov, father of the Soviet hydrogen bomb and an outspoken critic of the Soviet treatment of dissidents, has proposed a bill of rights for the Soviet Union and urged a major redirection of Soviet economic and foreign policies:

title: British Pound to Float
description: The British Government announced today that it would allow the pound sterling to float. London's foreign exchange markets will be closed today and Monday to allow changeover in trading arrangements. [Earlier story on Page 47.]

title: Dumbbell Test
description: The story of two Hunter College staff members who flunked their civil service examinations because they could not lift a 25pound bar bell over their heads with one hand is a classic illustration of the continuing abuse of the testing process. One of the victims is an audiovisual technician who never has had any trouble working and moving her projectors; the other is a graphic artist and audiovisual adviser who, to the best of anybody's knowledge, is not required to lift anything much heavier than a pencil or a file card.

title: Humphrey Says His Staying in Race Could Help Victor Gain Party Unity
REGULARS WIN SUIT IN MISSISSIPPI CASE
Murphy Sees Queens Slayings Solved
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said yesterday that! all four recent knife slayings of women in Queens might be solved with the arrest of a suspect on Wednesday who had been released by a mental institution in January while under indictment for the attempted murder of a policeman.

title: Barker, Lindner, Fleming Gain in ClayCourt Tennis
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 22Bob Barker of Port Washington, Ken Lindner of Brooklyn and Peter Fleming of Chatham, N. J., gained the semifinals of the Eastern men's claycourt tennis championships as rain forced play indoors today at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: Kenneth Phillips of G.M.A.C., Managed Foreign Credits
description: Kenneth A. Phillips, former manager of overseas and Canadian credits for the General Motors Acceptance Corporation before his retirement on Jan. 1, 1958, died in Midtown Hospital on Wednesday after a brief illness. He was 77 years old.

title: New White House Panel Backs Standby Services
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 The White House announced today the formation of a National Committee for Employer Support of the National Guard and Reserve Forces to improve employers attitudes toward men in the standby services.

title: LOWENSTEIN ACTS TO CONTEST VOTE
description: Allard K. Lowenstein, who lost his Congressional primary race with John J. Rooney, the Brooklyn incumbent, by about 1,000 votes, said yesterday that suits challenging the election's validity would be filed in Federal court today and in state court next week.

title: Boston Lifer Pleads Guilty To Killing 3 More People
description: BOSTON, June 22 (UPI)Kenneth Harrison, serving a life sentence for the murder of a 9yearold boy two years ago, has pleaded guilty to killing a man, an elderly woman and a 6yearold girl.

title: Swiss Wins 5.5Meter Title As Turner Finishes Second
description: GENEVA, June 22 (AP)Ted Turner of the United States has lost his world championship for 5.5Meter yachts to Claude Bigar of Switzerland.

title: Used Machine Tool SaleS Up
description: CLEVELAND, June 22 (UPI) Used machine tool sales rose 17.5 per cent in May from April and 34.6 per cent from a year ago, the Machinery Tool Dealers Association said today. The index of sales in May reached 202.4, the highest level in six years.

title: ACADEMIC REFORM URGED BY REPORT
description: The Carnegie Commission on Higher Education called yesterday for greater attention to the quality of teaching at most colleges, the relevance of the curriculum and the provision of creative opportunities for students.

title: Tupamaro Leader Seized In Downtown Montevideo
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 22 (UPI)One of the top TO Tupamaro guerrilla leaders, Jorge Manera Lluveras, was arrested, today on a downtown street, police sources said.

title: Trade Bloc Shapes Position
description: LUXEMBOURG, June 22 (Reuters)Monetary experts from the six member nations of the Common Market and the four countries that plan to join made their first progress toward a joint position in future negotiations on world monetary reform, informed sources said today.

title: STATE SUES TO END DEMOLITION HERE
description: In the first of what he said would be a series of such actions, State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz moved in court yesterday to halt the alleged fraudulent and illegal harassment of tenants by a Manhattan company managing buildings that are being torn down or proposed for demolition.

title: BIG BOARD PRICES STAGE RECOVERY
description: The stock market staged a modest recovery in the final hour yesterday as trading on the New York Stock Exchange held to a slowpaced 13.41 million shares.

title: Suit Says Beth Israel Rejects Ill Poor
description: The Beth Israel Medical Center was accused in Federal District Court yesterday of having turned away more than 3,000 ill Lower East Side residents who had no Medicaid or Medicare cards and could not afford the standard clinic fee of $45.

title: The Corner Presented
description: The three oneact plays in The Corner, which opened last night at Joseph Papp's New York Shakespease Festival Public Theater, have more in common than their blackness. Each is a mood piece that attempts to evoke the speech, atmosphere and life style of street people.

title: Kremlin Reassures Allies It Maintains War Preparedness
description: MOSCOW, June 22The Soviet Union reassured its allies today that it would carry on with necessary nuclearwar preparedness because the American Soviet agreements limiting the arms race did not yet eliminate that danger entirely.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference Emphasizing Domestic Matters
description: WASHINGTON, June 22Following is a White House transcript of the news conference held today by President Nixon.

title: Canada Seeks to Regulate TakeOvers of Businesses
description: OTTAWA, June 22 (AP)The Commons Finance Committee today approved the Government's bill to regulate foreign takeovers of businesses in Canada and sent the bill back to the Commons, where it may get final approval within a week.

title: Books of The Times
description: Since, among his other literary endeavors, S. N. Behrman served time in Hollywood writing screenplays, one chapter in these memoirs of an otherwise happy and fruitful life is devoted to that El Dorado an the West Coast. It is easily the weakest in the book, and I mention it right off because it proves that even in the hands of an urbane and incisive memorialist, Hollywood is a bankrupt subject. Once again, we have a runthrough of famous parties, with Chaplin doing his imititable imitations; of stories about Louis B. Mayer and Sam Goldwyn; of sessions with t h e European expatriate colony (Werfel, Schoenberg, Reinhardt); of the contemptuous way talent was treated (Scott Fitzgerald). Behrman had a juicy subject, it seemed to me, when he began to write about Hollywood's fatal attraction to psychoanalysis, but it was a vein he opened without delving further. Except for this backwater, the rest is vintage Behrman, a pure distillation, clear and light, delicious to savor and just as flavorsome taken an long draughts. read the book at one sitting because each chapter enticed me to read one more before shutting up shop. I was surprised when I found myself at the last chapter.

title: A SUBWAY CRITIC ADMITS FORGERY
description: The Transit Authority yesterday dropped its complaint of forgery against Stephen Dobrow, a longtime subway critic, after he apoligized in Queens Criminal Court for using the authority's name on a leaflet he had distributed.

title: Lord &
description: Lord & Taylor will open store in Dallas in February, 1974, and another store M Houston in the fall of 1971, William J. Lippincott, chairman and chief executive officer, announced yesterday.

title: GAIN FROM FREEZE DENIED BY INSURERS
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP)  The Health Insurance Association of America today denied charges that six large insurance companies had reaped a $96million windfall from group health premiums as a result of wageprice controls.

title: 26 Dead in FloodsRockefeller Calls Guard to Help
description: One of the worst rainstorms in decades slammed up the Eastern Seaboard yesterday, dropping a torrent of water that knocked out transportation and communications, sent tens of thousands fleeing from their homes and unleashed deadly flash floods.

title: Bridge: Italian and U.S. Teams Win In Semifinals of the Olympiad
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 22The final of the 1972 World Team Olympiad tomorrow will be between Italy and the United States, who overwhelmed their opponents in the semifinals today.

title: Nina M. Glickson Is Married At Yale to Ens. Stuart Smith
description: NEW HAVEN, June 22Miss Nina Miller Glickson and Ens. Stuart Whitney Smith, U.S.N., were married here this afternoon in Dwight Memorial Chapel at Yale University by the Rev. J. Philip Zaeder, associate chaplain of Yale. A reception was given at the home of the bride's parents.

title: Personalities: A Surprise Visitor
description: Denny McLain is still the Peck's Bad Boy of baseball. McLain, banished by the Oakland A's to Birmingham, Ala., in the Southern League May 14, ostensibly to get himself in pitching shape, returned unannounced to Oakland, Calif., yesterday. That came as a surprise to Dick Williams, manager of the A's, who says he has no place on his team for the former 31game winner. Charles O. Finley, the club's owner, said, I'm available if Denny wants to talk, but as far as his status is concerned we'll make the decisions. Williams added, If Denny wants to work out while he's in Oakland, it's all right with me. He's here at his own expense. Right now we have no plans to bring him back although the reports on him look

title: Case of the Disappearing Dune Buggy
description: The buggies do not always win. summer ago I was wandering the beach along the Sound early one morning with my prebrealtfast coffee cup, and came on one which clearly had lost. Some overconfident driver had been driving along far below the highwater mark, when his engine evidently had stalled.

title: Private Woman Writes About Public Life
description: WASHINGTON, June 22People say to Abigail McCarthy, If you can write like this, why aren't you writing all the time? And she answers, Well, I was writing, but nobody noticed.

title: $250,000 Awarded in Death
description: CHICAGO, June 22 (AP)The family of a worker killed during construction of the John Hancock Center has been awarded $250,000. A Circuit Court jury yesterday ordered the Tishman Construction Company of Chicago to pay damages to Marguerite Greenwood, 36 years old, and her two children. Clyde Greenwood, 42, was killed March 31, 1967, when he fell from the eighth floor.

title: SMITH IS OUSTED IN LONDON TENNIS
description: LONDON, June 22  Topseeded Stan Smith, the defending champion, was eliminated from the London grass court tennis tournament by lightly regarded John Paish of Britain today, but Americans gained the other three places in the semifinals.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: TONIGHT/NBCTV  CIIRONOLOG Irving Price author of bestselling BUYING COUNTRY PROPERTY. Sec adv. TV page. ADVT.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: BAARN, the NetherlandsWhen contemplating their alliance with Eutope, Americans are too often inclined to think of it in terms of the number of divisions, ships or aircraft being provided to NATO by these lesser powers and they are also inclined to overlook something perhaps even more important, namely industrial talent and human brains.

title: Roy Buchanan TV Rerun Warms Hall for Guitarist
description: Last fall a 90minute television special was shown on the public television network featuring a theoretically unkown but highly acclaimed rock guitarist, Roy Buchanan. Last Saturday this special was rerun on Channel 13 and, in the wake of this showing, Mr. Buchanan arrived at Carnegie Hall on Wednesday evening to the acclaim of a very eager and willing audience that filled the house.

title: Dr. Peter Altan Franken Dies; Acoustical Physicist Was 41
description: BOSTON, June 22Dr. Peter Allan Franken, an acoustical physicist, died here Tuesday in the Massachusetts General Hospital after a brief illness. He was 41 years old and lived in Bedford.

title: Jamieson, R. H. Sikes Share Golf Lead at 68
description: NORTHBROOK, Ill., June 22 (AP)Jim Jamieson and R. H. Sikes each battled biting cold with a fivehole hot streak today and shared the firstround lead at 68 in the $150,000 Western open golf tournament.

title: Towing Association Elects
description: The New York Towboat & Harbor Carriers Association, the trade group of the port's tug and barge industry, yesterday elected Francis B. Bushey as chairman of the board of directors. Mr. Bushey, who heads Spentonbush Transport Service, Inc., succeeds Thomas E. Moran, president of Moran Towing Corporation.

title: TV: The Rise of the BlueCollar Hero
description: With the success of Archie Bunker, veteran observers of the TV industry have been waiting for the inevitable march of a blue collar brigade across the home screen. The march has begun. Wednesday evening the American Broadcasting Company introduced two halfhour series in search of the big primetime money: The Super, at 8 and The Corner Bar, at 8:30.

title: GABLE TRIUMPHS IN U.S. MAT TRIAL
description: ANOKA, Minn., June 22 (AP) Dan Gable scored an impressive victory today in the first round of the United States Olympic wrestling trials.

title: Grim Army Assignment: Informing the Next of Kin of a Death
description: FORT BRAGG, N. C.A woman is always asked to sit down in case she faints. If there are children, the mother is taken to another room so they will not learn of the death of their father from a stranger. It is expected that women will weep, often hysterically, but that men will take the news with greater calm and selfcontrol.

title: STOCK PRICES EBB ON AMEX AND OTC
description: It was a day of downward drift yesterday for prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market. The Amex index fell 0.06 to close at 27.42, while the NASDAQ index dwindled 0.72 to end at 140.b3.

title: Anderson Denied Party Post
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., June 22 (UPI)Senator Clinton P. Anderson, Democrat of New Mexico, who is retiring after 24 years in office, was rebuffed yesterday by New Mexico Democrats in his bid for a national committeeman post. Mr. Anderson, 76 years old, who said he wanted the national post to help bring unity to the party, was defeated by Rudy Ortiz.

title: Saigon Replaces Troops Fighting to Relieve Anloc
description: CHONTHANH, South Vietnam, June 22After suffering) steep casualties for more than two months in an unsuccessful attempt to break through a Communist roadblock and enter Anloc, South Vietnam's 21st Division has been relieved of the responsibility for the job Old fresh troops have been thrown into the battle.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I have just received from a friend a copy of an article captioned New U.S. Commanding General by Drew Middleton. The article was dated May 15 and was from The Times.

title: ALFRED H. BRUNDAGE
description: MAPLEWOOD, N.J., June 22 Alfred H. Brundage, founder and president of the Electrified Appliance and Water Company of Newark, died today in St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston. He was 76 years old and lived at 11 Evergreen Place.

title: Anger With Employment Agency Is Cited as Gunman's Motivation for Jersey Shootings
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., June 22 Edwin James Grace, who shot 12 men, killing six of them, in an office building here yesterday, apparently had directed his rage at an employment agency that failed to get him a job earlier this year.

title: Elene Honest Is Wed
description: Miss Elene Honest and Edgar Zeltner, vice presidents and merchandise managers of Bonwit Teller, were married in the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church here yesterday afternoon. The Rev. Dr. David H. C. Read and Rabbi Phillip Schaechter performed the interfaith ceremony. The couple's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Gus Honest of Lehighton, Pa., and Irwin Zeltner of Long Beach, Calif., and Mrs. Bessie Zeltner of New York.

title: 5 Klansmen in Michigan Charged in Tarring Case
description: DETROIT, June 22 (UPI)The former grand dragon of the Michigan Ku Klux Klan and four klansmen were charged today with conspiracy in the tarring and feathering of a high school principal who was trying to improve race relations at his school.

title: Britain Unlikely to Challenge For America's Cup in 1974
description: LONDON, June 22 (UPI)Britain is unlikely to challenge for the 1974 America's Cup, the world's premier yachting event, a statement by the Royal Thames Yacht Club, which is organizing elimination races, said today.

title: PRICECURB MOVE AFFECTS FUTURES
description: The agitation for price controls on farm products is causing considerable nervousness in the commodities futures markets.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: LEBANON, Tenn., June 22 (AP)Weary Raymond Lasater, 42 years old, trudged off Hunter's Point Course today after breaking the world record for consecutive holes of golf and announced, I don't plan to do it again.

title: Comrade Snow White Spins Yarn in Saratoga
description: ALBANY, June 22The Moscow Central Theater for Children charmed most of an audience of 4,000 adults and children at the Saratoga Performing Arts Center last night with Fairy Tales by Pushkin, a lavish, colordrenched musical version of the Snow White story and a golden fish who grants wishes.

title: Brando Loses Alimony Plea
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., June 22 (AP)Marlon Brando, the actor, has lost a court action to end alimony payments to his second wife, Movita, a Mexican actress. Mr. Brando contends that his former wife is living with or has married James Henry Ford, a musician. He was ordered in Superior Court yesterday to pay $1,400 monthly alimony, plus $600 a month child support for the couple's two children, Sergio, 11 years old, and Rebecca, 6.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: INDIANAPOLIS, June 22 (AP)Roger Brown, forward with the American Basketball Association champions, the Indiana Pacers, will attend the Republican National Convention in Miami in August as an alternate delegateatlarge. Brown, elected to the Indianapolis CityCouncil last November, is among 10 unopposed.candidates for alternate delegatesatlarge to be elected tomorrow.

title: Pacer, 11, Campaigns Like 3YearOld
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 22  Among the 930 horses on the grounds at Roosevelt Raceway, 18 are aged 11 years or older and all but two of those are competing in claiming races. One of the exceptions, Arthur Nardin's Trader Nardin's, is the 31 favorite to win tomorrow night's fourth event, at $9,250 onemile handicap for Class AI/A2 pacers.

title: DEMOCRATS PICK AN ELECTION AIDE
description: David N. Dinkins, a 44yearold lawyer and Harlem District leader, has been recommended by Democratic leaders in the city for appointment as a Commissioner of the Board of Elections.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I very much appreciated the balanced presentation of the problems inherent in a heroin delivery research project in John A. Hamilton's column Free Fix for Addicts? on June 5. In addition to the problems described by Drs. Jaffe, Dole and Phillipson, we should add the special risks of heroin administration.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: BERLIN, June 22 (UPI)Monika Zehrt set a European women's 400meter record of 51.1 seconds today on the opening day of the East German track and field championships in Erfurt. Her time, in a preliminary, was only one tenth of a second slower than the world record, held by Marilyn Neufville of Jamaica.

title: Researcher to Direct BiologicsStandards Unit
description: WASHINGTON, June 22Dr. Harry M. Meyer Jr., a key figure in research that led to development of a vaccine against rubella, or German measles, has been named director of the Federal agency that regulates all vaccines and blood products.

title: A Chicken Recipe for the Weekend
description: In the menu below the dish marked with an asterisk is followed by a recipe.

title: ARTHUR L. FEINSTEIN, REALTY LAWYER, 59
description: Arthur L. Feinstein, a senior partner in the law firm of Herrick, Feinstein, Mendelson & Abramson, died Wednesday at Mount Sinai Hospital after a ong illness. He was 59 years old and lived at 200 East 57th Street.

title: U.S. Plans to Scale Down Its Command in Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 The Pentagon said today that it was planning to reorganize the military command system in South Vietnam to reflect the diminishing American presence in the country.

title: General Phone Unit May Make a Refund To Its Customers
description: The General Telephone & Electronics Corporation announced yesterday that as a result of a recent decision by the Supreme Court of California, its largest telephone subsidiary, the General Telephone Company of California, may have to refund about $16million to its customers.

title: 2d Faction of I.R.A. Calls Truce in Northern Ireland
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 22The Irish Republican Army's Provisional wing, under intense pressure from the Roman Catholic community to end its campaign of terror in Northern Ireland, today announced a conditional ceasefire starting midnight Monday.

title: West German Auto Output And Exports Show Drops
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, June 22 (AP)West Germany's automobile production and its export of cars have steadily declined from a year ago, the Automobile Industry Federation said today.

title: Maxine E. Lichtenberg Wed to Gary N. Gerson
description: Miss Maxine Ellen Lichtenberg and Gary N. Gerson, who were graduated this month from the University of Wisconsin, were married here last evening at the St. RegisSheraton Roof. Rabbi Edward T. Sandrow performed the ceremony.

title: Saigon Bars InPlace Truce
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 22 (UPI)  The Saigon Government will reject any inplace ceasefire agreement in the Vietnam war, Foreign Minister Tran Van Lam said today.

title: PIANO DEBUT MADE BY DIANA ALLABACH
description: Diana Allabach, a young pianist from Toronto, made her New York debut Wednesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, with a program of sonatas by Scarlatti, Haydn and Liszt, topped off by Chopin's Fantaisie Impromptu, the Nocturne, Op. 55, No. 2 and B flat minor Scherzo.

title: Cuban Veterans Group Linked To Raid on Democratic Office
description: WASHINGTON, June 22An organization made up of Cuban veterans who served in the United States Army after participating in the Bay of Pigs invasion in 1961 was reported by Cuban sources today to have been involved in last Saturday's raid on the Democratic National Committee headquarters.

title: BANK LOANS UP BY $320MILLION
description: Commercial and industrial loans from New York City banks during the week that ended Wednesday  a period that began with the June 15 tax payment dateincreased by $320million.

title: Tokyo May Cut Discount Rate
description: TOKYO, June 22 (Reuters)Governor Tadashi Sasaki of the Bank of Japan said today that his bank would lower the discount rate tomorrow if agreement could be reached to reduce interest rates on postal savings by then.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Leo Zeferetti,head of the Correction Officers Benevolent Association, said yesterday that guards in the city's prison system were refusing to eat meals at the institutions to press demands that civilian food handlers replace inmates in preparing and serving officers meals.

title: California Primary Upheld In Challenge to McGovern
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 22 (AP)A Federal judge rejected an effort today to upset Senator George McGovern's claim to all 271 California delegates to the Democratic National Convention.

title: The Lavelle Case
description: The initiative of a young Air Force officer compels the Pentagonand should impel Congressto take a harder and deeper look at the case of Gen. John D. Lavelle, who ordered unauthorized raids against North Vietnam and reported them as protective reaction missions.

title: Rye Residents Grow Weary After Heavy Rains
description: RYE, N.Y., June 22 Panic gave way to weary resignation here this afternoon as the, 1300 families whose homes borIcier Blind Brook sat in their darkened, soggy houses waiting to see what the rains would do next.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The June 5 column about heroin maintenance by John A. Hamilton of your editorial staff contains a number of misleading and incorrect statements. He refers to the proposal made by Howard Samuels and the Vera Institute of Justice which he misunderstood throughout.

title: Union Camp Expands
description: The Union Camp Corporation is entering the housing market in Florida through its Mule building subsidiary, the Tekton. Corporation which has activities in the west and midwest. The Florida project, valued at $25million, will be a 976unit condominium development near Ford Lauderdale.

title: Books of The Times
description: I was the wife of a prophet, and a prophet who was without much honor in his own countrythe Senate of the United States and the Democratic Party. One can search the books of the Old Testament from Isaiah to Malachi and find very little in the way of precept or practice to guide the wife of a prophet. So writes Abigail McCarthy, wife of Eugene McCarthy, who was drawn, not without initial reluctance, into her husband's campaign for the Presidency in 1968, a children's crusade whose denouement was a policeman's flailing club. in Chicago. The McCarthy's are now separated. Gene left our home in August of 1969, Mrs. McCarthy writes in the book's epilogue. He had long since come to the conclusion that the concept of lifelong fidelity and shared life come what may... was no longer valid. Thus, with only glancing reference to the difficulties many people today have in sustaining permanent commitments, she writes off 24 years of marriage.

title: Thousands Arrested by Saigon For Suspected Vietcong Links
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 22The South Vietnamese police have summarily arrested thousands of citizens suspected of Communist sympathies in the last two months, and officials say the detentions have denied help to the North Vietnamese that would have been invaluable in their offensive.

title: Advertising:
description: The Bliss in Bliss/Grunewald, a $9.million ad agency, came front its chairman, Ben B. Bliss, who has moved into Albert FrankGuenther Law, a centuryold Wall Street agency, to direct its consumer advertising capability.

title: Volcker Tells Congress That Basic Accord on Reform May Come in 2 Years
description: WASHINGTON, June 22Paul A. Volcker, Under Secretary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs, told Congress today that discussions among governments so far on world monetary reform had tended to slide past the fundamental points to concentrate instead on problems of technique and mechanism.

title: Kite, Crenshaw Pace Texas To 14Stroke N.C.A.A. Lead
description: CAPE CORAL, Fla., June 22 (AP)Tom Kite and Ben Crenshaw paced defending champion Texas to a comfortable 14stroke lead today in the National Collegiate golf championships.

title: Busing Order for Detroit Is Criticized by President
description: WASHINGTON, June 22President Nixon criticized today a recent court decision in Detroit ordering massive busing between suburbs and the inner city as a flagrant violation of the neighborhood school principle. He said it dramatized what he described as the weaknesses of antibusing provisions passed by Congress.

title: Film: Thriller With Etruscan Touch
description: "The Dead Are Alive" may not be the best promotion for the annual Festival of Two Worlds in Spoleto, Italy. But the background of this horror-thriller is certainly fascinating. Furthermore, the plot has a group of neurotic worldlings commuting from festival rehearsals and an ornate Spoleto villa to the equally picturesque Etruscan ruins in the same area, where a growling, off-screen presence is hacking young couples to death.The catch to the picture is the rather slapdash direction of Armando Crispino. But there, is nothing wrong with the intriguing plot, concocted by the director and a colleague, once the suspense has hit its stride.This takes a while simply because the characters are generally such a nasty, repugnant lot, ranging from an alcoholic young archeologist, glumly played by Alex Cord, to a paranoid conductor, deftly done by John Marley. Who really cares if they are being bumped off right and left? And we do mean bumpedhacked and slashed to a recurrent, deafening tape of Verdi's Requiem. An Etruscan demon-god is supposed to be running loose after thousands of years, but don't you believe it.And don't be fooled by the minor characters and loose story strands that seem to be dangling like loose spaghetti strands. In the last reel, the plot gathers them up tightly for a gripping, perfectly logical dnouement. The story, with those intriguing Spoleto and Etruscan trimmings, would have made an excellent whodunit novel.Samantha Eggar, Nadja Tiller, Horst Frank and Carlo De Mejo are among the glaring or hissing cast. The director stages one good brake-screeching car chase through the cobbled Spoleto streets, and his climactic showdown in a dark church is fine. Horror fans who will settle for poisonous parasites and a captivating color canvas should be satisfied.

title: MEAT IMPORT CURB MAY BE SUSPENDED
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 President Nixon disclosed today that he was considering temporary suspension of the meat import quota as a means of increasing the nation's supply of meat and of slowing the rise in food prices.

title: Meat Inspection Plan Gains
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI) A House Agriculture subcommittee approved today a Senatepassed bill that would increase the present 50 per cent Federal share of meat inspection costs to 80 per cent. The Livestock and Grains subcommittee also authorized the withholding of the Federal share, which is now matched by states, if a state enacted meat labeling and packaging requirements that were less stringent that Federal regulations.

title: COURT LETS UNION HELP CANDIDATES
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 Labor unions may legally make political contributions through separate funds financed by voluntary contributions from union members, the Supreme Court ruled today 6 to 2.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI)President Nixon picked part of his personal allstar baseball team.at a news conference today. There were no surprises. At the end of surprise news conference in his office, Nixon gave this rundown:

title: EXCOUNCIL CHIEF SCORES RENT LAWS
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 A former New York City Council President who sponsored rentcontrol laws enacted in the city 27 years ago told a Senate subcommittee here today that the laws were ruining the city of New York.

title: U.S. Opposes World Bank Loan to Iraq
description: WASHINGTON, June 22The Treasury disclosed today that the United States had cast its first formal vote against a loan by the World Banka negative vote based on President Nixon's new policy on compensation for American companies whose property has been nationalized or otherwise expropriated by other countries.

title: Belgium Acts on Franc
description: BRUSSELS, June 22(Reuters) The Belgian Senate approved today a Government bill formally revaluing the Belgian franc by 2.76 per cent, completing parliamentary approval of the new franc paritywhich has been in force unofficially since last Dec. 20. The only further step before the new parity0.0182639 grams of fine gold or 44.8159 Belgian francs to the dollarbecomes official is for Belgian to notify the International Monetary Fund.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 22The Senate passed by voice vote today and sent to the House legislation establishing a new Federal financing bank to coordinate, and in many cases replace, the market borrowing of numerous Federal agencies that issue their own securities.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Everyone talks about the theater but no one does anything about it. Season after season we see fewer and fewer shows produced and smaller and smaller audiences. Restaurants in midtown have gone out of business, the hotel business is off. New York is hard put to lure convention business to what was once every conventioner's dream. Even suburbanites don't want to come to Broadway to see a show. Why?

title: Sports News in Brief
description: LONDON, June 22 (AP)Jean Yves Terlain, crewman of the biggest yacht in the singlehanded Atlantic race, failed to report again today and anxiety for his safety deepened. For the fourth straight day the Frenchman made noradio contact with his base. An aircraft failed to sight him yesterday.

title: Enemy Is Reported Repulsed Near Hue
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 22 (UPI)  South Vietnamese paratroopers and allied aircraft reportedly turned back a major North Vietnamese attack against the defense line west of Hue today, knocking out 18 Sovietbuilt tanks and killing at least 146 enemy soldiers.

title: Shopping Centers'
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 The Supreme Court balanced property rights against freedom of expression today and concluded that owners of large suburban shopping centers might bar political pamphleteers from their premises.

title: 2,000 Protest War By Forming a Ring Around the Capitol
description: WASHINGTON, June 22about 2,000 women and children encircled the Capitol today in a protest against continued funding of the war in Vietnam.

title: Dike Attacks Charged
description: PARIS, June 22North Vietnam appealed to world opinion today to halt what it called premeditated effort by the United States to destroy its dike system and flood the country in the coming months.

title: State Cites Ethnic Bar In Schools
description: ALBANY, June 22Differences in language and culture are keeping 300,000 pupils, including 160,000 in New York City, from meaningful participation in school programs, according to the State Board of Regents.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, June 22 (AP)The British Petroleum Company announced today that it had substantially completed arrangements to raise $936million to develop North Sea oilfield. Describing it as the largestever private bank loan, B. P. said the money would be provided through a consortium of more than 30 European, North American and other overseas banks.

title: Dike Bombing Denied
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  A Defense Department spokesman said today that the dikes were not a target of the American bombing of North Vietnam.

title: LILLIAN GREEN
description: Lillian Green, who had been on the staff of the Metropolitan Museum of. Art for 44 years at her retirement in 1964, died on Monday. She was 73 years old.

title: NIXON SEES PERIL UNLESS CONGRESS VOTES ARMS FUND
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 President Nixon said today that American security interests would be very seriously jeopardized if Congress approved the agreements limiting strategic arms without also supporting the Administration's multibilliondollar program to modernize offensive strategic forces.

title: Not Their Cup of Tee
description: CLEVELAND, June 22 (UPI) A suburban couple, whose house borders Tanglewood Country Club, where the $150,000 Cleveland open starts next week, has filed a suit to halt the golf tournament. The suit, filed yesterday by Mr. and Mrs. Murray G. Fox, charged that spectators at the tournament would trespass on their property.

title: JudgeMade Monopoly
description: Everything about the Supreme Court's renewed finding that baseball, alone among professional sports, is exempt from the antitrust laws bespeaks that captivity to foolish consistency which Emerson deplored.

title: WHITE SOX DOWN BREWERS BY 52
description: MILWAUKEE, June 22 (AP) Tom Egan, a reserve catcher batting 175, singled in two runs today and led the Chicago White Sox to a 52 victory over the Milwaukee Brewers.

title: COURT POSTPONES DRUG UNION CASE
description: A State Supreme Court Justice yesterday postponed a hearing on a contemptofcourt suit against Local 1199, the Drug and Hospital Union, so that its leaders could continue in mediation proceedings aimed at averting a hospital strike on July 1.

title: Hanoi Reports Casualties
description: HONG KONG, June 22 (Reuters)North Vietnam said today that more than 150 people had been killed and every building in Hongai, the capital of Quangninh Province, had been damaged or destroyed in United States airraids.

title: China Believed to Favor A New Move to End War
description: HONG KONG, June 22An American source expressed the belief here today that China would like to see some serious negotiations to end the war in Vietnam. The source added that the Chinese might favor an approach more effective than that at the Paris meetings, which have produced little results.

title: Pattison Gains Semifinals By Routing Orantes, 63, 62
description: EASTBOURNE, England, June 22 (UPI)Andrew Pattison of South Africa routed Manuel Orantes of Spain, the topseeded player, today, 63, 62, to reach the semifinals at the Rothmans open lawn tennis championships.

title: ChrisCraft Clears Sale of TV Station To Metromedia, Inc.
description: Metromedia, Inc., announced yesterday it had completed the previously announced purchase of station WTCNTV in MinneapolisSt. Paul from ChrisCraft Industries, Inc., for $18million in cash, plus repayment of the station's indebtedness to ChrisCraft.

title: Mobutu Is Building an Authentic Zaire
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, June 19The Congo, now known as Zaire, won political independence from Belgium in 1960 but, even more than most black African countries, remained politically unstable and culturally and economically dependent on her former colonial masters.

title: Wayne Fearful of Floods Serious as Those in 1968
description: WAYNE, N,J., June 22 Civil Defense volunteers began evacuating residents along the rainswollen Ramapo and Pompton Rivers today.

title: FOUR U.S. GOLFERS ADVANCE IN BRITAIN
description: HUNSTANTON, England, June 22 (AP)Barbara McIntire, from Colorado Springs, led a group of four Americans into the third round of the British women's amateur golf championship today.

title: HUGH E. WHITE JR.
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., June 22Hugh E. White Jr., art director of Young & Rubicam, Inc., the New York advertising agency, died today in the New Rochelle Hospital after a long illness. He was 57 years old and lived at 39 Overlook Circle.

title: World Bank Unit Approves $169.9Million in Aid Plans
description: LONDON, June 22 (Reuters) The World Bank group said today it had approved three loans and four credits totaling $169.9million for projects in Mexico, Sierra Leone, Ivory Coast, Iraq, Cameroon, Yemen, Arab Republic and Mauritius.

title: Elinor Ross Sings Role of Elizabeth In Met's DonCarlo
description: In the performance of Verdi's Don Carlo given by the Metropolitan Opera on Wednesday night, Elinor Ross took the part of Elizabeth for the first time. She joined a cast that included Grace Bumbry, Franco Corelli, Robert Merrill and Giorgio Tozzi.

title: SOUTH AFRICA DEATH IS RULED A SUICIDE
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, June 22A magistrate ruled today that Ahmed Timol, an Indian whose death while in police custody last October set off nationwide protests, had committed suicide by jumping from the 10th floor of Johannesburg police headquarters.

title: Grand Union Profit Down In Quarter on Peak Sales
PAKISTAN REFORM APPEARS FAR OFF
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, June 22 It was 114 degrees in Rawalpindi and hotter elsewhere in Pakistan  hardly the most opportune moment to announce a stiff tax increase on cold drinks.

title: Retail Sales Up 9 Per Cent
description: WASHINGTON, June 22The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $898,000,000, up 8 per cent from the yearearlier $835,000,000. Total retail store sales were about $8,833,000000, up 9 per cent from the yearearlier $8,110,000,000.

title: Mrs. Rosalie Brody Wed to H. M. Feder
description: Mrs. Rosalie Garber Brody of Manhattan was married here at noon yesterday to Harvey M. Feder, also of New York, Rabbi Max Meyer performed the ceremony at the bride's apartment.

title: New Head of A.M.A. Charles Anthony Hoffman
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 22 Dr. Charles Anthony Hoffman, the new president of the American Medical Association, is a conservative from the hills of Appalachia who rose out of near poverty and survived a long illness and a series of personal reversals to make his way in life. I had to work to eat, he said of his youth in a statement reflecting the attitude of a self made man toward national welfare policies.

title: 7 South Vietnamese Students in U.S., Fearful, Refuse to Go Home
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 Seven South Vietnamese college students studying in the United States on grants from the Agency for International Development have refused to return to South Vietnam, saying they fear prosecution for their antiwar views.

title: Peking Fails to Hamper Trade Of Japanese With South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 21 China's attempts to cut down economic relations between Japan and South Korea by boycotting Japanese companies that do business with this country is so far having little if any effect.

title: Washington Area Flooding Kills 7, Routs Thousands
description: WASHINGTON, June 22Relentless rain and flash floods in the capital area early today caused at least seven deaths, impeded government, forced thousands out of their homes, caused untold millions in damage and raised fears of still further calamity tomorrow.

title: Owner in W.H.A. Says Hull Will Sign Tuesday
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, June 22 (AP)Ben Hatskin, owner of the Winnipeg Jets of the World Hockey Association, said today he would sign Bobby Hull to a multiyear contract next Tuesday.

title: Coast Dike Collapses
description: ISLETON, Calif., June 22 (UPI)  An emergency dike protecting this evacuated San Joaquin Delta community crumbled tonight, unleashing flood waters and stranding workers.

title: Big Board Presses Inquiry In Bausch &
description: The New York Stock Exchange confirmed yesterday that it is investigating trading of Bausch & Lomb, Inc., stock on June 14. That day the issue dropped to 50, and 131,000 shares were traded.

title: Werblin: Out of the Swamp by 1975
description: The title is Chairman, New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority, but David A. (Sonny) Werblin, never a man to be bothered by details, has to consult his business card to get the title exactly right.

title: Rain Inundates City Area; Jersey Homes Evacuated
description: The metropolitan area, already sodden from a week of sprinkles, showers and torrential downpours, got another dose of heavy rain yesterday as the tropical storm Agnes released its burden.

title: House Rejects Call To Trim the Staff Of the White House
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) Efforts to curb what Representative Morris K. Udall called the flow of power to the White House by trimming its staff and executive privilege were rejected by the House tonight.

title: Weekend Fishing and Boating
description: Because of the storm, charter and party boats did not leave their docks yesterday. Since only a few ventured out on Wednesday because of sloppy weather, reports listed below mostly are based on returns from early in the week. The consensus among captains yesterday was that the pickings would be lean today, even with clearing weather. They were hoping for a return to normal for the weekend.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your June 6 editorial Baghdad's Gamble analyzes fairly well the factors and issues involved in Iraq's nationalization of her northern oilfields. However, it would seem to me that a critical factor was, by intent or otherwise, omitted, namely, the role of France and French oil interests.

title: ASSEMBLY TO VOTE ON CAHILL TAX BILL
description: TRENTON, June 22  Gov. William T. Cahill won a skirmish in the New Jersey Legislature today when he got Democratic opponents of his tax reform program to agree to floor vote in the Assembly next Month.

title: Red Smith
description: Ken Buchanan of Edinburgh and Roberto Duran of Panama City are inhaling fresh air and tzimmes in the Catskills in preparation for a tryst in Madison Square Garden Monday night, when Duran will endeavor to swat the Scot loose from the lightweight championship of the world. A trifle less than 24 hours later, Muhammad Ali of Cherry Hill, N. J., Jerry and Mike Quarry of Bellflower, Calif., and Bob Foster of Washington, will pair off in Las Vegas for a doubleheader calculated (by the closedcircuit television promoter) to draw children from play and old men from the chimney corner.

title: South Korea's Economy Grew by 9.8% in 1971
description: SEOUL South Korea, June 22  The Bank of Korea announced today that the growth of the South Korean economy in 1971 amounted to 9.8 per cent in real terms, increasing the country's per capita income to $212.60 from $187.30 in 1970.

title: Wille Cites Danger of Bank Investing
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., June 22 The risk of failure among banks and thrift institutions would rise significantly if they were allowed to invest directly in real estate or common stocks, Frank Wille, chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, said here today.

title: Mets, Yanks, Golf, Trots Hit by Stormy Weather
description: Men, beasts and machines were driven off playing fields, putting greens and tracks yesterday as heavy rains, spawned by Hurricane Agnes, disrupted, sports.

title: Rabbi's Rabbi Keeps The Law Up to Date
description: FALLSBURG, N. Y., June 22 Among Orthodox Jews he is known simply as the Rav"the rabbi's rabbi.

title: Corporate Working Capital Rises Sharply in Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (Reuters)The Securities and Ex change Commission said today that net working capital of corporations in the United States increased $5.3billion in the first quarter of this year to. $240.6billion.

title: Yields Increase Sharply On TaxExempt Bonds
Senate Votes Complaint Unit For Foreign Service Staff
description: WASHINGTON, June 22Over State Department opposition, the Senate by a vote of 56 to 27 approved legislation today establishing independent grievance procedures for Foreign Service officers.

title: City Council Votes Record Rise in Property Taxes
