Both families are of New York, where Dr. Dansker is execu tive vice president of the In vestors Funding Corporation and the bridegroom's father is president of S. Toepfer, Inc., diamond merchants. Mrs. Dansker is chief med ical librarian at Lenox Hill Hospital.

title: Bhutto Is Willing to Meet Sheik Mujib in Bangladesh
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, June 25 (AP)President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto said today he hoped to meet Sheik Mujibar Rahman, Prime Minister of Bangladesh, in the second half of next month and prepared to go to Dacca, if necessary.

title: SOVIET'S SCHOOLS WILE STRESS JOBS
description: MOSCOW, June 25The So viet Union, still struggling to ward the proclaimed goal of a universal high school educa tion for its citizens, announced a program of modernization to day designed to make schools more responsive to the needs of society.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Personalities: A Busy Champion
description: Carlos Monzon, the world middleweight boxing cham pion, isn't resting on his laurels. The Argentine, who successfully defended his crown against France's Jean Claude Boutier nine days ago, agreed yesterday to meet Tom Bogs of Denmark in a title match at Copenhagen Aug. 19. Monzon had been sched uled to meet Benny Briscoe of Philadelphia in August, but that bout, set for Buenos Aires, was postponed when Briscoe was hospitalized re cently with a stomach ail ment.

title: Body in Connecticut River Is That of Robbery Suspect
description: ROCKY HILL, Conn., June 25 (AP)Through the use of dental charts the police identi fied the body of a man found floating in the Connecticut Riv er near the Rocky HillGlas tonbury ferry dock last Friday as Gary. Dube, 25 years old, of Agawam, Mass.

title: Israeli Airline Shows Profit Of $27,000 During 1971,
description: TEL AVIV, June 25Israel's national airline, El Al, weath ered a year of crisis in inter national aviation and finished slightly in the black, the com pany's annual report showed today. A profit of 113,551 Israeli pounds, approximately $27,000, was recorded for the fiscal year ended March 31.

title: Hamlet Raindate Tonight
description: A special performance of the New York Shakespeare Festi val's Hamlet will be given at 8:30 P.M. tonight in the Dela corte Theater In Central Park. It replaces the performance rained out Friday evening.

title: Advertising:
description: The newspaper business has its own magazine. Radio and TV have their own maga zine. As a matter of fact, al most every trade, profession or industry has its own maga zine.

title: Stateless Kayakers Seek U.S. Approval For Olympic Games
description: A ray of hope appeared yes terday that a Polish refugee kayaker, a stateless citizen, might get his dearest wish to compete for the United States in the Olympics at Munich later this year.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Sports News in Brief
description: PARIS, June 25Baron de Red's colt, Pleben, today captured the 104th running of the $375,000 Grand Prix de Paristhe toughest test for 3yearolds in the world.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: It your girl wants to make up a subject or earn extra credits, she can do so & enjoy a fun summer at fully accredited school in Berkshires. 2015674305.Advt.

title: A Pushcart Sells Mousse For the Strolling Gourmet
description: When The Better Moussetrap, a gus siedup tea cart, appeared in front of the Washington Square arch the other day, a couple of youngsters studied the sign and asked Sandra Barron: May we please see what a chocolate mouse looks like?

title: RAIDS NEAR HANOI ARE SAID TO WRECK BIG STEEL WORKS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, June 26 American fighterbombers using guided bombs have wrecked North Vietnam's only modern steel plant, halting production there, the United States command said yesterday.

title: Nat Fleischer, 84, Dead; Was Sports' Mr Boxing
description: Nat Fleischer, unchallenged holder for many decades of the title Mr. Boxing, died yesterday in University Hos pital. He was 84 years old and lived at 151 Bayside Drive in Atlantic Beach, L. I.

title: U.S. Tennis Sweep Forecast
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 25At long last this should be an American year at Wim bledon.

title: Jean Witter, 80, a Founder Of Dean Witter & Co., Inc.
description: PIEDMONT, Calif., June 25 (UPI)Jean C. Witter, a found er of the investment banking and brokerage house, Dean Wit ter & Co., Inc., died yesterday at his home here. He was 80 years old.

title: Paris Plans to Limit HighRise Buildings
description: PARIS, June 25Belatedly, those who govern Paris are drawing up new zoning regu lations to limit highrise build ings and preserve what is left of the city's harmonious sky line.

title: FRANK L. DAVIS, 70, AN INVENTOR, DEAD
description: NORTHPORT, L.I., June 25 Frank L. Davis, an inventor and chairman of Davis Aircraft Products, Inc., here, died follow ing a heart attack at Holy Cross Hospital in Fort Lauder dale, Fla. He was 70 years old and lived at Thunderbird Farm in nearby Fort Salonga and in Fort Lauderdale.

title: ThirdWorld Ecology
description: Among the rifts that threatened from time to time to swallow up the U.N. Conference on the Human En vironment, none had been so volubly predicted as the split between the rich industrial nations of the West and the underdeveloped states of the Third Worldreportedly eager for their turn to produce and pollute.

title: Fittipaldi Wins at Rouen
description: ROUEN, France, June 25 (UPI)  Emerson Fittipaldi of Brazil fought off a strong chal lenge by Mike Hailwood of Britain today for 30 laps before winning the 22d Rouen Formula 2 Grand Prix auto race.

title: U.S. and States Hailed On Flood Cooperation
description: BISMARCK, N.D., June 25 (AP)State and Federal gov ernments work fairly well together to cope with floods and other natural disasters, two Midwest Governors said today.

title: Student Visitors Learn That in China Boy Meets Girl ShouldertoShoulder
description: CHANGSHA, China, June 25 Wow! They really mean it.

title: City's 19th Rainy Day in June Brings Another 0.79 Inch in 11 Hours
description: It was a rare day in June yesterdaythe skies cleared tin midafternoon after 11 more hours of drenching rain poured 0.79 inch more water on de pressed New Yorkers.

title: Wild Parakeets Thriving Here Despite Cold Northern Winters
description: Handsome pet monk para keets that have escaped from cages have now joined pigeons, English sparrows and starlings as a thriving new nonnative wild species in the metropoli tan area.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: BEL AIR, Calif., June 25 When Senator George McGov ern wanted to relax on the day of the California primary, he came here to the hills of Bel Air, overlooking the smogbound flatlands of Los Angeles, to the Spanishstyle home of his friend Max Palevsky.

title: Warrant in St. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS, June 26 (AP) The man who rammed his car into a hijacked American Air lines jetliner as it was prepar ing to leave the St. Louis air port Friday night was charged in a Federal warrant today with interfering with an aircraft.

title: Miss Susan Nobel Bride of Physician
description: Miss Susan R. Nobel, a lawyer associated with the New York law firm of Lord, Day & Lord, was married last evening to Dr. Alvin Wertem theil, a physician. Rabbi Israel Nobel, the bride's father, performed the ceremony at the Terrace on the Park in Flushing, Queens.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When Yogi Berra was weaving his magic spells in the early part of the season and was thereby creating the illusion that his invincible Mets would win from the much more vincible Pirates. Bill Virdon waited patiently and silently. He is the new manager of the Pittsburghers, the champions of the world, and he knew it was all an illusion even if it isn't his nature to make loud boasts or start arguments.

title: Bridge: Soloway, Newest Ace, Hailed For World Championship Play
description: The Aces' performance in the world championship in Miami Beach during the last two weeks may not have been quite good enough to beat Italy's great Blue Team, but it did demonstrate that the newest Ace is fully cap able of representing the United States worthily in in ternational play.

title: Man and Computer: Uneasy Allies of 25 Years
description: In the 25 years since the late John von Neumann de signed the first fully modern electronic computer, tens of thousands of the controver sial machines have reached into nearly every realm of human endeavor to alter dra matically the shape of to day's society.

title: Treasury Bills' Yields Climb at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly com petitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Dollar Loses Ground, Breaking Through Official Floors
description: LONDON, June 26while Europe waited nervously for a clear indication of how its tangled monetary affairs would be sorted out, the floating pound drifted downward today in interbank trading on the Continent to $2.49, 11.5 cents below its former official rate of $2.60571.

title: Wallace Declines to Attend Maryland Trial of Bremer
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., June 26 (AP)Gov. George C. Wal lace will not attend the state trial of the man accused of trying to kill him, a hospital aide said today.

title: Another Cosmos Launched
description: MOSCOW, June 26 (UPI) The Soviet Union launched number 496 in its Cosmos se ries of unmanned earth satel lites today, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported.

title: Mrs. Mitchell Says She Won't Discuss Plan for Separation
description: RYE, N. Y., June 26  Mar tha Mitchell refused today to elaborate on her statement yesterday that she was separat ing from her husband, former Attorney General John N. Mitchell, until he quit his job as President Nixon's cam paign manager.

title: Business Briefs
description: OTTAWA, June 26 (Reuters)Canada had a season ably adjusted currentaccount deficit of $367million on her balance of payments in the first quarter, Statistics Canada reported today. The deficit resulted from a reduced merchandise trade surplus, together with the persistent net payments deficit on nonmerchandise transactions.

title: Black Bloc Pledges Votes to McGovern, but Latest Democratic Delegate Counts Differ
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 Senator George McGovern of South Dakota asserted this morning, after winning the en dorsement of a bloc of black delegates, that he had amassed enough votes to guarantee his nomination for President on the fir'St ballot at the Demo cratic National Convention.

title: SOCIALISTS APPLAUD SOVIET EMIGRATION
description: VIENNA, June 26  Demo cratic socialist leaders from 27 countries attending a congress of the Socialist International here today applauded the cur rent emigration of Jews from the Soviet Union.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: DO YOU KNOW ANY IMPORTANT MAN IN BUSINESS WHO DOES NOT READ FORBES MAGAZINE?ADVT.

title: Court Bars Trial of Army Over Civilian Surveillance
description: WASHINGTON, June 26  The Supreme Court ruled, 5 to 4, today that the courts would not consider the constitutional ity of the Army's surveillance of civilian political activities in suits contending that military surveillance was discouraging criticism of the Government.

title: Agnew Links McGovern To Henry Wallace Views
description: ST. LOUIS, June 26  Vice President Agnew defined the virus of McGovernism tonight as the doctrine of retreat over seas and radicalism at home. It is directly descended, he suggested, from the ultraradi cal leftist line of the Pro gressive party and its Presiden tial candidate of 1948, Henry A. Wallace.

title: City Players Excel In Church Program Of Barber, Mozart
description: The Orchestra of the City of New York has been presenting a series of Noontime Inter ludes at St. Thomas Church, Fifth Avenue and 53d Street, in recent weeks, but only yester day did it put itself on display, in the fourth and final pro gram.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Man in the News
description: Power wears out only those who don't have it, ac cording to Giulio Andreotti, Italy's Premier.

title: RAYMOND HOLDEN, POET AND EDITOR
description: NEWPORT, N. H., June 26 Raymond Holden, the poet and novelist who had also been managing editor of The New Yorker magazine for three years and personnel director of the BookoftheMonth Club for 12 years before retiring in 1951, died of leukemia today at his home, Whippoorwill Hill. He was 78 years old.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, June 26  Senator George McGovern began a swing through the South and Southwest today pledging to keep to his program of fundamental and new changes and new opportunities that the nation so desperately needs.

title: HARVARD FRESHMEN UPSET BRITISH EIGHT
description: HENLEYONTHAMES, Eng land, June 26 (AP)  A fresh man crew from Harvard beat the crack British eight, the Bedford Rowing Club, in a musclestretching practice to day for the Henley Royal Regatta.

title: Panel Assails Ban onDDT
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (UPI) The House Appropriations Committee, saying that DDT had saved millions of lives, questianed today the Govern ment's ban on its use and said substitute insecticides may prove a real hazard to man. The committee contended that the Environmental Protection Agen cy displayed a regrettable lack of information in banning the use of DDT in the United States, effective next Dec. 31.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on Colonialism, subcommittee on Indian Ocean territories11 A.M.

title: Air Force Unveils Fighter Designed to Keep Superiority Into the '80's
description: ST. LOUIS, June 26The F15 fighter, the Air Force's hopes for United States air superiority into the nineteen eighties, was unveiled at the McDonnell Douglas plant here today. Grant L. Hansen, As sistant Secretary of the Air Force, told the assembled Air Force generals and McDon nell executives and workers that the F15 will outclimb, outmaneuver and outacceler ate any fighter threat in ex istence or seen on the hori zon. Maj. Gen. Benjamin N. Bellis, the Air Force officer responsible for the plane's de velopment, told a news con ference that the F15 was equal to anything the Soviet Union is flying now, includ ing the MIG23. The F15 is the first American aircraft developed solely to establish superiority in airtoair com bat since the F86 went into production in 1948. In the last 10 years the Soviet Union has produced 13 new fighter types and is testing three short  takeoff  and  land ing aircraft, according to in telligence sources.

title: OGILVY GAINS LEAD IN HIPKINS REGATTA
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., June 26 C. Stanley Ogilvy of the host Larchmont Yacht Club took a 2point lead for the men's sail ing championship of Long Is land Sound today.

title: Floods Continue to Drop in Northeast,. WilkesBarre, Upstate Still in Crisis
description: The waters of one of the nation's most destructive floods continued to recede in the Northeast yesterday, leaving crisis points at WilkesBarre, Pa., and the Southern Tier of, New York State.

title: Shift to Thailand Completed
description: SAIGON, June 26 (AP)The United States command said the shift of American fighter bomber squadrons from Danang to bases in Thailand was com pleted today. The transfer, re ports on which were published earlier this month, was said to have involved more than 2,000 airmen and up to 150 planes.

title: Two Youths Electrocuted
description: MIAMI, June 26 (UPI)The police say that a damaged in sulator apparently led to the deaths of two 16yearold boys who were electrocuted when they touched a power pole guy wire in a park. Killed within moments of one another yester day were George Edward Walk er and Edward Lyon.

title: Defense Seeks to Bar Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, June 26 (AP) The defense in the Pentagon Papers case, in a new legal move today, renewed its fight to prevent the trial of Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony Russo on grounds they are being unfairly prosecuted.

title: PRIVATE SCHOOL AID IS OPPOSED IN SUIT
description: NEW HAVEN, June 26 (AP) The Connecticut Civil Lib erties Union filed its expected court challenge of Connecticut's latest parochial school aid statute today.

title: Danes Leave E.E.C. Pact
description: COPENHAGEN, June 26 (UPI)  Danish Government sources said that Per Haek kerup, Minister of Economics and Budget, had told the Com mon Market finance ministers that Denmark was forced to deviate from the 2.25 per cent narrow band for the more flex ible 4.5 per cent range under the Washington agreement.

title: I.R.S. in Flooded Areas
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (UPI) Agents of the Internal Reve nue Service have been ordered into the eastern states hardest hit by the tropical storm's floods to guard against price gouging, Treasury Secretary George P. Shultz said today.

title: Personalities: Mauch MiniBan
description: Gene Mauch, who said that he didn't even land a good punch, nevertheless was sus pended by the National League yesterday for one game after leading a bench emptying brawl in Sunday's game at Montreal between the Expos and the Phils. The Expos' manager sat out last night's game in St. Louis against the Cardinals. Mauch came out swinging against the Phillies' Steve Carlton, who had beaned Tim Foil. Fifteen years ago I would have landed a good one, said Mauch. Carlton was more contrite. He said, I'm sorry I plunked Foli in the head. I was trying to hit him ribs.

title: Stocks Retreat on a Broad Front
description: Britain's decision to let the pound float in value caused some waves in Wall Street yes terday. Stock prices staged a broad decline but recovered somewhat in late trading.

title: Pacific Phone Acts on Rates
description: The Pacific Telephone and Telegraph Company, an 89.7 per centowned subsidiary of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, petitioned the California Supreme Court yesterday to reconsider its June 9 decision reversing rate in creases of some $212million annually and ordering more than $145million in refunds to customers.

title: Hijacker's Ransom Found ht Mailbag on Indiana Farm
description: PERU, Ind., June 26 (AP) A halfmillion dollars paid to a young hijacker and the sub machine gun he carried as he parachuted or fell from a jet liner early Saturday were found today by farmers in fields about five miles apart, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said.

title: 2 Rights Groups File U.S. Suit to Integrate by Combining Suburban Schools With Buffalo's
description: Two civil rights groups have filed suit in Federal court in Buffalo seeking to integrate the city's predominantly black inner  city schools with the mostly white school districts of the surrounding suburbs.

title: General Mills Announces Record Sales and Profit
3  YearOld Basel Art Fair Lures Some Top Dealers
description: BASEL, Switzerland, June 26The route of the art dealers this summer traces a course from Venice to Kassel by way of Basel, where the sixday international Art Fair  or Kunstmessei as it is known in the tradedraws to a close tonight in the vast halls of the Swiss Industries Fair building. More than 200 art galleries and publishers of art books and prints from 15 countries are represented this year in what is, in a Sense, a mammoth indoor flea market of 20thcentury art.

title: Smith Kline Chairman Will Relinquish Post
description: Smith Kline & French Lab oratories said yesterday that Thomas M. Rauch, its 50 yearold chairman, would re linquish his post in the near future in order to devote more time to personal inter ests.

title: Proxmire Sees Crisis at Litton; Urges Navy to Reject Claims
description: Senator William Proxmire said yesterday that huge cost overruns on Navy shipbuilding contracts had seriously drained the cash balance of Litton In dustries and the company faced a financial crisis of major pro portions.

title: FOUR MEN ARE KILLED IN HELICOPTER CRASH
description: Del Vaughn, a 29yearold radio newsman for the Colutm bia Broadcasting System, and three other men were killed yesterday in the crash of a helicopter at Capital City Air Port near Harrisburg, Pa.

title: 2 Detectives Testify at Captain's Trial
description: Two detectives repeated yes terday their allegations that a police captain had discouraged one of them from pressing his claim of being bribed by a gambler lest he wind up in the East River, face down.

title: LAWsREN
description: MARLBOROUGH, N. H., June 26Lawrence M. Conant Jr., a former magazine editor, died at his home here yesterday. He was 72 years old.

title: Australia Is Pleased
description: CANBERRA, Australia, June 26 (Reuters)Prime Minister William McMahon and the Min ister for Primary Industry, Ian Sinclair, welcomed the Presi dent's decision.

title: SHOP TALK
description: In this election year, when political polls are almost a way of life, with every would be candidate trying to find out how everyone is going to vote, who cares about how many women color their hair at home or make their own salad dressing, how many men smoke a pipe or use an electric razor, and how many people have false teeth?

title: SHOP TALK
description: The upsurge of interest in tennis (10.6 million people were playing the game in this country last year against 6 million people in 1960, ac cording to a Nielsen survey for the United States Lawn Tennis Association) has re sulted in a corresponding up surge of interest in clothing and equipment. The same sur vey estimates that 15 million people will be out on the courts by 1980.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: The closest battle in balloting for starting berths on the National League AllStar team is between the second basemen, Glerin Beckert of Chicago and Joe Morgan of Cincinnati, according to totals released yesterday.

title: National Mediation Board Designates New Chairman
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 The National Mediation Board announced today the designa tion of David H. Stowe of Bethesda, Md., as chairman for the fiscal year beginning July 1.

title: Unpublished Pentagon Papers Reveal Peace Efforts During Johnson Years
description: WASHINGTON, June 26A detailed description of the United States' long, often futile effort to get Vietnam peace talks started during the John son Administration was made public tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Business Briefs
description: The New York State Banking Board approved yester day applications by two major New York City banking companies to expand their operations outside the metro politan area. The board said that the Chase Manhattan Corporation could establish a new banking subsidiary in Syracuse and that the Manufacturers Hanover Corporation could acquire the First National Bank of Bay Shore, in Suffolk County on Long Island. Both applications must still be approved by the Federal Reserve.

title: Trade Deficit Narrowed For the U.S. During May
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 United States imports contin ued to exceed exports by a wide margin in May, but the trade deficit narrowed from the nearrecord level of April, the Commerce Department report ed today.

title: U.S. Woman's Bridegroom, A Soviet Jew, Faces Trial
description: A young American woman, married three weeks ago in Moscow to a Soviet Jewish dis sident, said yesterday that she had learned that her husband would be put on trial Friday by Soviet authorities.

title: Pennsylvania Lottery Is Jolted by the Flood
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., June 26 (AP)The Pennsylvania lot tery lost its entire reserve supply of 45 million tickets, computer printing equipment and paper supplies, in the flood, Revenue Secretary Robert Kane said today.

title: 10 Mexican Soldiers Killed In MountainState Ambush
description: MEXICO CITY, June 26 (Reu ters)Bandits ambushed an army truck and killed 10 sol diers yesterday in the mountain state of Guerrero, about 125 miles south of here, the De fense Ministry reported today.

title: North Korean Premier Offers to Meet Seoul Chief
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (UPI)Premier Kim 11 Sung of North Korea has said for the first time that he is willing to meet with the South Korean President, Park Chung Hee, to discuss possible easing of ten sions between the two states, The Washington Post reported today.

title: Port., Notes
description: Three New Yorkbased companies have signed a $146million contract with the Navy to build nine 25,000 ton tankers for Navy charter.

title: Sense and Sensibility
description: The standstill on plans for extension of the West Front of the Capitol, caused by a stalemated HouseSenate conference, is about to end, for better or worse.

title: Oil in Canadian Waters
description: A Liberian tanker unloading recently at the Atlantic Richfield refinery in Cherry Point, Wash., accidentally spilled 12,000 gallons of crude oil, some of which fouled five miles of beaches in British Columbia. This relatively smallscale spill had wide political repercussions, pro voking angry Canadian newspaper editorials and forcing an emergency debate in Parliament.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, June 26The news was worth only a paragraph in the great scheme of things, but to many Americans it was landmark stuff. On May 27 a Federal district judge or dered the Defense Department to re store the security clearance it had revoked from Benning Wentworth, an employe of an electronics company who also happens to be an avowed, practicing homosexual.

title: LEBANON REPORTS ACCORD ON RAIDS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 26 Palestinian guerrillas have agreed to suspend their activity against Israel from southern Lebanon for the time being, ac cording to official sources here.

title: Westchester Board Meets in Old County Seat
description: BEDFORD VILLAGE, N. Y., June 26Westchester County's Legislature left White Plains today to spend an afternoon of history and nostalgia in a restored courthouse here, where the county government last met in 1829.

title: GERMAN POLICE KILL SCOT LINKED TO GANG
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, June 26 (Reuters) A Scot tish businessman was shot to death in his apartment yester day by the police and a prose cutor's statement today linked him to a gang of revolutionary anarchists.

title: JOHN E. MURPHY
description: John E. Murphy, a partner in the law firm of Hurley, Kearney & Lane, which represents the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn, died Saturday in Huntington (L. I.) Hospital. He was 54 years old and lived at 11 Redwood Drive, Dix Hills, L. I.

title: EARL J. HADLEY
description: Earl J. Hadley, a retired broker who had been city editor of the old New York Sun and assistant managing editor of the old New York Globe, died Sun day in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 87 years old.

title: AIR FORCE ALLOWS F1111 TO FLY AGAIN
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (UPI)The Air Force restored to flying status today the 215 F111's stationed in the United States. The planes were ground ed after two crashes of the swingwing fighterbomber.

title: 520 INMATES SHUN WORK AT RAHWAY
description: RAHWAY, N. J., June 26  The superintendent's office at the state's maximumsecurity prison here reported that 520 of the institution's 820 inmates refused to work today in the shops to which they had been assigned, although all appeared for their meals in the prison mess hall.

title: Quake Kills 9 in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, June 26 (AP)Nine persons died and five were injured in strong earthquakes last night in Bagh lan and Takhar province in northern Afghanistan, accord ing to reports reaching here.

title: Manhattan Boy Saved After Falling Into a Pit
description: A 12yearold boy was pulled from a rainsoaked ex cavation pit yesterday after he fell into it while playing at a Lower Manhattan con struction site.

title: AIR WAR CONTROL TIGHTENED BY U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 26  The United States command announced today that it had tightened its control over the air war.

title: GEORGE A. CUSACK
description: George A. Cusack, retired president of Pure Carbonic Company and a director of the Air Reduction Company, died yesterday in Roosevelt Hospi tal. He was 71 years old and lived at 434 Monterey Avenue, Pelham Manor, N.Y.

title: Policeman Shoots Another During Raid on Apartment
description: One of four policemen trying to seize an allegedly armed tenant in an apartment in Har lem was accidentally shot last night by another patrolman who fired through the groundfloor window of the apartment at 644 Riverside Drive at West 141st Street.

title: Erie Road, Citing Flood, Files for Reorganization
description: The Erie  Lackawanna Rail way announced yesterday that it was filing for reorganization under Section 77 of the Fed eral Bankruptcy Act. It placed much of the blame for its col lapse on the devastating effect of Tropical Storm Agnes.

title: California Will Vote On the Death Penalty
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif. June 26 (UPI)Californians will vote in November on whether to restore the death penalty, which was declared unconsti tutional earlier this year by the State Supreme Court.

title: U. S. Reports Bombing of a Power Plant, Blacking Out Part of Hanoi
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, June 27 (UPI)Twen ty Air Force fighterbombers have attacked a power plant 25 miles northwest of Hanoi with laserguided smart bombs that effectively destroyed its use fulness and blacked out part of the North Vietnamese capi tal, the United States com mand said yesterday.

title: Offside Rule Change By Soccer League Cuts Infraction Area
description: The Federale International de Football Association, the world governing body of soc cer, granted permission yester day to the North American Soc cer League to change the off side rule, reducing the area in which it is in effect.

title: ExConvicts in City And Former Addicts Join Cleanup Drive
description: A neighborhood cleanup ef fort manned by former nar cotics addicts, exconvicts and men awaiting trial or sentence produced its first conservation yield yesterday: more than a ton of old newspapers for re cycling.

title: Neighborhood Units Help Local City Services Department Heads Solve Problems Without Red Tape
description: We seem to have a problem with sanitation, Jay Larkin, parks general foreman, began hesitantly at the first neighbor hood cabinet meeting in the South Bronx last week.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (Reuters)Senator Edward M. Kennedy would run the strong est race for the Democrats if he were the candidate in threeway Presidential election campaign with President Nixon and Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, Louis Harris, the pollster, reported today.

title: R. F. Delderfield, Writer, Dies; Chronicler of English Life, 60
description: SIDMOUTH, England, June 26R. F. Delderfield, who wrote leisurely panoramic nov els of English life that were more popular in the United States than in his native Britain, died at his home here Saturday.

title: Y.M.C.A. to Honor Dr. King
description: The Young Men's Christian Association of Greater New York has declared Jan. 15, the birthday of the late Dr. Martin Luther King, an official holiday for the organization in mak ing the declaration yesterday the Y's board of directors urged all 24 branches to observe the holiday.

title: Ownership of WLIB Is Passing Into Blacks' Hands
description: The Federal Communications Commission announced yester day that it had approved the transfer of radio station WLIB AM in Harlem from white to black ownership, Thus, on Sat urday, the station will become the first in the city owned by blacks.

title: BINNEY & SMITH OFF 20 ON AMEX
description: Disappointed investors sold enough Binney & Smith shares yesterday to force the price down 20 to 45. It was the sharpest oneday drop for a stock on the Amex for several years.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., June 26 (UPI)The Kentucky State Racing Commission chairman, William H. May, announced today that he had sold all his and his private company's interests in Florida Downs and was resigning as the track's president.

title: Fire Kills 16 in Manila
description: MANILA, Tuesday, June 27 (UPI)A fire that broke out in a Manila hospital early today caused the death of at least 16 persons and injuries to sev eral others.

title: Oil Meeting Is Focusing on IranIraq Split
description: VIENNA, June 26 (Reuters) A conference of the 11 big gest oil producers in the non Communist world opened to day with the focus on the contrasting policies of na tionalization in the neighbor ing states of Iraq and Iran.

title: Ali, Foster Rated Favorites Tonight
description: LAS VEGAS, June 26Mu hammad Ali resumes his trip to the top of the heavyweight box ing ladder tomorrow night in a 12round rematch with Jerry Quarry.

title: Tornadoes Strike Florida
description: GRACEVILLE, Fla., June 26 (UPI)  Tornadoes struck through the Florida panhandle yesterday, causing one death and damage estimated at $300,000.

title: A Family Has Only Ruins and Debts After Flood Damages Its Elmira Home
description: ELMIRA, N. Y., June 26  Under bide skies in this flood shattered city, Laurie Elliott surveyed the ruins of her mod est, twostory, bluegray clap board house today.

title: NEW HAVEN RIDER ASSAILS THE I.C.C.
description: The Interstate Commerce Commission was assailed yes terday by an angry rail com muter who charged that the Federal agency consistently and unabashedly rules in favor of the Penn Central Transporta tion Company.

title: New Ferryboat Sought
description: WOODS HOLE, Mass., June 26 (AP)The members of the Woods Hole, Martha's Vineyard and Nantucket Steamship Au thority have voted to adver tise bids for a new ferry boat to replace the S.S. Nantucket.

title: Chicago Blacks Allege Police Brutality
description: CHICAGO, June 26 (AP) Black residents charged at a community hearing today that they had been beaten, partly blinded, robbed or intimidated by Chicago policemen in the last year.

title: Genesco's Bonwit Teller To Open California Store
description: Genesco, Inc., Nashville, an nounced yesterday that its Bonwit Teller chain will open its first California store in November, taking over a five story site on Wilshire Boule vard, Beverly Hills, which has been operated by Roos/Atkins. Roos/Atkins, based in San Francisco, is also operated by Genesco.

title: Merger Issue Roils N.E.A. Meeting
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 26 The question of a possible merger of the National Educa tion Association and its rival, the American Federation of Teachers, quickly developed to day as the dominant issue at the opening of the association's annual convention here.

title: President Will Depart For California Soon
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (AP)President Nixon will go to California toward the end of the week for an in definite stay, the White House announced today.

title: Advertising:
description: Beginning this weekend, Chase Manhattan will start to make TV commercial stars out of some local working folk.

title: From a Saigon Mother
description: I received this letter from my mother in Saigon a few days ago. My mother has eight children, four of whom are fighting in the Saigon Army. I myself am a student here in the United States.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (Reuters)The Federal Na tional Mortgage Association is sticking to its earlier prediction of 2.2 million housing starts this year, despite recent fluctuations, its vice president and chief economist, Harry Schwartz, said at a news conference today.

title: Market Place: Opinions Differ On Bottom Line
description: If you were a stockholder in Denver Chemical Manu facturing Company back in 1967 when Max Factor & Co. acquired the small pharma ceutical company, you may not have thought the kicker in the deal was anything special.

title: Israeli Is Criticized For Calling Raid Error
description: TEL AVIV, June 26Three opposition parties today re quested a debate in Parlia ment on a statement by Deputy Premier Yigal Allon describing the Israeli Air Force bombing of a village in Leba non last week as a regret table error.

title: Spanish Bus Plunge Kills 22
description: CACERES, Spain, June 26 (Reuters)A bus carrying 56 Spanish football fans home from a game plunged down a ravine, killing 22 passengers and injuring the others, 5 of them seriously, police reported today. The accident occurred late last night when the bus skidded off the road and crashed 40 yards down a cliff.

title: Venezuela Modifies U.S. Pact
description: WASHINGTON, June 26  In a concession designed to prevent disruption of interna tional oilmarketing patterns, Venezuela, a major oil export er, has agreed to modify rather than terminate entirely its bi lateral trade treaty with the United States.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Dedicated hunters who in recent years have been called everything from uncivilized brutes to inadequate males venting their repressed sex uality on defensless creatures would regain some measure of selfesteem by reading Jose Ortega y Gasset's Medi tations on Hunting.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: PLYMOUTH, England, June 26 (Reuters)A British yachtsman, Brian Cooke, who is among the leaders on the singlehanded transAtlantic race, lost some of his sail in a rough wind today and radioed for assistance from the bank where he normally works as manager.

title: BRONX WAREHOUSE RAVAGED BY FLAMES
description: A fivealarm fire that raged through a twostory brick ware house on the Penn Central freight yards in the Bronx early today forced the police to close the Triborough Bridge for awhile because of the heat.

title: City Construction Grafters Face Few Legal Penalties
description: The system of corruption now thriving within New York City's construction industry has been nurtured over the years by a network of fraternal rela tionships, economic, fear and political power that has easily withstood the traditional tactics of government investigators.

title: Bishop Apologizes to Nixon On Treatment of Brother
description: DALLAS, June 26 (UPI)  New York Bishop D. Ward Nichols of the African Metho dist Episcopal Council says he has sent apologies by telegram to President Nixon for the way the President's brother was treated recently at the church's conference.

title: WALTER NEFF, 66, AIRLINE OFFICIAL
description: Walter H. Neff, who retired in 1970 as public affairs direc tor for the Eastern region of United Airlines, died Sunday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home, 85 Farley Road, Short Hills, N. J. He was 66 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dr. Helen Gavin, 83, Dead; Did TB Work at Bellevue
description: WESTBROOK, Conn., June 26 Dr. Helen Gavin, a retired physician who was a pioneer in tuberculosis work at Bellevue Hospital, died here yesterday. Her age was 83.

title: OTB Branch in Queens Caters to Women Today
description: A Women's Day Festival to better acquaint women with the sport of racing will take place starting at 10 A.M. today at the OTB office situated at 3710 Junction Boulevard in Corona, Queens.

title: Credit Markets
description: Interest rates advanced on a broad front yesterday in mod erate activity in the bond and money markets.

title: Even Communist parties which disagree with Moscow from time to time share common objectives with the U.S.S.R. Moscow and Peking support Hanoi.
description: 1. The international Communist movement no longer exists, thus the danger has dissipated.

title: Castro, Beginning Soviet Visit, Expected to Ask Aid Assurances
description: MOSCOW, June 26Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba arrived here today on an official visit marking a steady improvement of relations after a period of strains between Havana and Moscow.

title: Storm Damage a Tax Loss
description: Damages incurred in sud den, unexpected events such as tropical storms Agnes may be tax deductible, the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants said yesterday. It advised victims to assemble photographs, news clippings, testimony of a public appraiser and records of the police and fire departments.

title: SECURITY COUNCIL CONDEMNS ISRAEL
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 26The Security Council, with the United States abstain ing, tonight condemned the re peated attacks of Israeli forces on Lebanese territory and popu lation.

title: Minnesota G.O.P. Chooses Youth for Electoral College
description: MINNEAPOLIS, June 26 (AP) William Jungbauer, a 19 yearold Mahtomedi youth who says he's been campaiging for Richard M. Nixon for 12 years, has been chosen to represent Minnesota in the Electoral College if the President carries the state in November.

title: CONNORS SCORES WIMBLEDON UPSET IN BEATING HEWITT
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 26  Jimmy Connors has done it again.

title: Judaism Body Names Head
description: Herbert Newman, a commer cial and residential developer, has been elected chairman of the board of trustees of the Society for the Advancement of Judaism. Mr. Newman succeeds Robert L. Krause, who served as the board chairman of the 50yearold society for two years. The society's head quarters are at 15 West 86th Street.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (Reu ters)Senator George McGov ern, received today a pledge of support from Paul Jennings, president of the 300,000 mem ber International Union of Elec trical, Radio and Machine Workers. Mr. Jennings said that the union would go all out for Mr. McGovern if he is nomi nated.

title: The Busing Distortion...
description: President Nixon turned the signing of the Higher Education Act, a measure of deepseated importance to the youth of America, into an extraordinarily rancorous display of political expediency. Instead of dwelling on the significance of this law for educational development in the United States, Mr. Nixon chose the occasion to berate Congress for not having attached to it the kind of prohibitive public school antibusing amendment he had recommended.

title: Guido Sets Qualifying Pace On Long Island for Ike Golf
description: EAST WILLISTON, L.I., June 26Dr. Joseph Guido of Man hasset, a New York police sur geon, earned the medal today among the Long Island quali fiers for the 20th annual Ike golf tournament to be staged next month.

title: COURT TOLD MAYE BEAT HOMOSEXUAL
description: Mark Steinberg, a former aide to Mayor Lindsay, testi fied yesterday that he watched as Michael J. Maye, president of the Uniformed Firefighters Association, raised his foot and kicked a young homosex ual in the belly and groin sev eral times as he lay semiconscious on an escalator of the New York Hilton Hotel.

title: Misses Cohen and Keen Team For Dances Enhanced by Spirit
description: Ze'Eva Cohen and Elizabeth Keen shared a beautifully con ceived and varied program that mixed wit and poignancy, Sun day afternoon at the Theater of Riverside Church. Miss Cohen, who specializes in solo work, presented an excerpt from Anna Sokolow's Rooms along with her own Cloud Song and Miss Keen's company danced Poison Variations and The Unravish'd Bride.

title: NIXON ENDS CURBS ON MEAT IMPORTS TO CONTROL PRICE
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 President Nixon lifted all quota restrictions on meat imports today to counter recent rises in the cost of meat but ruled out any freeze or direct con trols over farm products for the present.

title: Duran Gains Lightweight Title in 13th
description: In a chaotic finish created by a blow to the abdominal area with a punch and/or a knee, Roberto Duran of Panama de throned Ken Buchanan of Scot land last night as the world lightweight champion.

title: The Candidates' Delegates
description: The following table lists the delegate votes committed on the first ballot in each state to each of the Democratic Presidential candidates, as compiled by The New York Times. In three states, however, it includes a few black delegates said to be for Senator George McGovem whose status could not be confirmed independently.

title: Aussies Top English to Tie 5Test Cricket Series at 11
description: LONDON, June 26 (Reuters)  Australia completed the for mality of victory over England in the second cricket test at Lords today, winning by eight wickets with more than a day to spare.

title: Stable Population Possible
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (UPI) The United States may reach a stable level of population In the next 60 to 80 years and eventually zero population growth, Assistant Commerce Secretary Harold C. Passer said today.

title: Notes on People
description: The nation had to have a strong man, a decent man, a good man as Chief of Staff, You were the right man in the right job at the right time. So saying at a White House ceremony, President Nixon pinned the Distin guished Service Medal upon the uniform of Gen. William C. Westmoreland, who ends 36 years of military service with his retirement Friday. Last week Mr. Nixon an nounced his selection of Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, now the United States commander in Vietnam, as General West moreland's successor.

title: Grant Is Awarded to Build Clinic on Lower East Side
description: Representative Bella S. Abzug announced today that a $2,784,000 Federal grant has been awarded to help build a neighborhood health center at 306 East Third Street.

title: Fleischer Rites Tomorrow
description: A funeral service for Nat Fleischer, editor of The Ring magazine, who died on Sunday, will be held at 10 A.M. tomor row at Frank E. Campbell's, Madison Avenue at 81st Street.

title: MRS. NOEL DOWLING
description: Mrs. Elizabeth Brown Molloy Dowling, widow of Noel Thomas Dowling, who was Harlan Fiske Stone Professor Emeritus of Constiutional Law at Columbia University at his death in 1969, died Sunday of cancer at her home, 520 East 77th Street. She was 82 years old.

title: COSTA RICA LEADS BIRTH CURB TREND
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, June 21Costa Rica, which had one of the world's highest birth rates during the nineteenfifties, has become something of a trend setter in population con trol.

title: NOEL BLEECKER FOX, LAWYER, DEAD AT 94
description: Noel Bleecker Fox, a retired lawyer and one time State Assemblyman, died Sunday at his home, 6 Brooklands in Bronxville, N. Y. He was 94 years old.

title: St. Bonaventure President Announces His Resignation
description: OLEAN, N.Y., June 26 (AP) The Very Rev. Reginald A. Redlon announced yesterday that he was resigning as pres ident of St. Bonaventure Uni versity, apparently because of health reasons.

title: Student Day Proclaimed
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (AP) President Nixon today pro claimed Sept. 26 as National Student Government Day and said students have a legitimate interest in sharing in the proc ess of school governance. The proclamation coincided with the annual convention of the Na tional Student Government As sociation.

title: A Shoddy Relic
description: A Congressional conference committee now has a rare opportunity to rid the country once and for all of that useless leftover from the McCarthyMcCarran era known as the Subversive Activities Control Board. In the past year the Board has held exactly four days of hearings to no substantial purposeat a cost of $450,000 to the taxpayers.

title: Peron's Party Names Him Its Presidential Candidate
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 26 The exiled dictator Juan D. Peron was proclaimed the Pres idential candidate of the Justi cialist party at its convention here last night.

title: I.M.F. Forming Committee To Spur Monetary Reform
description: WASHINGTON, June 26  The International Monetary Fund announced today that its executive directors had agreed on the formation of a new Committee of 20, including both industrial countries and less developed countries, to ne gotiate reform of the world monetary system and related issues.

title: 6 San Quentin Prisoners File $1 Million Rights Suit
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 26 (AP)Six San Quentin con victs, who were charged with murder in the prison violence in which George Jackson died, filed a $1million damage suit in United States District Court today against the prison au thorities.

title: Study Finds That Oarsmen Live Longer
description: College oarsmen live long ercontrary to popular be liefthan their nonrowing classmates, according to a Harvard physician's study.

title: Hanoi Said to Make Use Of U.S. BombFree Zone
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 26The United States has established a 25milewide buf fer zone in North Vietnam next to the Chinese border within which it does not bomb, an American official reported to day.

title: Treasury Aides Named
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (UPI)President Nixon today named Warren F. Brecht of Darien, Conn., for promotion to Assistant Secretary of the Treasury. He has been Assist ant Secretary to the Treasurer for Administration.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (AP)The Supreme Court de clined today to hear a challenge by four banks to an order barring them from claiming deposits of the bankrupt Penn Central Transportation Company.

title: General Tire Wins Rubber Patent Suit
description: CLEVELAND, June 26 (AP) United States District Court Judge Frank J. Battisti ruled to day that the General Tire and Rubber Company of Akron held the patent for the synthetic rubber used in all tires. Grant ing of the patent could bring General Tire $150million in royalties.

title: Peace Seen as Both Sides Accept Pier Pay Ruling
description: Labor peace on docks from Maine to Texas appeared as sured yesterday with a joint announcement by the Inter national Longshoremen's As sociation and the New York Shipping Association that they would accept a Pay Board de cision.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Japan to Tighten Curbs
description: TOKYO, Tuesday, June 27 (Reuters)Japan plans to tight en her exchange controls to forestall heavy selling of United States dollars when the Tokyo foreign exchange market re opens later this week, official sources said today.

title: Europe Tour for Allende
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, 26 (Reuters)  President Salvador Allende Gossens will make a 19day tour of the Soviet Un ion and Eastern Europe in November, Foreign Ministry sources said today. The sources said his itinerary would include Rumania, Bulgaria, Czechoslo vakia and East Germany.

title: Grenade Kills 3 at Pleiku As 2 G.I.'s Play Chicken
description: PLEIKU, South Vietnam, June 26 (UPI)A hand grehade being tossed back and forth in a game of chicken between two American soldiers explod ed, killing both of them and a third soldier who had stepped into their quarters to get a cigarette, Army officials said today.

title: Roundup: Lahoud's Bat Paces Brewers
description: Joe Lahoud, who has been struggling all season to raise his batting average above .200 and Skip Lockwood, who has been trying to keep his earned run average below 4.00 put it all together last night for Milwaukee. They led the Brewers to a 30 vic tory over Baltimore, knock ing the Orioles out of a first place tie with Detroit in the American League Eastern Di vision.

title: Books of The Times
description: ANOTHER WORLD. By James Hanley. 203 pages., Horizon Press. $5.95.

title: COMMON MARKET PLANS TO DEFEND CURRENCY RATES
description: LUXEMBOURG, June 26The six member states of the Eu ropean Economic Community agreed tonight that they would defend existing fixed currency relationships by buying more dollars, if necessary, in the ex change markets.

title: Death Toll at 229 in Dakota
description: RAPID CITY, S.D., June 26 (AP)  Searchers have found two more victims of the June 9 Rapid City flood. The two deaths raised the death toll to 229, with 228 identified.

title: Delaware Lengthens Cards
description: STANTON, Del., June 26 (AP) Delaware Park will hold nine 10race programs to compen sate for the nine horse races lost last Thursday because of inclement weather, Austin A Brown, general manager, an nounced today. An additional race will be run July 2, 3, 4, Tenrace cards also will be pre sented on the six remaining Sundays of the current meeting.

title: CLARK SEES MISUSE OF LOCAL POLICE AID
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 The Department of Justice is using money intended by Con gress for law enforcement aid to local governments to buy our way into a police state, former Attorney General Ram sey Clark said today.

title: Troopers' Slayer to Die
description: MEDIA, Pa., June 26 (AP) A threejudge panel ruled today that Mrs. Marylin Dobrolenski of Toledo, Ohio, should die for her part in the killing of two Delaware state troopers last Jan. 5. The 19yearold woman was found guilty last week of first degree murder in connec tion with the shooting of the two troopers, Ronald Carey, 29, and David Yarrington, 24, in Concord Township on Route 202.

title: JURY TRIAL UPHELD IN GYPSUM MERGER
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (AP) The Supreme Court has de clined to block a trial protest ing the merger of the Susque hanna Corporation with the American Gypsum Company.

title: Money Rates Stiffen  Reserve Buys Bills No Panic Seen
description: Domestic and international money markets churned inde cisively yesterday as traders waited for word from Europe on the resolution of the most recent crisis on the foreign ex changes, which was touched off last Friday with the float ing of the pound sterling.

title: Library Passes Its $500,000 Fund Goal
description: The New York Public Library announced last night that, with the help of 3,750 gifts, it had exceeded its goal of matching the $500,000 challenge grant of fered by the National Endow merit for the Humanities.

title: Jersey Assembly Tax Panel Clears Cahill's Reform Bill
description: TRENTON, June 26  The heart of Gov. Wiliam T. Cahill's $1.8billion tax reform program, including a state income tax and a statewide property tax, cleared the Asembly's Taxation Committee here this evening.

title: HAZEWINKELS WIN IN OLYMPIC TRIALS
description: ANOKA, Minn., June 26 (AP) Trials began today for posi tions on the United States GrecoRoman wrestling team that has never finished higher than fifth place hi individual Olympic competition.

title: Centrist Coalition is Formed in Italy
description: ROME, June 26Premier Giulio Andreotti today formed a center coalition of his Chris tian Democratic party with the Social Dethocrats and the con servative Liberals.

title: News Analysis
description: RABAT, Morocco, June 19 Al though 11 days of long and arduous meetings disclosed a great complex of seeming in congruities, the 19th session of the Council of Ministers of the Organization of African Unity and its eighth session of chiefs of state were impressive. Fortynations came to gether to discuss common problems and 23 heads of state conferred. The meetings sawefforts to implement O.A.U. plans for an allAfrica com munications network and an allAfrica system of connect ing highways and to develop a system of laws to govern the rich commercial fishing areas now being fished for the most part by nonAfrican powers.

title: JESSE GRAY JR. HELD IN NARCOTICS CASE
description: The 22yearold son of Jesse Gray, the Harlem tenant acti vist and political figure, was arrested yesterday and accused by the police of being part of a group that sold narcotics to teenagers in the metropolitan area.

title: Production of Steel Continues Slump; Machine Tools Up
description: The steel production slump went into its sixth consecutive Week last week, according to figures released yesterday by the American Iron and Steel Institute. The trade associ ation placed output for the week ended June 24 at 2,556, 000 net tons, or 1.4 per cent below the 2,593,000 tons poured in the preceding week.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Senate Aspirant Endorsed
description: PIERRE, S. D., June 26 (AP)  Robert Hirsch of Yankton won the Republican party's en dorsement for United States Senator from South Dakota to day in balloting at the state convention. Mr. Hirsch, an at torney and former State Senate majority leader, will face Rep resentative James Abourezk, Democrat of South Dakota, for the seat now held by Senator Karl E. Mundt, a Republican. Senator Mundt suffered a stroke in November, 1969.

title: Bank Robbery Here Foiled When Teller Tells of Badge
description: A wouldbe bank robber picked the wrong teller  A moonlighting policeman  and got nothing but a trip to a police station yesterday, the police reported.

title: F.A.A. Orders Power Units
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (AP) The Federal Aviation Admin istration today ordered 39 power plants and 91 engine generator ets to provide emergency stand by power for navigation and communications equipment at airports and at the agency's air way installations. The $1,167, 000 contract went to John R. Hollingsworth Company, Phoe nixville, Pa.

title: Summary of Actions Taken by Supreme Court on Various Cases
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: ...The Child Care Battle
description: In approving the new child development bill by a vote of 73 to 12, the Senate demolished the contention that child care centers are favored only by the radical left. The basic provisions of this legislation are sound, even though they represent a deliberate compromise. The aim is to disarm the Nixon Administration's fiscal and ideo logical objections which led to a Presidential veto of a broader measure last year.

title: Scalper Fined $250 And Jailed 30 Days
description: In what was described as the first jail sentence handed a ticket scalper in New York state, 22yearold Richard Weis berg was sentenced to 30 days in Rikers Island yesterday and fined $250. At the time of his arrest at Madison Square Gar den, Weisberg had more than 50 ticketsmost of them for Garden sports eventsin his possession.

title: HIGH COURT DECIDES ON STOCK IN A TRUST
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (AP) Stock transferred to an irrev ocable trust is not taxable at death when the owner con trolled the power to vote the stock during his lifetime, the Supreme Court ruled, 6 to 3, today.

title: U.S. CUTS RATES 40% ON FLOOD INSURANCE
description: WASHINGTON, June 26, (AP) The Federal Government re duced by 40 per cent today the cost of subsidized flood insur ance in an effort to encourage wider purchases and to prod communities into implementing land use and control measures.

title: 10 Accused of Counterfeiting $950,000 in Stamps and Bills
description: Ten men were Indicated in Federal District Court here yes terday on charges of counterfeit ing almost a million dollars in $10 bills and 8cent postage stamps.

title: Spassky Rates Fischer Stronger Than in Last Meeting
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, June 26  Boris Spassky, the chess champion ofthe world, who has played Bobby Fischer five times and never been beaten by the American, said today that since their last encounter Fischer's game had become much stronger than before.

title: Executive Changes
description: B. P. Russell, president and chief executive of the Crum & Forster, insurance holding company, will become board chairman also on Friday. He ?? succeed William C. Ridgeway Jr., who is retiring.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: MOUNT POCONO, Pa., June 26 (AP)Rain wiped out activity at the Pocono International Raceway for the sev enth straight day today, making time a critical factor if the Schaefer 500mile championship auto race is to be run on schedule this Sunday.

title: MEAT PLAN IS MET WITH SKEPTICISM
description: A number of executives in the meat packing, processing and retailing industries ex pressed skepticism yesterday about the impact of President Nixon's lifting of quotas for im ported meat. They said the ac tion might not result in either higher imports or lower prices for several months, if at all.

title: ONCEARID REGION OF CHINA BLOOMS
description: LINHSIEN, China, June 21 For an American, a drive deep into Linhsien County in the northwest corner of Honan Province is like driving straight into the early 19th or late 18th century.

title: Advertising:
description: Advertisers and ad agencies are guided in most of their media selections by syndicated studies that help them to evaluate their buys. But they have had no help as far as farm publications go, and they are a medium that carried some $57million in advertising last year.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: AVON, S.D.  Three years ago, mostly because it seemed like a pretty good idea at the time, the Avon Lions Club bought the old Wesleyan Methodist Church parsonage where Senator George McGovern once lived as a boy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, June 26  The Democratic National Con vention's Credentials Commit tee split openly today into one faction supporting Senator George McGovern of South Da kota and a coalition of mem bers opposing his nomination.

title: Celanese Is Expecting Loss for Quarter
description: The Celanese Corporation in dicated yesterday that it would have to report red ink for the second quarter. This would compare wth net earnings of $15.8million, or $1.07 a share, on sales of $316.8million in last year's second quarter.

title: Ruskin Questions 3 City Inspectors
description: At least three City Build ings Department inspectors were called in for question ing yesterday by Robert K. Ruskin, the city's Investi gation Commissioner.

title: Some Say Code Bars Jeopardizing of Jobs
description: Most of an inspector's power to delay or stop a massive construction job de rives from the city's Building Code, an 843page volume of detailed specifications whose goals are to guarantee safe and sensible construction and, some charge, to exclude certain efficient production methods and materialssuch as plastic pipethat might jeopardize some union jobs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: POTATO FUTURES AT RECORD LEVEL
description: Rains and resulting floods in farming areas sent potato fu tures to their highest June level in the history of the New York Mercantile Exchange.

title: Judge Rules That the U.S. Cannot Require Oath of Allegiance as a Condition for the Issuance of Passports
description: WASHINGTON, June 26A Federal judge here ruled today that the oath of allegiance re quired of applicants for a United States passport is un constitutional. He directed the State Department immediately to cease requiring such oaths and denying passports to per sons who refuse to take them.

title: Laotian Base Shelled
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, June 26 (UPI)North Vietnamese troops opened up on the key Laotian defense has at Long Tieng with the biggest artillery pieces in their arsenal in the first attack on the outpost in a month, a Defense Ministry spokesman said today.

title: Block Party Thrown to Benefit The Sidewalks of New York
description: The intermittent rain fell on a few of the bright red picnic baskets and a number of the yellowclothed tables. But it failed to dampen the spirits of several hundred of the city's betterknown citizens who took to the street yesterday for a private block party aimed at the public good.

title: L.I. Jail Guards Seek Inquiry Into Cahn's Methods
description: MINEOLA, L. I, June 26 The president of the Nassau Correction Officers Benevolent Association asked Governor Rockefeller today to investi gate the procedures that last month led to the indictment of 24 Nassau jail guards on a variety of charges ranging from assault and attempted sodomy to drug trafficking.

title: MISSISSIPPI VOTING ON 3 CONGRESSMEN
description: JACKSON, Miss., June 26 (AP)  Mississippi Democrats will nominate candidates to re place three retiring Represen tatives tomorrow as the state moves into the second phase of its Congressional election process.

title: Japan's Governing Party Set Back in Okinawa Voting
description: NAHA, Okinawa, June 26 Chobyo Yara, who was the first, and only, Chief Execu tive of the Ryukyu Islands chosen by direct popular vote, has scored a sweeping victory in Okinawa's first gubernato rial election since the territory's return to Japanese administration last month.

title: Shaky Start in Italy
description: It would be hard to exaggerate the difficulties ahead for Premier Giulio Andreotti as he launches Italy's 34th Government since the fall of Fascism and the first in a decade to exclude the Socialist party. The difficulties begin in Mr. Andreotti's own Christian Democratic ranks: Aldo Moro, former premier and foreign minister, and Carlo DonatCattin, former labor minister, refused to join the new Cabinet because of the Socialist exclusion.

title: SCHOOL DISTRICT WINS FOOD FIGHT
description: The community school board of District 2 won the right yesterday to control and run its own school food programs with funds allocated by the central Board of Education.

title: MONMOUTH EVENT TO TWIST THE AXE
description: OCEANPORT; N. J., June 26 (UPI)Twist the Axe pulled away in the stretch today over sloppy track at Monmouth Park and easily won the $10,000 allowance feature at six furlongs.

title: TIGER ROOKIE TOPS YANKEES IN DEBUT
description: DETROIT, June 26 Bill Slayback, a 24yearold rookie pitcher making his major league debut, pitched a nohit game for seven innings, but his Detroit Tigers were in trouble until the final out in scoring a 43 vic tory over the New York Yan kees tonight at Tiger Stadium.Slayback entered the eighth inning with a 40 lead and had allowed just four Yankees to reach basetwo on walks and two via fielders' choices. Then Johnny Callison of the Yankees, after taking the first pitch for a ball, stroked a clean single into right field to thwart the rookie's bid for baseball immor tality. No pitcher has thrown a nohit game in his first major league appearance.

title: Dancing to the First Amendment
description: This is an excerpt from a recent ruling by Superior Court Judge Robert W. Winsor of Seattle in a case involv ing violation of ordinances prohibiting topless dancing.

title: New Jersey Man Is Shot In a Times Sq. Restaurant
description: A New Jersey man was shot and seriously wounded early yesterday by one of a group of more than a dozen men during an argument in a res taurant near Times Square, the police reported.

title: Boggs and Ford in China
description: TOKYO, June 26 (AP)Hale Boggs and Gerald R. Ford, the Democratic and Republican leaders of the United States Houseof Representatives, ar rived in Peking today at the in vitation of the Chinese People's Institute of Foreign Affairs, a Peking broadcast announced.

title: Genius Who Was an Extrovert
description: To almost everyone who knew him, John von Neumann was Johnny. Un like the reclusive Einstein, who was his contemporary at the Institute for Ad vanced Study, in Princeton, N. J., von Neumann was an extrovert, full of life, always the center of attention at parties whether thinking out loud on mathe matical problems or describing palace intrigues at the Eighteenth Century French court.

title: MANAGERS FOR SIAC NAMED BY EXCHANGES
description: The management team for the newly organized Securities Industry Automation Corpora tion has been announced by Robert C. Hall, president and chairman of SIAC, and by the New York and American Stock Exchanges. SIAC will become operational in July.

title: 36 Food Places Called Health Violators
description: The Health Department yes terday released the names of 36 restaurants and other food establishments charged with violations of the city's health code.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Ronan's Salary Raised to $75,000

title: Alexander Schaffer Dead at 72; Aided Collectors of Czarist Art
description: Alexander S. Schaffer, presi dent of A La Vieille Russie, at Fifth Avenue and 59th Street, and one of New York's noted dealers in antiques and works of art, died in Paris last Satur day while on a business and pleasure trip. He was 72 years old.

title: KOOSMAN OF METS SINKS PIRATES, 42
description: The Mets, who have been playing uninspiredly in recent weeks, played excitingly last night. It was the right time to change their image because the potent Pittsburgh Pirates were in town, and the new Mets won a dramatic contest, 42.

title: Vigil at the U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 26  Airline pilots and stewardesses held a vigil out side the United Nations today, promising to return periodical ly until governments acted to deter and prosecute hijackers.

title: BREACH IS FEARED IN MISSILES PACT
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 Senator William Proxmire con tended today that the United States would violate the re cently concluded antiballistic missile treaty with the Soviet Union if it proceeded with de velopment of an airdefense missile planned by the Army.

title: Oliva to Face Surgery
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., June 26 (AP)The Minnesota Twins said tonight that Tony Oliva, the outfielder, would be placed on the disabled list and undergo surgery on his right knee. Oliva missed the first two months of the season, then returned early this month. He played in 10 games and hit 321.

title: Daley Praises McGovern
description: CHICAGO, June 26 (UPI) Mayor Richard J. Daley said to day that George McGovern was an outstanding Senator who had done an outstanding job. But Mr. Daley refused to say whom he was supporting for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Downing of Jets Described
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Tues day, June 27,Two United States F4 bombers on a raid over Hanoi were shot down over the capital today.

title: U. S. Takes Cautious View
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (Reuters)  The State Depart ment said today that it would take a waitandsee attitude toward Premier Kim Il Sung's offer to meet with President Park Chung Hee.

title: Pell Believes U.S. Uses RainMaking To Flood Vietnam
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., June 26 (AP)  Senator Claiborne Pell says he believes that American military forces have used ad vanced rainmaking technology to cause flooding and death in Vietnam.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 26 (Reuters)A young Soviet woman interrupted a tennis match at Wimbledon today by walking onto the court and begging the Soviet star, Alex Metreveli, to help her husband leave the Soviet Union.

title: Leslie's Luv, 0 for 31 as Pacer, Is the Favorite to Lose No. 32
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 26 Leslie's Luv is a loser. Neither Dr. Sam Potkin, a Yon kers orthodontist who owns the 4yearold gelding, nor Jim Webber of Westbury, who trains him, is going to get rich as a result of the efforts of the New Yorkbred son of Egyptian Candor.

title: Two Democratic Candidates Meet on TV And Discuss Striving Harder to Be No. 2
description: The only announced candi dates for the Democratic Vice Presidential nomination, a mar keting consultant and a former Governor, had a televised chat yesterday about why they are running for an office de scribed with frank contempt by many who have held it.

title: Merrill Stock Declines Under Pressure of Selling
description: The shares of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Inc., were buffeted by selling pres sure on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday as a one year moratorium expired on sales by insiders or former in siders.

title: 2 Big A Trainers Offer Contrasts
description: The rich got richer yesterday at Aqueduct, where W. Preston King saddled four winners and Sally Bailie saddled another loser.

title: Ulster Truce Starts After a Violent Day
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Tuesday, June 27After three years of street battles, explo sions and guerrilla terror, Northern Ireland uneasily wel comed the ceasefire by the Irish Republican Army's Provi sional wing last midnight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Chess: Schoneberig Takes Laurels In East German Title Play
description: The new champion of East Germany is 25year old Man fred Schoneberg, who won the title in a strong 20player tournament concluded re cently at Gorlitz. Schoneberg scored 144 (11 victories, seven draws and one loss) and finished a point ahead of Burkhard Malich. Wolf gang Uhlmann, East Ger many's only grandmaster, played lackadaisically and finished eighth.

title: DEMOCRATS VOTE PROBUSING PLANK
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 After heated debate, the Plat form Committee of the Demo cratic National Convention ap proved today an education plank that calls for continued use of busing to achieve school desegregation.

title: Nader Team Is Studying Records of Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (UPI)  Ralph Nader said to day that his investigators had begun a thorough study of Con gress. He said the findings would be issued before the No vember elections.

title: United Fund Elects Head
description: R. Manning Brown Jr., chair man of the board of the New York Life Insurance Company, was elected chairman of the board of the United Fund of Greater New York, it was an nounced yesterday. He suc ceeds J. K. Jamieson, chairman of the board of directors of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey).

title: Guatemalan Leader Slain At a Party for Daughter, 10
description: GUATEMALA CITY, June 26 (Reuters)  Olivero Castaneda Paiz, a major political leader, was shot to death last night at a 10th birthday party for his daughter in a restaurant here.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Floods. The White House reassured officials in flood areas in the East that Federal assistance would be adequate and rapid. It said that the Office of Emergency Pre paredness and 25 other Fed eral agencies have direct in structions from the President to provide all Federal assist ance needed and to do it im mediately by cutting through red tape. Congress will be asked to appropriate addi tional funds if available dis aster relief funds are not suf ficient, the White House said.

title: ECONOMISTS DOUBT WHOLESALE DROP
description: CHICAGO, June 26  Farm and meat industry economists doubted today that President Nixon's action to increase meat imports would have any effect on the wholesale prices for the better grades of beef cattle.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Pipeline Work Reported
description: WASHINGTON, June 26  United States intelligence offi cials said today that the North Vietnamese were about to com pleteor might already have completedthe laying of a fuel pipeline from Hanoi to China's border.

title: Fig Leafs for Children Irk Librarians
description: CHICAGO, June 26Is it a laughable bit of Mrs. Grun dyism or an act tantamount to censorship when a libra rian paints diapers to cover the, pink nakedness of Mick ey, the little hero of Maurice Sendak's popular children's book, In the Night Kitch en?

title: Carnegie Hears a Different Drummer
description: You might call it the greening of Carnegie Hall 50 rock concerts during the past season, ushers dressed in redandwhite Carnegie Hall Tshirts, the sweet smell of marijuana drifting over the red velvet seats.

title: Fiddler Ends Sunday With Record of 3,242
description: Fiddler on the Roof, which on June 17 became the longest  running Broadway production in New York his tory, passing the mark of 3,224 performances of Life With Father, will end its run at the Broadway Thea ter after its matinee on Sun day.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Danish Bank Rate Up
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, June 27 (Reuters) Denmark raised her bank rate from 7 to 8 per cent today. The new rate will go into effect tomorrow, the Central bank said.

title: Howe: He'd Be Crazy Not to Move
description: The reaction to Bobby Hull's $1million bonus to jump from the National Hockey League to the World Hockey Association yesterday ranged from Gordie Howe's surprise, to acceptance by Chicago fans, to ecstasy around the W.H.A.

title: Brezhnev Attacks Bombing by the U.S Of Hanoi Plant Sites
description: MOSCOW, June 27Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, today condemned United States bombings of industrial targets in North Vietnam and vowed continued aid to Hanoi until victory of its just cause.

title: Roundup: Brewers Sweep the Orioles
description: Even though Milwaukee is mired in the cellar of the American League's Eastern Division, the Brewers have exhibited plenty of socks exRed Sox, that isin the last two days against the secondplace Baltimore Orioles.

title: Transit Patrolman Pleads Guilty in Subway Robbery
description: A Transit Authority patrolman pleaded guilty yesterday in the robbery of a subway change booth at the Mount Eden station on the IRT of $57 at gunpoint while he was off duty last March 5.

title: Levin Sets A Musical
description: Herman Levin will produce a musical version of Moliere's farce Les Fourberies de Scapin (Scapin's Pranks) on Broadway in late November or early December.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, June 27 (AP)Japan's Ministry of Internanational Trade and Industry said today that Japan should try to lower or remove trade harriers in a new round of international trade talks next year. In a white paper on trade, the ministry also said Japan should hold fast to the principles of freedom, nondiscrimination and reciprocity.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, June 27Following are excerpts from the four volumes of the Pentagon papers dealing with efforts to reach a peace settlement in Vietnam, as made available today by the columnist Jack Anderson:

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Henry Saltzman, president of Pratt Institute since December, 1970, has resigned and been succeeded by Richardson Pratt Jr., a greatgrandson of Charles Pratt, founder of the 85yearold Brooklyn school.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: BALTIMORE, June 27 (AP)Carroll Rosenbloom, owner of the Baltimore Colts, said today the proposed swapping of his franchise for that of the Los Angeles Rams appeared imminent.

title: 111 Foes of War Arrested in Capitol As Hall Is Blocked
description: WASHINGTON, June 27The Capitol police arrested 111 antiwar protesters who blocked a hallway outside the Senate chamber this afternoon.

title: Westmoreland Honors Unit
description: FORT CAMPBELL, Ky., June 27 (AP)The Army Chief of Staff, Gen. William C. Westmoreland, visited Fort Campbell today and delivered a Presidential Unit Citation to the Third Brigade of the 101st Airborne Division.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Awaits Bhutto
description: SIMLA, India, June 27 (AP) Prime Minister Gandhi arrived today in this 7,000foothigh resort in northern India for the start of peace talks with President Bhutto of Pakistan.

title: Smoother Sailing Expected for Dollar
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, June 27  Foreignexchange traders here today expected a little smoother sailing for the dollar following the agreement of Common Market countries last night in Luxembourg to buy more dollars if necessary to defend existing fixed currency rates.

title: 2 Policemen Are Sentenced In Car Ring Extortion Case
description: Two policemen convicted last month of conspiring to extort $5,000 from an automobile theft ring were sentenced yesterday to indeterminate prison terms of up to three years by Bronx Supreme Court Justice Aloysius Melia.

title: 67 Message on Bombing
description: Message from Henry A. Kissinger, then a Harvard professor, to Mr. Bo, delivered by Mr. Marcovich on Sept. 14, 1967.

title: Reconciliation Drive on in Ulster Truce
